Review: My boyfriend and I kept going back and forth on whether or not to buy one. I'm so glad we did because it has been so easy cleaning now. We have a dachshund who is quite the shedder. Our floors feel awesome after each cleaning. I wish it was easier to empty out the container but definitely a small con.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Roomba Is Perfect For The Busy Bees
Review: My background:Let me start out by saying that I am very picky and skeptical.  I read a million reviews before I buy product and base my purchases off of it.  I've always been intrigued with robots ever since I was a kid and couldn't wait for the day that robots started working for us around the house.  I've been following the progress of iRobot's Roomba series for several years now.  My aunt is a dentist and not only did she buy a Roomba for every level of her house, but she also gave away Roombas to her employees.  They all loved it, but experienced some issues.  I didn't go off of their feedback so much, but more off of my dad's because he's a quality inspector to those robot arms that build our cars and other things.  He's just as picky as I am, except he gets paid for it, ha!  I was excited, but very patient in waiting for iRobot to update their designs.  They continue updating their design, but I think they nailed it on this design.Here's what I've experienced:My wife was skeptical of the entire concept and obviously not as excited about the Roomba as I was, so I ended up paying out of my pocket and bought it for us as a "Christmas present."  I bought it, because we have a cat that likes to track kitty litter all over the floor and everybody who has ever owned a pet already knows about the pet hair issues.  Pet or human hair is not limited to specific rooms.  It floats around all over the place.  These are the things that drive me nuts.  My first run in with Roomba was when I borrowed it from my dad a few years ago.  I had a two story apartment that I was moving out of.  I just wanted to make sure that the apartment was decent for the inspection so I let the Roomba go around and do it's thing while I finished loading up the vehicle.  By the time I was done, it was done and charging itself on it's charging station.  Granted, it doesn't climb stairs so I had to physically move it, but it seemed to have done a decent job and I passed my exit inspection.  I didn't pay much attention to the Roomba during my moving process.Now that I own my own Roomba and it's the updated design, I pay very close attention to everything now.  People say that Roomba has a life expectancy of a couple of years, but my dad and aunt have only replaced their Roomba once within a 12 year span and their second Roombas are still going strong.  So anybody who has done their homework, might have read some old reviews claiming that cords get tangled in the Roomba, the brushes break easy, the front caster wheel gets jammed and scratches the hardwood floor, and the bin fills up too fast and you have to change it out halfway through.  Not on this model: ALL FIXED!PROS:* It charges fast* It memorizes your houses map* Parts can easily be removed for cleaning* The cleaning accessories work very fast* It's not as loud as a standard vacuum cleaner* You can schedule it to clean (without paying for extra addons now)CONS:* It only gets 97% of the dirt* It can run into table legs at full speed before it adds it to it's mapping* You're supposed to dump the bin out after every vacuum cycleCONCLUSION:If you have a scaredy cat like us, it helps if you run the Roomba while you give your pet attention so they know that Roomba isn't a threat.  After the second run, our cat began following the Roomba around because of curiosity. Roomba changed direction and came directly at our cat, but one swing at it's front bumper told Roomba to changed direction.  Now our cat sleeps through it's cleanings.  I'm leaving out information that you may have read in the description already, but I will say that I pet series is the way to go.  Tests have shown that it will vacuum up 97% of the stuff on the floor and it does do a great job at getting stuff out of the corners, but you will still need to vacuum once a month to get that 3% that it might miss.  I trimmed my hair and left clipping on the floor.  Roomba doesn't vacuum in the same pattern as humans so it was interesting to watch it map out the room in it's own special way, but the end result was that all of the hair got sucked up with the exception of where the floor meets the carpet.  That's where that 3% likes to hide.  My wife and I stay busy.  If we're not at work, we're spending time with each other.  The last thing that we want to do is drag the vacuum out of the closet.  My wife now loves the fact that the kitty litter trails and random dirt on the floor will get picked up while we're at work.  It gives us more time to spend with each other and our cat at the end of the day and that's what I appreciate about having Roomba around.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Happy in Raleigh
Review: Much more than I expected. Does a great job cleaning the hardwoods and carpet! Very satisfied!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: I may not use this like others, but then again, maybe everyone does it this way...
Review: Most people probably use this differently than I do.  I don't like to let it have free reign in the house when I am not about or someone is at least there to watch it.  My negative list below defines why.  It is similar to the old Ronco set it and forget it, then warning people about fire if they don't watch the appliance.Still, this is so way cool and does such a great job, I love it.  Today, I tried a test I never thought this could pass.  I put down carpet cleaner/deodorizer on a rug and blocked it in the room.  And it took it an hour of running about, but it picked it all up.  Oh, and it filled twice, which is a good thing, but it does shut off when it fills, so if you aren't there to empty it, that extra battery life won't do you much good.The battery is powerful and lasts a very long time.  I haven't had an issue with it yet, but as I mentioned, I don't let it have full run of the house. But it merrily executes is algorithm, which is kind of clever as you start to identify it.  It can identify an edge by hitting it at a certain angle, and then it walks the edge.  I was impressed enough it did this with furniture, but when it also vacuumed the trip on the rug, I was kind of flabbergasted.The unit also has this find the dirt feature, in which it spirals for a bit looking for dirt before it heads towards the problem area.  Usually only when it first starts up, but it is also kind of a smart approach.They have come up with square units, and I do not think the algorithm could work as well.  Squares have corners, and they tend to hit things.  The round design bounces off.  Does seem to leave some traces here and there at times, but it will get them the next time it runs.As I mentioned, I do not use this in the way most people probably do, but then again, maybe it is what most of us do.  I let it go wherever it want at first, but it would snag something, get stuck, fill up or whatever, and it would stop, or worse, keep circling forever in a small area.One day, I couldn't find the silly thing.  I had left it to clean two rooms and it wasn't there.  I am beginning to think aliens.  But it had actually pushed away a smaller piece of furniture and broken into an adjacent room, snagged up on my cell phone charger and tried to digest my phone.  Fortunately, the system doesn't keep trying.  If the brushes and such lock up, it stops.  But not until it had dragged my cell phone by the cord across the room.So, my pluses and minuses, in which the pluses far outweigh the negatives....Positives:1. Way cool.2. Fun to watch, at least at first.3. If you hate vacuuming, it is also a great feeling to sit and use your computer while you let this thing run about and do it for you.  Would only take you five minutes, and this will take an hour, but you feel like you have help.4. The unit gets up so much it scares me.  I didn't think there was much of a visible difference one time, and I checked the bin and it was loaded with stuff.  Hairy, dusty, dirty stuff.  Hey, how did that get there? I vac at least twice a year.5. Brushes are effective.6. Climbs rugs and such effectively.  Small rugs may get snagged up though.  Thresholds which are common in older homes are no problem.7. Makes you feel smart for buying it.Negatives:1. When it gets to an overhang, like a flight of stairs going down, it just stops. I was hoping the sensor would pick it up and back up.  But it doesn't catch it.  You can use those invisible wall things, but I just move a couple of pieces of furniture to get the floor underneath them clean and use them to block the stairs.  Not a biggie, but I was kind of disappointed when it didn't manage it.2. I would not give it any demerits for this, because it has to be limited based its size, but it still is worth a mention.  The back has a tray into which the filth is thrown.  It isn't that large.  So, even a small room will fill it up, and it stops.  So, if you think you are going to go to work, come home, and find the entire apartment vacuumed, it isn't likely.3. It has a slight incline towards the center.  And I believe if I measure it, it would amount only to a centimeter or two.  But there is still furniture that is perfectly the exact height such that the front goes under, but it wedges before it passes under and jams up.  it gets scratches as a result just outside the white line you see in the picture.  And it will work like the dickens to get out, but eventually it surrenders.  So, I have to know these pieces of furniture and block them off.How do I use it?  I just take it to the area I want to vac and create a fence of obstacles. I don't care about the parking intelligence that takes it back to its home base.  I have not yet seen the battery get to the point where it would do that before it fills up or gets snagged up in some way.  I have done like three rooms and it is still charged enough to keep going once the dirt is removed and obstacles or snagged items have been effectively addressed.Right now, it is upstairs cleaning our bathroom.  To monitor it, all I have to do is hear it.  Some people think it is a bit loud, but that makes it better for me.  Silence indicates it has shut off.I would never go back on this purchase.  I would buy it again in an instant.  Would I buy all the gimmicks?  Maybe one or two for stairways, but most of the time, knowing its limitations allows you to easily determine an effective obstacle.I am not sure if you remember the robot toys and such that would move about the room, hit a piece of furniture or some obstacle, turn around and keep on going.  They were fun, but they didn't work everywhere in the house.  This does, and attacks hard wood floors as well as carpet, climbs the edges of rugs, gets under many pieces of furniture, and makes you often wonder how it did what it just did.That is cool, that is fun, and while the cool and fun are going on, there is actually work getting done too!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Better at chores than my kids!
Review: Money well spent.  I come home and my Roomba has already swept my house.  I could never get my kids scheduled like that...

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Four Stars
Review: Mom loves it. Period.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Gets under the beds and furniture and that's great. We have all wood floors
Review: May take a little micro managing at first. Runs every day and keeps the dog's hair under control. Took a few weeks to iron out our stuff on the floor. It gets snagged under a few spots in the kitchen once and a while. Gets under the beds and furniture and that's great. We have all wood floors. 1 story house. 1800 square feet. We like the noo-noo.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: I love my roomba!
Review: many have mentioned that they name their roomba's and we are no exception.  Ours is named "ham" my son thought that would make the most sense.  We have 3 floors (finished basement with 2 large rooms, main floor with 5 rooms, and upstairs with 5 rooms.  However, we only have one area rug and the rest of the house is tile, wood, or painted concrete. The roomba can do 2 floors on a single charge.  The scheduler is overrated since you have to empty the bin and clean the brushes.  Long hair can get pretty tangled up but if you keep vigil it won't be a problem.  I'd much rather spend 5 minutes cleaning it thoroughly every 2-3 days and have a clean house than vacuuming as much as the robot does.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: It's like you're living in the future!
Review: Man, buying a Roomba changed my life! It is so thorough and the fact that you can schedule it saves so much time and hassle. I had to disable the cliff sensors with strips of white paper and painters tape (google it for exact technique), because Roomba refused to go over my black carpet thinking it was a cliff. The operation was easy and because I don't have any stairs, I don't need the cliff sensors anyway. Besides that little mod, it runs like a dream. I have several thick cables running across some parts of my floor and Roomba just goes right over them without so much as a second thought. There is one section of my apt that it always gets jammed up in, so I set up the included invisible wall to keep it out of that small corner. Roomba won't even go near the actual invisible wall unit which is pretty cool. You can keep Roomba away from more than just rooms with it. Roomba cleans my hard wood floors and my low pile carpet equally well and moves from one to the other perfectly. I live in a one bedroom apt and a full cleaning cycle takes about 1 hour and 15 minutes. That's a lot longer than I would take to vacuum manually, but I wouldn't be vacuuming under the bed and a bunch of other various corners that Roomba happily takes care of. It feels great to always have clean floors. It is also very cool having a robot regularly clean for you. It's like being in the Jetsons. Roomba even makes fun sounds when it starts and finishes. I love this thing. It has dramatically improved my quality of life.

Product: iRobot Roomba 650 for Pets
Title: Four Stars
Review: Makes cleaning fun when you have pets

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Your house isn't "Roomba Clean."
Review: You think your floors are clean?Ê They're probably not. The first time I unleashed by Roomba 880 on what I thought were clean hardwood floors and large area rugs, I had to follow it around and continually empty the bin and clean the filter. I was shocked. What appeared to be a spotless home simply was not. No wonder my allergies and sinuses were problematic.I scheduled it to run everyday for a week to vacuum a large open area (kitchen, dining room and sitting room) and put a lighthouse to the master bedroom. The bin emptying became less frequent. The hardwood glows. The carpets feel soft and new. Roomba even dusted the tops of the floor based lights. My allergies are under control and I imagine my Flonase purchases will slow. It now vacuums every other day and I only empty the bin when it finishes and is docked.Advice. Shim your doors open. Roomba is so intent on getting at dust along walls, it will push doors closed and imprison itself in a room.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Yes, it works.Ê It works really, really well.
Review: Yes, it really does work.Ê We have dogs who shed tremendously, and running the Roomba a couple of times per week seems to keep up with the mess very well.Ê The instructions recommend running the Roomba several times in succession over the same area to get embedded dirt and hair out, as the bin will fill up quickly.Ê Once we did that, we found that the Roomba could cover a large zone in the house before needing to return for a charge and to have its bin emptied.The extraction is excellent, even compared to my Hoover upright.Ê The longer I use the Roomba, the cleaner and brighter my rugs look and feel.Ê It's also rather fun to watch it bumbling around the room, like a bumblebee in a bottle.Ê It does a surprisingly good job of getting under furniture and into tight corners.We have a house with a semi-open floor plan.Ê It took a little figuring, but it was fairly easy to figure out a layout that divided the house into zones that were within the capacity of the battery and bin.Ê The Virtual Wall and Lighthouse units confine the robot into these zones, along with closing some doors. I find it easiest to run the Roomba in a zone, then empty the bin and let it recharge before moving on to the next zone.Ê Emptying the bin and replacing the HEPA filter are both easy tasks.It takes me about ten minutes to pick up things like dog toys, shoes, small scatter rugs and to move chairs the Roomba can't get under.Ê Then I turn it loose and go work on something else.Ê It tends to rumple up small rugs, but will ride right over larger rugs.Ê While it does not damage fringe, it does rumple it up a lot, so I don't run it over my expensive wool rugs. I do tuck electrical cords out of the way, but I have seen it encounter them several times, and it does not tangle itself in them.Ê I would be picking up and moving all of these things in order to vacuum anyway, so using the Roomba does not add any work.If you have a lot of open doorways, you may find it useful to get a third Lighthouse.Ê I was very confused about how to turn them off and on, until I realized that they turn themselves on and off when the Roomba is not active.Ê My instruction manual said they had an on/off switch - the later models don't have it.I have not used the schedule feature.Ê Our house is large enough that the Roomba and its charging station have to be moved from zone to zone.Ê Plus, with pets in the house I would prefer to run it when I am there to supervise it.Ê It has gotten itself stuck twice in the two weeks I have owned it.All other good things being said, it is not a substitute for a good upright with cleaning tools.Ê It can't be used on drapes or upholstery, or to clean cobwebs from the ceiling, and it certainly won't mop the kitchen floor (that's another IRobot product).Ê It is a huge help in keeping up with the day to day cleaning, and keeping the dust and pollen down.Ê My husband and one of our dogs have dust allergies, and they are both doing better since we started using the Roomba regularly.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOVE our roomba
Review: Yes to everything everyone else said. LOVEÊ our roomba. But- be forewarned, if the battery dies- you have to reset all your programming! Completely ridiculous out of a $600 piece of equipment. It can't keep the clock set if it can't find its way back to the docking station. Customer service says I'm trying to clean too large of an area and not using my virtual walls (well my toddler runs off with them!). So, until my kid all grow out of toddler age, I will reset the entire schedule probably on a weekly basis. Ugh!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My previous Roomba was working fine and I was reluctant to shell out the cash ...
Review: Yes there is a difference!Ê I have had every model of Roomba since the very first model came out.Ê My previous Roomba was working fine and I was reluctant to shell out the cash for the newest model, but I just had to!Ê It really has a lot more sucking power, and it is nice to not have to clean all that hair off brushes.Ê If you been wondering if there is a huge difference between this your previous Roombas, trust me, there is!Update, we dirtied 2 spots on the floor, a 2000 dollar boat anchor Kirby vs. Roomba.Ê Would you believe Roomba did as good if not better a job? When we figure out a way to do a more scientific test of these 2 will post a video.Ê The Kirby has been relegated to the garage.Ê The old advisory w that a Roomba does not substitute for deep cleaning upgright vacuum cleaners no longer applies.Ê In fact the New York Times I see stated the same thing, cleans as well or better then uprights.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great product, does a fine job.
Review: Yes the dust bin is a bit too small but what can you do, other than make the roomba gigantic (and this is already pretty big).Ê That being said, this thing works great.Ê I even brought it into my work and had it vacuum the office my boss and I are in and he was very impressed with this little guy (and he doesn't impress easy).Ê The pathing on this is fine, but yes it will miss an area now and then but I have it cleaning three main rooms plus 4 small areas (bathrooms, kitchen, etc)...I have a child and two dogs (small and medium), and it's great.Ê They need to come up with a stair roomba next though.Now, a couple things...it has closed itself in the bathroom a few times now so I have to lock it out of areas where the doors aren't secured open (magnetic door stops) when I'm not home, but that's hardly the devices fault.Ê I had to buy small risers for my couch so it would go under there (the first day I ran it the sensor on the top wouldn't allow it under but the roomba tried, scratched the heck out of the top of the front bumper too.)Ê I recommend picking up rugs off the floor if you can.Ê It doesn't have an issue specifically but it doesn't seem to be terribly kind on the edges of them, lighter rugs will probably get jammed up in it (maybe).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I LOVE it! It is much more advanced in its ...
Review: Years ago my son and daughter-in-law gave me one of the first roombas for Christmas.Ê It wore out several years ago and I sorely missed it.Ê This year I ordered the Roomba 880 for myself.Ê I LOVE it!Ê It is much more advanced in its cleaning power.Ê I didn't realize my floors could be so dirty and I don't even have pets!Ê I do have grandchildren though and they can be messy.Ê I did wait for the price to go down because I could not afford the full price.Ê Great purchase and clean floors!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Big Improvement over Older Pet Hair Upgrade Kit, but Costly
Review: Years ago I purchased the Pet Hair Upgrade Kit for my Roomba Scheduler.Ê It included a more intense brush, and a special brush cleaning tool.Ê However it clogged up so fast with hair that I switched back to the original brushes, and I just got used to the finicky amount of cleaning it needed.This model has rubber beater cylinders, rather than brushes, and a finer air filter to filter out allergens.Ê The rubber beaters work better because they don't get clogged up with pet hair.Ê The vacuum seems stronger, and cleaning seems easier.Ê Even if you don't have pets, if someone in your home has allergies, this might be a more helpful cleaner.Ê However, I'm not sure if the higher cost is justified -- I'll find out the next time we have people with cat allergies visit.The basic capabilities are the same as with prior Roombas, having overall room cleaning mode, as well as spot cleaning and setting up virtual walls to confine it to a specific cleaning area.The noise is sort of unpleasant (though not too loud), so in conjunction with the scheduler, we have used it as a signal to keep the day moving.Ê For example, you can set it to start up when it is time to leave the house in the morning -- that noise really motivates you to get moving.Ê Another option is to have it start up when it is time to take a break from work and go do lunch, though you have to be able to get far enough away from it so that it is not bothersome.It is also a fun pet toy, using the remote control to drive it around the floor like a remote control car.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is amazing. 2 cats 1 dog and dark hardwood floors
Review: Yeah, it's pricey. I kept the box just in case it was a dud. This thing is amazing. 2 cats 1 dog and dark hardwood floors. Every day at 11:15 it starts up. 1500 sq ft of wood. It does an amazing job. I do have to empty it a couple of times. No big deal. Once a week you have to remove the rubber wheels and dust them off. Also very easy. It does get hung on electrical cords. So. I've had to raise them up off the floor. I highly recommend this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great product and value
Review: Wow...great roomba

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Solution for pet hair.....not so much :(
Review: Wow....so disappointed in this little vac.Ê I bought the highest end one they make that is supposed to be for pets, but I'm sure not sold on it's ability to pick up pet hair.Ê Granted, my house is a HUGE test of a vacuum cleaner's ability to pick up pet hair.Ê I breed Cavalier King Charles Spaniels and have six of them that live with us.Ê But, all 6 put together don't much more than equal one large Golden Retriever or any other large breed dog, so I don't think I'm asking for the moon here when I want a vacuum that will do a decent job on pet hair.Ê I am a fairly fastidious house keeper and I am ALWAYS vacuuming.Ê I'm thinking of fashioning a holster for my dust buster! The Roomba does a reasonable job on hard surface floors, but how hard is that?Ê Any midrange vac can pick up pet hair on tile or hardwood.Ê But, I find that on my 5 x 7 area rug, all it seems to do is kind of ruffle it up into little wads, but then doesn't have to suction power to pick it up.Ê And yes, I clean the filters and the brushes very often.Ê I turn the thing lose daily so as to try to keep ahead of any build up of hair on the rug, but even with daily passes, it still just doesn't get the job done.Ê I want so badly to love this little guy, but alas, he is not the bosom buddy I'd hoped for.Ê The IDEA of a little helper that scoots around all day while I'm at work picking up dirt and dust and dog hair is so appealing to me, but I have now had both a Neato (which picked up the pet hair better but had "brain issues" every few months until the company refused to replace it any more) and now even the high end Roomba has let me down.Ê So far, I haven't experienced any of the brain farts that the Neato used to have where it would say that the dirt bin was full when it wasn't or getting stuck in the middle of the room saying there was an obstruction when there wasn't, but it's still too early to tell with the Roomba as I've only had it about a month.Ê I guess my take is, if you are looking for a pet hair solution, this isn't it.Ê So sad that Roomba is not the handy helper I had hoped for.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Get one, now!
Review: Wow, why didn't I get one of these years ago!Ê I ran the vacuum the day before getting this, and thought that the rugs were fairly clean...Ê The amount of dust and dog hair that this got up indicated otherwise.Ê I'd recommend having this systematically clean individual rooms, and then run on a daily basis once the initial cleaning is done.Ê The dustbin is small, but hopefully with frequent use this won't be an issue.Ê The rubber rollers are GREAT at getting up the hair, sand, and dust, and are super easy to clean.Ê I always needed a scissors at the ready when I vacuumed to cut off all of the long hair that wrapped around the rollers, but that isn't necessary with the Roomba.Ê It is not nearly as loud as the vacuum, and I can have a phone conversation when it is running under my feet without issue.Ê It has tackled electric cords and network cables without sucking them up or getting tangled.One word of warning though...Ê I have had this get stuck under my cabinets, since the floor tile was added after the cabinets were installed and the height from floor to the bottom of the cabinet is no longer standard.Ê Obviously not the Roomba's fault, but it is a minor annoyance.Ê I use the virtual walls to keep this out of the kitchen during the overnight programmed vacuuming sessions, and just do the kitchen during the day when I can be around to help it get unstuck.Ê You may want to measure for this as well as any furniture that might pose other sticking hazards.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does a great job on pet hair
Review: Wow, what a convenient way to keep all of the pet hair picked up.Ê Does a great job on pet hair, pet food, cat litter, and other debris on floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: BRILLIANT!!
Review: WOW, really impressed!!Ê Just replaced the 3 year broken original Roomba, number ??.Ê Bottom line, it failed miserably in comparison.Ê My "FemBot" is stellar, cleans really well IF you pre flight your house.Ê Remove large objects in the way, make her job easier, she will not disappoint me! Runs for hours on full charge, holds plenty of YUCK from carpets and floors.Ê I will not vacuum as much and now have her scheduled for 3 times a week.Ê BRILLIANT!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but this has done a great job. It's done a good job cleaning as ...
Review: Wow, I'm actually very impressed. I've only had this for 3 days now, but this has done a great job. It's done a good job cleaning as evidenced by all the stuff I've emptied out of the dust bin. The HEPA filter has been very good and has captured a lot of fine dust. So far so good!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: WOW!
Review: WOW!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing how much dust this thing finds even with daily ...
Review: wow our house feels so much cleaner!Ê Amazing how much dust this thing finds even with daily use and even when we thought everything was clean!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: WOW My wife thought our old vacuum did a great job.Ê This thing is amazing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great!
Review: Wow I absolutely love it...and so does my mom.....I might have to buy another one..since my robotic maid hasn't shown up for work ever since my mom decided to borrow her....

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth every penny! A must have for pet homes!
Review: Worth every penny. I have a cat and hardwood floors. Enough Said! This baby gets all the cat hair and dust picked up nice and clean. Love the schedule option! It allows you to come home to clean floors and vacuumed carpet! Only regret is that I didn't buy it sooner!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Worth every penny.Ê We run ours every single day

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Get yourself one!
Review: WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars

I have rat terriers and their hair is everywhere . I can sweep and mop then run the Roomba and I can't believe how much hair I missed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works surprisingly well
Review: Works surprisingly well. Gets stuck under furniture from time to time. My main critique would be a lack of a remote control function to find it when it is stuck. Also, the dust carrier does not hold much, and is difficult to empty.That aside, it scurries around like a tireless worker, and seems to find a lot of dust and fuzz - I've no idea where.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Almost perfect but ?
Review: Works pretty good. Only complaint I have is emptying the dust bin. There is a grate under the filter and that blocks the picked up material from being emptied easily. After the warranty is over I plan to cut some of the plastic grate away so I can just dump it instead of having to pick at it. If it was not for this one design flaw it would be almost perfect. I am still surprised how much this thing picks up off the carpet even after a regular vacuuming. So now I just let this thing run everyday and leave the big vacuum in the closet. it is also very quiet in comparison to a regular vacuum and it does not scare the my little dog like my other vacuum does. So once the warranty is up it will be better after I modify it as that is the one area that kinda pisses me off as I really do not want to touch any vacuumed up material.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works pretty good. It doesn't pick up dirt in small ...
Review: Works pretty good. It doesn't pick up dirt in small indented areas like cracks or area rugs with deeper designs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works better and worse than expected.
Review: Works pretty good.Ê Not perfect in a "real" house with couches, chairs, and tables, but with a little forethought (shoving a box under one chair where it always gets stuck), it does its job.Ê Picks up lots of very fine particles that normal housecleaning seems to miss.Ê We pretty much just use it in the master bedroom/bath/closet and let it run on its own.Ê Nice to get under the bed on a regular basis.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Much better than expected.
Review: Works much much better than I could have hoped for.Ê Really thorough and navigates flawlessly.Ê Feels like we have a hired hand in the house!Ê Our grandkids get a big kick out of it.Ê They follow it around and talk about it--never did that with a regular upright vacuum!Ê Also our two dogs ignore it.Ê They just stay out of the way.Ê Can do several rooms on one charge.Ê Only negative is the limited capacity for dirt.Ê Must be cleaned after each use.Ê No big deal.

Title: Great Product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works awesome for pet hair
Review: Works awesome for pet hair, with 2 German Shepard mix dogs, shedding was a nightmare and regular vacuums would clog and hair would wrap around the brushes. with the redesign on the 880, it pulls hair out of the carpet with minimal tangles. any tangles that happen are easily removed thanks to the tangle groove that allows wrapped up hair to fall off the roller, just release the roller from the housing and slip the hair off the end.some people complain of the roomba slamming into things, but if you watch, it actually slows down as it near objects and gently taps them to clean as close as it can. it easily travels under my couch that has a torn bottom fabric and it comes through without getting tangled. the patterns it runs can be somewhat erratic, but from what i've seen it travels at different angles to help pull more out of the carpet bc it may miss things going head on, but at a slight angle it will pick it up. This may not be the vacuum to end all vacuums, but it is worth it to me for its ability to keep up with the shedding.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good on floors
Review: Works as advertised.Ê Gets into areas and under beds where frequent vacuuming is not done.Ê Good on floors, better on carpet.Ê If you have pets, this is the Roomba for you.Ê The canister for dirt fills quickly, there's a light on the unit that glows red to tell you to empty the bin, a better solution would be an audible alarm.Ê The battery needs to be fully charged overnight to be able to clean a 1200-1400 sqft. floor of a home.Ê Need to move the charging station from floor to floor so it can find its way home for charging or at end of cleaning cycle.Ê I would consider have one of these for each floor and basement if they were less expensive.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great if you love fixing vacuums!
Review: Worked well for about a week.The things i have had trouble with are...Ê Dust bin is not easy to empty. When it gets filled with hair you have to root it out through a small slot. Just not designed well.Ê Intake duct under rollers will clog .Once this happens no more dirt will be picked up The vacuum will continue to roam aroundÊ aimlessly.Rotary brush stopped working after a month. Now works about half the time.This is with two small Pug dogs,not a house full of cats or large dogs. Given the high cost of this unit I expected equally high performance and quality. Now instead of spending time vacuuming I work on keeping it operating.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I can't spend that much. I'll try it out. It's incredible. It was money well spent.
Review: Without question, this is a borderline idiotic amount of money to spend on a vacuum, much less a robotic "toy". I couldn't get myself to buy one for the longest time because I would think of what else could be done with $700. That was what I thought at least, until I had used it just twice. We have one dog - a golden retriever - and I am not joking when I say we were mortified at the sheer amount of hair, dust, and dirt that the Roomba picked up. Even over areas we had vacuumed the day before. In our bedroom we had to run it FIVE times before it started coming back empty. Again, this area had just been vacuumed thoroughly the day before.We have some Persian rugs with long tassels and it has absolutely no trouble keeping itself from getting stuck.Pros:- Better suction and pickup ability that ordinary handheld vacuum- Gets under things you just cannot- Scheduling, charges itself- Doesn't get stuck on cords, tassels, etc...- Forces you to stay clean! You simply cannot leave things on the floor anymore.- No brushes!Drawbacks:- Must be emptied after nearly every cleaning- ExpensiveI have been most impressed by what a wonderful job it does vacuuming carpet. I expected it to clean our wood/tile floors well, but it is unbelievable how much junk it can pull up. As I said before, my absolute favorite part is how we must now make sure all the rooms are picked up daily otherwise the Roomba cannot do its job. It has literally turned our household from slobs to neat freaks overnight. Find another way to do that for only $700.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I Robot Roomba 880 Cleaning Robot
Review: with the new brushes you don't half to rake the hair out of the brushes. It is nice to Sch. a time when it will sweep. It is a lot faster then the 360 I had. I am very happy with it . Thank you Amazon for filling My order. I am glad you had a 880 New .

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wonderful relief for ailing hip
Review: With bursitis in my hip I needed help with vacuuming.Ê Roomba has done that.Ê My only disappointment is that it does miss some of the dog hair on my low nap area rug which leads to my 4-star rather than 5 star rating.Ê I would highly recommend Roomba for anyone but especially for those who suffer with mobility issues.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wife had it on her wish list, got it ...
Review: Wife had it on her wish list, got it as a christmas gift, and she likes it.Ê I took off a star because its salty price tag!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best.Purchase.Ever.
Review: WHY DIDN'T WE BUY THIS SOONER???!!! This is the best home appliance purchase we've made in a long time. I read EVERY review on Amazon before this purchase. And we've had ours now for several months. My thoughts and tips:We don't use the scheduling - at least not as a rule. I find Miss Roomba does a better job if you make sure she works awhile in a specific area that is partitioned off by using either closed doors or the lighthouses or a mixture of both. Also, she's like any maid. She cleans better if you pick up a bit before she gets started. : )Ê Since she has come to work for us, we've done a much better job of "cord management" around lamps and electronic devices so that she doesn't get hung up. She can and does get loose but why waste her time? In the bathroom, I have her run once without the rugs down and then when she is finished I put them back down and have her do another sweep so that they get a good cleaning too.It's worth it to have a vacuuming robot just to clean under surfaces you don't regularly clean. Under our beds, under tables and side tables and chaise lounge. It's amazing where she can go.As to the noise factor, she isn't silent. But there is something soothing about hearing her clean. I run her every morning in our bedroom after I make the bed.It works best when cleaning our her dust bin to take the filter outside where you can bang it hard against a hard surface and not worry about where the dust flies. Keeping the filter clean is important to her power. We ordered a box of extra filters so that we can put a clean one in frequently and then rinse them out from time to time.We have "joint custody" of our grand dogs. Its amazing how much harder Roomba has to work when they are here. I don't think I realized before how much pet hair they really shed. But our little vacuuming robot can get it all up.I so wish I'd purchased Roomba sooner. She makes life so much easier. I was a little reluctant to make the purchase - it seemed like a lot of money. Honestly, I've never been so impressed with a vacuum, home appliance or home helper of any kind -- ever.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Roomba with the Lowest Maintenance Yet
Review: Why did we wait so long to buy this? We have had Roombas before and they have given us a long and productive service life. But when our last one died, we just went back to using the regular push vacuum.Ê That was a big mistake. No one is going to vacuum their house as often as they would if it is as easy as pushing a button.Ê Plus, we all have better things to do with our time.Ê Besides, can you vacuum under your bed or dresser with a regular vacuum? I didn't think so. So stop hesitating and just go ahead and purchase this Roomba.I am glad we got this model because it truly is much less maintenance than prior models.Ê We have 2 cats and we have never had to clean the main brushes. We have had to pop off the rotating wheel and clean that every so often but its super easy to do.Ê Plus, this one comes with a remote control, so you don't have to corral Roomba in order for it to abide by your will.Conclusion: Just get it. Yeah, it is a lot of money to spend on a vacuum, but your house will thank you for it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Do not give up your upright just yet!
Review: While the Roomba is good for upkeep, it is not your deep clean vacuum.Ê Does very good on hardwood and alright on carpets.Ê Do not expect to get rid of your upright.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba the Toy
Review: When you have a Euro wife that goes back to see family every year, then you need all the help you can get. Roomba 880 was ordered the day she left and so me and cats got to know our new friend.Ê That's the issue...cats.Ê My wife shows long hair Siberians (really shows them..one is US neutered champ) and so our house is regularly covered in fine cat hair.Ê The answer has always been to vacuum a couple times a week and we keep a very presentable home.Ê I assembled Roomba..very easy..read up on it and set it free.Ê It did well not going down the stairs that I had put a virtual barrier, it got out of close chair legs and all was well until it hit the cat hair. Its smeared it...yes...smeared it.Ê I ran it over the cat hair a couple of times until me and cats got bored and then I emptied the Roomba trash collector tray. Very little cat hair.Ê So I get out the great Kenmore vac and get up the cat hair in about 10 minutes.Ê Back goes the Roomba to Amazon...all is well on that end, but very disappointed that little Roomba is more of a toy than tool.Ê That too is the conclusion of the WSJ article in May of 2014.Ê In fact little Roomba is moving product defect by virtue of its advertising.Ê The Uniform Commercial Code 2.314 and 2.315 applicable in all states, requires products to meet both normal fitness requirementsÊ as well as special attributes such as picking up cat hair..."Cleaning Robot for Pets and Allergies".Ê It is neither fit for normal house cleaning and it sure isn't fit for pets and allergies. Thus if you live in an tiny apartment which is meticulouslyÊ kept clean and you need a cleaning toy, Roomba may be just the useless expenditure you have been looking for.Ê But if you have a real job to do, go to Sears.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: worth the purchase but not perfect
Review: When it works, it's awesome!Ê But it doesn't usually make it back to its charger on its own, which is what we understood it would do.Ê Not a big deal, just not what we expected.Ê Also, sometimes it doesn't cover all of the rooms.Ê It just vacuums one room then goes back to the charger.Ê However, it is such a help with keeping pet hair under control (we have 4 dogs that are inside / outside dogs), that we would definitely not want to be without it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What A Fabulous Device
Review: When I think of roombas, my mind goes to the episode of Parks and Recreation where Tom Haverford mounts an iPod to his roomba and named it DJ roomba. Interestingly enough, the manual for the roomba explicitly states one should not mount anything to the top of their roombas. Anyways, this robotic vacuum cleaner is great. It is easy to set up, essentially you can take it right out of the package and use it. I let it charge for a bit and then let the roomba do it's thing. The algorithms can be pretty confusing, the roomba cleans in what seems like a nonsensical path and can be excruciatingly slow. However, it does a good job cleaning deeply the first time you run it. Afterward, it takes less time to clean the room but still does a fine job. I will state that other people mentioned the roomba gently hits furniture, unfortunately the one I have seems to slam right into the coffee table among other things. It also gets stuck going over the stair ledge. However that's a matter of me not cleaning the cliff sensors. If you decide to get one of these, be sure to wipe it's sensors down often and to continuously empty the bin where it collects the dirt. It takes about five minutes to do this which is nothing compared to how much time it would take to vacuum yourself. Really, this is the perfect device if you're looking to cut some chores from your life and to save on time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: What was life like before my Roomba.Ê Dirty.Ê This is my years best purchase!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I like it but its not perfect
Review: What is our Roomba up against?2 huge Golden retrievers (one being 70lbs and the other so tall he is slim at 90lbs)4 rescued/adopted indoor cats (we rescue and foster so often have extra kittens we are fostering)1 13 year old teenage girl (and her friends)1 17 year old boy (and his friends)1 20 year old college student who splits his time between dorm and home (and his friends)1 husband ~ messier then all the above1 frazzled housewifeLevel of cleanliness: before roomba vacuumed 2 times a day. 3 times if company was comingFloors: no carpet, only wood and tileI was excited to see the "for pets" Roomba for obvious reasons =)This machine is not going to spring clean your home for you, lets just get that out of the way right now. It misses stuff. Its not perfect. However it does a better job then my kids AND my husband when I ask them to sweep the floors. I don't like a lazy Roomba. If I see its fully charged I am pushing that "clean button"! On average I think I am pushing the button 4-5 times a day? I don't keep track as the other family members push the button as well. Over time it does pick up everything. It gets the walls and corners which seem to always get missed when the above are sweeping. It does pick up the hair that is on the floors and keeps it to a minimum. I went from sweeping 2-3x a day to once every other day or so. That is a huge time saver right there! I don't find it as loud as many on here. I have a Dyson and the Dyson is tons louder. The Roomba makes noise. Its going to make noise. ITS A VACUUM. I don't find it overly loud but I don't turn on Roomba while watching a movie either.The bad or room for improvement:The bin is still too small. Two goldens shed a lot of hair. In our large family room I have to empty the bin once (and sometimes twice) a session. That is getting better as I am using the Roomba more and more but still wish that bin was a bit bigger!!I don't think it would do as good of a job on carpet. I have area rugs and it always misses stuff on the area rugs. It does a decent job on them but not great. However on my wood floors and tile it gets everything.I hope this review helps. Roomba is not a miracle worker. Your not Cinderella with little magical birds and mice flying out of it and cleaning your entire room for you. Feel free to whistle while you work though.For my family its a great tool to keep pet hair under control.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love him!
Review: What a lifesaver for a family with two cats!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Getting stuck too often
Review: What a disappointment. I was recently diagnosed with dust mite allergy and thought I would use this as an excuse to get a Roomba.I've been wanting one for a while and was very excited when I got it.however, it just didn't work for our space... it was constantly getting stuck between furniture and other part of the house. Every time we would get home we would find Roomba stuck somewhere.. either stopped or sometime trying to get out of where it was a ruining the floor by doing so.on the plus side, the few times it worked, it collected a lot of dust.I didn't think our house was such a death trap for Roombas but apparently it is.Amazon was great though and offered to take it back.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: No going back!
Review: What a difference! Some months back a friend gave me her old but working Discovery model. I used it until I couldn't get it to 'go' any longer (about a year). Once you've used a Roomba on top of your usual cleaning there's no going back. Since one of our family members is a Norwegian Elkhound I opted for the best available model for pets and allergens. Ours is a two story home with hard surfaces on the ground floor and carpet on the second. Roomba does an equally impressive job on both. Drop offs like stairs, fringe on rugs do not pose a problem. Now all I need is a 'stair iRobot!' Edited to include that the 880's profile is lower than the Discovery, and the towers, batteries included, are in the box.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What a blessing. My living room has never been ...
Review: What a blessing. My living room has never been cleaner and all cat and dog hairs are now just a memory.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Really well-designed and carefully assembled item!
Review: Well, I'm experienced engineer, which can build same thing from scratch: mechanical, electronic and software parts. I have few bobSweeps I've re-assembled them few times, repaired and improved.So I've decided to buy this vacuum cleaning robot to look at it. Impression is really good. Every part of this item was built by experienced engineer. Wise mechanical construction, wise software, well built unit. Engineers, if you are reading this review, your construction of brushes is a real miracle! You really solved problem of the long hair!PROS- detects wires and carpet's edges and bypass them- easily can deal with hair (I have cat and my wife have long hair) and much-much-much better then "bobSweep pet edition"- cheap parts- good customer service- easy to clean- long battery life- dirt detectionCONS- expensive- as other cleaners, afraid of black patterns on a carpet. this can't be fixed at all, you have to return it if you have black patterns. No, you can't seal optical sensors 'cause they used for dirt detection alsoBOTTOMLINE: cool thing and I'm happy with it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cleans way better than I thought it would
Review: Well worth the money. "Reggie" the Roomba rocks. Cleans way better than I thought it would. He likes spending time under the couch. Must be dirty under there. Our 2 cats are pensive but I think they will make friends soon. Worth the $.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Well worth the money, compared to older models it picks up more.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Robot Vacuum Nightmare Scenarios Realized
Review: We've had this roomba for about 9 months now and, while it's done a remarkable job in a few places, especially picking up our dog's hair, it's done a lot of things poorly and perhaps a few things so terribly I wish I could go back and not have the roomba.Ê So, to keep it brief, here's a quick overview of the things that we ran into over the preceding 9 months:1. This roomba will never make it over the slight bump from our flat kitchen floors to the carpet.Ê The moment it enters the kitchen area it will never ever return to the carpeted area.Ê Having a dock is worthless.Ê Having the lighthouses doesn't help at all, the roomba still slips into the kitchen area and is lost to us until it dies.2. Despite our best efforts, the roomba fails to get under and around our dining table.Ê The only solution is to remove the table completely from the room or just let the roomba do it's thing around that area (when it's not stuck between a chair's legs) and then come back through and clean up later.3. The roomba is incapable of negotiating an area that might have two parallel, long spaces that can be entered and exited from two different, far-away, spots.Ê This has meant that the roomba is unable to clean half our house automatically.Ê Having a fancy scheduling system doesn't add any value.4. After 9 months, the roomba is exhibiting incredible symptoms of failure.Ê It rarely can move along the carpet in a straight line despite every effort to clean and maintain the thing.Ê Very low maintenance feels like almost a lie.Ê And the device makes loud cla-clunk noises as it moves around cleaning.And here's the thing that gives me nightmares:One crazy night shortly after a vacation our Roomba had once again forgotten it's scheduling.Ê Well, it'd actually lost track of time and the schedule still was going to happen no matter what.Ê So, that evening we opt for a comfy dinner.Ê The puppy is left to guard the house.Ê And all's well.Ê That is, until, the roomba kicked on at an actually unpredictable time and rapidly cornered our puppy who's scared of the monster vacuum already.Ê Unfortunately, the roomba didn't let up and after the guy was cornered, he finally lost it and peed.Ê Then, out of the goodness of Roomba's heart, it moved that puddle of pee all over our apartment.Ê Professional cleaners had to come in to repair the damage.So, yeah, great robot vacuum, I guess.Ê For the price I paid, I think I might have been a lot better off just hiring a maid.Ê And heck, the thing is already falling apart, 9 months into it's supposed very maintenance free life.Ê I don't think so.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: IRobot Vacuum ... not suitable for all floors and areas?
Review: We've had this model for several months and it's been troublesome. It got caught under the dishwasher several times. Likewise, it got stuck several times in chairs and tables. But the biggest issue has been with the wool rugs and runners. For instance, the leading edge of a new , wool runner is showing signs of wear. The unit appears to shear the wool fiber on our large living room rug. The unit is always full, "stuffed" with fiber, after every cleaning so much so that the unit never makes it back to the dock. I wipe off the fiber from the unit every day. I know that some have written that on new rugs it is normal to remove lots of fiber but that's not the case here. So if you have rooms with thick wool piles I would not select this unit.We moved the unit to kitchen with attached family room where we have mostly wood floors and some thin nylon rugs. I'll give it a try and report back.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Another huge step forward in the Roomba line!
Review: We've had several different Roombas over the years, and even a few competing models from other companies.Ê With almost all of them, the cleaning that they did and the convenience that they provided has been wonderful and improved with each new model.Despite they constant progress, the effort required to clean the brushes out was the one flaw that always made us wonder if vacuuming robots were even worth the cost and time.Ê Because we have two dogs that shed a lot, we've always opted to accept having to spend 15 or 20 minutes each week cleaning the hair out of the brushes, especially since that brush cleaning has gotten slightly shorter and easier with each new model of Roomba.This Roomba 880 has largely solved the hair in the brush issue.Ê Its new design is dramatically better than previous ones, both in getting the hair into the bin, instead of onto the brushes, and making it easy to remove the hair that does end up on the brushes.We highly recommend this robot, especially for pet owners.Ê It is quiet, thorough, and simple to operate and clean up.Ê It is great.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: now it works great for our main living area
Review: We've had ours for a few months now. It took some trial and error to get the most out of it. But, now it works great for our main living area. I do wish the Towers/Virtual Walls were a little cheaper. You'll end up needing more than the 2 that comes with it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Our Daughter Named Her "Lamie"
Review: We've had Lamie now for nearly a year, and she's like a member of the family.Ê Care and feeding is a breeze - She lets us know when she needs to be emptied or charged or cleaned, which isn't often.Ê She's always willing to work, needs minimal or no attention, and consistently does a terrific job.Her lighthouse units reliably guide her through doorways and away from areas we'd like her to stay away from... the fireplace, for instance.We have a large house.Ê My wife's a neat freak.Ê We host lots of guests and need to keep our home clean.Ê Lamie works so we don't have to.Thank you Lamie.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What a cleaner
Review: We've had iRobots for several years now.Ê The 880 series is a significant improvement over the 770 series.Ê We have two, and they are used every day.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Only designed to cover 533 sq feet, no company literature tells you that!!
Review: We started with an 870 series and where it seemed to clean the entire main floor and return to the doc, it was crossing the entire main floor a lot which seemed inefficient, so we upgraded to the 880 because of the lighthouses.Ê The two weeks we had the 870, it would clean the entire floor and doc itself each team.The 880 however has been a nightmare for proper functioning...it will spend 35 minutes cleaning the same room over and over again until it eventually drains the battery and dies in the middle of the floor.Ê It doesn't seem to have programming that goes, "hey, I'm almost out of juice, I should abandon what I'm doing and return to base".Called iRobot and eventually customer care said, "well it is only designed to clean 533 sq feet so turn a lighthouse into an invisible wall, cut your 1100 sq foot main floor in half, let it clean half and dock...then after it is recharged carry the robot to the 2nd area and let it clean the 2nd area".Ê What?Ê Really? I'm going to carry this thing around?It's been too long for us to return it to the store so we are stuck with it, but I wouldn't buy one again as the 1100 feet isn't really 1100 feet with all the furniture and an island in the kitchen, but that isn't the point.The robot isn't simply smart enough to figure out it is almost out of juice, and dock to recharge...it simply stops and dies...really simple bit of programming they seemed to have missed in the 880.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Returned It
Review: We returned it. It worked fine for a week or so, but even then I had to redirect it because it has a strange cleaning cycle.Ê After that, it decided it couldn't clean around my dining room table.Ê I tried everything to fix it, consulting videos at the Roomba site and cleaning everything, etc., but it would stop short around the table over and over again.Ê If it won't clean, what's the point in keeping it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: nice to wake up to clean rugs
Review: we replaced our older roomba which we had all but worn out with this newer model. the algorithm that it uses to search out the dimensions of the room appear a bit different. the room seems to get covered more efficiently but in very weird situations it can get trapped. floor wise it really cleans the rugs well. we use it every night at 2am and it cleans our entire 1st floor which is a large living room a large dining room a kitchen a small bathroom and a small bedroom. its nice to wake up to a clean floor. (btw we got a new battery for the older roomba and gave it to our daughter where she is using it for a smaller house with two large dogs).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacuum to HELP with cleaning, but won't replace human effort
Review: We recently moved into a new house with hardwood floors all throughout the main level and carpets on the second floor. We already owned a Dyson but that has proven to be more effective for deep cleaning carpets than hard floors, so when my parents offered to get us a housewarming gift I asked for money to put towards this.My husband - who researches everything and upsells me on nearly ALL THE THINGS! - decided this was the model he wanted above all others; we have 2 kids, 2 short-haired cats, a 75 lb dog that doesn't shed but has enormous paws, and a yard that's 95% sand, so I was inclined to agree with him. We dock this under a free-standing, raised cabinet so it's out of the way but in a central location, and I run it on our main floor just about every other day (I've never brought it upstairs or used it on the second carpeted floor).While I am very happy with Rosie, she's not an alternative to floor cleaning for me; rather I work alongside it to make sure my floors get fully cleaned. Our dog drags a ton of sand inside the house and it gets EVERYWHERE, so before I run the Roomba I take everything off the floor that can be moved, including our dining table chairs, throw rugs, our dog's bed, his food dishes, and a step stool that we keep a basket on with my kids' snacks; I also close the bathroom door because Rosie has gotten stuck in that room more than once by closing the door by accident. Then I take a microfiber dry mop and gather up as much loose sand as I can get; I generally sweep that into a dustpan and remove it, rather than letting the Roomba pick it up, since the dust bin doesn't have a huge capacity (I always empty it after each run).Our downstairs is approximately 750 sq ft and the Roomba takes about 75 minutes to clean the entire area, which is not an insignificant amount of time. We have a fairly open floorplan with just one hallway and no doorways or stairs for it to navigate, so it moves pretty freely in what always seems to be THE most random pattern, but it nearly always reaches every section that I need it to clean (sometimes it misses my front hallway, for reasons I don't understand).It's not prohibitively loud; I can still have a conversation with other people while it's in the room, but I wouldn't attempt to talk on the phone with it working nearby; I often turn on the TV while I'm cleaning and have to crank up the volume AND turn on closed captions to know what's going on over the Roomba noise.I have to keep an eye on her because she sometimes gets stuck while cleaning under my dishwasher - which is just SLIGHTLY closer to the floor than the surrounding cabinets - and under one of our couches; it makes a pretty awful screeching noise while it tries to free itself, and if I don't get to it in time it will audibly tell me there's an error.That being said, the side brushes get all the grains of sand from underneath my baseboards that a dry mop and other vacuums can't get to (I also occasionally use a Swiffer Vac when the broom and dustpan won't cut it but I don't have time to run Rosie). It also does a really great job on my area rugs, which means I don't need to drag my Dyson down the stairs to specially take care of those. I always wet mop the floors when it's finished vacuuming, and this really does prep the area well for me to do that chore.All in all, the Roomba is absolutely a luxury item, not a necessity. If we didn't live in an area with so much sand I likely wouldn't have invested in this machine, but I don't regret the purchase. It's not perfect and does require a fair amount of prep work in order to run it, so I don't have it set to operate on its own each day (that's a fun feature, but just not practical for my house).I regret to say that I'd never be able to convince my cats to ride it, but I'm happy that it's not so threatening to the dog that he feels the need to defend himself - or us - against it. I have discovered small green Army figurines going for a ride on it, though, so at least *someone* has used it as a thrill ride.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love this vacuum and our floors are always clean now
Review: We received this quickly and with a personal email as well. We love this vacuum and our floors are always clean now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It isn't perfect, but I'm glad we have it.
Review: We really like this thing. It vacuums very well, though like others have mentioned it can have a difficult time navigating changes in elevation in the floor. We have particular issues on our fireplace hearth and unfortunately there's no good way to keep it off as far as I can tell. Doesn't hang every time. I love the programmable feature - we have the machine run every night at 1am, and when we wake up the hardwood floors are clean.Not a replacement for periodic deep cleaning, but if you have a pet this thing is a must. I'll give it 5-stars when they get the elevation change thing sorted out and ship it with something that holds the charger base in place. To help with that I recommend getting some non-skid pads. If the base moves at all it can confuse it and you'll wake up the next morning in the middle of the floor with a dead battery.Easy to clean the unit thoroughly. Picks up so much stuff that we have to clean it out every other day at least.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent vacuum that has exceeded our expectations
Review: We purchased the Roomba 880 over a month ago and we are extremely satisfied with it. We have a dog that is a German Shepard mix and a cat and it does a great job vacuuming up the hair. The basin will fill up quickly the first couple times you run it but if you run it every day like we do, it won't fill up as quickly. If you stay ahead of the fur like we do, it will fill up "normally" but of course it depends on your situation. The great thing is that while it's running, you can do other household chores which makes your day more efficient. I highly recommend the 880.I went through some of the questions and I'll try to answer the ones that match our situation;-We have fringe on two oriental area rugs and it does not get caught nor does it tangle. We have a dark design on ours and it has no problems cleaning them-It will not damage the baseboards. As it approaches the walls, it slows down as it can sense it-For our house (4,000 sq ft) it will not do the house on a single charge-We do have an open floor plan and if you use the lighthouses, it will do all rooms. You just need to setup multiple lighthouses-We have hardwoods on our main level with area rugs and it has no issues cleaning both areas-We have full carpet upstairs and it does a great job with cleaning it and getting all the animal fur up-Like anything else, if you want it to last you'll need to do a little maintenance like cleaning it up, replacing the parts as recommended. For the amount of money we spent on this, it is not a deal breaker for us-Just like a normal vacuum, you'll have to carry this upstairs and downstairs to clean those rooms along with lighthouses-We have raised pet feeders for our dog and cat and it will bump it but it won't move them-It can detect a "cliff" if it goes near stairs and ours does not go over-If the clearance is high enough, it will go under bureaus, dressers, beds, couches, etc. and it will clean underneath-It has not scratched our hardwoodsFor those asking how long does it take to (insert situation here) or will it scare my animals or how long does a charge last, etc. those are hard questions to answer because everyone's situation is different. The great thing about Amazon is that if you don't like it, you can return it within a certain period of time.I think I covered the more common questions so I hope this helps.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So worth it!
Review: We purchased the Roomba 880 directly from iRobot right when it came out. We were looking for a new vacuum anyway, and the reviews about how it handled pet hair sold it for us. We have 2 cats in 1,000 sq ft apartment. It's a constant battle against cat hair and tracked litter. So far, the Roomba has done really well with both! The rubber rollers on the bottom have been the biggest difference. Our old vacuum had the bristled roller on the bottom and wouldn't even rotate it was so tangled in hair. Now, hair isn't a problem. And the rubber rollers have enough give that when it starts to eat something like an iPhone charger, it just stops, and we can easily pull out whatever is caught (no damage to any items it's pulled in so far).When we first got it, we ran it several times in a row each ending with the "full bin" light. Definitely made me feel like we were missing a lot of the dust when we were vacuuming ourselves! Now we have it set to run every day, and it usually takes a few days to fill up the bin.It is a bit loud when it's in the same room you, but as soon as it rounds a corner you can barely hear it. We just set it to run when we're not home, so the noise isn't an issue. It gets over the raised edges in the doorways fine, and it'll go under our bed. If it's not in it's dock when we get home, it's usually pulled in something like a iPhone charger cord or cat toy. It would get confused more often when we first got it, but it seems to be a rare occurrence now.*Bonus*Our cats don't ride it, but they do follow it around. We turn it on when we're cooking and they'll be off following it instead of getting into the food.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Our third child
Review: We purchased the new model mainly because it appeared to be a significant upgrade to their previous model (given price difference and technology), particularly in the pet hair department. We just upgraded our living quarters to a 3,400 square foot home with mostly dark wood floors, which we had no idea would show as much crap as they do at the end of a day. Our most recent vacuum was a Dyson pet model, which although has great pickup, is super stinky (again, years of pet hair) and, well, it's a push vacuum. We've moved the Dyson to the garage and literally only use it for cleaning vehicles and the garage floors.This Roomba has changed our cleaning lives. My husband is in charge of babysitting the Roomba, and he runs it every day in our main living/dining areas with wood floors, and every other day on carpeted bedrooms and tile bathrooms. It picks up pet hair, tiny cracker crumbs, cat litter that escapes the litter box, and even helps a bit with dirty paw/shoe smudges near exterior doors. Cleaning at baseboards/corners is excellent, and it is able to make it over our rugs. Requires a bit of babysitting as It gets stuck on a random sock or lost/stuck under furniture every so often but that's a minor inconvenience compared to the overall time and effort saved. We've had something block the interior once (probably a small kid toy) but it's easy to tell when he just isn't doing as good a job, and easy to open up to remove the blockage.It does seem to be growing 'smarter' after 2Ê months, navigating individual rooms faster than when we first let it loose. The ' virtual wall' units are easy to use -- just draw an imaginary line you don't want Roomba to cross, then face them toward each other across the room. Roomba will clean the space on one side of the line and will stop and turn off when he's done. Also various dings, songs, and calls out when needing a charge. Does sense stairs as promised, he hasn't had a tumble down ours to date.My only two beefs are not worthy of reducing stars: Obviously the dirt holder can't hold much debris/pet hair, so it does need to be emptied - but doing that takes as long as unraveling and plugging in a regular vacuum. Also, I find it loud enough to request it only run when I am not in the room (i.e., at night while we sleep or when we are out of the house); however, I am pretty sensitive to noise and my husband and kids don't have this issue.We were worried about its ability to navigate wood floors, as the website states very dark wood can confuse it. We haven't had a problem with this at all, and our floors are a deep brown, almost black. We ordered directly from iRobot as soon as it was released, so Amazon didn't have it yet. iRobot's website said 4-6 weeks but we received it in 1 week. Customer service told us to try it and could send it back for a full refund within 30 days if we weren't satisfied or it didn't work on our wood floors.Obviously I can't comment on longevity, but 2 months after we put it to use it's still going strong, and we really put it to the test with frequency of use and the debris (shedding dog and long haired cat). If you are debating over a new vacuum this one is SO WORTH THE MONEY if you value your time or have a huge space that shows dirt easily. If you're researching it you are willing (or almost willing) to spend this kind of money on a vacuum. From someone who had major reservations, I highly recommend buying it (with disclaimer of a short time of usage).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A must if you have pets
Review: We purchased 2 Roomba! 1 for upstairs, other for downstairs. We run them everyday, we have 3 cats, & it amazing how much Roomba pics up on a daily. It saves my wife so much time & energy from vacuuming! We will own a Roomba for life.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and this one is like 10 times better
Review: We owned the first generation roomba red, and this one is like 10 times better. It does have some flaws. The charger wouldn't charge at the 4th month of purchase, chatted with customer service online and they sent us a new one. We liked it so much that we bought a 2nd one for upstairs. Now both of them has the same issue - the dust bin full red light won't go off, regardless the bin is full or not. Other than that, they are life savers.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: He is awesome. Best to run him the first few times ...
Review: We named him H.A.L. From 2001 A Space Odyssey.Ê He is awesome.Ê Best to run him the first few times while you are home so you can see areas he has trouble maneuvering in.Ê He fits under our furniture including the range which is great.Ê Keeps filling up with cat fur and dirt - even after the place seems spotless.Ê Wish I found him years ago.Ê He can read lips too.... shhhh... :-)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We loved the performance of this unit so much that we ...
Review: We loved the performance of this unit so much that we bought two more (one for each level of the house)!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: we love this. there is a new version on the ...
Review: we love this. there is a new version on the horizon. the 980. supposed to be much smarter and works with a phone app.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth the cost - Do it! You won't regret it.
Review: We love this! I know it's a lot of money and I struggled with spending that much but I now know it was WELL worth it. It runs everyday on our tile/carpet/area rug-covered floors. It works beautifully, getting into all those places the big vacuums can't go without moving furniture. Now dust and fur are no longer the downfall of owning a good sized home. I have a bad leg and I always avoided lugging around the big Dyson. This saves me time and pain. Plus, My animals who normally hate the vacuum are completely uninterested in this machine. Two days after I bought it, Amazon dropped the price by $70. I wrote to them and they refunded the difference. We're very, very happy!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: We love this Roomba. It really does a good job of vacuuming.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: We love ours!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing!!
Review: We love our Roomba! It works amazingly and does everything for me so I can take care of various other chores.Ê it follows the towers perfectly. It's amazing

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love our roomba and she is already a part of ...
Review: We love our roomba and she is already a part of the family! My only complaint? She already has a squeaky wheel. She vacuums like a champ!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love our new robot
Review: We love our new robot.Ê Does a great job of day to day cleaning on our hardwood floors and area rugs. Gets up an astounding amount of pet fur, dust, etc. I wish the receptacle was bigger. Now if someone could figure out how to empty itself into the trash.It cleverly figured out our entire great room/kitchen and does a good job keeping it clean. We let it loose in the hallways as well on occasion.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: we love it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: We love it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Rumba with my Roomba!
Review: We love how this picks up so much animal hair!Ê We have 2 cats and 2 chihuahua's and a clean floor!Ê Recommend for everyone!Ê We have porcelain tile floors throughout kitchen, dining and family room and this just works great!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Better than I anticipated.
Review: We live it. The room a easily cleans our 1300 square ft laminate floored house. The 3 bd, 2 bth house is done in one 2 hr stretch. It's amazing how much pet hair she picks up. Plus it is nice to have the sand the pets bring in gone by the time we get home b

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Meet Tito, our new best friend.
Review: We live in Florida and have 2 big dogs.Ê A golden and a lab.
