Lots of sand and dog hair.Ê Even still, I was really struggling with the investment of a robot vacuum.Ê I finally decided to buy the "cheap" one at 359.00It was the Roomba 650 and while it was ok, it just wasn't as smart as I thought it should be and a total PIA to clean.Ê Some friends have the 880 and swear by it.Ê I decided to bite the bullet and buy the 880 after I got a 20% off coupon from a retailer.Ê I'm so glad I did. It's well worth the extra money. The 880 is so much easier to clean, it has a lot more direction and even after a thorough vacuuming, it picked up still more dog hair. We have both tile, wood, and area rugs, it does great on all 3.Ê My tile is light and my rugs are dark brown with light colors and we have no sensor issues.Ê This little dude even went up on the edge of the door jam with the door open and hopped back down after cleaning it!I empty the cartridge after every cleaning, which doesn't bother me at all.I read a review about one spreading dog poop all around the house and getting inside the Roomba, which sounded so horrifying, I put the dogs on the patio and just hit the clean button when I take my son to school. We aren't very routined, so I don't have it on a schedule, but my friends do and that works great for them.Bottom line, it's expensive, even with 20% off, but worth every penny.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Vinyl flooring, shag, and flat carpet
Review: We live in a 102 year old farm house on a gravel road with 3 cats, 2 adults, and a newly crawling baby.Ê Cat hair and dirt/dust are serious problems here.Ê We have vinyl floor covering in the kitchen, a hideous shag/loop blend carpet in the living room, and flat, almost indoor/outdoor looking carpet upstairs in the bedrooms.Ê I dislike vacuuming, but the baby was getting almost as hairy as the cats and it was disgusting.Ê (He didn't mind, of course)Ê Fittingly enough, the Roomba arrived on May Day 2015 and saved my life.Ê Not literally of course, but WOW, has it ever saved me a lot of cleaning.Our house hasn't been updated since the 1960s/70s (we're working on it, but it's a slow process) and they used to heat the house with a woodstove in the kitchen.Ê That sticky soot stuck everywhere it touched - the walls are dingy, the floor is grimy, and even my carpet shampooer didn't take out the dingy stains. There was dust (older than me, probably) caked on the carpet along the edges of the walls.Ê No matter how diligent I was with the crevice tool and the regular vacuum, I just could not pry loose that sticky dust.Ê In less than a month, the Roomba had eliminated that nasty edge.Ê I don't know how it managed it; the rotating brush on the edge feels really soft, but it sure does a good job of beating out the dust in the places that a normal vacuum cleaner would miss.Pros:I don't have to vacuum, I just turn it on and walk away.It works while I play with the baby.The baby is fascinated by it.I've used it nearly daily for 6 weeks and I LOVE having clean floors with no work on my part.The cats are shedding like crazy right now, and still it manages to keep up.It has probably pulled a 5 gallon bucket worth of cat hair and dust out of our carpets in 6 weeks.Ê Seriously.Ê I can think it's clean but run the Roomba anyway, and it'll have nearly a full bin from just the kitchen & living room - probably around 700 sq ft.I've only taken it apart and cleaned the brushes once.Ê I have longish hair and there wasn't much wrapped up in the spindles, but it was really easy to pull out on this 880 version.Cons:It doesn't have great suction; it mostly relies on the brushes to float the debris into the dust receptacle.Ê Surface clean rather than deep clean.Ê Apparently I'm shallow, because I'm ecstatic with this surface clean!Dust bin is really small (After the first month, it can run more than once before the bin is full though)It has a ridiculously hard time finding its dock.Ê It has to be within about 18" of it before it homes in on the infrared beam, apparently.The virtual walls/lighthouses don't always work.Ê Sometimes I come home to find it dead instead of docked.The first few days I had it, it got stuck under the bed and behind the couch several times.Ê You'll get to know where it should and shouldn't go.It was staggeringly expensive.Ê Probably worth it, as long as it lasts 5 years or so, but it was hard to commit to!You can't watch it work or it'll drive you nuts.Ê It's a totally random pattern.Ê It generally cleans the whole floor by the time it's done though.Overall, this is a wonderful product and I'm really glad I bought it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: #NAME?
Review: We have used this robot vacuum cleaner for two months and compared it to the Roomba 650 and Miele Scout RX1.Cons:- It has problems entering carpets from hard surfaces. It seem to be a program error, resulting in parts of the room left from the cleaning process.- In some instances, it just stops when meeting steps instead of continuing- When docked, it usually makes an clicking sound. Placement in living room or bedroom is not possible, unless wanting to listen to this constant noise.- The charging process and battery life is unstablePros:- the design of the main brush is excellent if having pets as cats or dogs. Most robot vacuum cleaners have brushes getting filtered in hair, but the 880 avoids this due to the plastic tube used.- Efficient and rapid cleaning pattern- Low noise in example compared to the 650 model- Simple and easy programming- Lighthouse/area dividing system works well.We may have had bad luck with our unit, the best advice would be to buy this model in a store with good and reliable customer service as it may be needed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: you pretty much need to vacuum every day to keep the ...
Review: We have two labs...you pretty much need to vacuum every day to keep the hair up. We run this thing a few hours each day and now we vacuum manually maybe once a month...just to get behind and under things where it can't reach. Only drawbacks are that it fills up frequently so you have to empty it a lot, and it's a little noisy. Does its job very well, however (mostly tile floors, but it does get up on some pretty thick rugs that we have too without any trouble).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: great dogs but shedding machines
Review: We have two black Labradors, great dogs but shedding machines.Ê We were needing to clean the tile floors (2400 sq ft) every couple of days to control.Ê Had a chance to purchase a Miele Robotic cleaner for $99 (a savings of nearly $400) and decided to take a chance.Ê It is a little work horse but needs to be cleaned a couple of times each run.Ê It does about an 85-90% job.Ê We decided to step up to the Roomba 880 based on the great reviews we've read and thought that having two robotic cleaners might be the way to go.Ê For us, the Roomba 880 was worthless and we returned after a few days.What we liked about the Roomba 880:Ê it is a bit faster than the Miele and the electronic wall devices worked nicely to prevent it from areas where it might otherwise get into to trouble.Ê The Roomba came with two such devices and we could have used three more.What we DID NOT like about the Roomba 880:Ê Though faster it was louder, squealed at lot and drug fur more than it cleaned up the fur.Ê We have two area rugs (solid edges no fringes or loops).Ê The Roomba seemed to roll a lot of the fur into little 3 and 4 inch ropes and deposit them along the edgeswhere ever it climbed onto the area rug.Ê On the rugs it did not clean the fur but left lots of fur clumps all over the carpet.Ê Same happened on the tile floors in several areas.Ê It cleaned the tile floors better but still left those little fur "ropes" and clumps around.Ê The squealing was loud and irritating as it ran and we had to frequently stop the Roomba to clean fur from the wheels and brush to stop the squealing sound for a few minutes.Ê I tracked the Roomba for the first three days.Ê Its random movement seemed to miss some of our wide open floor spaces though it did a better job near the walls.Ê Too much work to keep it running, too little cleaning, too random and left too much fur on the floors.Ê Hands down, in our situation the Miele Robot (nearly the same cost as the Roomba) does a better job for us.Ê We really expected and wanted the Roomba to be our main robotic cleaner but we just had too many issues with it and were disappointed.Ê Thankfully, Amazon allowed us to return it for full refund.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: SPOILED after only one week!!!!
Review: We have three dogs and three cats, all living indoors. One of our dogs is a humungous 115 pound mixed breed, year round, shedding machine.Ê Our backyard is nothing but dirt as the dogs have pretty much killed all of the grass.Ê Before I started working, it wasn't so bad as I would vacuum everyday or every other day.Ê Now, I work a part time job AND run a small business.Ê The last thing I feel like doing when I get home is vacuuming.Ê I considered a Roomba for a couple of years but the price kept me from buying one.Ê My business started picking up about six months ago, which gave me less time to do the vacuuming.Ê I finally got tired of hairballs all over the place and not being able to walk barefoot without having dirt and hair stick to my feet.Ê I debated for almost a month and finally decided to purchase the Roomba 880 with my Christmas money.Ê I bought it from Bed, Bath and Beyond and used a 20% off coupon, which made the purchase very sweet.Ê Mine came with two lighthouses and a remote control.Ê I have not set up the lighthouses as I'm not really sure I need them as our house is an open floor plan and "Spencer" (yes, I named him) seems to find his way around pretty well.Ê I have baby gates in the three bedrooms to keep the dogs out of them and so Spencer is responsible for cleaning approximately 1000 sq.ft of hard floor living space which includes, a huge living room, small kitchen / dining room, formal dining room, laundry room, hallway and bathroom.I vaccumed the floors with my Shark upright before I even ran Spencer the first time.Ê I was amazed that he still managed to pick up a canister full of fur and dirt even after I vacuumed with the upright.Ê I haven't set up Spencer's automatic timer because I prefer to wait until I get home to run him.....the last thing I want is for one of the dogs to get diarrhea or the cats to throw up while I am away and then come home to the stuff smeared all over the house.Ê Its not the quietest machine but it's not the noisiest either.Ê It doesn't bother me at all to have him running in the background while I am reading and responding to emails.Ê Spencer usually runs about an hour to an hour and 15 minutes everyday.Ê He goes in a zigzag pattern but somehow managers to cover all areas, spending additional time going back and forth on some areas before moving on.Ê I assume he feels these areas needs extra attention (near the backdoor and in front of the fireplace, where the dogs come and go and hang out most of the time).Ê I can finally walk barefoot in the house and the floor has NO grit, dirt or hair!!Ê He goes over the small throw rugs by the front and back doors easily but I have a memory foam rug in my bathroom that is kind of thick so when he comes to it, he bounces off it and goes in the other direction.Ê He also seems to go over electrical cords without any problems.Ê So far, he has not gotten stuck anywhere and he ALWAYS docks himself after his job is completed with a little tune of "ta ta ta da!"Ê With the six mentioned pets, I DO have to empty the dust canister everyday.Ê I usually make this a part of my nightly routine when I give the dogs fresh water and snacks before bed and clean cat litter boxes.Ê Spencer is like one more little "pet" I have to tend to.....but a more helpful one than the other six I have!I'm not normally the type of person who goes nuts over a gadget, but I honestly can't imagine my life without Spencer in it.Ê If he ever breaks beyond repair, I will HAVE to buy another one.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacum
Review: We have the cleaner set to vacum every day and it works great! Easy to "set-up".

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is awesome!
Review: We have named our Roomba and our kids think he's (yep, it's a he) another one of our pets practically. I highly recommend this product. This is one of those things you have no idea what you're missing out on until you have it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Clear Champion in Robotic Vacuums!
Review: We have had the Roomba 880 in our shopping list for some time.Ê Recently, it was priced down by $100 and we snapped at the opportunity to buy it.Ê We have not been disappointed!We have had four robotic vacuums from three different brands.Ê We have owned a iRobot Roomba 770 since November 2013 (you can see our review of that product elsewhere on Amazon).Ê We brought it with us from our rental apartment with dark hardwood floors and white carpets.Ê We have two cats, both of which shed significant amounts of hair.We now have a 3-storey townhouse.Ê The Roomba 880 lives on the open main floor (dining, family, kitchen, office) consisting of 1200 square feet of travertine tile floors with thin area rugs (no fringes) on pads.Ê It is programmed to clean four days a week.Ê The Roomba 770 is on the second floor (three bedrooms, two baths, long hallway) consisting of 1200 square feet of moderate depth cut pile carpeting.Ê That Roomba is programmed to clean on a M-W-F schedule.Ê We tried out a Canadian competitor, the Bobsweep Pethair on the 3rd floor (lounge room andÊ bath) consisting of 300 square feet of moderate depth cut pile carpeting.Ê Bobsweep was programmed to clean once a week.As other reviewers have noted, the Roombas are comparable in cleaning capabilities to other brands, although we give a slight edge to the Roombas, which seem to us to clean edges better.Ê The Roomba 880 is quieter than the Roomba 770 and the Neato we used to have.Ê Although other brands claim to do a more 'disciplined' job of cleaning since they plot the room and then navigate around in swaths rather than the random roaming about employed by the Roomba, at the end of the day, the Roomba does just as good a job.Ê Although the brush/roller on Neato products is significantly wider than the Roomba, surprisingly, that doesn't really seem to make a difference that we could tell.Our Roomba 770 is doing an admirable job on the 2nd floor, navigating through multiple rooms, under beds, around chairs and always returning to its base station without incident.Ê We tried running the Neato on the same floor and it utterly failed.Ê I would not even do a small area before complaining that the carpet was too thick.Ê The Neato got stuck sometimes under overhangs and in spots it got into but seems incapable of getting out of.A major failure of the Neato was that the battery seemed to be running out of capacity as it started cleaning part of the floor and then returned to its base station to recharge before completing the job.Our first choice is the Roomba 880, followed by the Roomba 770 and in last place by the Neato Botvac 80.Note, having a robotic vacuum (or more than one) does not mean you sit and drink iced tea and do nothing.Ê We clean ours after every cleaning cycle and check the rollers for string, yarn, hair, etc. wound around the rollers.Ê These should be cleaned thoroughly after every use in our application because of the copious amounts of hair from our cats that collects in the rollers.Ê The Neato is slightly easier to clean as the brush/roller does not seem to get clogged as much with cat hair.Ê Still, it is a small price to pay to have your house as clean as these keep it on a daily basis.Ê At this point, I am vacuuming the stairs once a month and doing periodic spot cleaning with the regular vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great labor saver
Review: We have cats, and they shed like crazy [we're not sure how they still have hair ;) ]. The first few days the collection bin was full, but now I let this run every day and it goes about a week without having to empty the bin. It has not trouble with heat registers or throw rugs. If you don't like to vacuum, this is for you!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: She is amazing. She can pick stuff up even after using ...
Review: We have been very surprised by how well our little helper works. We named her Eve. She is amazing. She can pick stuff up even after using our dyson. Best vacuum design for hair. It just rolls up on the end of the spindles allowing easy removal. We have her running every day. She definitely carries her weight.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: An amazing tool
Review: We have been most pleased with the Roomba 880. She (the voice is female) cleans every room very well. We have three cats, and we have learned to run her three times a week. Even when the room looks clean to the eye, she gets an amazing amount of dust and dirt. We could not be happier. Obviously, she does not get above the floors, but even so, I notice less dust on the cabinets and above-the-floor items since we started using the Roomba 880. Yes, we do pick up chairs and furniture items that she could get hung up on. That takes far less time than vacuuming by hand - and I would have to do the same thing to properly vacuum by hand. The 880 comes with two "wall/light house" boxes and a remote. We have had to use the remote a few times when the Roomba got stuck under a furniture item, and it worked well. The "virtual wall" works very well. The "lighthouse" function not so well. We have learned to just keep the Roomba confined to one room or one area at a time. We have also learned to move the "dock" and allow the Roomba to start from the dock each time. That means for our house we move the dock three times each time we clean. It is no big deal, and it saves time and trouble in the long run. So, don't expect to be able to use the "lighthouse" to guide the Roomba back to its dock and let it clean the whole house. Technology doesn't appear to be there yet. But the little bit of trouble you take to move the Roomba and move the furniture pays off very nicely in a much cleaner home - and much less problems with dust and animal hair.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We have been amazed with how well the Roomba performs
Review: We have been amazed with how well the Roomba performs. We have three dogs but no more "tumbleweeds" of dog hair when we wake up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Better than expected!
Review: We have a single story house with a lot of hardwoods.Ê On top of that we have two dogs and two kids.Ê Therefore our hardwoods were constantly showing dust and fur.Ê We picked up the Roomba to run between sweepings to help get the dust and fur under control and keep the hardwoods looking clean.Ê The Roomba has excelled at this.Ê We use the virtual walls / lighthouse to have it focus on the foyer / great room every day.Ê Our hardwoods show very little dust and stay clean.In addition to the daily hardwoods, we run the Roomba in various rooms throughout the week.Ê For example, if we are outside with the kids I will put the Roomba in our master bedroom and let it run.Ê Doing this helps keep the carpets looking nice.Ê We were also pleasantly surprised how well it goes under couches and beds cleaning places our normal vacuum cannot reach.The Roomba is also well thought out and engineered.Ê I took the AeroForce Extractors out to clean them and they will only go backÊ in one way making it impossible to put them in wrong.Ê Our daughter spilled some honey on the floor that we missed and got all over the Roomba's edge cleaning brush.Ê It was very easy to swap this out for a new one.The Roomba is expensive.Ê For that money you get something that cleans great, provides flexibility in cleaning, and is well engineered.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOVE IT
Review: We have a lovely dog and a 7 months baby girl. I was troubled with so much pet hair all over and even cleaning everyday didnt make the job. We purchase the Roomba in hope for a fix and it did it. Scheduled to vacuum every other day the robot proven to be the best solution.Thank you.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is absolutely worth it!
Review: We have a lot of hardwood flooring, tend to have the windows open, and therefore tended to have a lot of dust (pollen, who knows what?) on the floors, especially evident in afternoon light. No more! When the afternoon sun hits, all we have is shiny floors.My take was that this is a gadget that might be useful, but was really pricy.Ê Some reviews of earlier models raised concerns about falling down stairs, eating cords and rug fringe, etc. However, tired of vacuuming three or more times a week, (even with a Miele), and fighting seasonal allergies it seemed worth a try.Wombot's first outing was in the living room cleared of all cords and other possible indigestibles.Ê It spent 45 minutes (and I think I heard tsk tsk from a neglected corner) and left the room spotless, including baseboards, chair and table legs, and everything it could navigate under or around.Ê Small area rugs were no problem. Now it takes about 20 minutes to clean the same space and this week had no trouble spitting out a cord that I forgot to move off of the floor.Ê It always pulls back from the stairs on its own, so I can leave it alone to do the hallways.Ê The gizmos that let you "block" off areas work really well.We have a three story house and it is no trouble to move it from floor to floor and return it to the level with its docking station. It sails under beds, desks, etc., although you want to be sure bedclothes and curtains are not trailing on the ground. The bin is easy to empty, and it reminds you when it is full.It docks near the kitchen, and what a wonderful convenience to easily turn it loose in there when a few coffee grounds have gone astray, or we have been baking and some flour has inevitably drifted on to the floor. It is really good at working along the baseboards and the base of the appliances, as well as the middle of the floor.In terms of noise, I run it in my office when I am working and am only distracted when it tries to clean my feet and I have to lift them off the floor briefly.Ê It is certainly quieter than a regular vac.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 880 keeps routine house chores in check!
Review: We have a large 4400 sq ft home.Ê Roomba 880s'work every day..Ê They can't always find their base stations however they clean remarkably well.Ê Wife said it was expensive but it was well worth it!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for long hair dogs
Review: We have a heavy coated Golden Retriever and was pleasantly surprised how much superior this model is compared to other for picking up dog hair and how easy it is to maintain.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A lot better for pets.
Review: We have a 300 series Roomba in addition to this 880 series Roomba.Ê We were initially gifted a refurbished 300 series and it worked very well until we got a puppy.Ê Once the puppy started to shed, in combination with my wife's long hair, the 300 series got to the point that after every use the whole brush assembly needed to be taken apart to remove the hair from the brushes and the gears hidden behind the plastic.Ê That is why we got the 880 Roomba.Ê Since switching out the Roombas, it takes 20 seconds twice a week to pull a very small amount of hair off the brushes and it is back ready to go.Ê It's not cheap, but if you want your house vacuumed once a day every day and you have pets, it's worth the extra money compared to one of the older series.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Terrible disappointing 880 roomba
Review: We had a previous roomba for four years, never a problem. I have just returned my third 880 roomba after multiple problems. Wow how disappointing. It would stop, wouldn't charge, couldn't dock, terrible noise and grinding sound.Customer support is terrific but what a mess this has been. 4th time better be a charm or we will ask for our money back and try another type.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Picks up much more than my previous Roomba 572 Pet Series
Review: We had a gift certificate to use up so we "upgraded" a 3-year old Roomba 572 Pet Series used in our bedroom.Ê We have 2 dogs and It's great how the Roomba can clean under the bed.Ê First off, the new 880 runs much quieter than the 572 or even another 780 we run downstairs at night.Ê But what really surprised me over the past few weeks is how much we still find in the new 880's pickup bin.Ê Since the 572 was previously running daily and wasn't picking up that much, the new 880 is clearly much more thorough.Ê Great job Roomba!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My new companion
Review: We got the Roomba 880 to help clean up the food and hair mess constantly regenerating from our two cats (okay, we also make a mess, especially in the kitchen.) While I am thrilled with the superb job it does at vacuuming, in an unexpended turn, I find myself addressing it as if it is another pet or person in the house. The cats are definitely jealous and I only hope my husband doesn't follow suit.Some notes after a couple months of adopting Roomba:1. It makes a ticking noise while on the charger that really gets on my nerves so I moved it to a less used part of the house.2. It gets full very quickly when it vacuums our rugs.One major thing that would make Roomba better is wifi capability and an app to control it. Who uses a remote to control their robots these days?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Zoila (that's what we call our iRobot) has died.
Review: We got ours right when they came out and ordered it direct from iRobot.com. Today it's 7 months since we first got the 880 and it's died. Will not light up, won't charge, nothing. I just spent about 30 minutes chatting with iRobot to get a replacement product. They are sending us a new robot, because we're within the warranty. Makes us nervous that such an expensive product would just up and die randomly like this after only 7 months' time. A little worried---

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but it's really easy to use and it clean really good
Review: we got 2 dogs and 2 cats, one long hair dog and one poodle, my poodle are ok cause he doesn't lose hair, omg with one white long hair dog and one white cat and one black cat, there are hairs everywhere on my floor. so cleaning my hardwood floor become a daily thing, this vacuum helps a lot, i almost gonna get two, one for downstair and one for upstair, but it is kind of expensive, but it's really easy to use and it clean really good, of cause it will not get every spot in the house, but it did really good job clean the hair on the floor and dust too. i wish it has bigger battery and quiet sound, but those are not big problem at all, still a really good vacuum. just schedule when you want it to work and clean the box when you get home. make my life so much easier.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love our Kevin
Review: We call our Roomba Kevin after the Minion. We love our Kevin. Could not live without it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fantastic for reducing allergies, may make you a neat freak!
Review: We bought this Roomba 880 robot vacuum cleaner to help clean our family vacation apartment. The apartment is only about 700 sq feet and is occupied for about 3-4 months of the year, so lots of dust accumulates between visits. I have a very severe dust mite allergy, and I usually sneeze for most of the time we are in the apartment, even if we damp dust and HEPA vacuum it with our Dyson canister vacuum cleaner soon after we arrive. I was very curious (and skeptical) to see whether Minnie (our Roomba) could alleviate these symptoms and reduce our cleaning workload while on vacation.The apartment has mixed surfaces. About two thirds of it is tiled and the rest is carpet, including the bedrooms. The floor plan is fairly open, except that the 2 bedrooms and bathrooms are separate along a corridor. This is important when considering how to use the robot most efficiently. Now that we have had Minnie for around a month, I have to say that she (has to be a she - the error messages are all given by a female voice!) does a superb job. My husband is an efficient demon with the Dyson, doing a VERY thorough job. However, he insists that Minnie does a better job than he can. My allergies have improved hugely. So much so, that we are going to have to buy a second Roomba for our home.Now for some nitty gritty:Pros1. Does a fantastic job, probably better than most humans2. Happily goes under beds, eliminating those dust bunnies which make me sneeze all night3. Very easy to use4. Very easy to empty the bin and clean the filter - takes about 2 minutes, maximum. Good idea to clean the HEPA filter with a handheld vacuum like the Dyson models, to prolong filter life5. Virtual wall lighthouses work very well, once you understand their intricacies6. Can be left unattended or scheduled to clean while you are away, once you have Roomba-prepped the area to be cleaned7. Massively reduces the dust load in a home, far more than human vacuuming can reasonably do. Be aware that the first few times in a carpeted room, you may need to empty the bin every 15 mins or so. It really is that good at picking up dust. Be prepared to babysit the robot constantly at first!8. Much quieter than a standard manual HEPA vacuum, but don't expect to be able to hold a telephone conversation with someone on a bad cellphone connection when you are 3 yards away from it9. Decent battery life. Probably about 3.5 hours on our machine. We can now clean the whole apartment in less than 2 hours - no need to recharge. However the first few cleanings, particularly on carpet areas, took much longer than this, and required an overnight charge to finish.10. I have long hair - about 4 inches below the shoulder. Minnie picks it all up, even from carpet. It can wrap around the rollers, but simply removing the rollers and tugging on the hair pulls most of it away in one neat coil. Much easier than brush vacuum cleaners!Cons (most of these are minor design niggles, and I have tried to suggest a way to work with them)1. Instruction manual leaves a lot to be desired. It is fairly brief, and tells you most of the essentials, but it doesn't help you to understand how to use your Roomba most effectively. The iRobot web site doesn't fill in the gaps. You either have to learn from experience, or Google and hope that you find the answer2. Some of the information in the manual is misleading. For example, the cleaning patterns illustrated are not how the 880 works. If you start cleaning from the Home Base, the Roomba does a sort of random straight line scribble over the whole room, not a spiral and straight edge clean as displayed in the manual. It will pay special attention to edges, but the cleaning pattern is not as illustrated. I am certain that many engineers who own Roombas may be on the verge of a nervous breakdown if they watch this apparently random pattern. Having said that, our Minnie does pick up >99% of "bits" that I have noticed before starting her. This includes bread crumbs, hairs, lint, onion and garlic papery skins, grit from drilling the wall, etc. Just be patient and don't obsessively watch - she will get it.3. Virtual wall light houses are essential for an efficient clean, and their use is very poorly described in the manual. From a combination of experience and reading, I have come up with the following:a) Virtual wall lighthouses (VWLH) supplied with the 880 (2 of them) can be used to divide up a complex shaped area to clean it more efficiently. When you start Roomba, it counts how many VWLH are present (seems like it may only be able to count to 3 though!), then immediately starts cleaning the starting area where you first pressed the Clean button. All of the VWLH devices go into Virtual Wall mode at this point, penning the Roomba into the area you designated. According to iRobot.com, the Roomba will clean that first area until it is clean, or for a maximum of 25 mins. With Minnie, this is NOT true. For the first few uses, she would clean an area for over 45 mins, so the online info is not necessarily accurate. Once Roomba has finished the first area, the closest VWLH will then go into "lighthouse" mode, allowing Roomba to cross into the next area. Once she has passed into that area, it becomes a virtual wall again, keeping her in the new zone until Roomba has finished cleaning it. It then reverts to lighthouse mode, allowing the robot to exit the area and proceed to the next area protected by a VWLH, if any. This process is repeated until the segregated zones are cleaned, at which point the Roomba returns to its home base.b) Light house placement is somewhat critical. The VWLH and the Home Base both emit a kind of "halo" of a no-go zone around themselves, so that the robot can't nudge them out of position. It seems to be about 8-10 inches in radius. This means that you must not place the home base too close to a doorway where you intend to use a VWLH, or the two will interfere, and the robot may not clean the room. We have found that the best placement is on the far side of a threshold, behind, but level with the door frame. Experience will teach you what works best for you.c) If you are cleaning a narrow hallway, do not put the home base on one of the long walls, as the robot may get confused and stay down one end of the hall for much of the cleaning cycle (yes, I have done this). The halo effect can block a lot of the corridor and make it hard for Roomba to navigate along it past the home base or VWLH. You will know this is happening if Roomba keeps pirouetting on the spot before moving on to an area it has already cleaned. Happens with VWLHs as well as Home base - so place them both thoughtfully!4. Blinking lights are not well explained. For example:a) A blue starfish light on top of Roomba means that the side brush is slowing down. If the robot is on a deep pile carpet, it may just be friction from that. If not, you need to stop it and untangle any accumulated crud from the side brush under the robotb) A flashing blue magnifying glass usually means that Roomba has detected extra dirt. This light will usually change to the signal described in c), but if it doesn't you may need to clean the counter-rotating rubber rollers as described in the manual, and wipe out the channel under those (when the machine is upside down) to the collector bin. The dirt detector in the 880 is an optical sensor (not acoustic as in older models) above the rollers in the channel to the bin - if it gets very dirty, it can give false signals.c) A solid blue magnifying glass means that Roomba is in intensive clean mode. Now this gets confusing... If it goes into this mode itself, it will do a fan-shaped back and forth motion over about a 1 yard area. If it is showing this icon after you pressed the Spot clean button, it will spiral over about the same area, unless it hits something, at which point it will go back to normal cleaning mode. Don't stress, it is cleaning!Ê :)5. We have never heard a full bin warning. It would be helpful if it was either used, or nice and loud! The machine does not stop cleaning when the bin is full, so you may want to clean again if you find it with a full bin, as it is obviously not very

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A Beast Of Burden, Not A Toy
Review: We bought this new 880 made specifically for pets and allergies. The purchase severely hurt the budget, but the return is bringing comfort to an allergic household member that is not physically capable of vacuuming. I had no idea of the importance of vacuuming until this highly sensitive individual joined our home; it simply has to be done daily. My spouse and I have done a good job of staying on top of it, but we've each had our misses and realized we needed a contingency plan; I recalled seeing a Roomba at someone's home and decided it could be the solution. Having a home with tile, hardwood and carpeted floors, my expectations were that we'd have to limit the Roomba to one area at a time. As it turns out, it's not necessary, the Roomba moves seamlessly from one floor surface to another. In an area with a thick rug on top of hardwood, it's usually a matter of it just rolling on and off, but I have seen it take two attempts. On tile and hardwood, I think the Roomba works better than any vacuum we've had. I deliberately set the Roomba to vacuum the kitchen's tiled floor immediately after using a Dyson Animal. Considering the floor had just been vacuumed, the amount the Roomba picked up was amazing. We've been playing with configuring the two included "lighthouses" to effectively guide the Roomba room to room, but I think it's going to require manual intervention to completely work. We're currently running the Roomba on a nightly schedule in the open plan area of the house. By the time I wake up, it has run its course and recharged. In the morning I empty the bin and carry the Roomba (handy carrying handle) to a different room and let it clean until it stops. The first few times, before letting it roll free, I'd forget to scan for obstacles. After a few loud incidents, it's become habit to remove or raise all that I can (chairs and trash cans on to tables and desk; shoes, dog bed and toys to closet; floor fan set outside of door, etc). In the short month we've had it, I love it. If my opinion changes, I'll update here, but right now I highly recommend.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It seems to do a great job of picking up pet (and human) hair off ...
Review: We bought this after installing hardwood and laminate flooring throughout our house.Ê It seems to do a great job of picking up pet (and human) hair off the floor.Ê We still go over some areas with a wet mop (Bona or other appropriate cleaner) to get rid of spots.Ê But it's really a treat to know that a lot of stuff was picked up by the Roomba.One note - you MUST stay on top of emptying the canister & removing hair from the rollers and edging sweeper.Ê If you don't, they'll clog up just like any other vacuum cleaner.Ê Read the directions on that and do it regularly.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Robot Takes Up Residence After Passing Its Audition
Review: We bought this a few weeks ago and love it.Ê In fact my wife only allowed the purchase if it could be returned to the retailer in case she didn't like it.Ê It has not gone back because in our scenario it is doing a better job than our traditional Dyson vacuum.I was initially concerned about the size of the dust bin but that was much better than I expected, especially after the 880 had cleaned the house a couple of times after I had already vacuumed the house.Ê It really does a very good job of getting dirt that the vacuum doesn't get, perhaps because our house has 100% ceramic tile and the AeroForce Extractors make physical contact with the floor instead of the vacuum passing just above the floor.The 880 has exceeded expectations, even considering the price paid for it.Ê It really does cover the entire area to be cleaned and has yet failed to return to its dock at the end of a cycle.Ê If you manually tell it to dock it will still take a few minutes to do that so expect that behavior.My one wish is that the Schedule function had a method for telling the robot to put schedules on vacation with one or two commands.Ê Currently you need to reschedule each day to turn that off and a single command would avoid that and then re-establishing the schedule once you were back from vacation.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Better than we expected
Review: We bought our Roomba 880 during the thanksgiving weekend sale. I was pretty skeptical buying this product but my wife was adamant in buying it (even thou I vacuum the house :) ). It has been working well for the last month or so. We use it to vacuum our 1800 sqft house every week (I do have to carry it around since we have step downs at 2 places).The roomba does a very good job in picking up the dirt. We were really amazed the amount of dust we find in the compartment after every clean. The 1st time we vacuumed our bedroom (which is carpet but rest of the house is hardwood), we were surprised to see the dust collector compartment full before it finished its full course (I had vacuumed our room the week before). Overall it is been doing a really good job. I haven't necessarily see any scratches on our hardwood floors (entire house is hardwood and 1 room is carpet) yet as 1 of the reviewers mentioned. The lighthouse seems to be working fine.Like any product, it has some drawbacks. It is LOUD. It does randomly go around the same place many number of times. But a chat with the representative revealed that it will be vacuuming the place for an hour at least before it goes to its docking station. It does error out (I guess error 6) when it recognises a staircase at which time one has to move the roomba before it can continue (has happened like 5-6 times till date). It does NOT recognize the furniture legs, it does go and bang into the legs but it does well when nearing a wall.Ê I have also seen at times that it struggles to go back to its docking station the 1st time. It moves the docking station and comes out of the station but eventually goes and sits in place.Overall a very good product. Pretty happy with it!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A few brief points.
Review: We bought our Roomba 880 back in August and we really love it. I would say the single best thing about it, other than the obvious of it doing most of the work, is that it fits under all of our sofas, coffee tables, dressers, etc. It simply cleans more places and more thoroughly than we used to. Many others have written great reviews on what to expect, how to use it well, etc., so I just wanted to add a few notes.1. Others have said that it really does stop at the tops of stairs, but that is not our experience. I can't express just how distressing it is to hear your very expensive robotic vacuum bouncing down an entire flight of (luckily, carpeted) stairs. I am somewhat disappointed that it didn't vacuum the stairs on the way down!2. This thing is rugged! After #1 above, I thought it would be in pieces. Not only was it sitting at the bottom of the stairs in one piece, after bringing it back upstairs, I pressed the button and it took off like nothing had happened. I bought another lighthouse for the top of the stairs, though. Two isn't enough if I also have to also block the stairs.3. It does fine over bathroom rugs and short-napped room rugs, but don't expect it to handle a shag-style area rug. We bought one after having the Roomba and it could neither get up onto it nor run on it if we lifted a Roomba onto it. Naturally, we returned the rug!4. It does get stuck sometimes, but that really just means you shouldn't necessarily expect it to start up when you're not home and finish without you. You soon learn where it gets stuck, though, and if you can't block it with a lighthouse, you just learn to listen for the cry for help. No big deal, really, next to the time it takes to vacuum the old fashioned way.Overall, I am very happy with the Roomba 880 and I highly recommend it. If I were buying it today, I might spring for the new 980 that maps the house. I know that iRobot says their algorithm makes sure the entire room is covered with the 880, but I would feel better knowing that the robot knew the room and tracked it's coverage deliberately. Still, that's a small enough thing and the new lower prices on the 880 make it very attractive now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not Great for Wood Floors
Review: We bought it to help us keep up with our dark wood floors.Ê They aren't terrible to maintain on my own since I only have two little girls and no pets, but I wanted it to do the vacuuming and then I could just wet mop and be done.Ê My first impression...Ê This thing is AWESOME! But after 2 weeks I was thinking "WHAT IS THAT"?!Ê Sadly,Ê I now have patterned scratches all over my wood floor.Ê A couple of scratches wouldn't be a problem, heck, its a wood floor, but these are a 45 degree angle then a circle and another 45 degree and another circle, repeat, repeat, etc...Ê RIGHT IN THE FRONT ENTRY WAY, and more in the kitchen.Ê The thing is so loud, I couldn't hear the scratches being made.Ê What good is a vacuum that you have to follow around to make sure it doesn't destroy your floor?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We bought a Roomba 880 and love the work it does in our all wood floor ...
Review: We bought a Roomba 880 and love the work it does in our all wood floor home. It keeps the place neat and tidy and we couldn't ask any more of it, well other than make breakfast but that's another upgrade or two down the road.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: We are very protective of our first robot, otherwise works great

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: wow. a huge step up from previous models
Review: we are a neato family, so the bar is set really high.Ê however, we were really impressed with the latest Roomba 880 model. . it did a damn good job in cleaning with the new side bristles that did get to those corners.Ê even though it still runs on a random walk approach, the bouncing against the furniture was gentle, and it comes with 2 cones/lighthouses that placed in the strategic points, help the roomba to find its base to recharge.Ê in cleaning the bin - itÊ was very easy to clean and the hair does not get wrapped around the rollers.Ê we were quite impressed in how much it picked up.Ê just don't watch it as it can be frustrating as it can go over some spot 6x and one are only 1x!Ê pricey for its functions versus some of the cheaper versions of Neato.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: For the time you don't have
Review: We all like to think we'll vacuum more frequently especially those of us with shedding dogs. I purchased this to replace my bristle one because I got tired of cleaning the dog hair out of the brushes!! Works perfectly and I no longer see dust bunnies or dog hair piles under my living room chairs. Easy to program. One thing to keep in mind is that you have to cleaning the collection tray frequently.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: Waste of money! And worse part is they wait until you use the product to acknowldge that yes they know if underperforms.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I plan to use the Roomba 880 daily in various parts of the house and know I will love it.
Review: Was sick over the holidays so haven't used it much.Ê I plan to use the Roomba 880 daily in various parts of the house and know I will love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Was quiet the hit for couple with dogs !

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Go for it!
Review: Was always curious about robotic vacuums. After reading reviews and performance tests of the newest 800 series Roomba, I decided to pull the trigger. Very easy to set up and program. Does require frequent maintenance, but it's quick and easy. The first few runs, it filled up quickly (I can't believe how much my upright left behind!), but has required less frequent emptying as time goes on. It goes completely under the bed. Something I couldn't do before. I don't have pets so i can't say how well it handles pet hair. It will pick up my girlfriend's hair and I will have to cut that out of the rollers. Literally takes 5 seconds. You will have to observe it's behavior/abilities and address any areas it has trouble with. It is relatively loud if it's in the same room with you. I have mine scheduled to run 5 days a week while we're out at work. I must say it is nice to come home to a freshly vacuumed home everyday. Additionally, it promotes a cleaner house overall because things have to be picked up off the floor and cords tucked away so it can run it's course without getting hung up. It does bump into things a little harder than I am comfortable with, so I will be adding an adhesive foam strip to it soon. The included (2) lighthouses/virtual walls work as they're supposed to. It's not perfect, but it does what it was designed to do very well. You will still need to vacuum in corners and areas that it can't get into, so it's not a total upright replacement. It does, however, always have dust in it's bin so it's definitely working. If you can get over the initial cost, it will keep on giving back. I'm so happy with mine, I'm considering the Scuuba mop robot (but that hasn't reviewed as well). No regrets with this purchase. Absolutely recommend!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Do Vacuum Robots Dream of Electric Sheep? I don't know, but this thing cleans
Review: Wanted to wait a few months before writing this review.Ê This is well worth the money. This is also not like the first few Roomba's iRobot came out with... this one actually works.Ê I never thought it would be such a time saver and relief for the tedium of household chores. At first, it seems like you're getting a really expensive vacuum with less "bag" space and a seemingly stupid methodology for cleaning.Ê I had that same thought, but you quickly realize how much time you will free-up with one of these and how much cleaning it actually does - I also bought an iRobot Bravaa to mop floors.Ê The Roomba doesn't get really deep into carpets like a good vacuum, but it maintains your cleaning job much longer and on hard floors it picks-up every little piece of free dirt and dust.Ê You're going to want to run it everyday but maintain some semblance of traditional cleaning.Ê So I still have our vacuum, but where you would need to vacuum maybe 2-3 times per week, now only once per week or less - we have pets so carpets especially need more cleaning.Ê We rarely, if ever need to vacuum our hard flooring.Ê You can set it on a timer for every day of the week.Ê It runs around the house, cleaning while you're out.Ê Sometimes it can't find the dock or doesn't hit a room we want it to (We bought the one with 2x lighthouse/virtual walls to expand the cleaning area and I wished the instructions were a little clearer on how to make this work seemlessly.Ê I've tried many different arrangements and it doesn't seem to always route successfully).Ê That's ok though, because when you notice it hasn't been in a room or area you want it to clean, you just pick the Roomba up and put it in the room and hit the clean button.Ê I find myself just putting this guy wherever something seems a little dusty.Ê By the time it finishes its cycle, the floor is 95-100% clean.Ê Anything it missed, you can re-orient it to that spot and hit the "Spot" clean button.Ê That's it.Ê It's simple and effective.Ê The charge lasts for several cleanings in one day, and if near the docking station, it will go back to its charger by itself.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Nice
Review: Very very good

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: very simply, it does the job and saves my wife a lot of work

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ooh la la roomba....
Review: Very pleased with the 880 first time out.Ê It did a better job than I anticipated.Ê It went around the legs of my counter stools and under most of the furniture.Ê Much quieter than my regular vacuum. I would not run it unsupervised.Ê It doesn't hold a lot of debris so it needs to be emptied more ..also looks like frequent filter changes will be in order.Ê That being said, it still deserves a five star rating.Ê Hope it stands the test of time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth having, probably not worth the money.
Review: Very novel.Ê Generally effective.Ê Extremely small dirt bin.Ê We have a cat and the dirt bin fills up very quickly with cat hair.Ê It's nice for keeping the place generally clean, but it's no where near as effective as a good vacuum and swimmer.Ê That said, it saves on the workload so I don't mind it.Ê Probably not worth the exorbitant amount of money they're charging for it, especially since it seems to have a hard time remembering where the furniture and walls in the house are.Ê (They don't move).Ê It also has a hard time finding the dock, which I have tucked out of the way.Ê It might work better if I moved the dock into a more open area, but I'd rather have it out of the way and mostly out of sight.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: Very nice product. Works great!The amazon service is also great! Fast and reliable!

Review: Very intelligent. I read other reviews abouts is chaotic nature of patterning, which is does do, but we are very pleased with its performance. We have a 2100 sqft floor it cleans and besides some areas it cannot get to, everything is clean. It's definitely not a onetime 100% cleaning device. It takes a few days for it to hit all areas. Seems to vacuum for 1-2 hours per day. We're not sure why it varies from day to day. Overall we couldn't be happier.
