Review: Very convenient, sturdy and more than I expected from such a small machine! Never will I go back to manually handling sweeping/vacuuming!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Mobile Kitten Vacuum / Friend
Review: Vacuums fur and dander before it even touches the ground!Ê Kittens think the on/off button is too easy to hit with their paws on accident while riding, but device works great otherwise. Human has tried without success to separate kittens from their iRobot pal... Admits the extra weight on top of the device is probably not good for the warranty, but well worth the entertainment. Would buy another >**<

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth it
Review: Used practically daily for 4 months. Still going.1,500 sq ft hard floor house with a few throw rugs. 2 lab mixes, 2 short hair cats, 1 parrot.I keep the bedrooms closed to minimize trap zones and to encourage it to cover the rest of the house.It frequently gets stuck between the toilet and wall in both bathrooms so I'm not sure why it hasn't "learned" not to go in there. The last few weeks, it's dropping a wheel off the edge to the stairs, thus unable to maneuver out. I have cleaned the sensors. I have not called customer service.It will maneuver behind the sofas and out the way it came in.Dirt bin is small but as long as it is run (and emptied) daily, it seems sufficient.It does pick up medium size dog kibble and bird feathers.A hairspray cap got stuck between the pick up wheels and wore a bald pattern so I needed to replace those (easy peasy).I like how each day can have its own programmed start time.It is about as loud as a normal vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Unbelievable how much pet dander and dirty it picks up
Review: Unbelievable how much pet dander and dirty it picks up, works great!!Set the time and let it go and it does the job!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 880 vs. Neato XV Signature Pro
Review: Two years ago I purchased a Neato XV Signature. It did a great job. But last month the its LCD panel died. I gather it's a known problem solved only by buying parts on Ebay and undoing a million screws, including two crucial ones hidden behind white tape. Irritated by the whole situation, I was ready for something new. So, bolstered by the excellent reviews of the Roomba 880, I decided to give it a try. It proved to be a mistake.Navigation. I knew before buying the Roomba that it employed a very different algorithm than the Neato. The Neato sizes up a room, cleans the perimeter, mows it efficiently, and returns to its starting point. The Roomba leaves its dock with the enthusiasm of an anxious but blind roadrunner. It ricochets off walls and furniture, apparently relying on Chaos Theory to ensure thorough coverage. While the Roomba moves faster than the Neato, it takes longer for it to clean the same square footage because it doesn't care if it goes over and over the same area, whether that area needs cleaning or not. Often I find the Roomba in the middle of a hallway turning in tight circles for no apparent reason. Despite, or perhaps because of, its lower profile, the Roomba also seems to get caught beneath cabinets more than the Neato.Docking: The Neato rarely had issues finding its way back to its dock. I put the Roomba's dock in the same spot as the Neato's, and the Roomba can rarely find its way home. I had to pick another less-convenient docking spot for the Roomba to give it any shot at all. Oddly, the Roomba doesn't seem to like its dock very much. Often the first thing it does during a scheduled cleaning cycle is to crash violently into its own dock, knocking it sideways and making it impossible for docking without human intervention.Lighthouses and virtual walls. The Roomba relies on little battery powered towers to help guide it around the house. The virtual wall function of these devices works well. Too bad you only get two of these useful devices in the box. You can order a third one for $35 or so, but there's no point getting a fourth since the Roomba can't cope with more than three at a time. For houses with complex floor plans or with floor cables that need protection, this is a bad limitation. Honestly, I never could get the hang of the Lighthouse feature. It just didn't seem to help the Roomba navigate more efficiently. All this is in contrast to the Neato, which uses black magnetic floor strips to block the robot from entering certain areas. These strips can be placed as needed and without limitation. They require no batteries and work flawlessly. The Neato doesn't require any lighthouse help: it methodically cleans using on-board laser-guided navigation.Cleaning. The Roomba has a blue LED on top that illuminates when it senses particulate matter requiring extra attention. The theory and the light are fine, but I wasn't convinced that the light came on in especially dirty areas, or went off when those areas were.clean. Sometimes the Roomba would move away from an area while the blue light remained on, as if it conceded that this blue-light area (which was perfectly clean) was just too demanding to clean. The Roomba comes with a small spinning side brush intended to clean dust along the baseboard. Since new Neatos have adopted this feature, I guess its a positive feature. But that doesn't make up for the round shape of the Roomba, which prevents it from getting into corners very effectively. The D-shape of the Neato, and the fact that its rollers are wider, make it superior in the corners, with or without a spinning side brush.Noise. The devices are equally noisy, despite the Neato's more powerful motor. Neither machine generate as much noise as our upright.Dirt cup. The Roomba's dirt cup is considerably smaller than the Neato's. Guess this makes sense since the Roomba picks up less dirt. It's easier to empty the Neato's cup too; you pop off the filter and tap the cup and filter over a garbage can in one motion. The Roomba's dirt cupÊ demands that you open its narrow side door. You can tap the container too, of course, but I find that I often had to dig cat fur and such out with my fingers. And then the cleaning isn't done: I also have to open a separate hatch to get to the filter. Cleaning the Roomba's dirt cup and filter isn't hard; it just takes 30 seconds longer and is a bit messier.Remote control. Consumer Reports downgraded the Neato for its lack of a remote control. The Roomba has one, but I can't figure out why anyone would use it. I mean, isn't the idea to set the robo-vacuum and forget it? Who wants to bother directing a Roomba around the house?Ê Might be fun for three minute or so, but then what? The Roomba is not some radio-controlled hot rod; it moves like a staggering drunk when attempting to obey remote commands.Scheduling: Both devices can be scheduled without much effort. It's easier and nicer to do on the Roomba, however, since it has some excellent buttons for this purpose.Cat response. Our three cats view both the Roomba and the Neato as mildly annoying, but harmless, No cat seems to want to follow them around or ride them.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 3 cats and several house rabbits- doesn't mind filth and squalor- just happily sucks it all up- does have a small dust ...
Review: Tough little guy comes out to clean up behind 2 long haired dogs, 3 cats and several house rabbits- doesn't mind filth and squalor- just happily sucks it all up- does have a small dust bin that must be emptied often and if the scraps of bunny hay are too long they can wrap around the rollers and need extricating. Floors all look great- works on wood, brick,tile, pergo and rugs (none with fringe)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: it was full of sweet kitty fur
Review: Today I purchased the Roomba 880.Ê I quickly set it up and off she went!Ê It ran about an hour before running out of steam becauseI used it straight from the box ~ I'm not sure how long it will last with a full charge.Ê My housekeeper was in today and vacuumed theentire house.Ê After Roomba rumbled around for an hour I checked the container and , sure enough, it was full of sweet kitty fur.Ê Sofar I'm Very pleased.Ê My kitty lost interest after 10 minutes...HiÊ ~ This is day 2 of Roomba ownership.Ê I LOVE this machine!Ê As mentioned, I have a cat and the sweet kitty sheds.Ê Roomba gets the fur but much, much more....it picks up dust and dirt and very fine particulate.Ê I have a Dyson that does a great job but this is the icing on the cake for fastidious people!Ê Sitting here on my South Texas ranch, in the middle of nowhere, boots up and appreciating the beautiful prairie ofÊ bluebonnets and the fact that I'm accomplishing something inside while doing absolutely nothing out.I've had the Roomba for several days now.. It does an excellent , amazing job getting dirt from a very clean floor & carpet.Ê One suggestion for improvement is a locator button.Ê I've searched the house for about 5 minutes and can't find it.Ê Otherwise,Ê it's an incredible machine!One week with the Roomba 880~ I can't fully express how much I LOVE this machine.Ê It's the #1 best purchase I've made in years.Ê Put it on a freshly vacuumed carpet or floor and it will continue to pull out very fine dust, dirt and impurities.Ê Absolutely the best invention since God created kitties!!! 8~)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does the job
Review: Thought my new apartment was clean.Ê After pulling several liters of dust out of this machine's pan, I know it is now.A mobile, desktop, or web app that could interact with the device would be a nice addition to the pretty clunky 4-button interface.Clunky interface (that I've already managed to hit the "set clock" button on accidentally while emptying the dust bin), and lack of time to evaluate durability is the reason for the -1 star.Ê I'll bump this up to 5 if it's still working as advertised a year from now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: highly recommended
Review: Thought about buying this for a while...friends/family had one and loved it.Ê It wasn't until we saw one in action and our friend said "as a vacuum it works better than our Dys*n" we have been very happy with this thing.Ê Does a fantastic job. So nice to just let it do its thing. Our floors are cleaner because it's so easy to use we do it all the time now vs vacuuming once in a while.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This works perfect and I love to come home at the end ...
Review: This works perfect and I love to come home at the end of the day and not have to worry about pet hair all over!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: this works great for me
Review: this works great for me,Ê I have a part husky dog and she sheds A LOT.The machine works well on tile and carpet. It is easy to dump the reservoir and the battery life is sufficient for my needs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Terrible experience with iRobot
Review: This was the worst item I ever brought from Amazon. Horrible experience with both product quality as well as customer services. I brought the 880 on Amazon and first time to use it was 4 months later in another country. However, after 4 times use for cleaning rooms. It stopped recharge the battery and machine just went died. I tried to contact local iRobot customer support but they mentioned that your item is not supported since your brought it from US. And I contacted customer support in US, they wrote back that you need to find local customer support. I don't mind that I had back luck got a low quality machine but I do mind that their customer service for not doing their work. I went to iRobot website and read their warranty terms which I should go through before placed the order. It is not a good product warranty. So I would say I will take my lesson with $699.99 for cleaning my room for 4 times : )I will not recommend people who read my review to buy iRobot products with following customer profile:1. You are planning to buy iRobot product in US and use it in other countries. You will not get proper customer services;2. You mind quality of any electronic product and don't want to a lucky draw with $700;3. You think customer should get good service and care.At the end, 880 did clean my room, with $175 each time : p

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, love it
Review: This was the very first one to be invented, and over the years havemade this machine PERFECTION.Ê Love, love it.Ê it cleans betterthan anyone ever.Ê Quiet, efficientÊ and re-docks itself when done.Amazing machine. Knows when there is something close, knowswhen the next room is a (sunken room) knows everything. Cango under furniture, around furniture, no need to move furniture.So easy to fit under couches and etc.Ê The corners of the hardwood floors are cleaned !Ê I can't say enough good thingsabout this machine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This was such a nice surprise! I was very skeptical but once I ...
Review: This was such a nice surprise!Ê I was very skeptical but once I figured out how to use it, it was extremely satisfying emptying the collection bin.Ê Sounds funny, but I really like clean floors.Ê Its really amazing how much this little thing can pick up.Ê I really use it every day.Ê I hoped I'd like it this much and I did!Ê Especially in pollen season.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My newest BFF
Review: This was my birthday gift from my husband this year. He couldn't believe I wanted a vacuum cleaner. This is so much more, I really really love it. We don't have pets but we have wool rugs that shed worse than ten cats! The first time I used it on the rugs I had to empty it three times before it finished. Now I let it loose twice a week and the wool hair is now under control. It is well worth the money. The instructions are easy to follow. At first it seems to run in random patterns but after it runs around your house a few times it seems to learn patterns to follow. I did not know it had a "voice" and the first time it "spoke" It really startled me.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: New Age Vacuuming
Review: This was a pleasant surprise. This little gadget will vacuum close to the floor so it's relatively quiet. It doesn't need a jet engine to elevate debris into a canister. It zips under furniture I had trouble forcing my vacuum head and wand under, and no more getting on my knees to do it! I did vacuum my carpets before, but the first time I used this I thought my new calling in life was to empty the little dust bucket. It let me know how much dust I was missing. After using it the first couple times I noticed my carpet was actually brighter, and I only had to empty the dust bin, perhaps once. I let it vacuum for well over an hour. I was usually sick of myself vacuuming well before that (I have a small house). If you set up the virtual walls or close doors to keep it in an area you can leave to do something else, the same as you would with a laundry or dishwashing machine. It won't do stairs and you need to be aware of things to help it, like moving furniture and capturing wires etc.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing worth every dollar!
Review: this was a first for us but living in a much bigger home now with lots of hardwoods cleaning was a constant problem woth 4 pets. Roomba keeps everything in check and is pretty quiet the animals just get out of its way and let it do its thing. One thing learned the hardway was to do a quick check before it rolls out incase there is a pet mess or something that shouldnt be ran over on the floor....

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: in effect "Too bad! " Well
Review: This very expensive vacuum doesn't dock well.Ê I have to lift it up onto the charger, match the points and then stick a small box under it for the contact to be made.Ê F & F Fulfillment, the seller, said, in effect "Too bad!"Ê Well, imagine my disappointment.Ê I have sent an email to the manufacturer and after three days have not heard back from them either except to assign me a number.Ê Honestly, don't you think that's pretty shabby customer relations?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This version of the Roomba works great to pick up pet hair and dust
Review: This version of the Roomba works great to pick up pet hair and dust. It really stuffs the pet hair into the tiny compartment until none can be stuffed in anymore so you are not having to clean it every few minutes. I keep a pair of needle nose pliers handy to pull the hair out, as well as a can of compressed air to thoroughly clean out the collection area. We have a two-story house so it gets shifted from one floor to another. The dogs got used to it pretty quickly. Now, one pays so little attention to it, it runs into her and she doesn't even care.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fantastic
Review: This vacuum is so helpful for people who are gone all the time and too busy.I have a regular vac also and I admit my Roomba does a better job than I do! (that is so sad...)My complaint is that corners aren't really dealt with and sometimes it will get stuck on things and die when you're not home. Also it seems to go over the same places a billion times when you want it to go do another spot. So sometimes by the time its running out of steam and will dock itself to recharge, it hasn't cleaned the whole room. So that can be frustrating.Other than that though, this has been a serious blessing for me because I am too busy and its refreshing to come home knowing that there's less dust on the floor which helps SO much with allergies.My apartment is 400 square feet of hard floor and it does die a fair amount so I would question it's ability in a large home.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome, save us a ton of time
Review: This vacuum is awesome!Ê We have it set to vacuum everyday at noon (while no one is here).Ê It keeps the house clean.Ê I haven't used the large vacuum in a month!Ê It works very well on carpet and hardwood floors.I love this thing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This Vacuum is amazing! It goes all over my tile floors and ...
Review: This Vacuum is amazing!Ê It goes all over my tile floors and up and over my thick wool rugs with no issues.Ê I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Sit on the couch to vacuum.
Review: This vacuum is amazing I was sweeping every day and now that I have the vacuum it gets more dog hair than I could ever imagine. I have time to do other things while vacuuming.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent vacuum definitely worth it
Review: This vacuum is absolutely amazing and worth every penny. I should have purchased this a long time ago. When I get home the carpet and hardwoods look amazing and I didn't have to touch a thing. This vacuum is every bit of not better than any other vacuum I have used. It leave lines in the carpet so you know it has done a good job and it will even suck up nerf darts. There is no way to hurt or scratch the floors. It is a little loud so I would not recommend running it at night when you are sleeping. I definitely recommend this to anywone who is even thinking about it. You need this in your life!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Life-changing vacuum! Highly recommend
Review: This vacuum has changed my life. It works extremely well, picking up a ton of dust, cat hair, litter, dirt. It cleans close to the walls/cupboards and even can clean between all the dining room chairs. It also cleans rugs well. The filter is easy to empty. I have a physical injury that makes vacuuming with a standard vacuum very difficult, so this has made it much easier to keep the house clean! Highly recommend.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love my robot minion
Review: This vacuum does everything as described. It incredibly useful to the point of being indispensable. I'm only upset that I didn't buy this thing sooner.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great cleaning unit!
Review: This vac really works well.Ê I was a bit skeptical, thinking this wouldn't do the job of an upright vac, but it has amazed both me and my wife.Ê What a wonderful unit.Ê Frees us up to do other things while it does the cleaning!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This unit is the perfect partner to help keep the pet dander and pet ...
Review: This unit is the perfect partner to help keep the pet dander and pet hair cleaned up.Ê We have two labrador dogs and needed the help.Ê It serves us well and is well worth the money.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: #NAME?
Review: This unit (I purchased from Bed Bath and Beyond via a 20% off coupon) has a challenging time navigating my floor plan.Ê It's not a complicated perimeter but there are a few chairs, sofa, coffee table in near proximity to each other and the Roomba will regularly get lost or stuck under one of the mentioned items.Ê I've reverted back to using a broom and a regular vacuum cleaner, overall time to clean is less than using Roomba which I constantly have to get back on track.Ê -- Bought a Dyson Animal and really like it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing works great..
Review: This thing works great...Ê I had one of the original units from many years ago and it worked fine....Ê But this new version works amazingly well...Ê No more cutting hair from the rollers and it's suction is great...Ê Leaves the floors very clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: in a good way!
Review: This thing will change your life....in a good way!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: fun to watch and try and figure out what it's ...
Review: This thing rocks. fun to watch and try and figure out what it's thinking.Ê the remote control sucks. its to hard to control with any precision. it does a great job cleaning. gets stuck on towels and clothes so I have to pick that stuff up, it makes me be less of a slob.Ê The price is too high, wait for the 15% sales before purchasing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very good at new carpet fibers
Review: This thing rocks!Ê It picked up a ton of fine carpet fibres that managed to escape regular vacuuming missed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is the greatest thing ever invented
Review: This thing is the greatest thing ever invented! I'm so happy with it. I have had it for about 2 months or so. I have two cats (persians really furry and sheddy). I shake out hair balls the size of my fist from the trash tray. Great for people with animals that shed a great deal. I rarely ever sweep, and when I do I turn it on and let it run while I sweep behind and under areas the roomba can not reach and it just sucks it up with very little effort on my part. To be fair we do have a very small living area, but it is perfect for people on the go or college students that don't have literally any time to spare cleaning. I was sweeping 2-3 times a days due to the cat and dog fur, and my bf says he's never seen the floors cleaner. Initially I was running it twice a day, and now I'm done to once a day 7 days a week. I also was hesitant to buy it after reading the few bad reviews, and just took the leap of faith and so glad I did.Ê Best money I ever spent. I work, intern, and go to school and this saves me time and lessens my stress about the dirt on the floors (because I'm a clean freak). I can walk on my tile floors barefoot and it feels like I had them professionally cleaned. I will say that I have a small shaggy carpet that I just pick up and shake because it does not do that great on that particular carpet type, but if you have tile this is freaking amazing!!! You will also waste a lot of time staring at it do its work because it's just simply cool and fun to watch. I really want to try the scooba roomba now.... but i'll have to wait on that a bit and see how it pans out review wise and with technology updates before I just to invest in it. I will say that I will be a Roomba follower now and in the future.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!
Review: This thing is great. My house is all wood and tile floors, which seem to get dirty as soon as I vacuum. The roomba was up & running within 5 min of arriving. It's pretty straightforward. Picks up everything, including those elusive dust bunnies. Goes under beds & couches. Easy to clean out the bin. Only con is it's pretty loud.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Just like all the other reviews... excellent.
Review: This thing is great.Ê Get one and enjoy.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: worth every penny
Review: this thing is awesome...I was skeptical at first but sold on it. I have two large dogs that shed a lot and for the most part this keeps up with it. holds a good charge and gets all sections of the room.Ê easy to operate/clean etc.. so far so good.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Roomba ever
Review: This thing is awesome. Hair does not get stuck in it like in older models. It also doesn't do quite as good of a job, but it's close enough. The best part is the hepa filter that cuts down the dust in my house and makes everything feel clean. Love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Convenient and effective little sucker
Review: This thing is amazing. We let it run nightly, and we've seen such an improvement in the amount of fur floating around. We have pets that shed heavily, and this has really reduced the frequency with which I need to thoroughly vacuum the whole house. We don't have any carpeting, with the exception of a couple small rugs by the doors, and the Roomba has never had any issues with those.This is our first Roomba, so I cannot compare new features to the previous models. We've yet to have any issues with tangling of hair/fur. The battery life has been great, and it's very easy to program. With frequent use, the bin size is sufficiently large.Ê If we skip a day, it will fill up and we'll need to empty/restart it, but that's just the nature of living with our heavy-shedders.A minor negative (and it is super minor) is that we've had to loosen/tighten the side-spinning brush at times to prevent some odd noises and to get it actually spinning again. Otherwise, it functions just as well (really a bit better) than I expected. Another downside is that it can be a little loud. If you're a light sleeper, it can definitely wake you up if it runs at night. We've programmed it to run around the time we need to be up anyway, so it's not a big issue for us.Fun fact: if you leave shoes anywhere the Roomba will vacuum, it may relocate them for you. I've awoken to find a flipflop from the entryway halfway across the foyer on more than a few occasions.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Technology Making Life Far Better
Review: This thing is amazing. We have three cats and a toddler but I had no idea how much filth we lived in until we bought this. We run it every day and I'm grateful every time I hear that little chime come on indicating it's running. The rubber rollers are an wonderful replacement for brushes and the whole thing takes very little upkeep.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What are your expectations?
Review: This thing is amazing!Ê I left some negative feedback for the seller because I had a problem getting what I ordered but this is about the product. It does just what we wanted it to do.Ê We have two long haired dogs.Ê A springer spaniel mix and a Golden.Ê We have rolling tumbleweeds of hair in our apartment.Ê A real pain pulling out the real vacuum when it gets too noticeable.Ê Amazingly my skittish Golden doesn't seem to mind it.Ê Even lets it bump into him and bounce off.Ê This is a dog that freaks if you step over him or drop the leash loudly on the floor.Ê it's very quiet and we can let it roam the apartment while we do other things.Ê We're still learning what it will do and continually surprised.Ê I had to help it one time get around a mess of speaker wires and electrical chords but it did NOT get wrapped up in them.Ê I just had to lift it off.Ê After that I secured the wires to the wall and that was the end of that issue.Ê I love the way it goes under chairs and tables where I can't ever get with the upright vacuum.Ê That always seems to be where the little tumbleweeds of dog hair seem to congregate until the HVAC decides to blast it around.Ê This thing would never substitute for an occasional cleaning with a really powerful vacuum like a Shark or Dyson but it certainly takes care of the in between days and reduces the number of times I really feel we NEED the other vacuum.Ê I'm a happy camper.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is AMAZING! I have it set to vacuum my place ...
Review: This thing is AMAZING!Ê I have it set to vacuum my place at noon during the work week when I am not home.Ê It allows you to schedule which days of the week you want it to work.Ê I have my home professionally cleaned once a month, and this is a perfect companion to a deep cleaning.Ê I am overly impressed by it.Ê So impressed that I purchased a second one for my office two weeks after buying the first one.Ê I would rate this a 10 out of 10.Ê I am amazed at how little dust there is in my place now after using this daily.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This Roomba is pretty awesome. Cleans up well and you don't have ...
Review: This Roomba is pretty awesome.Ê Cleans up well and you don't have to worry about anything.Ê Easy to set up and empty.Ê Works great on all surfaces. I recommend to anyone with long hair or pets.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing
Review: This Roomba is incredible.Ê I have been using it in my beach house...sand, debris, etc. and I am amazed at how fantastic it is.Ê It always surprises me when I open it to clean it, how much dirt and debris it has picked up.Ê Everytime it finds it's way back to the base, I am in awe.Ê With three dogs and kids it is a godsend.Ê Expensive but so worth it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Well worth it!
Review: This Roomba is amazing!Ê We have two cats, and the amount of hair it picks up on a daily basis is amazing.Ê We have tile, hardwood, and a large area rug, and the Roomba has no trouble going from room to room.Ê I love that you can schedule it to vacuum at 3am while you sleep!Ê Two big thumbs up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best. Vacuum. Ever.
Review: This Roomba cleans like no other!Ê I have owned four Roomba cleaners over the past 10 years and have bought them as gifts.Ê The 880 has everything I ever wanted in a robotic vacuum already included.Ê It has scheduling built in and easily programmable.Ê The lighthouse barriers are sensor-activated, meaning you just place them and they only turn on when the robot is nearby.Ê No need to place / move / replace them or worry about whether you activated the virtual walls.Ê Bonus feature: it has a feature that keeps the cleaner within 1 room with the virtual wall until she (mine is named Rosie the Robot) decides the room is clean.Ê Then she goes to the next room!My wife and I are amazed at how much dust and dirt the cleaner manages to pick up vacuuming every few days.Ê It is entirely self-maintaining, only needing us to stop by once or twice a week to empty the dust bin and clean the filter.Ê Rosie always finds her way back to home base for charging, and has never once gotten stuck or pulled out a hair of our rug fringed edge.Ê If I won the lottery, I'd definitely buy a second one!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This robot which I named "vroomvroom" is absolutely wonderful and delivers
Review: This robot which I named "vroomvroom" is absolutely wonderful and delivers. So far no problem and it doesn't attack the extension cords. Returning to its base as expected. Love it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for picking up SAND!
Review: This robot was purchased to help with the incredible amount of sand that is tracked into my beach house (camp).Ê I was a little reluctant to try it at first, but decided to give it a shot and return it if we did not like it.Ê To my surprise, it works like a charm.Ê The vacuum picks up sand remarkably well, and finds itself into every room of my 2000+square foot camp.Ê I absolutely love the fact that it has sensors so we do not have to program it where to go.Ê It even knows where there is stairs, and does not fall down.Ê The Roomba gets lost occasionally and its battery dies before it makes it back to the charger, but for the amount of sand it picks up, I can live with having to search for it every now and then.Ê It also gets stuck on one of my bathroom rugs, which is big and fluffy, so no wonder why it gets stuck.Ê I can easily solve that problem by closing the door, or setting up the blockers that come with the robot.Ê The vacuum is loud, so there is no TV watching while it's in the room.Ê My kids hate it, because it vacuums up their small toys...they will just have to learn to pick up their toys so they do not get sucked up ;)Ê The vacuum does not take the place of sweeping or mopping, I just use it as extra means for keeping sand off our floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: You can't rely on iRobot to honor their warranty!
Review: This rating is completely do to iRobots horrible customer service. Simply put, they do not honor their warranty, even within the first 30 days. When you are dropping $700 on a vacuum cleaner, you need to be able to trust that the company who built it will keep its word, and do the right thing if the vacuum is defective. iRobot will not.I was sent a defective Roomba 880 (one of the motors didn't work properly). I notified iRobot within the first 30 days, and asked them to replace it, and extend the warranty. They advertise a 30 day money back guarantee, so I thought I'd give them a chance at a do-over.Ê Not only did iRobot refuse to fully extend the warranty on the replacement unit, but they also refused to fully swap out the defective unit (they offered to swap out only parts of it). Then, as added salt in the wound, this penny-pinching company tried to tell me that I had to PAY to ship the defective one back to them!This unit had only two weeks of use, and the CLAIM that they have a 30 day moneyback guarantee. I was disgusted with their refusal to take full responsibility, and so informed them I wanted to return the unit for a refund under that guarantee. However, when I asked for a refund, they then ignored the request!Luckily, I bought this through Amazon, and Amazon also has a 30 day return policy. In the face of iRobots horrible service, Amazon has been good enough to do what iRobot would not, and refund my money.Ê If it had been more that thirty days, however, I would have been screwed by this company that does not honor its promises, or stand behind its product.****UPDATE***I have upped my review from one star, to three stars.Ê Here is why: after writing the review above I received one of those email "How was your customer service experience?"Ê questionnaires from iRobot.Ê I filled it out as one might expect from my review above, except that I also included the names of the service representative and the manager I had dealt with.In response I was contacted the next day directly by iRobots Director of Global Customer Care. My experience with her was everything that my previous experiences with iRobot's service department was not. She was gracious, intelligent, and I believe that she was honestly appalled by my experience with her company.Ê She had had also diligently reviewed my all of my previous correspondences with the service department, before reaching out to me (a step I very much appreciated, and one that I believe spoke volumes about the critical approach she took to the matter at hand).Ê I am hopeful that the current penny-pinching paradigm in iRobots service department is now being addressed, and will be less of a problem for future customers.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: product is excellent
Review: This product is just amazing. After we received, we test it out and its just awesome, we all love this product. 100% recommended,

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Breakdown expected in the first 3 months with a tricky warranty coverage designed to avoid responsibility
Review: This product is announced as being equipped with the latest technology and an "INTERNATIONAL Warranty". Let me tell you my experience:1. The software became corrupted in the 3rd month after purchase. The program module has to be replaced for some reason. I live right next to the sea and it's not that dusty (nor humid as indoor AC controlled 24/7), the vacuum is programmed to clean a 2 bedroom flat (100 sam in size) 4 times a week. At its 42nd or 44th clean, the software went crazy and keep the side brush spinning when switched off / recharging, but no spin during clean. This means that the brush spins and produces huge noise when recharging / idling / doing nothing. The only way to stop it, is to screw open the battery cover and remove the battery -- Obviously this is not the best battery life extending method.This is NOT the issue in the Manual Troubleshooting as the brush axis being entrangled by hair, but simply a software failure that messes up the spinning program. ------------ If it is a product with the LATEST Tech, well, it is a mature and sophisticatedly developed and tested new tech;2. INTERNATIONAL Warranty. Be extremely careful with these warranty. It is supposed to have you covered world-wide in their ads campaign. Hang no a sec guys: it is NOT. i've bought this thing in states and travelled to another country with it hoping the Amercian product can help me keep the house clean. Within the 2nd month of regular use, this piece of machine has become an useless expensive decoration and i called the local distributor: NOT covered, not only you have to pay for the delivery, you have to replace the software module as well. Irobot company covers nothing at all for this manufacture defect. How about the US. customer care as this product was purchased in the states? I've sent my compliant for over 50 hours without any reply.I'm appalled to find out this gigantic (at least portraited in their ads)Ê multibillion international firm with manufacturing facility in China, isn't confident enough to warranty their product internationally. And, indeed, you know what? this hardware crash down within the first 50 times of use justifies perfectly their warranty policy: defect has been expected and free repair or exchange has been avoided by their terms in warranty.3. The product itself. this thing loves challenging the least expected and necessary corners to be cleaned. For example, if it's set to clean a huge living room with a sofa set and tea table, its most concentrated area is the narrow gap between your sofa set and the wall, leaving the huge area untended, it attempts time after time to enter into that small gap, again and again. when being physically placed in the center of the living room and restarted, it seeks and rushes to that gap dead straight without any deviation. it's like being programmed to try to clean those impossible corners as priority, while ignoring the vast easy area needs to be cleaned.Overall, the software issue disappoints me and their warranty insulted me!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for apartments w/ dogs
Review: This product is a game changer if you live in an apartment with a dog.Ê I used to have to vacuum all the time and I hated it.I set my Roomba up for daily cleanings and when I come home from work, I just empty the bin and that's all I have to do.It's great on hardwood floors, but can have some trouble with thicker hair on thick carpets.Ê The change smell in my apartment is dramatic because of this product.It'll occasionally get stuck in weird places but the homing beacons do a good job of keeping it from going in areas that you don't want it to go in.Overall, I'd highly recommend this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love Rudy the Roomba
Review: This product changed my life. I was vacuuming every 1-2 days and my hard wood floors were still dirty in between with kids food, dog hair, grass, dirt ect. We do not even wear shoes in the house.Ê Now I run "Rudy" the Roomba almost nightly and only vacuum myself once a week. There are some areas that I will always do better in my house such as over certain rugs with lots of dog hair or places the Roomba can not fit but overall it has been great. I empty the trash bin usually 1-3 times after a nightly run and its full of all those yucky things. It amazing how much dirt there is on those floors after just a day. We have a shedding dog and 3 kids. It isÊ also amazing on our carpeted areas and I run it on those rooms about once a week. I had people over this weekend, cleaned up the dishes and just ran Rudy to clean the floors; It was great! Strongly recommend. My husband was very hesitant about this product because of the cost, but now even he loves Rudy.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: =) Couldn't be happier!
Review: This product changed my life. =) Couldn't be happier!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: More than Five Stars
Review: This one far outshines my old 595i iRobot. Along with it being new & improved, it's also a #%*+ lot easier to clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Four Stars
Review: This machine is very good in many ways, but the battery is not durable

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Magical Machine
Review: This machine is magical and worth every penny.Ê Not only is it fun to watch (at first), but it actually keeps my 2,000 square feet of hardwood dog-hair free.Ê I used to vacuum twice daily because i hate how dog hair stands out on hardwood floors.Ê No more...this lil' guy gave me back 2 hours a day!Ê Love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and will easily clean under furniture with 12cm tall feet or higher
Review: This little robot turns cleaning the house a job MUCH easiear. There are already a lot of reviews of it here, so I'm just going to add the two points that I've not found elsewhere until I had this robot:Roomba is about 9cm tall, and will easily clean under furniture with 12cm tall feet or higher.Roomba is not perfect because it does scratch a little the floor (that's why it didn't receive a 5 star rating from me). My floor is burnt cement, more resistent floors may not have this problem.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for busy households.
Review: This little machine sure makes a huge difference in our house.Ê Dust and allergens have been reduced and she picks up more than our regular vacuum.Ê You'll notice I refer to the Roomba as she, we named her Rosie.Ê Rosie has won us all over.Ê She encourages my son to pick up his toys as he doesnt want Rosie eating them, and helps encourage us adults to pick up after ourselves too.Ê We love watching her do her thing!Ê I would highly recommend this great device to any busy household and even to those that just dont like to vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A Veritable Robot
Review: This little gizmo reminds me of the Twilight Zone episode "I Sing the Body Electric," where the husband seeks a robot nanny to care for his children. Everyone is, of course, dubious until the miraculous electrical "Grandma" shows up and whips the house and children into shape. Well, substitute "roomba" for "nanny" and "vacuum" for "care for children" and you pretty much get the picture. This little robot is a fantastic servant for cleaning pet hair and grime; its pleasantly quiet; finds dirt you never will; and charmingly finds it's way home to charge. I ordered one, and after a day, ordered another for the upstairs. Can't speak to the earlier models, but this 880 is simply fantastic.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This latest version 880 is awesome in almost all respects
Review: This latest version 880 is awesome in almost all respects.Ê Functionally it is 5 star.Ê The missing star, surprisingly, is poor documentation by iRobot.Ê Not only does the documentation leave you as a user short on how to properly use it, namely the "lighthouses", I couldn't find the clues on iRobot's site.Ê Had to drill down into user blogs.Ê If your house is anything like ours, you need this info to understand what is going on with the Roomba and lighthouse communication to guide this really cool tool through your home.Actually, my discovery astounded me.Ê The Roomba and lighthouses communicate with radio and infrared beams--not to mention the Roomba's internal optical sensors observing around and underneath for dirt searching and control.Ê Without knowing this, and how the lighthouses talk to each other, the Roomba, and the base dock, you will be shortchanged.Ê Our space is a large u-shaped living area leading into an entry hall and a bath off of that.Ê The base, where the Roomba starts (and ends) is in the living room part.Ê The first lighthouse guards the entry to the kitchen/dining area and it won't let the Roomba pass until it has spent enough time in the living room.Ê That lighthouse must be in line of sight to the base dock because they communicate via radio.Ê Eventually, that lighthouse lets the Roomba into the kitchen dining area.Ê The next lighthouse blocks the entry hall and bath until the Roomba has spent enough time in the kitchen/dining area.Ê That second lighthouse must be in line of sight with the first light house, again because they're all talking by radio.Ê Eventually, the second lighthouse lets the Roomba into the hall and bath area and won't let it out until it has spent enough time there.Ê Finally, the second lighthouse approves the release of the Roomba which sets itself in dock mode and works it's way back to the dock in the living room guided by both lighthouses radio communication and precisely docks like the space shuttle, sounding a victory chime and goes into charge mode.Ê All automatic!Ê Amazing!Ê A true robot.Problem is, iRobot doesn't, anywhere I can find in their literature explain to you how the lighthouse communication works which blocks your ability to effectively use these amazing tools to send your Roomba on a mission through your home.Ê Otherwise, I can't say enough about the Roomba 880's awesome capabilities.It is important to follow the thing around the first time or two to keep emptying the small trash container, as recommended, especially if you have pet hair.Ê In fact, before the first cleaning, if pet hair is an issue, I'd get out the big gun vacuum to clean up as much of the hair as possible, then go from there.Ê It is also important to run the Roomba daily to stay ahead of trash so you don't have to keep dumping it.Great tool!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: One Star
Review: This item was listed brand new but when i got the item it was used already.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I returned it after 3-4 days because it was pretty worthless.
Review: This isn't a robot and that title is misleading. It's a vacuum that randomly roams around. It has no AI or any real 'intelligence' whatsoever. It's a vacuum with wheels that moves by itself, not a robot. I returned it after 3-4 days because it was pretty worthless.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: This is your best friend at home!!! I love it!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cannot recommend enough - BEST PRODUCT FOR YOUR HOME.
Review: This is the single best thing we have ever bought for our home. The Roomba is easily programmed and we set it for two hours before we get home from work. We have mainly hardwood floors with transition strips between all the rooms (Why? ask the previous owner!). Throw rugs cover large areas and there are always a couple of cords crisscrossing the rooms if my husband is in the middle of a project. The Roomba navigates everything with ease.Best feature of this is the ability to easily take it apart to clean the rollers and wheel and three armed brush mechanisms. I have very long hair - the Roomba seems to pick up every strand that has fallen out. The ends of the rollers, behind the wheel and under the brush will get filled with a wad of hair and need to be cleaned at least monthly. Takes 5 minutes and the hair comes off as a curled up ball - no untangling or anything really annoying.The Roomba will clean about half of our home on one charge. It probably will clean more, but it is not the charge that prevents this - it is emptying the bin. We seem to be swimming in a sea of dust - at least this is what it looks like when we empty the Roomba! It is this limitation which would prevent me from recommending the upgrade to the newest version - unless the hopper is bigger, you still are limited on how much area the Roomba will cover by having to empty it.That said - we don't use the towers. Instead we try to get the "maid" as we call her, to clean one are at a time by trapping her. The timing program still works if we remove the Roomba from the charging station in the morning and place it in a closed room so that the focus is the bedroom on Monday, for example.Highly recommend. Quiet when running - won't damage your furniture. It doesn't "go down stairs" and won't crash to it's death. IRobot has created a very user friendly product which works, consistently and effectively. Reduced my allergy issues as well - the dust pick up is amazing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRobot Roomba 880 Vacuum Cleaning Robot For Pets and Allergies
Review: this is the first time i used this kind of vacuum and im not disappointed at all! this helps alot in our household chores! just leave it and roomba will do the rest! love this robot!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: This is the best. Love everything about it!Ê Remarkable how this can clean!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: This is the best tool invented, keeps my hardwood floors cleaned up nicely.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: BEST GIFT EVER!!!
Review: This is the BEST thing I ever received.Ê My husband bought this for me for Mothers' Day.Ê It is awesome.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My Best Decision
Review: This is the best purchase I have made in a long time.Ê I have always liked the idea of having a Roomba, but just didn't want to spend the money.Ê I bought one for my daughter for Christmas.Ê She was so pleased with the performance that I bought the 880 for myself.Ê I have a shepherd mix that sheds a lot.Ê There was always dog hair along the baseboards and under the furniture and my allergies were terrible.Ê I schedule my Roomba to vacuum every day.Ê The amount of hair and gross stuff it picks up is amazing.Ê I clean the hepa filter every time. I no longer have trails of dog hair around the edges of the room or under the furniture and my allergies are much better.Ê It is wonderful to come home and have my floors neat and clean without any effort on my part.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is the best investment I ever made in my home cleaning routine
Review: This is the best investment I ever made in my home cleaning routine.Ê I am amazed at how well it picks up dirt, how gentle it moves around furniture and how well it adapts to a new environment.Ê After having in for a few months, I really don't know how I functioned without it.Ê With two indoor dogs, it is almost a necessity.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing machine
Review: This is the best cleaning machine I have ever bought. I bought Roomba 880 for my mom and she loved it. It make the house very clean and easy to clean it. I strongly recommend it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is the absolute best thing I have ever purchased
Review: This is the absolute best thing I have ever purchased!!!Ê We have two English Mastiffs that are indoors. Together they weigh about 350 lbs so you can imagine the hair and dust. The Roomba 880 takes care of it all, no problem. 2,500 sq ft of mostly hard floors but also does clean rugs and carpets well too!Ê I'm just sorry I waited so long to get one!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: WONDERFUL AND FASCINATING
Review: This is so wonderful and so automatic that my kids were so impressed, they just ordered one also.Ê A note, you want the 880.Ê It comes with a guidance system so the 800 can find its way in multiple room situations, back to its docking station, automatically.Ê All model 800's are the same machine.Ê The last two digits indicate the accessories.When you register your 880 they will send you 2 extra hepa filters.Ê I have already ordered more from Amazon.Ê They get dirty real fast and even though you wipe them off it still feels like you will want to replace them every month or so.And the reviews where people say that it is fascinating to watch - they are not crazy, it's true.Ê Especially if you have small kids who like to run over and press the button or cats thatÊ move out of its way.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works Well and is Fun!
Review: This is so cool! Keeps the floors generally in good shape. You'll want to wet mop once in awhile still, but this does take the regular vacuuming work away. Visitors are like WoW! Now if they'll make one that cooks and tends bar....

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best vacuum for cat hair ever
Review: This is our third Roomba.Ê We have three indoor hairy cats and Roomba does an excellent job of picking up the hair.Ê It has extended the life of our carpet for it does a great job vacuuming.Ê The carpets look very clean when it's finished.Ê We have one upstairs and one downstairs and sent a third to college student at school. This is the best vacuum.Ê My favorite activity is to play video games while you vacuum!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Third Time Around
Review: This is our third Roomba and probably the best. However, be aware that I love all of our Roombas. This Roomba is a champ. It did a wonderful job in our family room which is carpeted with a low profile Berber. It can take virtually any surface and goes under furniture such as couches, chairs, end tables, etc. The only thing it didn't go under is the big screen tv stand which only has an inch separation from its bottom shelf to the floor. The Roomba uses a triangulation pattern that covers the entire floor surface as it traverses all floor areas multiple times. It is confined by a laser like tower which defines the area to be cleaned and confines the Roomba to a specific physical area. When it has cleaned everything, it returns to its dock to recharge its battery. If stairs are involved, the RoombaÊ senses the change and will not fall. In the interim, you should empty the bin that collects the debris before the next programmedÊ cleaning.Since my sister has three cats and enough cat hair to knit a sweater, I tested Roomba at her house. Not surprisingly the area tested was spotless after Roomba finished. I ran over the cleaned area with her Dyson. It picked up nothing.Roomba spins around and does a great job around floorboards as well as normal fuzz bunny areas. Periodically small brushes and filters may need to be replaced, but good maintenance keeps replacement of parts infrequent.There are a lot of models available dependent on your needs. This is great for pet owners because it picks up a lot of hair as well as the usual dust and dirt. As I write this, it is cleaning the master bedroom and walk in closet. What a champ.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 880 appears to have a better design. The rollers are rubber and not brushes
Review: This is our second Roomba.Ê The first, a 560, lasted about 4 years before it succumbed to pet hair in the workings.Ê I had to totally take the gear box apart on the 560 a couple of times to clean it out, but eventually, it gave up.Ê This new, 880 appears to have a better design.Ê The rollers are rubber and not brushes.Ê Pet hair does not get into the internals as easily.Ê The 880 is a bit larger than the 560 - it is a little taller and a little bigger across.Ê So it does not fit into some small spaces.Ê Overall, I like it much better.Ê It is quieter and does not get into trouble (hung up) very often.Ê It picks up so much dirt and pet hair, I need to empty it every day.Ê That's a good thing, I guess.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Horrible service, they just don't care
Review: This is our second Roomba in 5 years and its gone down the drain again way too soon for all the money we paid. Contacted their service department to just get a couple of links posted back to me to track down the issue myself. The Roomba says its charged but dies soon after. What else is there to troubleshoot. Horrible service, they just don't care. Not buying another one.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: works great, WE LOVE THESE THINGS and have nothing but ...
Review: this is our second RoombaÊ and it has more features than the first, works great, WE LOVE THESE THINGS and have nothing but good to say abouttheir performance. saves us another chore every day.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cleans well but area rug transition could be better
Review: This is our second robot, got a Roomba 880 last year that works better with transitions but for the price (and the mopping) the bobsweep still deserves 5 stars

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good for hard floors
Review: This is our first robot. We have mixed feelings. It does a pretty good job on hard surfaces, but rugs are a problem. We have wool rugs, and it balls up the wool and leaves it everywhere making a worse mess than we started with. Also, it has to be emptied a LOT. We ran it in an empty carpeted room and had to empty it 4 times before it finished. We've had it about 2-3 months. At first it would dock itself before the battery died but now we find it stranded somewhere with a dead battery. Another problem we have with rugs seems to be with dark colors. We have a rug with black background that it absolutely will not work on. If we place it on the rug it turns off every time. We think because of the color it thinks it's at the edge of stairs? Anyway, for hard floors it's a nice timesaver; but for rugs and carpet it's more work than help.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Efficient Product - Happy User !
Review: This is our feedback after a couple of weeks of use of the new Roomba.Roomba is a good vacuum cleaner especially for vacuuming smaller areas. Because of the battery life, cleaning a larger space is an issue.It does its job pretty efficiently. The noise level has reduced compared to the earlier models which is nice. Features like scheduling is great to have.I would have loved to have a larger bin on this vacuum cleaner. The bin needs to be constantly emptied (we have a Labrador in our house and he sheds) as it gets filled up quickly.The spot cleaning is a little cryptic; am still trying to figure out how to efficiently do this using the remote control.One thing that I have observed is that the Roomba sometimes (few) gets stuck at places like below our dishwasher and kitchen cabinets. Not sure why this happens because at other times it cleans those areas without any issues.Also I would suggest fellow users to minimize the obstructions in the area being cleaned. That way the Roomba does a faster job. For example we remove the chairs in our dining area before setting Roomba there.Overall, happy with the product !

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 880 vs. 650
Review: This is not necessarily a negative review, but a review that should make you consider the Roomba 650 instead.Ê I had two Roomba 880s before I switched to the 650; the 880s were never able to find their home docking station.Ê I'm not sure if they were defective, I had a poor layout in my house, or they just weren't that intuitive, but I did switch to the 650.Ê THAT is not really why I would like others to consider the 650.Ê Here is why:1. HEPA is actually only attainable in a closed seal on your dust bin, something that a battery operated machine will never have the power to do.Ê It is just a marketing ploy--feel free to look this up and not take my word for it.2. The virtual wall/lighthouse feature was worthless on both of my 880s.Ê I let the Roomba Jr. (as I call it, the 650 model that is) run its course a couple of times a week and it is able to clean all visible carpet that I can tell, and return to its docking station.Ê No need for the virtual wall/lighthouses in my opinion.3. No remote with the 650, but why do you need one?4. The only truly remarkable (albeit probably not worth $300 more) advantage of the 880 is the brushes have no bristles, so you do not have to clean them.5. It's really not that much quieter than the 650, although people claim this in reviews.6. Battery life between 880 and 650 were the same.7. I have terrible allergies and they did not change between models.Our 650, Roomba Jr., has been smarter and more effective than the big brother.Ê In fact, we empty just as much from the bin weekly in Jr. as we did the 880.Ê I really can't see the purpose of purchasing an 880.Ê I hope my review doesn't go overlooked since there are so many reviews out there.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not a very good vacuum cleaner
Review: This is not a very good vacuum cleaner. I did a comparison between the Roomba and my old Dyson that I plan to replace. Both vacuums collected dirt in a loft and a hallway. The Roomba had two passes at the area FIRST, running a complete power cycle each time, but collected only about 2/3 of the total dirt obtained. I just think a vacuum cleaner at this price point should do a better job vacuuming.It also gets stuck a lot and that requires attention to resolve.If you have pets and just want to get the top layer of pet hair and dirt off of your floors this might be something you want. It will do that. But I really wanted a vacuum cleaner and, for me at this price point, the product just won't do. I returned it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Poor battery!!
Review: This is my second vacuum cleaning robot. The first, which lasted for around four years, was a brand called InDream, and was quite sufficient, but died. I then decided to go for a top model.It worked great the first couple of months (start October to mid/end November) - more quiet than the old, quite efficient and better brushes. But it had to be in the docking station all the time (when it was not running) - a day out of it and the battery was very low (contrary to my old one which could be out of the dock for a week or so).It then began to not charging and reporting frequent Error 5, so, in accordance to the manual, I made sure no battery contacts was dirty, but still the same. Then in December it completely gave up and wouldn't charge.It went to the repair shop and got the battery exchanged. After one cleaning it started with Error 5 again, and now, two days after, it made some dying noises and won't charge again.If the battery worked, I would perhaps recommend it, but not as it has behaved for me.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I need more robots
Review: This is my second Roomba. I was extremely happy with my first one, the workhorse 560 model, but after two years and multiple replacement parts, the robot developed a mind of its own and the weakened battery made him lazy. When he went two weeks straight without making it back to his base, we knew it was time for a new battery, but we opted instead for an upgrade and went with the top of the line 880.I was sort of hoping that the newer model used most of the same parts as the older one, since I still had replacements left over, but unfortunately, the only common part is the side swiping rotary brush. Fortunately, however, everything else, from the high volume bin with HEPA filter, to the brushless pick up rollers, is actually new and improved. The brushless rollers in particular are a godsend, because they eliminate the tedious task of removing pet hair (we have two long haired Persian cats) after each run. This also eliminated the need for special tools to clean the brush, which were one more disadvantage of the older model. The high volume bin has a flip open lid that makes dirt removal easy and doesnt require as much finagling as the older style bin.One legacy part that works with the 880 is the old virtual wall. I use this to limit the area the Roomba has to clean on any given day, since our house is a large ranch that the Roomba can easily get lost in. The old virtual wall works really well in tandem with the lighthouses that came with the new one, which allow you to force the Roomba to clean one room before going on to the next. They also can be used as virtual walls, if you need to further limit the Roombas range. I also like the remote control, which allows me to play with the robot, if I am so inclined. It lets you specify a direction or cleaning mode, or I can just bother the cats and my wife if I want. Of course with the onboard scheduling, you can set it and forget it (except for bin and filter cleaning) and the robot cleans up all on its own. Cleaning ability is much improved on this new model, thanks mainly to the efficient pick up rollers, and even though suction is improved, the 880 is much quieter than the old 560. It also has better sensing abilities overall, which means it does a lot fewer full speed butts into walls and objects. The mostly black housing is sleeker and less obtrusive, too, making the Roomba feel like more a part of the home and less like an appliance that somebody dumped in the corner of the room.Although the Roomba is still not good enough to clean a large house completely and effectively on its own, for keeping dirt and cat hair to a minimum and maintaining a respectable level of clean around the house without a lot of fuss and effort, it is second to none. I hope that iRobot keeps developing new robots and improving their old ones just like they did from the 560 to the 880. If they do, I will continue to fill my house with these five star wonders.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pays for itself in first year!!!
Review: This is my second Roomba. I bought a model 6 years ago and have only replaced the battery.Ê Extremely reliable and decided to buy the 880 for my downstairs.Ê The new model (880) has stronger vacuum. How do I know, the following items have been emptied at the end of the day: 1 paperclip, 1 US quarter, 1 US dime, 1 screw, 1 paper US dollar, 1 one inch long 1/4 inch diameter steel pin, and enough hair to claim I own a cat. LOL, it pays for itself within the first year of ownership, just empty it before another family member gets to it...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: This is my second roomba.Ê Would not want to go back to manually sweeping.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: No more vacuuming
Review: This is my second Roomba.Ê Having a house with hardwood floors and three dogs, vacuuming is a daily necessity.Ê We just let Roomba (a/k/a Hazel) vacuum while we're at work and come home to clean floors.Ê The Roomba 880 seems to have resolved some minor glitches from previous models.Ê Definately a keeper.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love My Roomba 880
Review: This is my second Roomba, I purchased the very first generation and the battery life never did very well, threw it away. I was a bit leery to purchase another until my son told about how great his worked. He purchased one at Costco for $300 that does not have all the features that the 880 has.I opted for the 880 model due to the rollers and the way it picks up dog hair. I have two cocker spaniels along with tile and wood flooring throughout my home. We also have a silk rug and a Persian wool rug. The iRobot is a dream come true! I do not have to lug out the central vac every two days to pick up fur balls floating around the house.I haven't programmed it yet, but I will. I just need to sit and read the manual. I would recommend the unit for purchase, it's worth it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Its like having a Maid
Review: This is my first roomba. I just love it . makes me wonder why any one would ever vacume manually. Sure if you want to put in a lot of work you can do better vacuming than the roomba. But for normal day to day clenleness the roomba can handle pretty much anything. You just drop it down in a room start up the clean cycle and like magic come back to the room later and its been vacumed. I have it set to vacume everyday my room in the morning and it does it everyday and goes back the charger no problem when its done. Emptying it out is also no problem. Having a roomba does make you more aware on what you put on the floor because it can get stuck every now and then. But this roomba is a tank some times it will go over thing no problem. Overall was worried it was going to be a horrible purchase when I got it but so far no regrets

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Effective, if flawed (and expensive) vacuum.
Review: This is my first Roomba and I am generally pleased. It's a fun gadget to have and it works pretty much as described.PROS:- works great on hard floors and low-pile carpet.- quiet enough where it's not terribly distracting.- impressive battery life.- easy to clean/maintain.CONS:- not great on thicker carpets or wool rugs that shed a lot. (The rubber "extractors" can get clogged with the wool fibers).- it's not as intelligent as I was expecting. It's very random in its pattern of sweeping -- so you have to give it a lot of time to cover everything.Ê Also, as far as I can tell, it doesn't seem to "learn" rooms. So each time it starts, it is as random as before.- minor design flaw:Ê there is a "dirt sensor" in the vacuum that is designed to "listen" for dirt;Ê when it detects a lot of dirt, it instructs the Roomba to focus on an area until it senses no more dirt.Ê In my experience this sensor is malfunctioning frequently -- causing the Roomba to spin in circles and focus on a 2' x 2' section of floor endlessly.Ê The fix is to remove the dirt bin and rubber extractor rollers and clean off the sensor (which is hidden behind the rollers).Ê This works, but I'm having to do it nearly every day and it's a bit of an inconvenience.Bottom line: fun, albeit expensive vacuum. Glad I purchased it, but not blown away by it.Ê If Amazon allowed half-stars, I'd have given it 3.5 stars.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Happy for the purchase!
Review: This is my first review. It is just amazing that this robot works so well, that I have to tell everyone.Ê I decided to get iRobot 880 because of my busy schedule, and I dont want to sacrifice to have a dirty house for my kids.Ê This iRobot 880 does an AMAZING job and sucks out all the dusts, and goes to hard to reach area.Ê We have hard wood floor with area rugs in each room.Ê There was a review saying it does not go on dark surface so I was nervous about it.Ê Surprisingly, or luckily, mine went on to my sons navy blue border carpet (pottery barn kids carpet if you want to know how dark it is).Ê Maybe it is not dark enough to the robotluckily!Ê You can feel the floor is clean by walking with bare feet.Ê Kids love her too and they know mommy can spend more time with them because of the robots hard work.Ê Love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best purchase ever?!
Review: This is my first review ever and in full disclosure I did not purchase my Roomba from Amazon.Ê I felt compelled to write a review because this is probably one of my favorite purchases ever.Ê It works incredibly well and I can not believe how much dirt, dust, and hair it picks up.Ê If you are on the fence about getting one, do it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love this little machine!!
Review: This is my favorite piece of equipment I have ever owned. I have 2 dogs and I cannot believe what this little machine picks up. You can set the schedule and off it goes. Electronic sensors detect stairs...I move it up and down stairs on alternate days. I have wide open rooms which make it easy to maneuver. I don't know how I lived without the Roomba!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is my 4th roomba and by far the best in terms of suction
Review: This is my 4th roomba and by far the best in terms of suction, and ease of cleaning up. I have dogs so the old Roomba brushes were always time consuming to clean. This one uses rubber rollers that do a better job of cleaning surfaces and are a breeze to clean periodically.This is my favorite roomba to date. The price was a bit steep. I would expect this to come down in time. I still wish we had more control over the roomba via a smartphone or computer. I tend to loose remotes.On a side note, I've read some comments about the roomba not being so great with pet "accidents" in the home. As a dog fanatic I can honestly say this is clearly a problem with improper training and should not be blamed on the roomba. Learn how to properly housebreak a pet. Remember, anger is not discipline.

I would rate a tad lower than this model.Ê It is overdone.Ê I can't get it to last longer or clean better than my Roomba 880.
