Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Countless flaws, but I totally LOVE it!
Review: This is an early review. I've had my Roomba 880 for less than week, but have used it every day. Let me tell you all the problems I have with it. Caveat: I may not have figured it out, which is also a flaw in the documentation and design, because it's a household appliance albeit a sophisticated piece of electronics.Ê My criticisms are almost all about its technological deficits. It's 2015 and my expectations are high.CONS:1. The battery indicator only shows FULL (green) or CHARGING (yellow) or DEPLETED (red). There should be an indication of percentage. I can find nothing in the documentation telling me how long it takes to charge or how long I might expect it to run. I'm aware battery health and life changes, but if my phone and laptop can estimate based on normal usage, so can iRobot. I know they know.2.Ê It can't return to the dock if it doesn't have line-of-sight, which means it can't locate the dock from another room or even around a corner. Roomba has died in different parts of my house twice when I let it have access to other rooms and I had to go looking for it with a flashlight - it was under a piece of furniture.3. Roomba has a near useless remote control, also is infrared powered, so it has to be a few feet away to connect. All it really can do with assuredness is turn the device on and off. The directional controls are terrible. Buttons aren't labeled.4.Most important: The 880, top of the line, newest version, doesn't have bluetooth connectivity or what would be even better, Wi-fi. This would allow for control with a smartphone app. Come on iRobot! You guys have been doing this for a decade, and yet now when everyone is coming up with internet-connected homes, you're sitting there with your dopey IR remote! It's lame and insulting to buyers.5. User programming is pathetic too. Basically you can only program it to leave the dock and start sweeping once a day.Ê That's it. You can set the start time, but not a stop time! It just runs until it dies somewhere off in another part of the house with no ability to get home. If you want it to work while you're away you must carry the Roomba and the dock to the room you want cleaned, set up barriers (virtual walls or close doors). Later you can do it again somewhere else. Insult upon injury, when setting the timer, there's no direct entry.It's like a 20 year old digital clock. You have to press the hour and minute buttons repeatedly and of course when you go past your time, you have to go around again. Yes, I'm spoiled, but this thing cost as much as an iPhone, which did lack a lot of features in the first generation, but RoombaÊ 880 is NOT first generation. iRobot, step up your game and at least get some connectivity beyond that insulting remote control, which apparently adds at least $100 to the retail price.6.Ê Admittedly I don't understand the Roomba's movement patterns.It is a mystery. I'm sure it's doing what it's supposed to do. However, if I had a decent iPhone app, I could change its direction if I see the need. I left it running for an hour today, with access to the foyer, master bedroom, hallway and master bath, which has a large rug. When I got home, it was obvious it hadn't made it to the bathroom. The rug had lots of lint and hair visible.7. This is not so much a flaw in Roomba's design as it is a warning: move lightweight lamp cords and other thin wires off the floor, out of its way. On my first day, Roomba pulled a lightweight candlestick lamp off a dresser (It was plugged in behind the dresser, but excess cord was on the floor.) The fluorescent bulb shattered on the hardwood. I was there to stop it from sucking in any glass and mercury, so hopefully no serious harm done. Roomba cannot defy physical laws. It is quite possible for it to drag a cord and cause breakage.PRO:1. My house is so clean! I can't believe how much dog hair and dust it manages to pick up every time. I had run my canister vac over the carpets and swiffered the wood and tile before I let it loose. I can walk barefoot now and feel nothing but smooth floor.2. I'm already breathing better. My allergies aren't gone, but the level of congestion has gone way down.3. I had some sheetrock work in my living room last summer. The contractors didn't properly cover everything, including the HVAC vents and returns, but I thought surely by now all the dust was gone. Let me tell you, the first few full bins were 50% or more sheetrock dust. Every time I've emptied it the HEPA filter has been totally clogged with sheetrock dust. This has been shocking. I'll probably have to hire a company to professionally clean my ductwork, but at least I know.4. I now realize just how much I despise vacuuming -- lugging it around, dealing with the self-tangling 50 ft. cord, having it unplug itself with the slightest pull. Banging into furniture and baseboards.Ê I'll have to use it above the floor to clean upholstered furniture, refrigerator coils, drapes, etc. but...maybe I can find a lighter weight less unwieldy design.5. My back is so happy! So much less bending to get under the sofa and beds and lifting the canister. Yet my floors are super clean. Normally, after cleaning floors I can't stand upright the next morning. Some problems really can be solved by spending a few bucks.6. Roomba is quiet, compared to a regular vacuum! It doesn't even bother the dog, who tears out of the room the minute she hears a regular machine. I can hear the TV or radio while it's in the same room.7. I will not give Roomba up for anything - except the next generation that addresses the above shortcomings. If they come out with a wi-fi enabled model, I'll buy it in a heartbeat.8. Its name is NOMAD, after a space probe from the original Star Trek series. NOMAD had a lot of shortcomings, but much talent and zeal (though somewhat misguided) for it's mission to clean up the universe.9. I find myself becoming interested in cleaning for the first time in my life.Ê NOMAD has made a good start on the dirt, dust and debris. This has inspired me to clean windows, grout, and other things I've ignored.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I really like this little gadget!!
Review: This is a terrific little gadget.Ê We have two parrots in our living room, and as parrots are prone to do, they toss seeds, veggies, and feathers all over the area.Ê We specifically bought our Roomba as a solution to this problem, and it works.Ê The Roomba cleans once a day, and if I want it to do an extra clean, no problem.Ê You just grab the remote and click it, and Roomba goes right to work.Ê I often find myself doing this, parrots being how they are.I knew very little about these robots before I bought ours, so this review is geared towards people like myself who know next to nothing about them.Ê Basically, this is a tough, robust wheeled device that bumps and thumps around its designated area in a rather haphazard way, its vacuum cleaner running, until it cleans the area.Ê In practice, even in our cluttered living room when the Roomba is done, the room is clean.Ê However, there is very little apparent order to the way the machine does it -- if you stand around supervising the Roomba it is frustrating.Ê But I find that if I leave it alone to clean the room it eventually does it and returns to its charging station.Ê And the areas around the two bird cages are clean!The Roomba has a lot of suction and it does a very good job cleaning.Ê I was amazed at the stuff that it swept up in our living room.One of the other reviewers complained that the Roomba lacks "true Artificial Intelligence" ("AI").Ê This is both true and untrue.Ê The Roomba does not even pretend to "learn" your room, or learn from experience, and it cannot even see anything except the light tower barriers and its docking station.Ê On the other hand, the Roomba has numerous subroutines built in which help it feel along the various surfaces of your room i.e. furniture and other objects, and extricate itself from tight spaces.Ê It also will verbally tell you when it has certain problems.Ê Mine surprised me recently by telling me that I needed to clean its rollers.Ê Turned out it had sucked in a long length of speaker wire.Ê A nice feature.Ê The Roomba also cleans longer or shorter intervals depending on how much crud it is picking up.Ê All of these subroutines combine to create what might be called "simulated intelligence."Ê Simulated in the sense that the Roomba sometimes acts intelligently without actually being intelligent. (I hope that this made sense.)The Roomba is very easy to clean and maintain. One of the best design features is the easy access to all of the cleaning areas.Ê Even the rollers are modular and pop right out for easy cleaning. I tend to keep a can of compressed air around to blow out the filter and the innards of the filter module.Ê The filter module snaps right out of the Roomba and is very easy to clean.Ê Replacement filters are available on Amazon or elsewhere and are very easy to replace.Overall I view this device as a success and it is worth the money.Ê I wish that we had bought one years ago.Ê RJB.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is great
Review: This is a must if you have a carpet. It cleans very well and does it automatically. It goes all over the place like a retard sometimes, but it still gets the job done.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This is a great product. I returned mine not because there was ...
Review: This is a great product.Ê I returned mine not because there was anything wrong with it, but because it did not fit under my furniture.Ê Cleaning under my furniture was the reason I purchased it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cleans and saves me time!
Review: This is a great help!Ê I love it.Ê It cleans the floors daily and keeps all the dust and dog hair and other debris in check and off the floors.Ê I was amazed at how much dirt if finds and picks up!Ê It cleans under the beds and the corners.Ê Most of all I like that I do not need to push it around.Ê It is the most effective time savings device I have ever found!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacuum!
Review: This is a great device! The first Roomba I've owned so I can't compare it to other models. It's a very well built system. I particularly like how easy it is to clean. The key places are marked with yellow arrows. The roller system on this unit works very well at picking up just about everything. I've used it on carpet, hardwood and tile with great success. My one comment about using it on carpet is that it pulls a lot of fiber and tends to make a little raft which trips the bin full sensor simply because the raft doesn't drop down in the bin. Also, if there is a lot of hair you need to clean the rollers frequently otherwise it tends to wind the hair tighter and tighter and can cause damage to the rollers. These are easy to clean and easy to replace which Roomba suggests doing fairly frequently for most effective cleaning. It's not particularly noisy but unless you're a deep sleeper you probably can't have it cleaning in an adjacent room during the night. Setting up the virtual wall is very easy and I've never seen the Roomba go past one. I haven't used the lighthouse feature very much, this is supposed to aid multi-room navigation.Being able to run the vacuum and have it return to it's charger is a key feature for us as my wife is sensitive to dust. We can leave the house and come back to a clean room and recharging Roomba. Brilliant!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very Good Choice
Review: This has preformed well over 1500 square feet. we have animals and it picked up all the hair.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Greatest investment for your home!
Review: This has been the worst season for pet hair in the 10 years that I have had my two dogs and chinchillas. I was vacuuming and sweeping everyday after work and still not keeping up. I didn't want to spend over $600 on a tiny robot vacuum unless this thing did exactly what it said it was supposed to. Guess what? It does exactly what the good reviews say it does. I turn my Roomba on before I leave for work and when I come home the house is spotless! No animal fur rolling around the ground or stuck to the carpet! It is amazing! This vacuum is literally the greatest thing I have every bought for our home. Now when I ask my husband to vacuum he just walks over and turns the "maid" on and it's done about an hour and a half later. I wish we would have gotten one sooner. The only thing is watch for cords laying around, it will try to suck those up as well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This guy works great, the lighthouse function efficiently cleans a whole floor ...
Review: This guy works great, the lighthouse function efficiently cleans a whole floor of 4 separate areas without me there to keep it moving.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It can clean really good on wood and even better on carpet 2
Review: This guy is getting 3 stars because 1. It can clean really good on wood and even better on carpet 2. Because it can also scratch wood floors really good. We just bought a new house with brand new floors. And I know exactly where certain scratches were because I hand washed the entire 1st floor. When I got this roomba all of a sudden I was noticing weird circular scratches on the floor. Without a doubt it was the roomba. Only the roomba could make marks that curve like that. So I decided to watch it for an entire sweep one day and noticed exactly when the scratches occured. When it got stuck and started spinning in circles it was scratching the wood floors. Now I wanted automated cleaning but not for the price of a scuffed up floor. Even after putting electrical tape on the caster wheel it still scratched the floors. Thankfully it was within 2 weeks of buying that I noticed this and returned it to Amazon for a full refund. If your house is carpet get this roomba. If it's mostly hardwood like mine, PASS.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: WOWÊ What a Great Inv
Review: This device is a godsend. It does work while you are away and does an amazing job. It cleans in between the regular house cleanings and keeps the floors looking like they have just been cleaned everyday. We run our M-F at 10am while everyone is away and it does its thing. When we return we empty the collection tray and it is ready to go the next day. It made a big difference in our household since we have a cat. Keeps him company too. Worth every penny.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Like it!
Review: This cleans very well and it's not loud.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: Thing has stopped working effectively at all.Ê Worked well for a couple of months.Ê Now it is worthless.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: How Did I Live Without It?
Review: Thie iRobot Roomba 880 saves me from having to push a heavy vacuum cleaner, plus it cleans all the places missed by an ordinary vacuum, such as under the beds and furniture. It is simple to assemble, and it does its job efficiently and quietly. Although some people schedule it to run while they are away from home, I always run mine while I am at home as occasionally its waste paper basket needs to be emptied or it gets itself stuck in a location from which I have to extricate it and switch it to a new location. Picking up a Roomba is a breeze, however, as the robot vacuum is light and it has a neat recessed handle that you lift up when you want to move it by hand. My only quibble is that its waste paper basket is small, and if you have a lot of dust and dirt, you have to empty it frequently. This is not half as cumbersome a job as emptying a bagless vacuum. The Roomba 880 runs for approximately 2 hours when fully charged. If you don't need it to vacuum for this amount of time, you return it to its docking station. Highly recommended for people who hate vacuuming.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOve It
Review: There is constant dust in our hi-rise condo due to the way the a/c ducts are configured...more like a commercial building and the ducts cannot be professionally cleaned.Ê We did a major renovationÊ including the demolition of the previous bathroom and sanding hardwood floors which created a lot dust in the ac system.Ê The dust is still a major problem after more than year of living here.Ê The Roomba 880 is just the best.Ê I cannot believe how much dust, dirt, pet hair, and "stuff" it picks up.Ê I run it about every other day in different rooms.Ê It has made a huge impact in the reduction of dust in our home.Ê I am buying another one for our farm house which also suffers from lots of dust.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Must have for pet owners, parents, people with allergies or who live in country on dirt roads.
Review: There are great reviews already- so i won't be long winded.Ê I used the advice from the reviews and got a great discount at bed bath and beyond (sorry amazon i am usually your girl, but 20% off cannot be past over!) So thanks for the info!!I have only had my Roomba 880 for 3 days.I cannot believe the amount of dirt and dust (on a dirt road) and pet hair it picks up.My house feels cleaner.Ê Walking barefoot this morning I noticed a huge difference - the floors felt Cleaner than ever and we had gone to the beach yesterday and tracked back sand.I have a large open area in my ranch house, so it cannot get it all at once.Ê I am using the lighthouses for now to keep it out from under the kitchen island where it likes to get stuck, i will plan on using those later for more efficient cleaning.Funny thing is though, i noticed the first day it concentrated on the kitchen and living room before it filled up on me.Ê The next time i used it it seemed to spent most of its time in the living room, but discovered the master bedroom and bath.Ê Just now, It went almost straight to the bedroom and spent almost all of its time there.Ê It picks up a ton of Pet Hair!!Ê (90 lb shepherd/lab mixÊ 50 lb Boxer cattle dog mix, dirt road in country)I now why people say they love to watch it and name it.Ê it seems almost to have a brain.Ê It loves to circle chair legs again and again.Ê It kept trying to get under the armoire in the living room.Ê i didn't think it could get under there but a while later i heard a noise and the stupid thing had found a way under.Ê i gave it a little time and sure enough after banging around under awhile it found its way out.Ê Similar story with the end tables in the bedroom.I have now bought some furniture gliders for the island and probably for the armoire and night stands to help raise them just a little bit so it can get under.Ê3-1/2-Inch Felt Bottom Round Furniture Sliders, BrownBest Birthday present ever!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Other than that I love my Roomba
Review: The virtual walls don't work .. I have to take the batteries out every time and reinsert them every time I want to use the Roomba. Other than that I love my Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The vacuum works great, but I find that I pretty much have ...
Review: The vacuum works great, but I find that I pretty much have to babysit it.Ê We have a dog, and the bin gets full quite often, or rather the red light comes on quite often even though the bin is not full.Ê We have one room that is carpeted, so when the red light comes on it seems to start leaving clumps of dog hair around the room if I don't notice right away and empty the bin.Ê Definitely not something I can just turn on and forget about.Ê It does a good job for the most part though.Ê Additionally, it will sometimes get stuck under things that I can't use the sensors for, like the dishwasher, so again somebody has to be keeping an ear out for it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Meet the new boss... the best on the market
Review: The updated Roomba 880 is a definite step up from the other robotic vacuum I have (the Moneual MR6550).Ê While the Moneual vacuum will fall off ledges or stairs, the Roomba will not.Ê The edge detection on this unit will save you a lot of aggravation that you have with a unit such as the Moneual.This vacuum no longer uses brushes to clean the carpet, instead opting for "Aeroforce Extractors" that are much better, as they will not collect hair and other things that you will have to manually remove as they get clogged.Ê This is not to say that hair or string will not get wrapped around the extractors, but the removal of these things is MUCH easier with the new design, as it is not stuck in anything, but rather simply wrapped.Ê Just pop the extractors off and slide the hair or whatever off and replace the extractor in the unit.Ê Easy.The new Aeroforce extractors lead to an updated suction mechanism that is extremely powerful.Ê This unit works amazingly well and has a lot of power.Ê Our dog sheds a lot and this thing really cleans up the hair very well.Ê I cannot complain about the performance at all.The unit comes with two navigation cubes that help the robot learn your floor plan and navigate around your house.Ê What is really great is that the cubes work with the Scooba 450 as well, and you can use all the cubes (if you have the Scooba as well) to provide better coverage.Ê These two units work great together and can be used to clean your floor without any effort on your part.This is, without question, the best robotic vacuum on the market.Ê Sure, it is expensive, but, at least in this case, you get what you pay for.BOTTOM LINE: HIGHLY Recommended

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Too expensive for this quality of product!!!
Review: The unit battery dies too quickly. It goes back to dock after about 20 minutes of cleaning. It also has a problem understanding the lighthouse features. It some rooms it will go and do the job one day, but not the next.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: trash bin full
Review: The trash bin gets full way to fast, however it is an excellent product that we will continue to use!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The only vacuum you should buy.
Review: The things this picks up is amazing. I mainly purchased this to pick up dog hair and save us from arguments on cleaning the floors. In the past, we'd have dog hair magically appear all over our clothes and now it would take longer for us to find any on us. It picks up a lot of the standing dust and when we first got it, the tray ran full a couple of times. Now I only need to empty it every 3 or 4 days. It does a pretty decent job on hard floors and an excellent job on carpet.Unfortunately, it can get itself stuck by unintentionally closing doors or under our fridge that has just enough clearance for it to get stuck under. Another con is if you have a dog that isn't potty trained, roomba will go over it (lesson learned). Luckily, we only have 1 dog that is afraid to use the doggy door and his poops are less than an inch. However, cleaning/dismantling this thing was a breeze. They have clear indicators on the unit on what you need to take apart and even use separate colored screws to signify what screws need to come out.I'm considering on buying the scooba or braava based on this purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Okay, at best
Review: The Roomba works, but for the amount that this one cost, I'd say save your money and buy a cheaper one or a different brand.Ê This Roomba continually and constantly gets stuck on my area rug that is under my dining table.Ê The rug is not long or deep, just a normal area rug about 1/4 to 1/2 inch tall.Ê Being that the dining room in next to the living room, kitchen, and hallways, the Roomba gets stuck every single time it goes out.Ê It's been about a month now, with the roomba cleaning daily, and yep, every day I find it around the rug, stuck behind the couch, or stuck on the bathroom mats.Ê Overall, the technology is cool, but only cool if the darn roomba would back up and unstuck itself.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The package came not to n a box it was like it would be if you got it in a ...
Review: The Roomba works well so far I only had it clean a few times.The package came not to n a box it was like it would be if you got it in a store.So the box was damaged and water had gotten on.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good buy
Review: The Roomba works pretty good. It navigates between wood floors tile and rugs without getting stuck. During the first couple of uses trouble areas for the Roomba to get stuck were identified and corrected. I have it scheduled to run every day. It works better than expected. I should have bought one long ago

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cute but not perfected yet
Review: The Roomba was fun to watch, but took too long to vacuum the floors. It had trouble moving from one carpet to another when it had to cross the wooden floor. After many tries it did finally make it.The dirt bin is too small. It makes an annoying sound since it takes over one hour to do a few rooms.The "light houses" didn't always stop it from going to a separate room or stop it from going over the edge of the wooden stairs.I believe it is WAY over priced and the restocking fee of 25% is way too much!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A great purchase decision!
Review: The Roomba has exceeded my expectations.Ê We have 4 cats and a dog so we set it to run everyday.Ê It does a fantastic job.Ê I highly recommend it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love the Roomba 880 v the Neato BotVac 80
Review: The Roomba 880 replaced my Neato BotVac 80. It's more expensive, but the robotics are much better. First impression is the product quality and "out of box experience" is way higher quality than the less expensive Neato. The negatives were smaller dust bin. This is out-weighed by it truly is a robot needing very little human intervention. My Neato always was stuck somewhere and whining. Very high maintenance! The Neto does re-start after a charge, whereas the remote is needed with the Roomba.My Roomba is covering over 2800 sq feet which is impressive. Way quieter and way faster than the Neato..Even little itens like better lights and shipping me a fully charged unit make a way better consumer experience.Great device! I could add some minor features, if they ever want end users feedback!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 880
Review: The roomba 880 is rather large didn't think it was going to be big but I like it cleans up pretty well and get all the dust from under furniture. Warning: if your furniture is low it will get stuck,that is the only thing I really don't like because I can't really let it roam free in the living room it needs supervision. Other wise works well great for bedroom I just put in my bedroom close door and let it clean for me. Overall love it great product arrived quickly very easy to put together and use.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Remarkable and Much Improved
Review: The Roomba 880 is much improved over an earlier model I bought a couple of years ago.Ê The new debris extractor roller is a nice improvement which greatly reduces long hair from curling up and clogging things the way it does on most vacuums. On some vacuums I have to spend about 20 minutes with scissors cutting hair off the rollers and brushes...Not so much with Roomba's new debris extractor design.Ê Bravo!The suction is pretty good...though not on a par with a good upright vacuum.Ê You sometimes have some dust particles left on the rug.Ê But, usually, the Roomba does a good job.Ê When you empty the dust drawer, you'll see that Roomba did some pretty good work.A standard Upright causes my back to flare up.Ê So the Roomba is a welcome appliance for anyone who has back issues.Ê You just let it wonder around and clean...while you go about doing something else.Ê The landing on the staircase was a bit dirty, so I left the Roomba on it while I took my daily walk.Ê When I returned, the Roomba had finished, cleaned the landing and turned itself off....very cool.The capacity of the drawer which holds the dust is small.Ê So you have to empty it after each use.Ê But the drawer is easy to clean.Ê The filter sits in the drawer, so it is easy to access and clean as well.There are certain places in which the Roomba will get stuck.Ê For instance, it worked its way into a slot between a bookcase and my dog's crate.Ê Once in this opening, Roomba could not exit.Ê It was stuck and turned itself off.Ê It also got stuck underneath our living room sofa...it could get in, but the top of the Roomba rubbed up against the underside of the sofa, and the poor thing cried for help as it couldn't get out.The Roomba has a timer function so you can schedule when it cleans.Ê But I have not used it.Ê It comes with two virtual walls.Ê A third would be quite useful.Ê These virtual walls are used to block the Roomba from places in which it might get stuck (like under our living room sofa).Ê It would help if the manual accurately depicted the virtual wall so you would know which way to turn it to have it work.Ê But, after a bit of trial and error, I figured it out.When it is done, or when it is getting low on battery, the Roomba returns to its dock..Ê The Roomba comes with a remote.Ê But I did not find it useful.Ê I could never figure out what to press when you simply want Roomba to go back to its dock.Ê Trying to guide it there using the remote is non-intuitive.Ê Easier to just pick up Roomba (which is very light) and place it on the dock.We really like the Hoover Linx cordless vacuum stickÊ It is light weight and works well.Ê The reason I mention it, is that the vacuuming ability of the Roomba is on a par, or perhaps slightly below the ability of the Linx.Ê The Linx is easy enough to move around.Ê The Roomba has the advantage of working without you doing anything after the initial prep.Initial prep you ask?Ê Yes.Ê For Roomba to work efficiently, it helps to move the chairs from under tables, and use the virtual walls to keep the poor guy from getting stuck somewhere.Ê But once you do that prep, you can let Roomba do its work, and watch in amazement.Overall, I'm happy with the Roomba...and amazed by the ingenuity of the product.Ê One last thing I have to mention...the price is really high, and that is probably Roomba's biggest drawback.UPDATE: September 2014 - I upgraded the rating to 5 Stars because the Roomba has taken over the vacuuming chores around the house more than I thought it would.Ê We haven't used a standard vacuum ever since we got the Roomba.Ê It is truly wonderful...no more twisting and injuring my back.Ê The house gets vacuumed every weeks...sometimes twice in a week.Ê Just clear the room, set it, and come back an hour later and the room is done.Ê Highly Recommended.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it, Would buy this product again.
Review: The Roomba 880 is certainly a nice upgrade from the Roomba 560. I had the Roomba 560 for around 7 years. Had to replace the battery twice which was 30$. When I saw the Roomba 880 I knew it was possibly time for an upgrade. I purchased the Roomba 880 about 4 weeks ago. I have it setup to clean a 900sq ft apartment every Thursday at 12pm. It has returned to its dock each time, only had 1 issue when it was trying to return but that is it. I placed the virtual wall lighthouse in great spots and it seems to help the Roomba 880 get to where it needs to go. I love the hepa filter in the debris bin that helps collect smaller debris. I also like the new look of the Roomba 880 top deck, also the new rollers are so easy to clean. I am no longer having to cut hair or brush hair out of the Roomba 560 which was time consuming.Now with the Roomba 880, once the debris bin is full I or it needs cleaning I simply empty the debris bin and vacuum the bin and hepa filter with a handheld hepa vacuum. When the Roomba returns to the dock I usually clean out the hair from the rollers, but you just pull the hair out of the roller. No cutting or pulling needed. The remote control sounds like a nice feature but I have not used it yet. The battery in this Roomba is also very impressive. The Roomba 880 seems like it goes forever before it turns red with low battery. Great job iRobot with making the Roomba 880Ê the best robot vacuum around. I have certainly suggested this product to friends and family and also would buy this Vacuum again.Video - iRobot Roomba 880 video showing the Roomba 880 performing its cleaning function. Passing virtual wall lighthouses, cleaning the debris bin and returning to the dock.iRobot Roomba 880 Vacuum Cleaning Robot For Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great!
Review: The Roomba 880 has so far been great. We have a pet lab and the Roomba has been kept busy with his fur. No problems so far.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fantastic robot vacuum
Review: The Roomba 880 does a great job cleaning.Ê I would suggest you purchase additional Virtual Walls if you have a very open house like ours.Ê I love the fact that it easily cleans under furniture, including beds!Ê What a time saver it is!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and gets caught in the most dumb of places
Review: The robot gets stuck on area rugs whose edge is a different color then the base carpet. and gets caught in the most dumb of places.. If you have a round room made up of wood floors or low carpet this is for you...If you have a standard house then be aware, save the packaging for the return

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: the product was quite dirty when we opened the box
Review: the product was quite dirty when we opened the box. It seems it experienced a very heavy duty and it's owner was tired of cleaning it and decided to sell it. Fortunately, it still works after one hour cleaning.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great Product
Review: The price seems like a lot- until it changes your life.Ê I would estimate the complaints from my wife about the tidiness of the house have decreased by over 60%.Ê And, would my wife ever consider doing it on the kitchen floor?Ê NEVER!Ê Now, we've done it TWICE!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Quiet and thorough!
Review: The other day I received this text from my boyfriend: "I bought something for us. It will make our lives easier (well, your life anyway)." I assumed it was alcohol. Later, he admitted he bought a Roomba. I thought $700 for a vacuum was too much. After all, we live in only 500 square feet, and I don't mind vacuuming. At first I was pissed, but then I was kind of excited to see it in action.It arrived fast, even though it shipped directly from iRobot's factory in China. With the press of a button, it chirped to life. After 24 hours of charging, we decided to see what it could do. We had it docked beneath the couch.Ê Assuming that it would be really loud, we braced ourselves for a piercing roar. We pressed "clean" and watched it emerge from beneath us. The Roomba floated along, making a rumble low enough that we could still watch TV. We watched it learn the room, going back to the same spots and whipping its whiskers into corners and under furniture legs (seriously!).Our TV stand was like Roomba's Everest. It knew it could do it, it just needed to try. You could almost sense its frustration. After trying multiple points of entry, Roomba pressed down on its wheels to make itself extra compact and glided right under. It recognized the space beneath it as containing lots of dirt, and so it kept going back, crouching, getting stuck, righting itself, until it cleaned the space thoroughly. I had never been able to vacuum under the TV stand. I always had to move the stand, unplugging numerous things from the wall and hating everything.Perhaps even more impressive was its attempt to clean our bathroom. The bathroom door was slightly ajar. Roomba mounted the saddleboard and kept pressing on the door. It really could have opened it, but it seemed to recognize that it was not supposed to go there and backed off.Ê Roomba is ambitious, but it has boundaries.Eventually, it sailed under the bed, easily cleaning out dust-filled corners. 45 minutes later, it returned to its docking station. We were eager to see what it had picked up. I vacuum daily, so I didn't think there would be much in it. We couldn't believe the amount of dust and crumbs in its filter. Not only did it reach places we couldn't with a regular vacuum, it left no area untouched.I will post updates on its long-term performance, but so far, I am really impressed at its robot intelligence, determination and results.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: we like him so much we named him
Review: The newest member of our family, Rudy the Roomba! Yep, that's right, we like him so much we named him. He does about 90% of the sweeping for my first floor that consists of marble tile, hardwood and low profile carpet. He glides beautifully under my leather club chairs and the amount of dust he picks up is really awesome. It's been hands down one of the Best Purchases I've made (and I've made quite a few) All Year. The iRobot Roomba 880, or as my family lovingly refer to him as Rudy the Roomba, he Rocks!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The new "Aero Force" system does a great job on fine dust
Review: The new "Aero Force" system does a great job on fine dust.Ê The size of the opening to the dust bin, however, is too small and frequently clogs up due to dog hair from our two labs.Ê Given that the 880 is being marketed to pet owners, I view this narrow slot as a design flaw, hence 3 stars.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This sweeper seems to handle soft throw rugs better than our upright
Review: The model 880 Roomba has met our expectations.Ê It seems to pick up a lot, while remaining pleasantly quiet for a vacuum cleaner.Ê The suction appears to be quite adequate.Ê I was very impressed when it found, and picked up a copper penny off a hard tile floor.Ê It gets into areas under furniture where our corded upright cannot seem to reach.Ê The first time we ran it, the dirt bin full indicator light came on in 20 minutes, filled with dust bunnies we never knew were there.Ê In followup, as cleaner conditions improved, we found we can run the sweeper every other day, for a full hour without totally filling up the collector bin.The new rubber meshing rollers seem to work well.Ê They do not seem to require after-use sweeper maintenance, reported on previous models having brush rollers that tangle hair around them.Ê We only need to empty the collector bin, and clean the surface of the HEPA filter.This sweeper seems to handle soft throw rugs better than our upright, that jams with too much suction.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It is fun to watch
Review: The iRobot Roomba works very well and it even cleans under the bed where I could never clean very well.Ê It is fun to watch.Ê I purchased the iRobot Roomba 880 which has the AeroForce cleaning system which has a few more extras.Ê I have four cats and 1 dog in the house and their hair is picked up very well.Ê I am very satisfied with the performance.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Every house should have one!
Review: The iRobot Roomba is officially my favorite member of the household. Everyone should have one. It never complains, has a pleasant little tone to tell me it's trash bin is full. stays under the couch or the bed cleaning like a trooper and then, when it's done with a room, bee bops back to it's dock to recharge. I love it so much,Ê I'm seriously considering getting the one that mops as well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Four Stars
Review: the I bot rumba 380 is a very good vacuumed and we have enjoyed using it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: The HEPA filter is very impressive and leave the room in an unprecedented clean state.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The goods are excellent in terms of quality and protection
Review: The goods are excellent in terms of quality and protectionThank you for your attention, and your cooperationWith best regards

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing Vacuum - Give it time to do its thing
Review: The first few days were a bit of a disappointment for me. I felt like the storage container was not big enough for the dirt it was picking up. After scheduling Roomba to vacuum daily, I love it! It has my concrete and tile floors, carpeted bedrooms and bathroom mats cleaner than they have been in years. I like that roomba cleans under items that I normally can't reach with my standard vacuum cleaner ie. Beds, some chairs, etc. I have found that treating vacuuming as a daily task for Roomba and a once a week for me and my standard vac keeps the apartment in top cleanliness. I have high expectations for cleanliness - dust bunnies, pet hair, grit or grime cannot to be found anywhere. Roomba got trapped 3 times in the last 20+ cleaning cycles. Not bad at all. Especially considering it is cleaning while I am out getting my morning run done or while I am doing laundry or the dishes. Give Roomba some time to work in your home and keep the debris tank emptied. In 1 to 2 weeks you will be amazed. A major time saver!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Disappointed after 6 weeks:(
Review: The first day we used our Roomba was July 8th and we were all very excited. She, we named her Rosie, worked wonderfully for the first 6 weeks and the last few weeks I've been continually disappointed. For the amount of money we paid for this product, I shouldn't have to follow behind it to vaccuum things she misses.Was initially very happy, but now feeling disapointed. We've ready the manual, cleaned the brush heads and filters and nothing seems to make a difference. Hoping for suggestions from the seller.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The dust bin is hard to clean out the dust ...
Review: The dust bin is hard to clean out the dust the clings to the inside. Sometimes the iRobot gets lost and just keeps turning in circles.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Clock resets, runs at midnight and wakes everyone up!
Review: The clock does not have an internal power source and it will reset the clock almost daily, and if you set the schedule it will start running at Midnight each time.Ê I bought this two months ago and it is past the return policy deadline but I am going to do what I can to return it.Ê This is a major defect with this model and it becomes a real nuisance when it starts at midnight several times a week.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: New System is Incredible at Cleaning Rugs!Ê Worth the Extra Price.
Review: The cleaning power on this thing is RIDICULOUS!!Ê The first time I used it on my area rugs (one border collie, one short-hair cat, 3 kids) I had to follow it around to clean out the trash because it was getting full every 5-10 minutes.Ê This is with a cleaning person and vacuuming ourselves in between as well.Ê My rugs have never looked better!Ê It is still pulling up ridiculous amounts of fuzz, hair, and dirt.Ê I was choking at the price, but the new system is totally worth it!Ê It isn't completely automated, as the trash container is small, and you have to finagle with the lighthouses to get it to go where you want.Ê Basically it does each room for 25 min.Ê I take it in bedrooms once they are picked up, shut the door and turn it on and set a timer.Ê I don't feel it really works the best for an entire house, because theÊ battery will go before it gets everywhere.Ê But, for the high traffic areas, with pets and kids, it is awesome.Ê I set the timer to go off once the kids go to school, 3 days a week.Ê It is slightly loud, but not horrible.Ê Not something you want to watch TV while it is on, but I usually work at the computer and it is fine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Extremely happy with my purchase
Review: The cleaning area covered by each lighthouse is a little smaller than i thought it would be, but not a big deal. Others mentioned that roomba hits hard when it runs into furniture, but mine doesn't.Extremely happy with my purchase!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iPet
Review: The best toy with cleaning as a bonus . Funny and mischievous when finds and moves sleepers away from the couch, makes nice sounds when goes to the charger - and surprisingly efficient in collecting dust in what seemed to be a clean room.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 5 stars
Review: The best substitute to the ordinary vacuum cleaners.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best purchase I have ever made
Review: The best purchase I have ever made. My wood floors are so much easier to clean. I'm amazed at how much the Roomba 880 picks up. I love watching it dock when it is finished. Just press the button and let it go....

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wonderful!
Review: The best machine I've ever bought.Ê Cut's my floor cleaning time in half at least.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Best Investment Ever
Review: The Best Investment Ever!!!Ê I love my IRobot Roomba 880.Ê It has changed my life!Ê I have a blonde lab and had to vacuum everyday before I discovered this amazing machine.Ê I come home from work, hit the button and it goes to work.Ê It glides easy from hardwood floors to Persian rug with thick pad.Ê My floors are spotless.Mary

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Much better than 770
Review: The battery does last longer and the new brushes don't get caught on rugs and cords. Also the brushes don't wrap up hair and string like the other models. It cleans very well especially animal hair. It goes under furniture easily and the best thing is its noticeably quieter than the other models. Took a star off because of no real room mapping tech. They do give you a remote to guide it which is a bandaid for now. Come on irobot devs. Get the room mapping tech! People will pay more for it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Improved Roomba 880 vs Neato Botvac 80 vs Neato XV-21
Review: The actual vacuum part of this Roomba 880 is actually better than previous Roomba models (I have owned four others).Ê The vacuum is still not on a par with the Neato XV-21 vacuum robot (tried one, it broke after four or five days but the vacuum power was IMPRESSIVE!) The new brush-less roller seems to be a great improvement, too.The largest problem with this robot is that the algorithm for movement and motion control still SUCKS!!!!Ê My 880 has been stuck between a chair's legs now for over 45 minutes.Ê I have been watching it just spin right, right, right, right with about 45 degree turns, followed by a couple of 15 degree turns and almost, but not quite line up to get out from the chair but each time the front push sensor taps a leg, it spins 15 degrees right, and cannot make it out.Ê If it would just once turn left 15 degrees (which would seem the logical movement considering it is ALWAYS the very right side edge of the push sensor tapping the leg, the stupid roomba would be free.Ê After about five or six failed rotations to the right, the roomba does do a 'reset' rotation to the left of about 90-degrees, then it starts the failed attempts to the right again.Ê IF the reset was only about 75 degrees rather than a full 90, it would clear itself, too.Ê There are a few very simple little coding procedures that could make this machine far 'smarter' and much more capable.Ê At this rate the battery will be dead before the roomba can freeÊ itself.Ê Here is another place the neato never once found itself trapped.The Roomba 880 does do a much better job a maneuvering around other objects around the rooms it cleans.Ê The Roomba has yet to get 'trapped' on my area rugs like the Neato did frequently.Ê There are black areas on the area rugs where the Neato became 'cliff-scared' and thought it was going into a precipice.Ê This prevented it from always cleaning the area rugs - sometimes it got scared, sometimes it did not.Ê When it did get scared, it just stopped!Ê No backing up, no turning, it just stopped and cried for help.Ê The Roomba is at least smart enough to avoid this pitfall.Ê The Neato had no issues getting up onto the area rug but the Roomba can only manage this if makes a cross-angle approach. If the Roomba attempts to go onto the area rugs straight on, it always fails and turns around.Ê This means that it will not always clean the area rug but so long as it does this at least every other time I use the Roomba, I will be satisfied.I would have kept the Neato over the Roomba because of the vacuuming power but with the complete failure, I decided NOT to replace it but to return it.Ê I read too many complaints of similar failures.Ê I have not tried the newest Neato as it was not available at the time of my Roomba purchase.Ê The flaws may be worked out with the newer model.The Roomba is doing its job for the most part.Ê I have used it about eight times now to clean a very large area.Ê The dust bin is smaller than the Neato.Ê The battery time is shorter.Ê The Neato would restart to finish cleaning after recharging, the Roomba is not this clever.Ê The zone control for the Roomba requires the battery powered little towers, which work.Ê The Neato has a nice concept with the magnetic strip but this did not work right, either, as the Neato did pass right over it at least twice.The verdict, only three stars because of the small dust bin, lack of ability to continue cleaning after a charge and because IT IS TOO STUPID TO EXTRICATE ITSELF FROM UNDER A CHAIR (it has been trapped about 55 minutes now..... pathetic!)Ê It is slowly relocating the chair so it might clean just a bit more of the room before dying.I will keep this vacuum but will some reluctance.Ê It just seems that Roomba could do better with the programming.------------- update ------------When I returned home from work the Roomba 880 was on its charger so it apparently freed itself but it was still trapped at least 70 minutes (when I left for work).Ê Maybe one of my cats freed it?------------- update 2 (25 April 2014) ----------I had originally thought the Roomba 880 was just missing or avoiding my area rugs on occasion because of the short battery life but utilizing the two included Lighthouses, I 'trapped' the 880 into a zone to force it to clean one of the wool area rugs.Ê What I discovered was the Roomba 880 could not properly clean the area rug.Ê It just pushed the dirt, cat hair and dust around.Ê Any debris that was on the new rollers (collected from cleaning the adjacent hardwood floors) was cleaned off the rollers and left as smudges on the area rug. This was not very impressive at all!Ê I am leaving the Roomba 880 at 3 stars but one my primary reasons for buying a robot vacuum was to keep the cat hair from accumulating on the area rugs.Ê The Neato XV-21, while it lasted, did a great job of cleaning the area rugs.Ê Since Amazon is now offering the Neato Botvac, I ordered the model 80 and will see if this does any better.Ê Hopefully the new Neato will last longer than the XV-21 (which I truly believe was a rebuild).Ê Whichever one proves better for my needs I will keep and the other will be gifted to my mom.Ê The Roomba is not so bad as to return, it just fails where I need it most.Ê I think this could be resolved with an actual brush style roller but this is not an option for the new 'superior' Roomba's.Ê (They are both too expensive to justify keeping two robots but I know my mom will appreciate either one of these.)------------- update 3 (12 May 2014)Ê ----------------As promised, here is a comparison/review of the Neato Botvac 80.Ê I cannot say that this Neato is an 'improvement' over the Neato XV-21 because it does not seem to be as powerful a vacuum.Ê But then again, it does seem to have a better navigation program.Ê The Botvac 80 does not clean the area rugs as well as the Neato XV-21 but it does do significantly better than the Roomba 880 on area rugs.Ê The Botvac 80 is much quiter than the Neato XV-21 and, to my ears, seems on a par with the 880.Both the Roomba and Neato machines do an adequate job of keeping the carpets clean.Ê It still amazes me how much dirt both of these machines pick up each day!Ê Both are relatively simple to program.Ê The Roomba is easier to maintain.Ê The dust bin on the Roomba is smaller yet it is easier to clean out.Ê The Roomba filter is easier to clean (I swipe it down with an old tooth brush to remove any residual dust and cat hair.Ê The Roomba filter has a nice little protective screen built in over the filter material that makes maintaining it quite easy.Ê The much larger Neato Botvac dust bin holds significantly more debris but the filter is tougher to pop out (not difficult, just tougher in comparison).Ê The Neato's filter, though, is not at all user friendly in that the dust and cat hair really clings to it and cleaning it off regularly is both necessary and tedious.Ê The new Neato filter is not at all user friendly.Ê Neato 'brags' about the size of their filter, it is much larger than the Roomba filter, but honestly, I cannot see where this is plus considering the limited amount of cleaning these machines can do anyway.Ê I would rather have a filter that is easier to maintain, such as the one found on the Roomba 880.The Neato has a much, much better battery.Ê The Neato battery lasts well over two hours with each charge.Ê The Roomba battery lasts almost exactly 55 minutes with each charge (see update 4, below).Ê The nice thing about the Neato is that it 'measures' the room and if it feels the room(s) has not been completely cleaned by the time it needs to re-charge its battery, then after charging, the Neato will resume cleaning - sometimes two or three times.Ê The bad thing about the Neato is that it will resume after recharging.Ê I actually find this irritating because I work rotating shifts and sleep odd hours; I do not want this machine to start up on its own at odd times of the day to complete the maintenance vacuuming.Ê I am quite happy with the Roomba starting at the same time each day and finishing in 55 minutes.Ê The Roomba may not maintain the entire area but, hey, this is 'maintenance' cleaning, not thorough cleaning.Ê I use t

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The 880 with the extractors is much easier to clean ...
Review: The 880 with the extractors is much easier to clean and doesn't have to be cleaned as often as the older model 550 that I previously. The hair and threads are so much easier to remove on the 880 and operates longer and quieter.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRoomba 880 is fantastic!
Review: The 880 replaced my 770, which I gave away.Ê The 880 exceeded my expectations by a wide margin.Ê Forget about the robotics, it picks up fine dirt far better than an vacuum I have ever seen.Ê I've made good use of the scheduling to have it run when there is no one home.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The 880 does OK. It cleans the entire room ...
Review: The 880 does OK. It cleans the entire room well. However mine seems to ignore the virtual wall. Also it gets stuck frequently. It rarely finds its way home and when I go to pick it up and place it on the charger sometimes it does not connect. This is my first robot vacuum cleaner and honestly I thought A.I. had come a lot farther since the 80's when my friends were programming dots to find their way out of mazes on a TRS-80. But apparently not.Also it is rather noisy. Not quite as noisy as a regular vacuum cleaner but I find I need to leave the house when it is running.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Be forewarned that it doesn't work on dark surfaces
Review: The 880 cleans well if your house is what the Roomba wants it to be...Ê Note that it doesn't work on dark surfaces.Ê I't wont get on top of my area rugs that have a dark border.Ê If I put the Roomba on top of the rug it wont clean it because of the dark pattern on the rug.Ê Yes, you can hack the poorly designed cliff sensors but you shouldn't have to hack a $700 machine with scotch tape and white paper.Ê When I contacted Roomba support about the problem, this is the response I got (they call the machine not working as advertised an "inconvenience".."Thank you for taking the time to contact us with the issue that you are having for the robot. We have looked at the picture of the rug and we are sorry to inform you that the robot is not able to run on dark surfaces. Because the border of the rug is back the robot will not be able to mount it.We apologies deeply for the inconvenience.Sincerely,Machellieann D."

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: thank you

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Three Stars
Review: Takes long time to finish the room and multiple runs on the Sam area again and again.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great stuff to rid one's house of a pet hair covered floor!
Review: Super helpful robot to keep pet mess at bay.I have a very active dog who brings a lot of sand into the house after his runs and tops this off with a coating of hair. The roomba goes to work and does a great job.At first it did take a bit of time to find how best adjust furniture to make sure the too be could clean everywhere and not get stuck. Have a look on YouTube and some people have posted videos of how to best do this.Another this I really like about this product is how easy they have made it to do quick main tends on the robot, with the use of yellow coded latches and pieces designed so they only fit in their correct position.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRoomba, great idea!!
Review: Super cool! Fun to watch, not super noisy, but I do hear it. Cleans thorough, goes under all the stuff I don't normally move. We have a shedding beast of a dog, Roomba goes for a couple hours and does a great job before returning to base. Highly recommend the 880 model! Works with the remote towers to get to any room with an open door.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Dust Mites and Carpeting Allergens;Ê 880, 770, and Hombot
Review: Summary:Ê The most automated of the 3 high-end HEPA units I've tried.Ê However, its HEPA filtering is less capable and its vacuuming often necessitates a person nearby. Some allergy sufferers nearby still be exposed by vacuuming's dust blowout.Carpet accumulates dust mite and pollen allergens.Ê Constant manual carpet vacuuming is a drag, and even a HEPA vacuum blows out residual allergens and makes misery.Ê My allergy-reduction strategy is robot vacuum 80% of carpet every two days.Ê Then manually vacuum every 10 days to reach the 20% the robots can't.Ê Robotic vacuum cleaners can help prevent allergy shots and pills.I've used 3 HEPA robotic vacuum cleaners:Ê Roomba 770, Hombot 3.0, and this Roomba 880.Ê In summary, Roomba 880 travels smartest. Hombot's HEPA filtering is best, 880 second best.The evaluation criteria of Roomba 880 include:1. How well does Roomba pick up allergens, using the sneeze-nose test?2. How automated?3. Are additional supplies needed?4. How much allergens blowout is created, while babysitting the robot?Unlike many other reviewers, I'm less concerned about how visibly clean the results are, because my carpeting is brown and because my sneezing is accurate on how much dust mite allergens remain.All three robots need the environment to be set up.Ê With the 880, this means, removing small cables, (e.g. USB cables), placing barriers to vibration sensitive devices (e.g. floor standing PCs), removing paper products (e.g. cardboard), rugs, and angled wedges that can trap the robot.After set up, here's how the tests went:1. Picking up allergens:Ê The Roomba 880 does a very thorough job.Ê Far superior to manual vacuuming, but not quite as good as the Hombot.Ê 770 performs poorly on capturing allergens.2. Automation:Ê After the environment is set up, Roomba 880 is fairly automated.Ê All three robots still need babysitting, but the 880 needs the least.3. Extra supplies:Ê Roomba 880 comes with two lighthouses for doorways, perhaps for upto 3 rooms.Ê However, furnishings and walls can create what appears to be doorway entrances to the 880.Ê For example, my elliptical's edge and a wall form an opening about the size of a door.Ê I'm guessing Roomba 880 doesn't like to transverse this opening because 880 may perceive the opening as a doorway.Ê By placing additional lighthouse ($60), 880 then transverses this "opening".Ê Replacement HEPA filters cost $8 each (ouch!).4. Allergens blowout:Ê Roomba 880 blows out little allergens, so it is possible for one to stay nearby while 880 vacuums.Ê But I'm highly allergic to dust mites and still am a little sensitive to 880's air blowout, and I wasn't to Hombot's blowout.Overall, this Roomba is fairly automated and its HEPA filtering helps.Ê 5 stars for effective HEPA vacuuming.Ê 4 star for automation.Ê If you want to reduce allergy meds or shots, yes, this will help.6-17-14Ê The HEPA filter and dust bin are small.Ê Needs constantly changing.Ê I found using compressed air helps clean HEPA filter.8-4-14Ê Of the 4 vacuum robots I've used, this is the most automated, meaning it needs less human intervention to escape from being stuck.9-11-14Ê theÊ remote control usually gets confused.Ê Fastest way to change directions-- use robot vacuum's LED panel.Ê Minor annoyance.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Three Stars
Review: Still needs improvement

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: it's not perfect, but its damn near close
Review: spectacular....don't know how i ever lived without this. it's not perfect, but its damn near close.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Just buy it.
Review: Soo.. we were one of those couples that purchased this due to shear laziness...I do not have a dog, a cat, or kids... our apartment is not huge but you know what? I hate vacuuming. Also, I recently purchased a $$$ 100% wool rug which sheds like I have 3 sheep running around the place. Apparently I'm supposed to vacuum it 2-3x weekly but as a young woman once said on national television "ain't nobody got time for that".Ê In all seriousness..+1- Does an excellent job in my carpeted (medium pile) bedroom, hardwood floors & tiled bathroom floors.+1- The roomba does not have the traditional beaters and so it does a great job on my wool rug (unlike the dyson which wantsÊ to completely eat and destroy my rug)+1- The charge is great. However, it tends to require charging more frequently during the first week or so that you use it. InitiallyÊ roombi (yes that's what we call her) would require charging after she was finished with my bedroom. Two weeks later roombiÊ could do my bedroom, bathroom and walk-in closet before she headed to the dock.+1- I love love love the lighthouses/virtual walls. Roombi does a phenomenal/thorough job when she is limited to the areas she isÊ supposed to clean. Hallways/ high traffic areas are not a problem.+1- Forget maintenance- I run roombi everyday and never vacuum. Each room in my apartment gets vacuumed 2-3 times perÊ week. Ba-bye dyson. I may buy a handheld vacuum to vacuum my couch and to get to deep corners (but roombi does getÊ the majority of corners).-1- The price.But+1- The quality of the product make the price so worth it. I bought mine on amazon via Hammacher and Schlemmer for the lifetime warranty - you know just in case.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does its Job, doesn't replace regular deep clean.
Review: Some of the reviews I read of this thing give it 1 star undeservedly. It is a tiny circular robot that drives around your house at 1 in the morning or 12 noon when you are not at work and picks up dust, garbage, and hair.I was a bit skeptical at first, but I think it has been doing a fine job in my house for over 3 months now. I have one dog, and hardwood floors. My Rhoomba is a champ at driving around and picking up the hair she sheds all over with great regularity.It isn't a mop, so sometimes I find myself still breaking out the swiffer-wetjet, but man has it made things easier. Plus I have a robot that drives around my house which I think is awesome.If you have an insane amount of dirt in your house (you know who you are) this thing isn't going to change your life. But if you typically have a mild amount of dirt, running this thing regularly will keep our house pretty clean.5 stars

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Girlfriend told me I needed to vacuum the house more often...
Review: Solved THAT problem, I did! You can't beat the iRobot for convenience. My girlfriend has issues with my cat and can't deal with the fur, so "Hank" vacuums for us every single day. I swear he picks up more dirt and dust than a certain expensive ball vacuum I have. I just have to empty his container every few days, and he makes my life MUCH more pleasant.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Have you ever paid full price for a refurbished product?
Review: So, let's be fair.Ê I ordered and received this unit in October 2014.Ê I never even opened the box until today.Ê Today is 8/8/2015.Ê I am looking at the actual robot and it seems like it looks "used".Ê I don't know why.Ê It seems to have minor scratches and the brushes and the other rollers on the bottom have a minor amount of "grim" in them.Ê I am keeping the rating at 5/5 for the following reason:Ê It is still recharging.Ê I expect to rate this device fairly after I start actually using a robot vacuum machine thingy such as this.Ê This is just my first initial observation.Ê I am not accusing anyone of anything.Ê Also, I plugged in the virtual walls and put the batteries in the remote control.Ê The time has been set.Ê I tried to get it to clean my place but it just says that it needs to be recharged.Ê I understand.Ê I am patient.Ê More to follow.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I HAVE A TON OF ANIMALS AND WOW!! I love it!
Review: So where do I start. I have two cats who shed like it's their job, two pet rats that love to shove shavings out of their cage, a Jack Russell terrier talk about a major shedding breed, and a horse who's hair some how managed to get in every nook and cranny of the house.Before I purchased the roomba I was vacuuming about every two days which is a lot to do. It wasn't a crazy thorough vaccum but everything I could get without moving furniture. It still wasn't enough not to mention one of the biggest struggles was the bathroom(where we have the litter box) i would have to plant my feet firmly on both sides of the carpet each time and maneuver the vaccum on it, and change the vaccum head to do the tile to get all the litter. Such a major pain. There was always dust around everywhere and I felt like the problem would never go away.I bought the roomba 880 from bed bath and beyond with the 20% off coupon. I love this thing! I was shocked that it did truly do a better job then my 1 year old Hoover vaccum.Ê I have programmed Jeeves(our roomba) to run every day at 10. It's cut back on all the dust the house always looks amazing and it always has a full bin. I love my animals but hated always having to clean up there messes. Now I get to enjoy my animals have a beautiful home and amazingly clean floors. This is a must have for any pet owner truly!!! My life is so much simpler and it goes between carpet to tile to rug like its job. In the bathroom it doesn't even bat an eye to go over the bath mat and then the whole floor!Ê You may think that's a ton of money to spend. But once you have one you understand it's worth every god damn penny!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Buy two Neato Botvacs instead!
Review: So we bought both this Roomba 880 and a Neato Botvac at the same time so we could figure out which was better. We were really surprised to find that we love the Neato, and weren't that impressed with the Roomba. The Roomba kinda randomly stumbles around, knocks into things, and doesn't get much stuff up. The Neato maps out a plan, and neatly goes around cleaning the entire floor. It's also has a much stronger vacuum, the Roomba is more of a sweeper. So the Neato takes way less time and actually cleans the house.To put icing on the cake, you can get a Botvac 65 from costco for $300, less than half the price of a Roomba 880. Keep in mind the Botvac 65, 70, 75, 80, and 85 are all the same machine, they just include different filters to charge different prices at different stores. Buy the least expensive, you can swap out filters anytime you want. We ended up returning the Roomba and buying two Neato Botvacs instead.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: So much better than the first ones they had out.Ê Run it everyother day have two dogs.Ê Perfect.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So far so good.
Review: So I've had this roomba about 2 1/2 weeks.I'm running it 4 times a week. It does a good job. I have a small living room (carpet) and kitchen/dining (wood) area that it does.One time it stopped in the living room. Like it lost its way and ran out of battery. Everything was clean, though.I wish it was a bit more intelligent. I wish it would be a less random, but at the end of the day it does everything and well. I haven't seen missed spots yet, so I'm happy.I have never had a cleaning robot, so I am curious to see how long this lasts for the price.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I expected more.
Review: So I bought this after reading reviews and I thought it would be great but it just runs around the house randomly bumping into things and getting stuck. I don't know if it is defective or something but it is pretty annoying. I set it to automatically start at 9:00 AM, it is now 12:33 PM and I have had to get it unstuck 3 times and it is just walking around the house like a drunken sailor. I have hit return to base 3 times but it refuses to go back. I have yet to figure out what pattern if any it is trying to use. Seriously thinking about sending it back, for almost $600 I expected more.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I <3 robots !
Review: So far so good!Pros:*We have a short hair pit bull mix and surprisingly this dog loses hair constantly. I couldn't believe the amount of hair this roomba picked up from the wood floors and carpeted office area where my dog hangs out during the day. I'll take pics later. I was astounded and how clean the carpet and floors are after the robot has it's way. I'll have a Rottweiler pup in another month which is another reason we bought this. I don't regret the purchase at all.*Easy to program.*Very sturdy, well designed.*Plenty of space in the tray unless you live in an absolutely filthy environment.*Not as loud as I thought it would be.Cons:*Can't navigate around chairs when under the dining room table. Gets a bit confused.*The lighthouses/virtual walls don't seem to work that well. The roomba glides right through the virtual wall after appearing to recognize and turn back a couple times. A video on how to set these up effectively would be nice.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Far Exceeds Expectations
Review: So far it's exceeding our expectations.Ê We have a dog who sheds, and she is the main reason we got this.Ê This is a very thorough cleaner, and it's doing a better job than my built-in vacuum ever did!Ê Plus, it's a blast to sit and read a book while "I'm vacuuming!"Ê Just be careful to keep it maintained (cleaned) as directed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: so Far it has exceeded the wife's expectations,Ê And that my Friends is what Really Matters ! Stephen Powell

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So far I love my little robot vacuuming buddy
Review: So far I love my little robot vacuuming buddy.Ê He gets stuck now and then (or drops the dust tray) but overall it does exactly what I expect it to do - it cleans based on a pre-programmed regular schedule which I could never bring myself to do.Ê What can I say.. I am very lazy, so this thing is perfect for me.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: so good, love it
Review: So far , so good , love it !

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: All Hype But No Performance
Review: So disappointed.Ê I bought this to replace a very good Iclebo whose only fault was having brushes that I hated cleaning.Ê The 880 has rubber blades/fins that eliminate the need to touch disgusting pet hair, etc. while cleaning brush.Ê From what I can tell, this is its only advantage.Ê Sadly, this 880 didn't follow the program.Ê It sort of cleans at will - even starting up at 1 am a few times.Ê Also, it gets lost all too frequently - and often in the same place.Ê It is NOT smart.Ê The Iclebo is much more "intelligent" about cleaning and finding its way back to the charger.Ê This 880 seems obsessed with cleaning a certain area while ignoring a tuft of pet hair just inches away.Ê Many times it refuses to cross the threshhold into the kitchen - and no barriers either electronic or physical are stopping it.Ê Right now, it's just sitting in the middle of the floor with no obvious reason to have stopped there.Ê With all the good reviews, maybe this particular machine is defective - and it is being returned, considering the steep price.Ê On to the next robot vac, but it will not be a Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: half short carpet home so I pooped for the 880 and glad I did 10 months ago
Review: Single guy here who likes a clean house but with 2 long haired dogs and a cat not to mention dirt I track in (I live on a small farm) in my half hardwood, half short carpet home so I pooped for the 880 and glad I did 10 months ago.I'd been watching the Roomba reviews for years and held off until the 880 came out before I spent the money.Ê so...It picks up everything from dust, lots of gritty dirt and wasps (I tend to leave my door open a lot for fresh air).Ê Bumble bees and large dead moths are beyond it's capabilities but they are few and far between inside.Ê My small dogs have very fine hair which tends to clump up on the carpet and while my Roomba 880 gets every bit on the hardwood it doesn't pick up the smaller clumps of fine dog hair off the carpet.Ê Not a big deal to spent 1 minute a week to grab them by hand.I've got a small air compressor and thus far the original Roomba filter is still going since I blow it out every 3-4 cleanings.Ê I've had to replace the brushes twice in the last 10 months since they sometimes loose one of the arm's bristles.Ê Once again not a big deal and a easy job.Ê This "vacuum" was clearly designed for easy maintaince.Today I heard a louder than normal noise as it ran.Ê Upon inspection I saw that one of the rollers had been cut through by a wrap of fine dog hair.Ê Since the rollers are so easy to clean (something I do about once a month and takes 1 minute) I ordered a replacement roller (sweeper) set .Bottom line is while I wouldn't call the Roomba "intelligent" (It bumps too many table legs) I'm very satisfied with the labor the Roomba 880 saves me every day.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: Simply marvelous

Review: simply awesome!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Simply amazing. Buying the Roomba has been one of the ...
Review: Simply amazing.Ê Buying the Roomba has been one of the best purchases I have made in years.Ê We have two dogs, one of which sheds constantly.Ê This meant that unless we vacuumed a few times a week we would have dust and hairballs throughout the house.Ê The Roomba runs nightly and we essentially have no more dog fur issues.Ê In particular I think the fact that it can get underneath furniture that we miss with an upright has made a huge difference.Ê On our first floor we have hardwood and persian rugs only which the Roomba does very well with.Ê The second floor is carpeted which admittedly the Roomba has a much harder time with.Contrary to what I had read, the Roomba seems to be able to handle a pretty large amount of space.Ê Our first floor is ~1250 sq ft.Ê With the virtual lighthouses we can focus the vacuum on the main room that we spend our time in and it does a good job with the less trafficked rooms.I spent a great deal of time agonizing over wether to drop so much money on a vacuum.Ê It really has replaced my upright which we only need to use now once a month.Ê So long as you do not have carpet I highly recommend
