Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 880 VS. iClebo Arte VS. Neato Botvac 80
Review: Short answer: the Roomba 880 does the best job cleaning. I bought all three and tested them all over 2 weeks and 2 houses. The 880 charges faster, is easier to pickup and move around (it has a handle!!), is built with higher quality components, and the virtual walls are superior to the magnetic strips. The iClebo Arte sounded like it was going to fall apart.Ê Compared to the 880: think USA made vs Chinese made quality (Yeah I know iClebo is South Korea but you get my point) The Neato Botvac 80 is 2x as heavy as the 880, and the battery life is not nearly as good - in reality it probably has the same battery milli-amp-hours as the 880 (not sure but guessing) but since the Neato has a much more powerful vacuum than the 880 it burns through the battery a lot faster. Here is why you want the 880 for cleaning (and you'll be surprised by my answer) First a robotic vac does not have the same suction power as a plug in vacuum. Robotic vacs are really for maintenance. We have house cleaners every 2 weeks but I also have 7 and 9 year old boys and I a 40 year old male love to cook. So after the maids leave the house is dirty in 10 minutes and trashed in 24 hours. So having a push button robotic vac I don't have to con into cleaning the floors daily is well worth it. Also, when you get the 880 vacuum it looks like a robot with ADHD. It's almost maddening watching it. See when I vacuum I start from the left and move to the right in straight lines and I apply that logic to the robotic vac (as if I know better than a machine... silly me) but you will soon realize that when you hit a dirty spot from every direction possible (like the 880 does due to it's ADHD) it actually cleans better and more thoroughly than the iClebo and the Botvac 80 both of which can do the random ADHD as well as the anal straight line cleaning we are all too familiar with. I want the highest quality vac I can get with great cleaning and a good power vs battery life balance. The 880 fits the bill and does the best job.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Shedding Dog makes getting a Roomba an easy decision
Review: Shedding dog=get a Roomba. My life is easier now that I have my Roomba, Many more positives than negatives,Pros: Programmed easy, navigates well, picks up enough hair for two dogs, pretty intelligent pattern, my dog is used to it now after two weeks, cleans out easy, charges in it's stand under a table out of sightCons: Gets stuck under my kitchen cabinets occasionally and shuts down. Battery life could be better but it seems good enough for what we use it for, we could theoretically have it vacuum twice a day while we are away, occasionally we have to carry it home to it's dock because of where we put the charging dock, a bit noisy but way less than the average vacuum, price was steep but over time should be worth it,I WOULD buy this product again knowing what I do now about it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's okay...but for the money I spent I expected better.
Review: She's pretty good...ours is a French maid named Clotilde btw.Ê At first I thought there was nothing better in the world than this piece of machinery...and if we didn't have 2 dogs that shed constantly I would probably rate her a 5.Ê However, with all the hair that they misplace I can only rate it as 'okay.'Ê The hair does not always make it to the bin and gets caught underneath the rollers, and then I have to remove the rollers, the hair glob, and put it back together.Ê It does pick up a lot of junk.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love our "Ruby"!!!
Review: She keeps our hard wood floors free of pet hair and dirt from their paws! Before we got her, even with me sweeping every other day, you could still see little balls of fur rolling across my hardwood like little tumble weeds. I have her clean the main hall, living/dinning room, and kitchen everyday. About once a week I will put her in a bedroom and close the door and let her go to town. I haven't had to sweep or vacuum in month. The instructions say to change the hepa-filter once every 2 months but I bought extra due to the excessive pet hair and am planning on changing it every month. Filters are cheap though. I would definitely recommend this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Get back your life!
Review: She is a life saver! She is not perfect but neither are we. Whatever debris is missed she will get it the next time. She is extremely easy to clean but yes she does get stuck under some furniture.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: NOT WORKING AFTERÊ BARELY 2 MONTHS.
Review: SELLER CAN YOU PLEASE CONTACT ME.Ê We set his time to clean, however he keeps setting his own time-going off in the middle of night and waking us up.Ê The spinning brush is making grinding sounds and it does not appear to be anything blocking it.Ê Sounds like it may be a motor issue.Ê Tried to return to replace but seller will not accept return.Ê Bought March 2015, if seller will contact and return/replace that would be great.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: runs daily and keeps the house clean we have pets and it keeps up with all their hair with no issue

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A worthwhile splurge
Review: Rosie the Roomba joined us a little over a month ago, and I am thrilled and appalled with the amount of cat fur, dust, and other nastiness she removes from our floors. She runs every day downstairs, and this increased vigilance means no more cat fur tumbleweeds clinging to the bottoms of my kitchen cabinets or lurking beneath my china cabinet. Most days I take her upstairs in the afternoon and let her do a few rooms up here too. I work from home, and can easily work and be on conference calls even with her upstairs. Shes not all that loud, mostly a monotonous hum that the cats find a mild curiosity. I do hear her thudding into things, usually my kitchen chairs. But she gets all crumbs off my kitchen floor, without any intervention from me.Ê We have berber carpet, ceramic tile, hardwood, and area rugs. She does sometimes miss something on the highly polished hardwood, but shell get it the next day. My baseboards arent furry any longer either.Cat hair. Ah cat hair. We have two enormous, furry, long-haired Maine Coons. Shedding season is here, and theyre blowing their coats. Overnight the carpet sprouts fur. To add insult to injury, the house is on the market, and people want to walk through on short notice and track debris through my home. The Roomba eliminates the stress, and the mess. Running her every single morning downstairs means the carpet is the cleanest its ever been. Ive debated getting little risers for my couch so she can easily get under it - just not quite enough clearance.Ê Cat hair does not get stuck in the rollers. Cat hair does wrap around the inside edges of themÊ where you pop them out for a weekly cleaning. It slides right off and into the trash. It takes me 3 minutes for the weekly maintenance.Ê Think about that. It takes longer to go get the Dyson out of the closet and unwrap the cord and plug it in. (Which I had to do for the stairs.) I adore my Dyson. I really do. It does a fabulous job. But I like not having to use it every few days even more.Ê And why did the Roomba fill up fast on the first time on a floor just swept with my Dyson? I was horrified.Our house may be an optimal design for a Roomba. I loathe clutter, and theres very little on the floors to impede operation of a robot. (No kids here = only a few cat toys.) I do close the bathroom door because bath rugs get dislodged by the Roomba, and there could be moisture, which is fatal to a Roomba.Ê I protect the cat food/water by keeping it in a plant/boot tray instead of using a lighthouse. It was $6, and also keeps cat-made messes inside the tray and away from the Roomba (water=death). The Roomba bumps the tray, even skews it at times, but all is safe.Ê The Roomba deals well with the rather high threshold from the living room to the ceramic tile. It also unsticks itself from the living room curtains that just drag a few inches on the floor. It also untangled itself from a cell phone charging cord. It did turn off my surge protector by smacking squarely into the kick button in front (oops). Ive relocated that to the bottom shelf of our office bookcase. It returns to the dock every day, unless it gets stuck under the edge of the coffee table, which is just at the height clearance. Im still working on ways to fix that issue.As designed, the Roomba does an excellent job, and most days I let it go, unattended. I do find that with a little prep from me, it can do an amazing job. I invested less than 5 minutes clearing the floor in my sewing room this morning, and will let the Roomba loose this afternoon to thoroughly vacuum the floor, and not worry about thread tangling or anything else it might pick up. Since I only do that room once a week or so, its worth the time to prep. I also keep my cord clutter contained and behind furniture, off the floor, so I am sure that helps. Did I mention that it goes in the closet, under my clothes, without a hitch?The cons:- Price. OUCH.- Plastic feels a bit flimsy for something this expensive.- Virtual walls require C batteries. Seriously? They drink batteries. Ridiculous. I deal with this with a set of rechargeable batteries and a good charger. Upstairs I often close the robot into a room with (gasp) the door, until it finishes, rather than use walls with batteries.- Should come with 3-4Ê lighthouses rather than virtual walls at this price point.- Only comes with 2 filters at this price point. When you register it on the site, youll get 2 more free as a gift. I swap mine out once a week and thoroughly rinse them out. They must be ABSOLUTELY dry before you use them.My conclusion?I love her. Really deeply love her. I loathe vacuuming. Its tedious and mindless, and there are so many things Id rather do. Out of the box it works very well. With a little assistance it can really keep your home cleaner. I'd give it 4.5 stars, but since I can't, I'll go 5.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomie is the bomb. I bought it for the ...
Review: Roomie is the bomb. I bought it for the new house because we are slowly unpacking and right now there isn't a lot of time to vacuum. I let him loose in the bedrooms and he picks up quite a lot of stuff. A couple minor quibbles: The bin is a little small, the light comes on after 10 minutes and he gets hung up under furniture.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: In use every day
Review: Roombina, as we affectionately call her, works every day at our house, sweeping under the bed, in the corners, and especially concentrates on wherever the cat is lying at the moment. My husband has worked out the method for each room and delights in sitting at his computer and watching her work.Ê We rarely use the lighthouses any more - we purchased three long pieces of baseboard from Home Depot and set those up as walls instead of the virtual walls.Ê Roombina has very little trouble with rug fringe, but can't manage the height/fringe combination of two rugs stacked one on top of the other.The first run on our living room rug required NINE empties of the dirt bin.Ê With almost daily runs over the last month, we are down to 1.5, and hoping to get down to one.Ê The house in general seems brighter and doesn't require dusting as often.It took the cat about a week to completely ignore Roombina - but she still watches carefully if she is laying on the carpet!Ê :)We have had absolutely no trouble with Roombina so far, but will update the review as necessary.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love you! Keep on cleaning everyday
Review: Roomba, I love you!Ê Keep on cleaning everyday!Ê Yes it really works.Ê Great cleaning machine that won't fall down stairs or miss spots.Ê Easy transition from hard floors to rugs and carpet.Ê She is an off-roading machine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fun, functional, time saving, good with xmas tree needles
Review: Roomba is nice to have around. I have never owned a robot vacuum before. In a nutshell, I've experienced the same as all the other reviewers to an extent, I've owned him now since Nov2014 and I can't really add much although I will elaborate or confirm what other reviewers have said.Apologies to amazon but I did as others recommended and signed up for the bed bath & beyond 20% off coupon and bought from them for the discount. So easy and over $100 savings.I have a 3 person household and 1 english setter w/ fine silky hair, short to medium length and it picks up well except for some of the dog's longer 'feathers'. It does however collect the feather hair and wind them into yarns that are easily picked up from the carpet once he's done vacuuming.When you first purchase and use, his bin needs emptied frequently. It's helpful to have another vacuum to suck out the extra dust and debris from the bin and especially the filter but if this is not practical, a swiffer hand duster is awesome as well. I empty the bin in the garage because it's a dusty process.I haven't run my 15 year old hoover wind tunnel since I got roomba. I have a 1500 sf ranch with a basement level that contains another approximate 1100 sf finished in mostly carpet. Upstairs 1500 sf is about 60% hard laminate with throw rugs, the rest normal pile synthetic carpet. Like some have said, Roomba is not efficient in his erratic pattern so quite often I just sweep w/ a broom my hard floor and shake the throw rugs which is a 15 min process at best, Roomba would take 1.5 hours to get this properly. Some say he gets stuck on rugs with a dark patch as if it's a dirty area; I have a tri-colored Brazilian cowhide that I suspect Roomba gets stuck with sometimes.Ê I prefer to turn him loose on the regular carpeted areas. I do like his `spot' clean function, when I sweep my hard floor I pull the crumb pile into an open area and let him suck it up instead of me and a dustpan doing the rest of the job. Very helpful...and more fun.Furniture/clutter staging is required, thicker throw rugs need to be folded in 1/2's or 's and certain tight spots need blocked off. You learn quickly when he gets stuck to the point of stopping where to prep at. I've never had an issue with him falling over the steps.My favorite thing when we first got him... got his battery charged and everyone was excited to see him in action, I turned him loose in my bedroom first and he promptly disappeared under my bed for the next 25 mins! Son was so disappointed but the underneath of my heavy bed set is no longer a dust bunny/allergen breeding ground...he hits it hard under the furniture if he can fit.I notice on our synthetic carpet that he does pick up carpet fiber. When I empty the bin it seems that alot of the debris is carpet fiber as much as dog hair. This seems to have reduced, but we've had this carpet now for almost 9 years so it's bound to have loose fibers. It's not like the carpet looks as if it's going bald, it's just nice to think that loose debris like this is getting pulled up.I don't have the patience to run Roomba with the lighthouses/virtual walls. I followed other various reviewers comments to just let him run free through a room or if you want him to focus on 1 room, put him in there and shut the door for a certain period of time. I thought I had these devices figured out but then Roomba behaved counter intuitively to my understanding and I threw my arms up. I don't program my Roomba to run daily while we're gone either, this isn't necessary in our home, we're not that dirty. Our dog is also mature and has had recent health issues that has caused messes on the floor and I don't want to have the situation that one reviewer mentioned where it ran through one of the messes and spread it through their home.I enjoy working with Roomba as a team, only using him when I'm home and controlling his work area. He's fun to run while you're cleaning other things or just drinking a beer watching him; its satisfying when he eliminates the need for me to vacuum while I dust or clean bathrooms. He cuts down a lot on cleaning effort and I got rid of my hired house cleaner when I got him...he'll pay for himself in less than 5 mos.He fascinates my mechanically inclined husband, he can't take his eyes from him as he whizzes through the room. The dog doesn't trust him but understands that Roomba isn't deliberately chasing him; he just likes to be sure he's not in the same room that Roomba is cleaning. I like things clean and I feel that the only time I'll have to get the regular vacuum out is when I need to get behind furniture and cobweb corners. Roomba picks up well overall and doesn't get bothered with my long hair. I think in the winter he helps keep our allergen/asthmatic aggravations at a lower level. I run him every weekend in our carpet rooms and then once he's charged I run him through the same rooms again. As another reviewer mentioned, he's an all-terrain vacuum vehicle, don't worry that he'll get stuck unless it's an honest obstacle.I can be a control freak but I giggle when I see his random `pinball' pattern that he leaves on the carpets. Roomba takes on this enormous vacuum job for me, to hell what his cleaning pattern turns out looking like - I love it!In summary, I give Roomba 4 stars because he's not perfect but damn close to it. He's not efficient on the hard floors in my opinion (but I'm impatient) and his bin needs emptied frequently at first. I see that he's not picking all of the dog hair out of our carpets but it's better than I could do with my upright vacuum with the time I have to myself and I'm not the one vacuuming. He's charming and sincere and strives to please. He's entertaining to clean house with. He's been durable, I haven't had any defective part problems or breakdowns. Oh, and he did an excellent job spot cleaning after I pulled the xmas trees out of the house, he was a spruce tree needle monster machine. I don't regret this purchase and I would make it again. It's like your dishwasher or laundry machines...you could be standing at a sink or tub and hand washing every piece yourself or you can just push start and tell Roomba to happily do it again for you!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Nice helper!
Review: Roomba has come a long way. I bought one of the first generations ages ago and it was fair. My family and friends made fun of me because I bought it. Ironically, my daughter bought a Roomba recently and raved about it to me--hmmmshe was one of the biggest skeptics when I bought the first one. I've followed her advice to try again and a month ago purchased the Roomba 880 and am amazed at how far it has come. I know I will still need to pull out ye olde vacuum now and then for certain dirt. The Roomba cannot delve into deep corners. I'm impressed with how long it will work. We have two collies and a long haired cat and it has no problem with the pet hair that blows around the house. Under the bed it goes to tackle dust bunnies. Picked up loose kitty litter that was on the floor. One great thing about this way of cleaning is that it organizes me. We have mostly hardwood floors, hard tile bathrooms and porch, some wall to wall and a thick carpet in one room. It has handled all situations so far. When you first get it you will waste time watching it but that'll pass. I mowed the lawn while Roomba was vacuuming--quite rewarding.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba has changed my life!!!
Review: Roomba has changed my life. I was constantly cleaning up dog hair... 1 yellow lab and an Assie that she'd 24/7 365. Then throw in a long haired cat!!! Ugh. Well Roomba rins every day and even goes under the bed!!!! Yes really. Why did I wait so long to buy this!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best gift ever!!
Review: Roomba and scooba are worth their weight in gold!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wish I purchased the Roomba years ago
Review: Roomba 880 is beyond my expectation.Ê I wish I purchased it earlier.Ê I like the option of "spot cleaning" the more soiled area.Ê I can relax and read a book in the same room, the Roomba is quiet, unlike a upright vaccum cleaner.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Cleaning Combination!
Review: Review is for the Roomba 880 and the Braava 380tSetup: 1200 feet of hardwood flooring, 600 upstairs, 600 in basement.Ê Upstairs black bamboo with brown highlights, downstairs dark brown laminate.I've had both of these for about 6 weeks now.Braava 380t: I bought this first and used it for dusting and mopping.Ê Since buying the Roomba 880 I no longer use this for dusting.As long as you understand how it works you'll love it.Ê The Braava has a reservoir which you fill with water and you attach mopping pads onto it (I have bought 9 additional pads).Ê There is also a GPS device that comes with it that keeps track of what was mopped.It's not perfect, especially if your room configuration is not typical.Ê I have to do 2 moppings with mine, but it does a great job at mopping.Ê I probably mop both floors twice a week, as traffic shows up on dark hard wood pretty quickly.Ê The reason I stopped using this for dusting, dark/black flooring shows all the dirt, and since this machine isn't a vacuum, it isn't going to pick it up.Ê So I bought the Roomba 880.Roomba 880:Ê Comes with 2 virtual walls which are completely necessary if you have more than 400-500 square feet and if your room configuration isn't typical.Ê I have to divide my room with a virtual wall and do one at a time, otherwise, the whole 600 ft area won't be cleaned (it cleans for an hour).Ê It moves fast and does a great job picking up dirt.Ê The bin is big enough, I love the fact you can program it for each day of the week.Having both products, we no longer have to vacuum or mop.Ê There are places these can't get to so once in a while we have a hand vacuum we use for those.Ê The time saved by using these products is immense and I can't imagine not having either of them.They aren't perfect (no machine/computer is) but once you figure out how they think and get used to them you won't be able to live without them.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Recomended
Review: Returned. NOT RECOMENDED

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Yea for robots!
Review: Replaced another brand with this one. What a difference. It is stronger, faster, long-life battery and does a much better job. No more back-breaking vacuuming for me. This robot does most of the work and is keeping our carpet looking new.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Remarkably useful. Doesn't replace routine cleaning
Review: Remarkably useful. Doesn't replace routine cleaning, but decreases the frequency with which I need to vacuum to maintain a clean apartment considerably.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love this vacuum.
Review: Really really cleans the floors! You can see how much stuff this guy picks up, even after you vacuum with a regular one it still gets more!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does a good job!
Review: Really enjoy the 880. it does a good job on hard surface floors but seems to struggle on carpet. It needs to be taken apart and cleaned weekly as we have dogs with lots of hair. Picks up lots of dust that I never realized was there. We have had this for about 3 weeks and no problems

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: very poor response to battery problem
Review: Really does a great job of removing all the dog hair. I have three dogs and a cat. Most impressed.After about 3 weeks of use there is a persistent recharging problem and I cannot use the machine as the battery won't charge.I have phoned the Cairo number and was promised that someone from the technical division would call.......10 days later, nothing. I have emailed the customer care in USA/Canada and again, no response. Very dissatisfied with the after sales service.and still can't use the machine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: bought neato robotics. then bought Roomba.
Review: Quiet. Cleans well. Almost always finds it's way back to base. Strongly recommend.On the other hand...neato robotics, has never picked up as much dirt as the Roomba picks up almost every time, seldom finds it's way to base, noisy, and customer service non-existant.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Beauty and brains
Review: Quiet and functional.Ê A smart robot doing a dirty but necessary household job with ease.Ê A really cool machine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great, but only for a little bit
Review: Purchased this item in July 2015. Loved it in every way and used it almost daily since. However, after proper maintenance and cleaning (you have to do this regularly), the robot simply stopped working. It does not dock as it just trips with the docking station, and charges up when it wants to after having to manually attempt various times to get it to dock and charge. Very disappointed especially for the money invested

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Floors are wood and tile and this is doing a great job picking up pet hair as well as the ...
Review: Purchased for my mother who has 1 dog and 2 cats plus lots of foot traffic in her home. Floors are wood and tile and this is doing a great job picking up pet hair as well as the normal sand etc...that gets in. It's a little bit loud when it runs but not a deal breaker tho. Happy with purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: good but could use some simple improvements
Review: Pros:Cleans wellCleans completelyDoesn't get jammed upProgramming feature is niceCons:Can get stuck - it constantly gets stuck in between legs of a stool. It uses the same pattern to try to get out which means it just hits the same spot on the stool legs until the battery runs outNeeds to be reprogrammed constantly -Ê if it gets stuck in the stool, it will twirl around until battery runs out. If battery runs out, it looses the time and the clock needs to be set again. This should have an extra backup battery used jut for the clock.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So, SO clean in my house now!
Review: PROs:* Picks up AMAZING amounts of dirt, crumbs, thread, flecks, grit, shards etc. day after day even in a house I thought was pretty clean* After Roomba runs, the floors feel so perfectly clean everywhere to my feet, it's just amazing* The carpets look so clean as well - not only is all dirt removed, but the pile is thoroughly fluffed* The suction is surprisingly powerful* The SPOT clean function is quite handy* It's so easy to empty (I use my central vac toekick to dump the dust pan and clean the filter)* Appropriately solicitous of its own safety....it's cute to watch it "tiptoe" onto a dark surface* HEPA filter means that air quality is improved too (but be careful when emptying as you can undo all the good work)* Even when it has sucked cables, hairpins, sheets of paper, toothpaste caps etc. it has been easy to detect and correct the issue without damage to Roomba or the object* I don't think I've sneezed once in my house since bringing this home 1 month ago....and I have a dust allergy* It climbs (actually clambers) onto various height rugs with no issues* Well-designed and well-engineered for function and maintainability.Ê It's clear this is many generations mature and lessons have been well-learned (filter design, emptying, suction etc.)CONs:* Takes much longer than a person would* Is slightly annoying to watch as it meanders brainlessly (that's why it takes so long)* Doesn't always return to base or respond to the light towers as I would have thought it should* Should really be run with supervision unless you're confident you've picked up all your cables and other things that could be sucked up* Sometimes get lost in house* Sucks so firmly that a few threads in my new Oushaks have been loosened.Ê I'll be monitoring this closely* It seems that there might be possibilities for algorithm improvement.Ê Ideally, Roomba would incorporate a mapping ability (GPS???) to learn the house better and get the job done fasterOn balance, this is life-changing for the better.Ê Great for my dust allergy.Ê (My data:Ê single story house;Ê combo of hardwood, wall to wall, kitchen and bathroom mats, and hand knotted Oushak rugs;Ê no pets.)Ê For me, it is worth the (not small) price.UPDATE:Ê The love affair continues.Ê Even my teenage daughter is amazed and loves to Roomba her room.Ê Yes, it is true the filter is not an actual HEPA as found in a semiconductor cleanroom.Ê It is, however, based on my dust allergies, a very effective and easy to clean one.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Product is perfect. The price is modified. Could I refund by the new price?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Disappointed with performance and value
Review: Pro's - Great build quality, relatively quiet, does well on hardwood and tile.Con's - 1.Ê Does not cover 100% of the room.Ê The "random" pattern is just that, random regardless of what the manufacturer says.Ê I have watched and videoed to verify that it doesn't cover all of the room.Ê 2.Ê Will bypass the hallway to the rear of the house about 50% of the time, regardless of how I setup the lighthouses.Ê Even moved the docking station to the rear and it rarely made it out of the back bedrooms to the front of the house. 3.Ê Poor suction - this is really nothing more than a glorified sweeper with a little suction.Ê Only gets the surface of carpet.Ê 4.Ê Frequently fails to make it back to the docking station.Ê I even have purchased extra lighthouses so that no matter where it goes, it has contact with a lighthouse, each lighthouse can see at least one other lighthouse, and one lighthouse sees the docking station.Ê No lighthouse is closer than 10' to the docking station.Ê The lighthouses are set in a pattern that should allow it to cover each room in sequence.Ê Get the same result no matter how few or how many lighthouses are used.For what this is, it's extremely overpriced.Ê I was well aware of the "intelligence" of the unit before I purchased but took into account all of the reviews.Ê When it works, it does an ok job.Ê But it rarely works as it's supposed to.Ê For the price, I would expect more performance, more intelligence and the ability to autonomously perform it's function instead of having to have constant intervention to keep it on track.Ê Would not buy again knowing what I know now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome!
Review: Pricey, but worth it. Was skeptical for a long time on cleaning robots, but it does a great job. Gets a little hung up going back and forth under our kitchen table, but makes it out of there. It has 8 chairs in a small space so a lot of legs to bump into so I can't get too upset. Means it stays cleaner under there. Doesn't cover every spec of the floor each time it runs, but will over the course of several days. Highly recommend.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: solid, not spectacular
Review: Pretty solid.Ê For the price point, you'd expect this product to be life-changing, but alas, it's pretty average.Ê It will pick up most obvious particles, but it does need to be cleared of tangled hairballs regularly.Ê Just dump out the filter after each use, and the product will work satisfactorily.Ê If you expect this to replace your human standard, however, be prepared to be disappointed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pretty good
Review: Pretty good, but the spinning brush sometime may "kick" the debrish far away.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pretty Good
Review: Pretty good but might be a bit overpriced. The 880 does an excellent job of maintaining our hardwood and slate floors but has some quirks that keeping it from being a set and forget device. If you have only one room to vacuum you can probably set it on a schedule and just let it do its thing on the schedule and have the room kept cleaner than you could keep it with a traditional vacuum. But with two or more rooms it occasionally gets confused. It will sometimes clean one room and go back to base forgetting the other rooms (might be a lighthouse thing - they seem to work sometimes but not others). It will sometimes clean all rooms then return to the first room and clean it for an extraordinary length of time until the battery dies. Most of the time it does all rooms and returns to base like it is supposed to. But if you get it going and leave, when you come back and it is in its dock you don't know what rooms it has actually cleaned. Also, it has understandable problems with regular doors - like bedroom doors. It will come in contact with the edge of the open door and spin, thus closing the door some. It then runs into the partially closed door completely closing it and locking itself in the room. We don't find it makes that much noise so we simply run it when we are home and in the back of our minds keep up with what rooms it has done and get it back on the proper course as needed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pretty disappointing, from its price it should do a ...
Review: Pretty disappointing, from its price it should do a good job, but it doesnt do the whole room. Just goes about 5 times in the same area then back on the docking station. Ive checks his path multiple times. Considering the time cleaning the roomba, cleaning where he didnt clean, and the price, youre better off cleaning yourself or hiring someone to clean your house.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Poor performer for the price
Review: Poor performer for the price. After it finishes cleaning my tile floor, I have to go through the house with a swiffer to finish the job. The photo shows what is leftover. (I run it once a day. Seems like there shouldn't be this much left behind on a small tile floor.) I gave it 3 stars because it DOES clean some dirt, but save your money... Swiffer (or similar-type sweeper) will be much cheaper. I'm hoping to return this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Roomba yet!
Review: Picks up pet hair with no problem. The timer function is wonderful.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Ok.....but........
Review: Picks up a lot of dog hair. Problem is that it frequently rolls hair into a 3-5 inch worm shaped collection and leaves it laying on floor. Then we have to get the upright and clean that up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Perfect. Use it everyday.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: PERFECT IF YOU HAVE A PET THAT SHEDS
Review: PERFECT IF YOU HAVE A PET THAT SHEDS.it is important to note that you should make sure cables and cords are picked up because they may become entangled.some times Roomba gets lost in the house or as my wife and i call it "Roomba got drunk again" since it tries to find its home and passes out under a table or in the middle of the floor.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best invention..".
Review: Perfect gadget for hard to reach areas. The best buY we had.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Perfect for my apartment!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Perfect for daily vacuuming
Review: Perfect for daily vacuuming. I do have to go around the house and make sure all the cords are tucked away and the curtains are off the ground. But it does a better job than my dyson!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Perfect

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does not climb rugs or carpet.
Review: People claiming it can climb "half-inch" rugs must have a very creative definition of "inch". This guy will treat any rug more than 0.3 inches tall as a WALL which makes it almost useless to clean rooms with rugs. Not only does it fail to clean the rug, but it also walls itself off from all the carpet space BEYOND the rug, UNLESS it gets super lucky and climbs the rug at a shallow angle, which is rare.Also, did no one else notice that the startup song for "Clean" is identical to the Windows 7 startup song? These people could be in a lot of trouble if Microsoft decides to sue them for copyright infringement.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Paradoxically better vacuum, surprised
Review: Paradoxically better vacuum, surprised.First off, read all the reviews, spared no expense (this one is pricey!!), and bought what I thought seemed to be the best robot vacuum in August 2014, the 880.Even though my Dyson (which I love) has better suction, better brushes etc to remove dirt and dust from carpets, the roomba 880 is a better vacuum.Ê In fact, I don't think I will ever go back to a human vacuum again.Here is why, end results:Unless we are all into vacuuming, it doesn't matter how good our vacuum is because let's face it, vacuuming is tedious.Ê If I was graded on my vacuuming, I'd get a C-.Ê I race through it.Ê I procrastinate as well so it rarely gets done.The 880 I've scheduled to vacuum every other day (I have 2 cats + allergies to them).Ê It vacuums for 1 hour 15 minutes each of those days.Ê It gets under a lot of furniture that I could never reach.Ê The bin is always full each of those days.Ê My allergies are decreasing!!Procrastination has been addressed, robot does it for you.Tediousness addressed, you just have to empty the bin (kind of fun seeing how much dust you are getting rid of.The quality of dirt you get from this vacuum is awesome.Ê What I mean is you get this fine dust that is picked up by the heppa filter.So.... major TIP!!!Ê When I empty the bin, I get an air canister to blow back the dust from the heppa filter.Ê Of course do this outside.Ê This will really clean the bin and filter will last longer and be ready to trap all that small stuff again that can make you sneeze!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Overpriced piece of garbage, that once it craps out
Review: Overpriced piece of garbage, that once it craps out, you have to wait 4 weeks for the spare part. Keep well away and save your money.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 870 is better deal
Review: Overall I really like this Roomba, however I would have been better off with the 870.Ê The only difference between them is the inclusion of virtual room/lighthouse technology (and the pointless remote...) but I don't think it works that well.Ê I've read the detailed article online about how the lighthouses work and I've tried numerous configurations to get it to work to clean my entire ~1500 sq ft floor.Ê First I divided it into 3 "rooms" but most of the time Roomba decided to dock before visiting all rooms, or it would run out of battery.Ê 2 rooms did not work much better.Ê When I did not use any lighthouses and let it "roam free," it would cover most/all of the floor and return to his dock.Ê It still runs out of battery some of the time looking for the dock or docks early but overall it works better in that configuration.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it - Better than old version
Review: Over the last 12 years we have owned over 5 of the Roomba Sages (Named Robbie, Roberta, Salvage, Robbie II and Robbie III).Ê It was with heavy heart, and lack of available parts that we finally invested in the Roomba 880.Ê We have a large house and usually will have 2 running at the same time on different floors.We are tickled to death.Ê This Roomba is much quieter, and does an even better job than the original Sage(Robbie).Ê Like other reports, we had to empty the dust bin several times during its maiden voyage.Ê Now it gets through about three rooms on a single bin.Ê It does get stuck under a trundle bed.Ê However, this only occurs when it backs into the bed.Ê It appears to wedge itself in (Front is taller than the back), and the only time we see it back up, is if it is trying to get up heavy dirt.The new lighthouse walls are great also.Ê We put one between our master bath/utility room, and our bedroom.Ê It finishes the bath/utility room completely before it moves into the master bathroom.Ê This saves having to run around and moving walls all the time.As a side effect, it keeps your floors uncluttered.Ê You can't run the Roomba unless the floors are uncluttered.Ê Getting tired of people taking off their socks and throwing them on the floor?Ê This may help :)For those that have cats, the 880 not only does a good job at the cat hair, but also will pick up spilled kitty litter.Robbie II has been permanently retired now, and Robbie III does his best to compete, but we will soon putting him out to pasture and purchasing another 880.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Outstanding Performance
Review: Outstanding product.Ê I've been following the development of the Roomba for several years and was concerned that you had to clean the brushes after just about every use if you had pets.Ê This model seems to have solved that problem with the new brush system it has. I have two dogs and two cats and I would recommend the Roomba 880 to anyone with pets.Ê The only thing you have to clean after every use is the bin that collects the dirt in the Roomba, which is a plus I would think.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A great product.
Review: Outstanding product.Ê I was skeptable when i first received it but it has exceeded all my expectations.Ê A great product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love Rosie!
Review: Our Roomba was named Rosie after the helper bot from The Jetsons.Ê I purchased ours direct from iRobot because at the time it wasn't available from Amazon yet.We have 7 kids (some with allergies) and 2 dogs in our house, so it is a very busy place and it can get hard to keep up with the housework no matter how hard my wife works at it.Ê Rosie has been a blessing!Ê We can ask the kids to clear the room, pick up toys, shoes, books...etc and then let her go.We prefer to "prep" the room before she goes, so we haven't messed with the automatic scheduling much.Ê In our dining room, we'll move all of the chairs and stuff to one side and let her go under half the table and open space, then switch it around to ensure she gets to it all.Ê She works great around table legs, over rugs (some are pretty shaggy too!), and stairs.We use the virtual walls all the time, the work very well to keep Rosie in the space we want her to work in.Ê We have only used the lighthouse feature a few times and it seems to work just fine.I love that it doesn't have the brushes like most vacuums use.Ê With 3 daughters, I'd expect to find hair wrapped around the brushes all the time, but the rubber brush-like mechanism doesn't seem to pick up nearly as bad as our old Shark.My one issue is that it doesn't get perfectly into corners, but that is an easy fix when she's done.Rosie helps us get the floor vacuumed more regularly, which was our ultimate goal.Ê 5 minutes of prep, let her go and then move on to something else while she does her thing.Ê The Roomba 880 does a great job of picking up dirt on our floors, which range from Frieze carpet to tile, to hardwood and rugs.Ê It doesn't have the battery life to clean an entire 2000 sqft house without recharge, so if that is your requirement you'll be disappointed.Ê We can have it clean a few of our rooms in a row before having to get her back to her base.This thing is a must for busy families that would rather spend their time on things other than vacuuming.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... yellow lab that sheds year around and lots of fine dust. Good at picking stuff up off of ...
Review: Our iRobot has made a marked improvement with keeping our floors clean since we have a yellow lab that sheds year around and lots of fine dust. Good at picking stuff up off of hard surfaces and low pile carpet, little more tentative on area rugs with more of a nap. Easy to operate. Definitely glad that we made the purchase. Does not completely replace having to bring out regular vac cleaner for a more heavy duty cleaning, which I can do monthly now instead of weekly. Makes me smile!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: One of my favorite things
Review: Our household includes three cats, a large dog, two humans, two turtles, and a bearded dragon.Ê There is a lot of work to be done to keep everyone healthy, happy, and clean.Ê I can't imagine life without Rosie, my Roomba.Ê She isn't perfect but the convenience of getting a decent vacuuming done at a scheduled time EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK makes her few shortcomings easy to overlook.Ê And having that major chore out of the way has really motivated me to keep an even cleaner house than I did B.R. (before Roomba).Because the marketing and other reviews more than adequately cover the pros of owning a Roomba, I'm only going to hit on a few of the cons in this review.Ê Please keep in mind that, overall, the pros far outweigh the cons for me.Ê This isn't meant to be a negative review at all.Ê I just think it's important to know what sort of caveats to expect if you're considering joining the Roomba owner's club.*Getting Trapped Under Things:Ê I have a low couch that Roomba has just enough clearance to get under.Ê There is a spot where the slight sag sometimes traps Roomba.Ê The solution is to wedge something under that spot to prevent Roomba from getting there or to find a way to raise similar furniture (Amazon sells taller replacement couch feet, for instance).*Avoidance Of Black Floors:Ê I had a large rug with black patterns on it.Ê Roomba's infrared edge sensors can't differentiate between cliffs and black floors so it would go unvacuumed.Ê I modded my Roomba so that it was blind to edges.Ê It wasn't difficult but it isn't something I'd recommend for most people.Ê I wasn't that dedicated to the rug so now it is rolled up in storage and I've reversed the modifications.*Inability To Navigate Out Of Tight Spots:Ê On the wide side of my dining room table's barstools, the legs are just far enough for Roomba to get in between them and get stuck.Ê As soon as it bumps into a leg, it starts turning and testing different directions.Ê Unfortunately, it never quite lines up with the path it took to get under the stool and eventually runs in circles until the battery dies.Ê My solution has been to turn the barstools 90 degrees so the narrow ends point out and Roomba never gets under them.Ê Of course, that looks a little funny and it means no vacuuming gets done under the table.Ê Similarly, Roomba would sometimes push my bathroom trashcan back and then get trapped between the wall and the side of the toilet.Ê I now keep a little gravel in the bottom of the trashcan to prevent Roomba from being able to scoot it back.There you have it.Ê I love my Roomba.Ê I am constantly amazed at the type and quantity of stuff that gets picked up every day.Ê Maintenance is fairly straight forward and not overly costly.Ê As soon as iRobot can make a more automated, schedulable mopping robot, I'm in.Ê And I'm especially looking forward to the invention of a dusting robot.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Picks up dust and dog hair even after I vacuum
Review: Our house is frequently vacuumed with a Dyson animal vacuum. It was still difficult to keep up with two labs who seems to shed year round. The roomba 880 was a perfect solution to our problem. Set to run every day and sometimes twice a day, "Benson" as we named it collects dust and dog hair from under the furniture that is often missed in a normal vacuuming cycle. The bin is small and I find myself emptying it two or three times on a normal cycle which is somewhat of an inconvenience but then I'm still amazed with what it's collected each time. It's not a complete replacement for regular vacuuming but it definitely cuts down on the need to do it as frequently. We have also figured out two two pieces of furniture it gets stuck trying to go under and the one small bathroom that can trap it if it swings the door shut. Otherwise, I'm a huge fan!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Simply amazing
Review: Our home is almost fully carpeted (except for kitchen and bathrooms). My fear was that Roomba will not work that great on carpets. But looks like Roomba 880's claim of 50% more dirt extraction is accurate. This is our first Roomba so I can't compare with previous versions but overall I am impressed. It helps to Roomba proof your home but Roomba doesn't get stuck on cables and wires etc. It might knock off things like flower vase if it is not stable or not heavy enough. Roomba 880 cleans well and covers the area well (it may look random but it covers the room including edges quite well). Another benefit is that it can go under beds and sofas etc. It does make some noise but I am fine with that as I run it in the room where no one is there or schedule it when no one is at home. Now can Roomba replace my Dyson upright? I think it can for the most part. I like the feeling when I ask Roomba to do the cleaning and I read a book. Cleaning debris bin is a chore but once you start using Roomba daily or almost daily you won't have to do that that often. Cleaning debris bin releases some dust in the air so that is a problem just like other vacuums. Roomba 880 is pricey but there is a mother's day 15% discount going on currently so may not be a bad deal. Ongoing expenses for parts like HEPA filter etc. is not that bad from what I can tell (there are 3rd party non-iRobot parts available too). I got 880 as it is the latest model that allows you to direct Roomba to more than one room.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great Machine for Floor cleaning
Review: Our "George" was fabulous, the first time on the floor. Great machine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: this machine is amazing and has changed my life
Review: Other than getting hung up occasionally on a threshold, this machine is amazing and has changed my life. I have two dogs and a large cat that shed leaving fluff in all corners and edges of the walls. No more!! Very, very happy customer.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: great in principle. lacking execution.
Review: Originally the 770 but found that the brushes and dog hair don't work well together.Ê as noted in others feedback, this was quite challenging to clean.Ê In principle really helpful but not so if you have to keep cleaning.Ê Sooo, returned to amazon and bought the 880.Ê The 880 is much better. they use rubber rollers instead of brushes.Ê This seems to clean better but also seems to pull up carpet fabric.Ê not sure.trash bin gets filled up faster, and we could not get the sensor to go off.Ê so even when empty it reported full.Ê Then the wheels began squeeking. since it is a closed system, there is nothing to lubircate.Ê irobot suggested we return. which we did. now upgraded to the 980. who's the fool here. hopefully that will work. so far not sure. its a bit noisier.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: While my rugs are nice and have pads below
Review: Only buy if you have fully carpeted floors or wood/tile WITHOUT area rugs.Ê It would NOT transition from hardwood floor to an area rug, making it absolutely ineffective in my home.Ê While my rugs are nice and have pads below, they are not high shags or thick such that I would have expected the Roomba to treat the rug like a wall.Ê For the price, it's inability to handle area rugs on hard floors was extremely disappointing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: One of the best investments ever
Review: One of the best investments ever.Ê I have all tile floors.Ê The Roomba runs every day and always picks up cat hair that I have missed.Ê We live in the desert so there is always dust everywhere...but this cleans like a pro!Ê I haven't had any problems in the 2 months that I have had it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not as good as I was hoping...
Review: On bare floors, this little baby works great. But it bogs down on some shag carpet that is not very thick at all. Disappointing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A Dog Lover's Best Friend!
Review: OMGoodness!!!! I am extremely impressed.Ê Let me lay the background.... We have a new construction home with a great deal of sand in the yard, as landscaping is coming along slowly and we have 2 pugs who shed an extreme amount of fur on an hourly basis while also bringing in sand since I haven't successfully trained them to wipe their feet upon entering the house.I charged the unit as soon as I received it and scheduled it to begin vacuuming early the next morning before I headed to work so that I could watch it and see if there were any problems that I needed to solve.Ê 'Rosie' has worked everyday for the past 2 weeks and I am extremely impressed.Ê The sand, fur and dust is collected each day while we work.Ê When I arrive home, I can go barefooted immediately.Ê It has only lost it's dock once, but that is acceptable.Ê She's a bit louder than I anticipated, but I rarely have her working while I'm home, so it's no big deal for me.Ê I can't say enough good things about 'Rosie'

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Expensive, but marvelous fun and a REALLY good product!!!
Review: OMG.... I love this, I love this, I love this! For me, I actually had a "medical" need for this. Severe back problems have made it difficult, if not impossible, for me to vacuum, and I really, really, really hate dirty floors! This does such a good job...I have an open plan house with hardwood floors and lots of throw rugs. I pick up light objects from the floor and get this going and it just cleans my house. Has no problems going from hard floor to throw rug and back to floor. There are some tight corners it can't reach, but a conventional vacuum cleaner would also be unable to get in to clean those spots, so I just take my swiffer or a broom and catch whatever in in those small areas.It's really fun to watch it when it detects a "dirtier" spot and goes into "focus" mode where it cleans that spot repeatedly until it has cleaned all the dirt.And the "fun factor" of this is absolutely priceless! Sometimes I throw dirt down on the floor just to watch it do its thing! I was hesitant to spend the money on it, but I'm really happy I did. The added features of this high-end model really come through with it doing a quality cleaning job.One note: I'm still trying to find the best location for the docking station, as it seems to have trouble finding it if it in not clearly in the line of vision, so sometimes I have to pick it up and put it right in front of the docking station. This is noted, somewhat, in the manual. Also, the manual is not the best-written, and provides some misleading or confusing information, but the iRobot folks know this and are working on improving the documentation.Nevertheless, I still love this device!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: roomba 880
Review: OMG I love my roomba.Ê Unfortunately, my other roomba died a horrible death thanks to running over my doggy papers if you know what I mean.Ê Now, I put one of those foam tubes along the door just in case, however what is nice, is the towers that come with this roomba that turn on automatically when roomba is on.Ê I think it sometimes picks up better than my rainbow vaccume cleaner!Ê I have 6 animals in the house and keep it running all the time.Ê Gets in places my vaccume can't!Ê Cons are the price.........however I am a firm believer that you get what you pay for.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: OMG FANTASTIC. This vacuum works better than I expected
Review: OMG FANTASTIC.Ê This vacuum works better than I expected.Ê I had the first Roomba and was disappointed with it, it would get stuck on everything.Ê This one never gets stuck.Ê I would buy another one if anything happen to it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love Lazlo!
Review: Okay, so I have only had Lazlo for a week, but he is great! Lightweight, portable, easy to clean, and very very smart! Be prepared to babysit initially. You need to see where there may be potential problems, as he will nose around a tight space to push his boundaries-- bad boy Lazlo! For instance, I had to block off a side table with books to keep him out of a too tight spot. Once you know how to best prep the room, you can then leave and let the little thug get on with it.A nice tip: I used the ubiquitous laundry pegs to peg up my dust ruffle, so he could nose around under the bed to his heart's delight. He really likes it under there! I love the fact that he knows not to dice with death at the stairs. He just huffily turns around and gets on with business--good boy Lazlo! I have to take some lessons in obedience training, as I cannot quite get the responses that I am looking for when using the remote control. Am I thick or is Lazlo just downright disobedient! I have not used the virtual wall/ lighthouse yet. I prefer, as another reviewer suggested, merely closing the doors!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I've purchased this after reading all the reviews and wanted to have the best and newest products that will last for years
Review: OK, so, after having Refurbished Neato XV-21 and new one, I've decided it's time to get something that will actually move in the house and will not get stuck in the middle of nowhere and say error till the battery is drained.I have a puppy and he sheds and I wanted something to clean after him without babysitting it.I've purchased this after reading all the reviews and wanted to have the best and newest products that will last for years. After the first time I have to say that I was imppressed. the battery lasted for the whole apartment (big apartment with wooden floors and kicthen with tile, one bedroom.It finished and went back fully loaded to the dock. BUT the only problem is that I have 3 carpets in the living room and bedroom which are 40% of the atp's space and the nice vacuum cleaner doesn't go on them.My carpets are not that high and not dark colored so there where no reason for the robot no to climb and clean. When I called the customer service they told me that if I need robot for my carpets I better return this one and get no IROBOT. great customer support, at least they're honest.At the end I've decided to return this, buy the newer cheaper version 870 and surprice, it climbs on 2 of the 3 carpets and clean them with no problem. So the only different between the 880 and the 870 is the stupid remote control.So, anyway, if you need a good robot I would recommend to go with the Irobot roomba 870.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: BEWARE DARK COLORS!
Review: Ok, I've only had this bot for one day and it has gotten "stuck" on my partially dark colored area rug a dozen times.Ê I called customer service and their "solution" was for me to block off the rug area.......ummmm that's why I bought a vacuum in the first place!Ê When I said this isn't a solution, they promptly told me "they don't do well on dark colored surfaces".Ê Needless to say, this piece of crap is going back.Ê Just so everyone knows, the rug only has maybe 20% of it's surface that is dark colored, the rest is lighter colors, but the bot continues to get stuck with an error 6 message.Ê If you have any dark colored areas on your flooring, I would NOT buy this bot......

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We want to love you but you are too sensitive!
Review: Ok so I want to love this robot so much because it does suck up dog hair, dirt and dust particles really well. However, it's very sensitive. We are constantly jiggering with it to deal with error messages, wiping down the sensors that are already scratched, bumping the edges so stuff comes out if it's stuck, etc. Latest error message we couldn't fix ourselves. The Left wheel is not rotating so the roomba keeps going in a circle - it looks like the treads are worn out already on the left-hand side so thus getting stuck:( We have reached out to customer care so hopefully they help us fix the issues so we didn't spend $100/mth on this vacuum. Can you please last for at least another 6 months???!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Doesn't stop when it's full!
Review: OK returning this because1) It doesn't stop when it's full, and actually starts dumping debri everywhere once it's full.Ê I would come home and find piles of dirt all over the house.Ê Nice that it has a cannister full light, but this light is only useful if you keep checking on it.Ê Why doesn't the machine stop once the light comes on???Ê Talked to tech support and they confirmed there is no way for it to auto stop once it's full of dirt.Ê DEAL BREAKER for us.2) LOUD!Ê You pretty much have to run this when you're not home.Ê It's annoyingly loud3) Gets stuck under tables, beds, etc4) cleans randomly, doesn't seem to have any set pattern or to go over spots it hasn't covered

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 1 Sweeping the floor 0
Review: Ok its expensive but after a month of use I will not live without a Roomba and Im thinking of the Scooba 450. The Roomba is programed to go everyday at 8AM, when I come home I empty the trash bin to find so much dust balls and cat fur, kinda cool. My floors are hardwood and tile with 3 throw rugs at the entrances and for the dog/cat in a corner. Now the daily maintenance of making sure there are no grandkids toys or clothes (ok my socks) thrown about and emptying the trash bin is really the only thing I need to do, other then that the floors are cleaned almost everyday and after a few months I think it pays for itself. Now is it perfect NO, does it miss certain areas like kitty cornered furniture or areas around the lighthouses or underneath the dinning room table with the chairs all tucked in, YES...Still 80-90% of the floor is cleaned EVERYDAY without human interaction. I highly recommend it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Four Stars
Review: ok

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wow! This thing is awesome...
Review: Oh my goodness, what can I say to do this justice?Ê I purchased my Roomba because I have major back problems and have a difficult time taking care of my floors.Ê I am a stickler about my vacuum cleaners and how they should work.Ê I have bought every kind on the market and spent a lot of money over the years in doing so.Ê I have cats and dogs and teenagers, so needless to say my floors are always high traffic areas.Ê This was so easy to set up out of the box and works so well even I was surprised.Ê I was very impressed with how much it picked up in the short time I had it run just for my entertainment to begin with.Ê I will say that this is one of the best purchases I have made and am so glad I invested in it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Oh my god this is the best thing in the entire world in my house I ...
Review: Oh my god this is the best thing in the entire world in my house I have a white tile floor in the kitchen and was sick of constantly cleaning up tea leaves.if you can afford one of these get it you the only thing is you must have a very picked up house of clothes shoes and items and have more of a big area not good with children because of their toys I do a doggy B&B in my home and a few of the dogs that I have that stay here for weeks on end shed and it picks up the dog here every day which is wonderfulI think any level of this product is wonderful it doesn't totally do a great job it does 95% of the house it has gotten stuck a few times but it's understandable with not knowing or what's on the floor it's sometimes get stuck in front of the fridge raider which is very rare but it actually gets stuck

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Holy Cow, my house is much dirtier than I thought it was; you gotta buy one of these cool machines!
Review: Oh Happy Day, my robot vacuum is simply stunning! Went online to Bed Bath and Beyond to get the 20% Off Coupon in exchange for my email address, then I ran down to the store and got a $140 discount off of the $700 price, so my 880 cost me $560, Yayyy!!! I disregarded the instructions to charge the battery for 24 hours before use and sicked it on the master bedroom to try it out as soon as I got it home. I set up the lighthouse to trap the vacuum in that one room, turned it on and watched it do its thing. I had to empty the tray 2 times and I ran it until I drained the battery all the way. So I am super impressed with the cleaning power of this little thing while being very grossed out at how much dirt/cat fur was trapped in my carpet, UGGHH! This vacuum has major sucking power and I plan to run it through the whole home until All of the dust and the fur from my 3 cats is history. I chose the 880 over the 870 because:A. I wanted the remote control.B. I wanted the 2 lighthouse/virtual wall units.C I could afford it by using the cool 20% off coupon.Now granted, I have only had this for a day, so for all I know it will spontaneously combust tomorrow, but for now, I am choosing to believe that I have found the solution to my cat fur problem and my desire to not vacuum all the time. Frickin robot cleaning rules, at least until Skynet becomes self aware and tries to whack us all...I will post more info as I work this thing hard every day for quite some time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Three Stars
Review: Not the best on bare floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not perfect but since its programed to run same time everyday ...
Review: Not perfect but since its programed to run same time everyday it does the job well overall. I just have to remember to empty it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It helps but not perfect.
Review: Not perfect but helps a lot.Will I buy it again? Maybe I will try another one with room mapping function instead. This one just keep crossing the room all over like a stupid robot but as I said, it helps.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Max (NOT Enough) Headroom
Review: Not our 1st iRobot-- it's the best cleaning iRobot yet--EXCEPT that it's TALLER than the old version--and will NOT fit under MANY pieces of furniture or will jam itself into locations without the adequate headroom causing you to execute an annoying search and find mission to extricate it. We liked the fact that our old iRobot fit easily under our furniture to get all of the dust bunnies that our "normal" vacuum couldn't get.Ê iRobot customer service suggests placing coasters under your furniture to lift it up to the height where the iRobot will be able to get under the furniture to clean without getting stuck. I should NOT have to alter my entire environment so that the $700.00 iRobot will work effectively and I have never thought of "furniture coasters" as a wonderful design statement in my decor. VERY disappointing. We should have named our iRobot: "Max NOT enough headroom".Ê What were the engineers thinking?Ê Did they even test it in a "normal" household with normal furniture? Since my iRobot WON'T fit under my furniture, I could have just used my usual vacuum cleaner and SAVED $700.00.Ê If iRobot expects you to alter the height of your furniture to allow it to work, it should INCLUDE furniture coasters for that purpose in the $700.00 price.FYI- One plus about pets and the iRobot: Our nervous little dog is not as intimidated by the iRobot as she is with our usual vacuum cleaner.Ê And the iRobot does a great job dog picking up (short) dog hair---but the collection bin should be emptied every time the iRobot is run to be most effective.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but does a better job than manual vacuuming
Review: Not only saves time and effort, but does a better job than manual vacuuming.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Machine does its job pretty well. We have dogs and cats
Review: No problems with ordering or getting it. Pleasant experience. Machine does its job pretty well. We have dogs and cats. Saves the day to day sweeping and vacuuming. Does not replace the need to do an occasional good job of sweeping or mopping or vacuuming. We would recommend this as a time saver. Dogs aren't real fans.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it. Use it many times a week
Review: No need to give lots of details (good reviews already available).Ê Love it. Use it many times a week. Our floors stay cleaner than before, time for housekeeping is reduced quite a bit, and we're all around very pleased.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cleans entire home.
Review: No need for my old upright. Roomba cleans my entire home like a pro. I have 2000 sq. feet of hardwood floors that have never been so clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Four Stars
Review: No issues

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good job at my house
Review: Nice.Ê A little pricey

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wonderful Customer Service, WOW
Review: Nice, quality product.Ê Had to return the unit because of a defective wheel problem, but my interaction with the company was so perfect and accommodating that I have to say "Thanks for the wonderful service!"Ê WONDERFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very good
Review: Nice and good vacuum I have ever usedÊ . I want this each levels on my home!My children like moving this,and roomba take my children always.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Nice

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It doesn't take too long to discover the traps that will disable Roomba - he once locked himself in the bathroom and on another
Review: My wife was deeply skeptical when I bought the Roomba, for a lot of reasons.Ê He's pricey, and we have two dogs that shed constantly.Ê But, now she's a convert.Ê We set him up to run every night after we go to bed and are suitably horrified when we find out how much hair and dirt he picks up.Ê Every day.Ê It doesn't take too long to discover the traps that will disable Roomba - he once locked himself in the bathroom and on another occasion sucked up a device cord.Ê As you can see, we have already anthropomorphized him.Ê He's not R2D2, but for the 21'st century, he'll have to do.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This does the job - and motivates us as well!
Review: My wife wanted this product, and hey, it's a robot so, cool!Ê That being said, it also makes us think about picking up the floor more often so that 'Rosie' doesn't vacuum up things it shouldn't.Ê Easy to clean (take it apart and clean it up weekly...you will be happier if you do) and doe s a great job.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fabulous
Review: My wife loves it, our floors have never been this clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wow
Review: My wife is a clean freak. She loves it. Enough said. Don't plan on saving any time the first month as you sit there and watch it. Picks up very well and goes under almost everything so overall dust in the home is really reduced.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: My wife and I love this thing

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: truely amazed
Review: My wife and I have discussed getting a Roomba for several years.Ê We finally took the plunge, ordering the 880.Ê We have been using it for two weeks every day and both of us are extremely pleased.Ê We have a high end German vacuum that does a great job, but you still have to spend several hours per week pushing it around.Ê I doubt the Roomba will do as good a job as the high end German vacuum, but [always a but] our floors are cleaner than they have ever been.Ê We run the RoombaÊ 2-4 hours per day and our floors are squeaky clean [they are all tile and hardwood, with some throw rugs].Ê What makes the Roomba worthwhile is the ease of use.Ê Charge it and turn it loose.Ê Some reviewers have complained about the noise level...neither of us are bothered or even distracted by the noise.The only downside is the price and the instruction manual could use a little upgrading.Ê Had to view a few U-Tubes to find out how to really use the "lighthouse".Ê We have ordered two more lighthouses and some Hepa filters.Ê If you can justify the price, buy it.Ê You will be very pleased and your floors will be cleaner than they have ever been and you will have some extra time to do things you enjoy.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Easiest to use vacuum ever!
Review: My wife and I are both impressed by how much this vacuum picks up every day. It does an excellent job vacuuming and is of course so easy to use - just press the button! I highly recommend this Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Super Time Saver
Review: My third robot vacuum and they finally got it right.Ê Very few issues such as getting stuck, stopping and needing adjustments. My other two were needy and didn't do a good job. We have nine dogs and have gone from vacuuming daily to once a week to get crevices behind furniture. We have all ceramic tile so don't know how it performs on carpet.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I liked my first one (560 series) but it had some ...
Review: My second Roomba. I liked my first one (560 series) but it had some issues. This one is great. Bigger waste bin and better dust filter, better battery life and cleaning pattern. They got a lot right with this one.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Prepare to replace filter often if you have pets...Buy replacements as soon as you order the roomba.
Review: My second roomba, and I love it, except...I have multiple pets and the hepa filter needs to be replaced frequently, probably once a week. I have tried shaking out the filter, gently tapping it against the garbage can sides to dislodge the stuff in the filter. It didn't work the first time, and I had to change the filter (after 2 days of use). The second time was the same week. I tapped it, and was able to dislodge enough gunk to get the red warning light to go off okay. I have ordered a lot of replacement filters.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My Roomba is dead, that's why I am writing ...
Review: My Roomba is dead, that's why I am writing this review. The cause of death is unknown since it is not responding at all. No blinking light nor response no matter how many time i hit the start button... Roomba lived in my hardwood floor flat for 14 months. I don't have a pet or kid so it is basically pick up dust and my wife's hair. Although I had it program to work at least 6 times a week, I still think it was pricy for its life span. This sucker costed me about $800 including extra roller set, extra filter set, and shipping when I purchased it.Ê $800/14 months is $57 a month!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: WOW!
Review: My Roomba 880 has been used for nearly 3 weeks now. I have it on a schedule to clean everyday at 11:00am. My floors are hardwood and tile and the 880 seems to be the perfect fit. I have 4 rescued cats and that is a job in itself for my wife and I to keep clean. This robot has takes 95% of that work off of us. The large bin holds a lot! I didn't know we missed so much on the floors until I bought this! The floors actually shine somewhat more now with the robot. Highly recommend it even if you do not have pets.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: easy operation, and easy to clean
Review: My review:I bought my Roomba 880 in May 2014. My job has an odd schedule, which requires me to work very long hours in June, so I got the Roomba (who I've named Rex) so I wouldn't come home exhausted and have dirty floors on top of it. I keep cords off the floor or tuck them away because tangling can happen and I have "Rex" scheduled to clean when I'm at work and not there to rescue him. I am really impressed that he keeps my hardwood floors free of dust. They gleam.Ê I've run him every day since I got him and when I use my Hoover Floormate to wash the hard floors, the water it sucks up is so much cleaner than it used to be!Ê He does a great job on carpets too and brushes up the pile nicely on the cut loop style carpet.Ê I have long hair that always is so difficult to clean from the brushes of upright cleaners, but it's so easy with Rex!Ê I just pop out the easy-to-remove rubber rollers once a week and take out the hair that collects at the hollow spots where the connector pins, that hold the rollers in the machine, are located.Ê Rex is simpler to use and maintain than any other vacuum, even top-performing commercial kinds like Simplicity and Rainbow. My floors have never been cleaner AND he does the work for me! The commercial vacuums are the same price or more and they don't do the work for you,Ê so they will never keep your house as clean as the programmable Roomba. I always come home to clean floors.Ê It's a wonderful feeling. I've been so satisfied with my Roomba that I bought one as a Christmas present for my Mom (who is 59) and my Dad (who is 72) so they won't have to use their heavy Simplicity and wrench their backs. They love how their Roomba gets under the bed and they don't have to bend down.My Mom's review: cleans very well, easy operation, and easy to clean,Ê only problem is when cleaning the L.L. Bean waterhog mat, it is too nubby of a texture to pick up the dirt between the large nubs on the rug. But even uprights can have trouble vacuuming waterhogs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Give one a try and you will fall in love with the results
Review: My place has not been cleaner. Mixture of dark laminate floors, light color tiles, and floor mats, no problem. It's cleans randomly but thorough. No more dust bunnies! It gets under and around furniture without a problem.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!
Review: My only reqret about this cleaner is that I waited so long before purchasing one. Well worth my money I have a golden that lives In the house. I was sweeping twice a day. This thing does the floor and I do something else. Love it!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: If Only It Did Dusting Too
