Review: My local Roomba distributor is hopeless, selling models long obsolete in the USA.Ê I imported this model to take care of polished solid-timber floors which I had nightmares about vacuuming every day for dust.Ê It has a switching power supply, so no problems with the local voltage.Ê Owned for a few weeks, and so far excellent.Ê My floors are clean and I don't have to think about damp-mopping more than once a fortnight.Ê I don't own any pets though.Ê My place is a bit of a maze, but it always finds its way home.Has a tendency to close doors and die behind them in small rooms, making it tricky to rescue.Power boards and masses of cables on the floor can be a problem.Ê You'll want to find a way to minimise these just like you would for a manual vacuum.These devices are not good for cleaning brand new carpet.Ê The pilling will fill the bin within seconds.Ê You'll need to manually vacuum these for months first.The bin is small, and could be easier to detach.Ê Capacity isn't really a problem in my case.These are all minor quibbles for what is a fantastic time-saving appliance.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best Mother's Day gift ever!
Review: My husband game me the iRobot for Mother's Day, and this is the best present I've received in years.Ê He programmed my iRobot to vacuum in the early morning.Ê I wake up to clean floors!Ê It has no problem going from hard wood surface to carpet.Ê When it's done or when the charge is low, the vacuum returns to its docking station and recharges.Ê It is simple to empty the dust bin (a red light comes on to indicate when it's full).Ê I can press a button to spot clean an area.Ê In addition, my iRobot goes under the bed and gets the whole area vacuumed.Ê It has a little brush that extends out and rotates, so is able to clean up against walls and corners.Ê It slows down when approaching a wall or piece of furniture, and I am impressed with how it can clean around furniture legs and redirect itself.Ê This is a great product!Ê I am planning to purchase one for my parents.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Total Roomba Girl!!!!
Review: My husband bought me the 780 for Christmas after much protest from me that I did not want one, I would not like it. Well I love it and it is my bff. I loved it so much we just purchased a 880 for the downstairs to replace this one and moved it upstairs so I guess you could say she (780) got a promotion. Then a good deal came up and I got the 450 Scooba.Seriously whoever you are if you clean your home you need at least one of these wonderful machines. I would fight anyone that would try to take mine from me. I have no idea how I lived without it for so long.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing cleaning robot
Review: My house feels so much cleaner! Amazing how much dust this thing finds even with daily use and even when we thought everyhing was clean!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Robots!!!
Review: My girlfriend is a neat freak, so I thought I'd lessen the load of vacuuming by getting the Roomba. This thing is amazing, and the fact that it self-docks, makes life much easier! We have a portable Dyson that we use to vacuum out the bin and the filter when it's full. The Dyson is a bit easier to empty than the Roomba, and it makes emptying the bin much cleaner and quicker. In tandem, the Roomba and the Dyson keep our hardwood floors and rugs nice and clean.Make sure your rugs are tacked down to the floor if they have a tendency to curl, or the Roomba will either bump them and treat them like an obstacle, or it will move them into large bunches all over the floor. The 880 moves from hardwood to rug without any problems otherwise.The scheduling feature is awesome, and we schedule the Roomba to clean everyday. It takes care of our dog's hair and never has a tangle issue. The maintenance is quick and easy, so as long as you into a pattern, this thing will make your floor cleaning life much easier.Note: Get used to the quirks of your furniture setup, so you can prevent the little bugger from getting stuck under chairs and couches. Once you make small adjustments, you'll notice cleaner floors all around.It's been about a week since we've gotten this robot, and although the company claims that the 880 is not a replacement for your upright vacuum, I can say confidently that we haven't used the upright at all. We'll see if that still rings true a month from now.This guy cleans about 1000 square feet, between multiple rooms every day. I like the fact that it still cleans as it heads to dock, and it still has plenty of battery power left over.If you have multiple rooms, you should consider investing in one, or two more lighthouses.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: My favorite appliance

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: we love it
Review: My dog loves this little guy as much as I do, hehe. Works great and is fun to watch.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I like to wear my shoes indoors
Review: My dog likes to shed. I like to wear my shoes indoors. My wife likes to drop stuff. Overall, we all create quite a bit of mess. This Roomba catches a lot of the trash we leave behind. It easily navigates the carpeted and hard-wood areas of the house and pulls up much of the debris that plagued us in our previous living areas. Keeping the house clean has become significantly easier since I bought this little guy, now I have much less demand to vacuum the house to clean up after the dog and myself.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works flawlessly
Review: My dad has bad cat allergies, but now lives in a house with two cats. (Long story) He hasn't had a problem since we bought this. We just turn it on every night, (on wood floor downstairs) and in the morning it always has a full storage bin of cat hair. This amazed me, since in the day I don't notice a single hair. We never need to vacuum downstairs anymore, and my dad never has allergy problems anymore. It always returns to its charging station by morning, except 3 or 4 times in the entire year we've owned it. Those three or four times were completly our fault, and we found a half eaten charging cord next to the vacuum the following day. A must have for any household with pets!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My allergic reactions to dust and pet hair/dander are much ...
Review: My allergic reactions to dust and pet hair/dander are much lower now that I can have something else vacuum every day. My cats are entertained by it as well. It seems to actually clean some surfaces more thoroughly than my Dyson upright (with the correct attachments).Plus, litter box scatter is no longer a problem. Roomba roams the basement floor...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Dear iRobot, PLEASE add a child lock...
Review: My 1.5yr old changed the scheduled cleaning time for the third time. Last night the roomba woke everyone up at 2am when it started diligently cleaning the downstairs. I'm really surprised the roomba doesn't have a child lock. Even my washer and dryer have child locks. If you are a parent and your children are obsessed with "bot bot", I'm sure you would appreciate this. Otherwise, it works fairly well. It usually misses a couple spots, but still better than cleaning the floors ourselves.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Want a 2nd one for upstairs
Review: Much quieter than earlier models. Does not get hung up easily. Vacuum your carpet with your full size vacuum and then run the 880 over the same area and see the additional dirt it picks up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best one yet.
Review: Much improvement of the three we already own. I wanted one that programs so I didn't ned to screw if it. just check the bin every now and then.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: much improved over prior generation roomba

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Most amazing vacuum ever
Review: Most amazing vacuum ever.Ê Cleans up all the crumbs and dirt.Ê My very long hairÊ does not get tangled in the brushes.Ê The kids love the robot voice and get super excited to turn it on and watch it go. Anything that encourages the kids to clean :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: More than expected amazing product

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Close but no cigar.Ê Good for a smaller single-level abode for the price.
Review: Mixed feelings here.Ê The unit does work like a champ, with a mind of its' own, but, for our home, with wooden floors, it would require the acquisition of a number of not-inexpensive buffer stations in order to guide it to and from the areas which require vacuuming.Ê Too bad.Ê I really liked the unit, but, for the cost of the overall system, I can use the exercise pushing the old vac.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Tears of Joy.
Review: Mine was purchased off ebay at a much better price. My dog sheds a lot and I recently acquired a kitten and between the two, I used to wake up and start my morning by swiffer-ing the hardwood floor and scooping cat litter. I programmed this roomba to work at 5AM daily and now I wake up to CLEAN floor. Honestly I can't get over how it does much better job than I. After all, roomba does clean for about an hour, its little brush thing gets the corners real well. Considering I was considering getting cleaning service more frequently, this is worth every penny of it.Now on the new kitten and Roomba. Kitten, [James] has completed day 3 of training riding sessions. He's not afraid of it, but he hasn't gotten the hang of staying on it. He does follow it around, I see a lot of potential with this young one. I figured get him started early.This morning, I caught myself talking to it softly while sipping coffee. Roomba and Litter Robot, I feel they have added years to my life.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Might be the best piece of consumer electronics I've ever purchased
Review: Might be the best piece of consumer electronics I've ever purchased.I live in a house with two large dogs and hardwood floors.Ê After a day there is usually a decent amount of hair all over and the detectible "pet scent" from their hair and dander on the floor -- Not anymore!!Ê The 880 runs every morning and i'm amazed by the amount of stuff that it picks up.Ê I couldn't recommend this more to anyone who hates to vacuum!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wish I had bought it sooner!!!
Review: Meet Rosey, named for the Jetson's housekeeping robot.Ê She is wonderful!Ê I have an Alaskan Malamute with hardwood floors and large area rugs.Ê Rosey vacuums every morning and my floors are cleaner than ever.Ê My great room is 23' x 44' and I divide it with the 'lighthouse' into two areas for maximum efficient coverage.Ê Some days I put the dining room chairs up on the table and some days not.Ê Rosey knows to vacuum thoroughly either way.Ê Some days I have her cross another lighthouse into the entry and the bedroom hallways and some days I keep it as a 'wall' and not do the entry.Ê She just knows what I want and does it.Ê Because I have the dog and carpets I have to empty the dust bin at least once during her cleaning session.Ê And because I have a long furred Malamute, sometimes Rosey leaves little clumps of fur here and there for me to pick up after she is done.Ê This is much easier to pick up than lots of flying dust bunnies on a daily basis.Ê I bought the 880 model because it did not have brushes that would tangle with fur.Ê Quite seriously I am amazed and disturbed at how much dirt is picked up on a daily basis.Ê We are empty nesters with two or three days a week visits from my son's family of three (1yr old).Ê The dirt is a sorry example of how much comes in despite our best efforts.Ê My daughter-in-law comments on how clean the floors always look now.Ê I love Rosey!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Weak performance, poor durability. I would not purchase again.
Review: Many other reviewers suggest waiting several weeks to write a review after using the product and I agree with this suggestion. After operating the machine in various areas of my 3,000 ft2 home over a four month period I have made the following observations ("+" = Positive & "-" =Ê Negative):- The motor that drives the Debris Extractors became weak over time and finally failed... I take some responsibility for this because I have an area rug (~ 8' X 10') that is "shag" and this relatively small rug in my home may have contributed to the demise of the motor - I could hear the 880 laboring as it worked on the rug+ Unlike others, by experience with customer service was excellent! I explained my situation, including the info above, to the customer service rep on the phone, she asked several questions to confirm the situation, then after 2 minutes on hold (I assume to get authorization from a superior) she offered to replace the cleaning head module free of charge under warranty and indicated it would arrive in ~ 2 weeks- I have a cat and over time the 880 became less efficient at picking up the cat fur - it would just roll the fur up into little rolls on the carpet and move them around the floor. I thought this was an indication that the filter needed to be replaced, but after installing a new filter pickup was no better+ When the extractors were working the 880 was very efficient picking up small amounts of litter the cat tracks out of the litter box onto the hardwood floor- I have another area rug with a 5" black boarder and as described by many others the cliff sensors are unable to differentiate between the dark boarder and a cliff so the 880 is ineffective around this rug+ The virtual walls are very helpful for containing the 880 in specific areas so cleaning can be done one section at a time - the 880 is unable to manage more than a couple of rooms in one cleaning session due to the complex geometry of multiple rooms so it has to be broken down into segments to be effective, not to mention the battery only lasts ~1.5 - 2 hrs- This machine does not bring me $700 worth of value based on its poor durability, inability to manage area rugs, & poor fur pick-up on carpet. This amount of money pays for 3 months of my home cleaning service (every other week) and this service does A LOT more than vacuuming of my floorsIn conclusion, the concept is great and I think this is a very good application for a "robot", but based on my experience I would not purchase the Roomba 880 again. If it were not for the good help I received from Customer Service I would have to give this $700 machine that lasted only 4 months a single star... I can't afford that kind of expense!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Machine is awesome and cleans perfectly
Review: Machine is awesome and cleans perfectly. Compared to some cheap chinese robot I had before it doesn't get stuck on cables nor scratches the floor. Me and my wife love it and our cats love it too :-)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!
Review: Loving our Roomba 880 vacuum robot.Ê We have 2 Labradors, 1 St. Bernard, 1 Pug and 2 cats and are very happy with how it is cleaning.Ê We have laminate floors with big rugs.Ê I have to say the Roomba doesn't do a very good job of picking up the dog hair on the rugs, but I am still giving this 5 stars because of the job it does on our bedroom carpets and laminate floors.Ê We run the Roomba once every day, and every day we are cleaning out the trash can on the Roomba at least 2-3 times per cleaning.Ê The vacuum is completely full each time which tells me the vacuum is most definitely doing its job!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Top of the Line!
Review: Loved the programmable roomba! I have 2 long haired dogs, that I have to clean the hardwood floor at least twice a week. I never could get the remote control to work. I returned the Roomba after 2 weeks because it died! Kept saying it had something in the left wheel, and stopped working.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Loved my Roomba
Review: Loved my Roomba.Ê Named her Rozie.Ê She just never learned a good pattern and stayed stuck under my Tables, Cabinets and Furniture.Ê She worked perfect if I didn't have so much furniture that was just the wrong height for her to get stuck under.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Loved it at first but only works well on wood ...
Review: Loved it at first but only works well on wood floors. Works on carpet but you have to empty it fairly oftenÊ if you have shaggy rugs. Does work very well on wood and title. Over all like it i dont have to run the big sweeper as much.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, love
Review: Love, love, love my Roomba. My house hasn't been this clean with two toddlers and two dogs running around.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for pet hair, dirt, and dander!
Review: Love, love, love my Roomba--despite the fact that I do have a black rug.Ê We put tape on the sensors as was recommended by others and now it does go over the rug (although without the sensors, it sometimes rams into things kind of hard...)But that said, I still love it because it collects huge amounts of dog hair, dust, and dander that is hiding on my floors.Ê My dog is a German Shepherd, otherwise known as a "German Shedder" and it is really amazing how much crud this little thing picks up.Ê I have to empty it somewhat often if I haven't run it for a while, but it is so nice to be doing something else and having my Roomba on the job picking up all the random dirt and hair tumbleweeds that have accumulated all over the house.Ê Great timesaver!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome for pet owners - a must buy!
Review: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Roomba 880!Ê We have 2 dogs that shed A LOT and I could never keep up with the hair - we had hair EVERYWHERE!Ê But not anymore!Ê It's so easy to use and I run it everyday before I leave for work - when I get home my floors are spotless.Ê I have rugs, carpet, hardwood and tile - and it works well on all surfaces.Ê When I first got the Roomba I had already vacuumed with my Dyson but wanted to use it right away.Ê I literally had to empty the collection bin over 5 times due to all the dog hair it picked up - and that was after I had already vacuumed with my Dyson!Ê My dogs shed so much that we have to empty the bin everyday, and sometimes twice while it's running. Another awesome feature - I have a couple rugs with frayed edges and it senses the loose strings as it vacuums so it won't get tangled up in the rollers.Ê It's quiet, works relatively quickly and perfect for everyday maintenance!Ê If you're on the fence about buying this, don't be.Ê You will not regret this purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, love
Review: Love, love, love it!!Ê It does exactly what I wanted it to do!Ê It picks up the cat hair that seems to accumulate from out of thin air, gets around most things, and is relatively quiet.Ê :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I'm in love!
Review: Love, love, love it!Ê I have two labs and two cats (one long hair).Ê I barely use my central vac anymore!Ê I does a fantastic job.Ê After buying this I was given an original Roomba and bought a new battery for it.Ê I sometimes run them both around at the same time.Ê The new one is hands down fantastic compared to the original.Ê It does a great job on my area rugs and picks up a ton of pet hair.Ê When I first received it, I used the central vac and vacuumed the entire house and then used the Roomba.Ê I was SHOCKED at how much it picked up.Ê So shocked that I spread a newspaper out on the table and put the dirt on it to show people!I also have an upper level with carpet that is gated off from the pets.Ê I vacuumed just the bedroom up there and then ran the Roomba on the carpet and was amazed again at how much it picked up.Ê VERY impressed.Ê You will have to get the vacuum out occasionally to really get baseboards, corners, etc.Ê BUT I would need to vacuum every other day and I use my central vac about every two weeks - if that.Ê I'm in love!Ê Our house is big and I move it around from room to room, but keep it docked in the bedroom to go off every day.Ê I can't tell you how nice it is to walk into the bedroom and not see pet hair rolling over my wood floor.Ê Our dogs sleep in dog beds in there and of course the cats are in there too.Ê Before the Roomba goes off at it's set time, I just use the feather duster and have a spotless room.Ê It's worth every penny to me!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love this. It works on the schedule
Review: Love this. It works on the schedule, sometimes a pain if it sweeps up ribbon or something, but rarely have issues with it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this,!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this vacuum. It is everything I expected from the advertising. Highly recommend!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this vacuum seems to really cut down dust in the house.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!

The more you run it, the longer it takes for the reservoir to fill too quickly.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacuum!
Review: Love love love this guy! I have been wanting a Roomba for a couple years now. I finally decided to splurge and get one because we just had our 2nd baby and I was not in the mood to vacuum! All I had to do was charge it over night before I first used it and it was good to go! So easy to use! The first clean took quite a while. I was under the impression that you could just stick it on the floor and let it clean that whole level as long as doors were open. I think it was starting to do that, but It died after about an hour and 45 mins of cleaning. I have since learned to use the virtual walls that came with it and let it clean one room at a time. It's a lot more efficient that way.As for the actual performance - it is awesome! In preparation for the Roomba, I had vacuumed AND shampooed my carpets the day before I knew it would be here. So I would say it was very clean carpet to start with, at least I thought so. After the Roomba died on that first run, and I decided to empty the bin, I was completely baffled by the amount of dirt it picked up!!! The bin was packed FULL. I don't even know how that was possible but my vacuum/shampooer must just not be cutting it.When it is finished cleaning the room, there will be a little victory song. I wasn't aware of this since it died on its first run due to my lack of virtual walls. I had it cleaning my sons room and thought it was taking forever and I wasn't sure if it stopped or just went until it died. I finally heard the song after about 45 minutes. So don't worry! Some rooms take forever to clean, but you don't have to manually stop it.As for where it stops, prepare to use your remote/dock sometimes. Somehow this little guy decided that it really loves being under beds. It was okay when it did its little victory dance underneath my daughters twin bed because I could actually reach it.Ê However, as I walked into our master bedroom and heard the victory song under our bed, I groaned. Of course it stopped RIGHT in the center so it was impossible to reach. I had to grab the dock from the kitchen, bring it into view of the Roomba, then use the remote to get it to dock. That was a pain in the butt.The noise level is tolerable. When it's in the same room as you, I would compare it to it sounding like there's a real vacuum in a different room. If that makes sense. It didn't bother me at first but considering how long it takes to clean some rooms, it gets a little old. Which is a little annoying when you work from home and you can't schedule it to clean when you're gone.I'll post updates in a few months!UDATE (8/3/16) - I still LOVE my Roomba! I can't tell you how awesome it feels to come home from a busy day and see the room freshly vacuumed!Ê Anyway, I am writing this update because I had an issue earlier.Ê I had put our Roomba downstairs to clean and noticed that it was making a weird clicking noise. There was nothing visible so I knew it had to be under the wheels somewhere. I didn't have my manual on hand but decided I could maybe figure out how to pop everything off and clean it on my own. It took 2 seconds! I flipped Roomba over and there were obvious tabs to push to pop the wheels out. Somehow a chapstick cap had gotten sucked up!Ê They really make this thing user friendly. I've never had to refer to the manual once for anything other than the initial quick start setup! I'm trying to clean my other vacuum right now (Dyson) and there are SO many parts and pieces. I keep having to look up how to get certain things apart and put them back together. It's frustrating!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It doesn't like the rug in our living room
Review: Living with Roomba - Day 1Roomba comes with two of these little doohickies that you can use to keep it out of rooms. I put one by the bathroom door as it got into all kinds of trouble in there yesterday: it ruffled up two of the rugs and then got itself trapped under the medicine cabinet after it moved the trash can. Yes, it's a boisterous little bugger, strong enough to move dining chairs, and I just watched it as it figured out how to open the pocket door to the closet!Gabby, our labrador, is completely indifferent to it, but does keep an eye on it whenever it heads her way. If she stays on the rug she's mostly safe.It does a very thorough job of cleaning and it's fascinating to watch. It doesn't like the rug in our living room, however, it seems to be on the the threshold of what it can handle. Mostly it hits the edge like it's a wall and changes direction. Also it spends an awful lot of time under the bed, what's it doing under there?Now if they can just make something that will do the laundry, clean the windows, dust, load and unload the dishwasher...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does a decent job but can't justify the price, Still has same flaws from original 2002 release
Review: Let me start out by saying I'm a big fan of Irobot, I even own some stock in them.Ê I bought the original Roomba when it first came out in 2002.Ê I had also owned one of the Discovery Models (4XX series) , I also owned a 5XX model as well as a 6XX model.Ê Obviously they never were good enough to be a replacement for my regular vacuums but they were great for weekly maintenance when I didn't want to vacuum.Ê Also they were a great topic of conversation (back in the early days before they were so wide spread).Ê Unfortunately they never seemed to last and while Irobot had good customer service, after the year warranty you were pretty paying expensive repair bills.Ê The last few models I owned I purchased from BBB or Costco due to their amazing return policies.Now fast forward a bit, in 2013 I started seeing reviews for the Neato vacuums., while I didn't know much about the company I was impressed that they map the room rather then just bumping around like the Roomba.Ê I ended up purchasing a Neato XV-21 and sold my 6XX series Roomba.Over the course of the last 2 years I actually came to really like the Neato, the suction was pretty much on par with the Roomba and it seemed to hit every spot on the carpet.Ê I also liked how you could add new features by doing a firmware upgrade yourself.Now fast forward to a few weeks ago.Ê The batteries were barely holding a charge on the Neato,Ê it was about time to replace some of the rollerbars and filters etc.Ê I decided I would look into upgrading to one of the newest generations of robotic vacuums.It came down to the Neato Botvac 85,Ê The Roomba 790 or the Roomba 880.I ended up going with the Roomba 880, because I was intrigued by their claim of maintenance free and the new non-tangle brushes.Ê (I have a Shiba Inu and there is dog hair everywhere).Ê Also there was a Mothers Day sale going on so the price was lower, as well as I had 2 nice credits where I had purchased it, so in the end I only paid about $360 for it.Ê There is no way I would pay over $400 for this product, especially with the puny warranty they come with.Now that I'm done rambling on with the back story let me get to the actual product review.Ê I listed a few pros and cons at the bottom, but I just want to talk about a few in more detail.* First of all, the Roomba 880 looks very sleek and cool looking, unfortunately when it comes to a vacuum this isn't always great.Ê In just 1 week there are scratch marks all over the glossy top.* Iadapt technology?Ê - This is my biggest beef,Ê Irobot has had 13 years since the original roomba was released and they still haven't added mapping technology to this thing?Ê As soon as I used this new model for the first time I immediately missed how the Neato rarely bumped into anything.Ê The 880 bumps into everything, I know they list it as a soft touch bumper, but if its so soft why are there already scratch marks on the bumper.* Another big issue for me, in 13 years they haven't fixed the issue with the Roomba going over black patterns or dark rugs?Ê Why aren't the cliff sensors set to detect depth rather then color?*Ê The cleaning and vacuum system is much improved from previous models, but I'm wondering by loosing the bristles on the brushes is it really getting deep down into the carpet and rug fibers as previous models.Ê There is a reason every vacuum manufacture uses bristles for their vacs (they work)Ê Maybe I can find a friend with a 7XX series and run a comparison test.Ê Does the stronger suction out-way the bristles doing a deep clean.Pros:Slick LookingEasy to setAmazing job picking up dirt, dust and hairvirtually maintenance freebin full alert noticelighthouse featurequietCons:scratches easilystill a dumb robot and bumps into anythingemptying the filter/bin is pretty messy.does not work on black carpet or carpet with black patternscarrying handle seems flimsy.So in conclusion, this is just a decent robotic vacuum.Ê In my opinion it is not worth the $600+ price tag.Ê If someone would take the Neato 85 and the Roomba 880 and merge them together you would have the ultimate robotic vacuum.Ê I guess will see what happens with the Dyson Robotic vacuum that will be coming out soon.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works but with frustrations.
Review: Let me begin by giving some background. This Roomba 880 is my first experience with a robotic vacuum. I cannot compare it to any other model either from iRobot or any other company. I have a fairly large house and I decided to try this device out on the first floor and limit it to three rooms, to keep down the animal hair from two Labrador Retrievers. I bought an additional virtual wall / lighthouse for a total of three. One is used as a wall and the other two as lighthouses. The idea was to have the Roomba clean three contiguous rooms; the home station is in the center room and the other two rooms are on opposite sides and marked by the lighthouses. The house has a moderately open floor plan but there is furniture in the center of the rooms, in addition to against the walls. Also, although I gave this review three stars, I would have preferred three and a half, if that were possible.I am reminded of the opening of Dickens A Tale of Two Cities: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times. With respect to the Roomba I would say it is a remarkable machine, it is a very flawed machine. The Roomba works, but at least in my configuration, there are significant frustrations. First, the lighthouses dont work quite as they should. As they are described in the configuration I have, the Roomba should spend approximately one-third of its time in the first room, go to a lighthouse and spend about a third in that room, and then move on to the last lighthouse-marked room and finish there before returning to the home base. This rarely happens; it may have done this once. It usually runs around the first room, goes into one of the other two and then docks. My expectations for the lighthouses may be unrealistic, but this is the impression given by the advertising. The virtual wall works as advertised.A bigger frustration is that it seems like much of my furniture was specifically designed to entrap a Roomba. Most of the bedroom pieces and a credenza in the family room all trap or wedge the Roomba under the front ledge of the furniture. If the furniture was half an inch higher or lower Im sure it wouldnt happen, but the furniture is what it is. The Roomba gets trapped somewhere every time, often more than once during a run. Not exactly set-it-and-forget-it.Bottom line: with some fussing and un-wedging, it still picks up quite a bit of dog hair that would still be on the floor if I didnt use it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent, but here is what it does not do well:
Review: Just to give this some context, at this point I have quite a bit of experience with robotic vacuums.Ê More than two years ago I purchased a Neato Botvac 85 with which I was very happy.Ê I was so satisfied with it that I purchased a second one so that I would not have to move it back and forth between the two floors of my house.The Neato started having technical problems a couple months ago.Ê That, combined with some annoyances I had experienced and a recent "leading consumer magazine" review convinced me to try the Roomba 880.Let's get this out of the way: The Roomba 880 does an excellent job of cleaning a room.Ê It probably does a somewhat better job of cleaning your room than the Neato Botvac 85, particularly on carpeting, but you would not be dissatisfied with either one.Ê One thing that I really like about it is that the cleaning brush is designed in such a way that it does not get tangled with the fringe on the edge of your carpet (the Neato does) and it does not get all covered with long hair and strings that later need to be cut away.Ê It also is better than the Neato at hopping over high thresholds between rooms.Ê But it is not perfect.Ê Here are some of the things that I wish it did better than it does:- It runs into things much harder than the Neato Botvac.Ê As I write this review the Roomba 880 stopped by to clean the room I am in, and when it bumped into my chair, I definitely felt a bit of a jolt.Ê The Neato was much more gentle.Ê Why does this matter?Ê Well, on several occasions the Roomba has trapped itself inside of various rooms when it ran into their open doors and forced them closed.Ê I have come home a couple hours later to find my tiny mud room exceptionally clean after 90 minutes of the Roomba trying to find its way out unsuccessfully because of the now closed door.Ê It has also knocked over a number of things left on the floor, such as fireplace tools, that were immune to the bumps of the Neato.- The dust / debris compartment is too small and is somewhat difficult to clean.Ê Apparently this model Roomba has a dust compartment that is larger than past models, but that is hard to imagine.Ê The compartment is about half the capacity of the Neato Botvac.Ê Also, it is harder to remove from the vacuum and harder to clean both the dust compartment and the filter.- The charging / docking station is annoying.Ê At first I thought it was pretty cool:Ê Very small and light, what's not to like?Ê First of all, unlike the Neato, there is no place to store the excess power cord, so if your docking station is one foot away from the plug, you have several feet of cord laying on the floor preventing the Roomba from effectively cleaning that area.Ê Worse than that, often when the Roomba runs over the excess cord it ends up moving the charging station.Ê More than once I have come home to find the Roomba with a dead battery six inches from the docking station because it had run over the power cord and, in doing so, turned the docking station around 180 degrees so that it was now acing the wall and unreachable to the Roomba.- It does not deal with slanted first steps well.Ê I live in an old house and the threshold just before my basement stairway is tilted slightly downward toward the stair.Ê The Roomba get stuck there every time.- Its navigation is not as sophisticated as it could be.Ê For comparison, when it came to navigating a room or a house, the Neato Botvac was a total genius.Ê It regularly could find its way back to the docking station from three rooms and multiple doorways away without any problems.Ê This was without any assistance in the form of beacons or anything.Ê The Roomba 880 often gets confused and needs assistance.- It is pretty slowÊ The Botvac 85 could clean a large room in about 20 minutes.Ê I am pretty picky about cleanliness, and I was quite happy with its result.Ê I think the Roomba 880 does a bit better job (maybe 10% better???) but it take about an hour to do the same room.Ê If you are not home when it runs, who cares?Ê But if you are looking for a cleaning before you have company, you better plan ahead.So, this all sounds negative, but please understand that I gave the Roomba 880 FIVE stars.Ê I still am glad I bought it.Ê If I was offered the Neato Botvac 85 or the Roomba 880 for free, but I could only have one?Ê Tough call.Ê I would go with the Roomba 880, but it would be with some uncertainty.Ê If they would just make a few changes (more gentle on impact, larger, easier to clean dust bin, more sophisticated navigation) it would be almost perfect.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: MyRobot OK. So Far So Good.
Review: Just received our robot day before yesterday, and have only run it three times so far. The first time it went one hour ten minutes, and the light came on the dust bin was full, so after it docked itself I cleaned it per the instruction manual. The next morning it took off running again, and ran one hour fifteen minutes. This time the dust bin didn't fill up completely so the light indicator did not come on. I cleaned it anyway as the instructions indicate I should. This afternoon I set it to go for 4:00 PM, and it did. At 4:00 PM the R2 D2 sounds could be heard, and it was off, and running again. This time it picked up even less, but it is keeping the place nice, and clean. We bought the device to keep an 800 sq. ft. atrium room clean. The floor is tile throughout, and by keeping the dog, and the cats out of the room the robot can get it cleaner everyday. Later we will be having the animals into the room more, but right now they stay out. We are in the process of remodeling the entire house so the little robot will be getting a workout in the future, and we'll come back to comment later. I think from what I've seen of this little guy so far that it's going to be a good relationship. I can't see any negatives with it at this point.

I am impressed!comes with two lighthouses!Ê im trying to figure out how to place them so I could navigate the cleaner toward the bed room and other corridor !also has a remote that you can steer the robot in case!so far good :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Just get it! You won't regret it!
Review: Just get the Roomba! I know you are probably scouring reviews deciding if its really worth the $700 well let me tell you it is! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE mine. Love it. It picks up so much stuff! I'm always amazed how much it picks up even when I run it everyday. I have 2 dogs who shed a lot and it picks the hair up no problem. It even picked up a quarter yesterday and I was impressed at that. It does take a little bit of maintenance. I have very long hair and it gets wound up on the edges of the rollers (hard to explain without you knowing what it looks like) But it takes less than 2 minutes to clean it all out really good.I've had mine for over a month and run it everyday I've used the scheduling which works great but I just put it in the room I want it to clean and press the button. Seriously this is a life changer just get it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Totally awesome and worth every penny.
Review: Just awesome. My wife asked for this for over a year and a half but I just thought it was a gimmick. After reading many reviews I took the plunge. My only regret my wife had to vacuum for that last year and a half while she was asking for it.Ê When you see everything it picks up every single day and then it makes it around your whole entire house and then it docs itself back on the charger you're going to be giggling like we were.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Just amazing. All I can say. I haven't tested it on stairs though.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: it Sucks, hut Not in a good way!!!
Review: Junk! I've got stock in this company and I'm going to sell it! I set it for twice a week in our Small summer house in NH with hard wood floors, no carpets. On those days I pick up the chairs and anything else in the way ( bed and bath trash cans, bath room scale, bed room and kitchen chairs, wedge the couch side tables so it can't get behind the couch and get stuck, and like the sweeper brush gets under the counter edges in the kitchen, Ha) and if you run it when you get home to clean the areas it missed its under foot and noisy! I hate this machine, I gave it 8 months because of my dear sweet wife but enough is enough!!! I'll vacuum on the weekend and do it cheerfully!!!! Don't waste your money, don't move everything for this pig and keep your stress factor low!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love it
Review: Ive had my Roomba for a couple months now.Ê I absolutely love this vacuum.Ê I have white tile and three rat terriers that shed bad.Ê The dogs along with a sandy area I live makes my floors get dirty every day.Ê The Roomba has solved my issues.Ê The amount of dust in my home has reduced drastically from keeping my floor cleaned every evening.The goodCleans my entire home easily 1350sqft is allCut down the dustfun to watcheasy to cleancan clean under my big bedThe Bad :(will get stuck in places at times like the antique baby chair it can somehow get over the rocker and high center.Like to be wherever I am at.Ê Its like the little sucker can sense me and follow me around my house like a little puppy dog.Ê It's annoying.Ê If im in the kithcen cooking it will be in there under my feet.Ê If I am in the living room it will spends its entire battery in there bumping my recliner.Ê I tell it to leave me alone and it will go away for a few minutes and come right back.Ê just like the annoying neighbor kid that just wont go away.It will eat cables.Ê Sucks them up and trys to drag your charger across the house.Ê Ive found it a few times like this.Ê Seems like its trying to hang itself so it can have a day off.Will get lager objects stuck under the rollers and drag them around the house making awful noises until you can stop it.can get caught under the cabinet edges.Looks like I have more bad than good but I wouldn't want to be without it.Ê My poor shark vacuum only gets used to clean the roomba these days.Ê I love this vacuum

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good Little Roomba! Good Boy!Ê Give Daddy that nasty ole dust ball.Ê Good Boy!Ê Yes, you are!
Review: Ive had my Roomba 880 for about a month now and wanted to report my experience with it because its a pricey purchase.Ê The Roomba 880 lists for 700.00 and I purchased mine at Bed, Bath, and Beyond with a 20% off coupon; final purchase price was $560.00 plus tax.Ê Brought the Roomba home and let it charge for a full day.Ê Next day I started it up and half way through its cleaning cycle I could not resist, I had to stop it and check the dust bin; the dust bin was already full and dirt was backing up into the rollers.Ê This was my operation pattern for the first two or three days then, half way through the week it was time to not hover over it any longer and to let it do its thing while I was at work.Ê For the next three to five days it got stuck in different places and I Roomba proofed those areas by either putting up one virtual wall and one virtual lighthouse or slightly modifying my 1800 Sq foot basement layout that I wanted it to clean.Ê Most of the time now, it finds its way back to the charging station and the dust bin is 75% full.Ê Verdict: For a guy who works all day, comes home, may work in the yard until the sun goes down, then comes in, makes dinner and then finally wants to sit down and take a break, this is a great labor saving device.Ê The carpets are now much cleaner than I used to keep them with my Dyson and its just one less thing that I have to do.Ê I will be buying another for the main floor.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I named my Roomba Colin
Review: Ive had Colin for a few weeks and despite how comically stupid he can be, he does a pretty good job. My floors are noticeably cleaner and I love to come home and see all the trails Colin leaves behind in the carpet after vacuuming.However, Colin does have some bad habits. He likes to go into rooms and trap himself by pushing the door closed. He will then clean the heck out of the room until his battery dies so hard he forgets what day it is, (Seriously. When this happens I have to reset the date and time).Colin also has occasional docking problems. His dock is so light weight that sometimes when he is undocking, Colin will shift it so that he cant redock. He then proceeds to happily vacuum the floors until he once again forgets what day it is.Overall, Im happy with Colins performance. I was able to fix his bad habits by buying doorstops for all my doors and taping his dock to the floor. Ill have to see if these self induced marathon vacuuming sessions have an adverse effect on the battery life.Dont Panic.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: its the greatest thing since sliced bread.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Its awesome so far
Review: Its awesome so far.Ê It does ram furniture a little bit, and the robot won't always find its home with the lighthouses.Ê Another negative is the dust bin gets dust in the surrounding area when you empty the bin, and even though it is very detailed it sometimes does miss a spot. However, the positive of not having to vacuum --other than pushing a button-- outweighs the negatives buy a handful including the steep price tag. Make sure to read the manual.Ê I found the part about charging the roomba all the way a little late.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: It's usefulI Like it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: It's sooooooo great :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fabulous
Review: It's so great to find something that is so deserving of a 5 star review.Ê Everyone else has referenced challenges & details, so won't go over again.Ê But I sprang for this despite the steep price and personal skepticism that anything so Jetson's would actually work because:1) demanding, research obsessive and tech savvy friends had one & warmly recommended it2) the NYT review: [...].I didn't need any more endorsement.Ê Also, was able to purchase both with Amazon Prime (no shipping) and through Amazon Smile, so that meant a contribution went to my designated charity, which is nice.As others have noted, the initial mass of dust and debris in the Roomba880 'diaper' is both startling and very satisfying.Ê I hate to vacuum, so it will be quite a while before this guy stops filling up & singing his "empty my diaper" song, but what a fabulous addition to the household.Ê Love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: it's smart

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: It's good.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good for daily upkeep; suction power not strong enough to be primary vacuuum
Review: It's good, not great.Ê I bought this very expensive thing more for convenience rather than its suction power.Ê The instructions aren't very thorough, but I was able to get the information I needed by searching online.Ê It does a good enough job, but it doesn't do a very thorough job.Ê I have old parquet hardwood floors and some of the wood has sort of splintered away, creating larger than desired gaps between the parquet tiles.Ê The Roomba's suction power isn't strong enough to get the dust that accumulates between the panels.Ê Therefore, I still need to use my hand vacuum to get those spots when doing a more thorough clean.Ê This is why I can't recommend it as the primary vacuum in the house.Ê Better to invest in a Miele if you can only afford one good machine.Ê That being said, the Roomba is good for every day maintenance of clean-enough floors.Ê As my apartment accumulates dust bunnies all too frequently, and my back isn't up to the constant vacuuming, this was worth getting for general upkeep.Ê The little revolving sweeper is good at getting at the dust along the wall edges.Ê Also, it's kind of cool that when it's done, it finds the base and docks itself.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Irobot rating and comment
Review: It's good, it beats me vacuuming.Ê I turn it on almost everyday.Ê I am amazed on how much dirt it picks up.Ê The only thing I fine is that it doesn't really detect dirt.Ê But since I vacuum everyday if it does not pick it up today it will pick it up tomorrow.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good product, save a lot of time for me.
Review: It's good, I don't need to clean my appartment myself after I bought it, the only issues it's a little stupid and sometimes start cleanning in the middle of the night or can lost his way in one of the rooms. But in general good product, saving a lot of time for me.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Goes all over the place while cleaning, but she does it well!
Review: It's funny to watch Rosie (My Romba 880 named after the Jetson's cleaning bot) go all over the floor in what appears to be an erratic fashion, but in the end, the floor is spotless!Ê At first I was wondering how she could possibly be tracking where she cleaned at, but I was pleasantly surprised in the end.The Roomba 880 comes with two lighthouse/virtual walls, a remote control, an extra HEPA filter, manuals (Including troubleshooting data) and other papers, batteries for all the accessories and the Roomba, and the docking station.Ê The remote works on two AA batteries and each of the lighthouse/virtual wall units work on two C size batteries.Ê The Roomba works on a proprietary rechargeable battery that should last quite a while.Ê Roomba says, "iRobot XLife Battery: XLife Battery delivers twice as many cleaning cycles as previous Roomba batteries, doubling the time before you may need to replace your Roomba battery.Ê Roomba runtime remains the same between recharges. Battery lifetime varies with home environment and usage. Use Roomba as directed for longest battery life."If you activate your warranty on the iRobot website, you get a free gift. (I haven't gotten mine in the mail just yet, so I don't know what it is and as they don't tell you what it is, I don't think they want ou to know until you get it.Ê It's a gift!)Ê Some robots come with free coupons when you register them and the Roomba 880 might start being one of those robots at some point.Ê In short, register your bot and see what comes of it.Ê It activates your warranty as well.Now for the part of pros and cons.Ê (There are too many pros, so I'm just highlighting a few of the more important ones to me.)PROS:1.) You can schedule the Roomba to clean house once a day every day of the week or less.2.) The lighthouses can be configured as virtual walls.Ê When in virtual wall mode, they block the bot just as much as any other wall would.Ê When in lighthouse mode, they block the bot until it finishes cleaning the room it's in in order to clean most effectively.Ê Got a hallway?Ê Put up a lighthouse!Ê No door?Ê Lighthouse it!Ê They also have a 3 state switch that you can specify the distance you want the IR beam's thin conical shape to cover.Ê The lighthouses turn on when the Roomba is on and off when the Roomba is off.Ê This saves the lighthouse batteries.3.) It fits under objects that regular vacuums cannot.Ê (Ex. The refrigerator door, kitchen table chairs, etc.)4.) It never gets tangled in even the smallest of the wires near my desk and has even gone over top of them to clean that space!5.) The remote allows you to tell the bot to clean, spot clean a 3' area, and dock.Ê You can also control the bot to move forward, turn left, and turn right, but it doesn't allow you to tell it to move backwards for some odd reason which could be helpful in some situations.6.) If you're a programmer or roboticist, you have a 7 pin TTY serial port under the flap on top of the unit.Ê I've only ever played with 4 pin TTY, so I'll have to see what the other 3 pins are for.Ê You can probably talk to it with PuTTY and MAYBE use the iRobot Create stuff.Ê The manual says you can reprogram the Robot with that port as well, so if you're looking for a programmable bot that's possibly more up to date physically than the Create (Create is a stripped down version of the old Roomba 400) and you don't mind paying the $700 price tag for it, you could use this Roomba 880 as a bot to experiment with.CONS:1.) It crashes into stuff fairly hard.Ê It hasn't broken anything yet and it does have a bumper to cushion the blow, but it makes me a bit nervous.Ê I'm a neat freak, so having stuff bumped into a lot makes me wonder if things will get busted.Ê It does seem to slow down before the crash, though, so there is some kind of mechanism telling it that it's about to collide.2.) It gets tangled in the bed skirt sometimes as the bed skirt drapes quite heavily to the floor.Ê It also gets tangled sometimes on floppy rugs.Ê (The kind of rugs that don't have a rubber backing)3.) It doesn't seem to clean rugs all that well.Ê (Floppy or not - I have both.)4.) It makes a whining sound everywhere it goes.Ê It's not the zoom sound that the upright vacuum cleaners make and isn't terribly loud, but it just makes a whining sound.Ê You can learn to tune it out as it's monotonous.Ê Personally I don't mind it right now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's fantastic!
Review: It's fantastic! Keeps on top of the hair my two German Shepherds drop on a daily basis. The only very small gripe I've got is it's a bit noisy, but easy enough to shut the door and leave it to get on with its task. Just love it!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So far so fine
Review: It's been great for a month. I hope it lasts many years.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I still love the thing and can't do without it
Review: It's been about a half a year. I think that's long enough for me to have an opinion on it. I know a lot of reviews mention early on they can't imagine living without it, then a few months later they wind up forgetting it. I want to testify against these reviews. After 6 months, I still love the thing and can't do without it.I'm not a big cleaner. Most people mention they're clean freaks and get a roomba for that reason. In my case I didn't care much about sweeping up the place but I knew if I didn't want my computer overheating every few months I'd have to tackle this dust situation. My roommate was also moving out and I knew the problem was only going to get worse without them sweeping up. Air purifiers only marginally helped to combat the dust. Using this thing, though, has made a noticeable difference, and it does so with minimal effort. After the usual dust purge that accompanies purchasing one, I maybe get a full dust bin maybe once a week. The computer has yet to develop any further issues.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Saves time and effort, clean up neatly
Review: It's been 8 to 9 months we are using roomba, we have a lab with us who sheds throughout the year, Labradors are known for heavy shedding , roomba in one word saved me,Ê my efforts, time , no we I just turn it on and do my own stuff , I don't need to think about it, it cleans very neatly, very easy to handle and operate, saves time , amazingly helpful

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Review: It's a very handy vacuum.Ê Gets under a lot of quite low furnishings (i.e. claw foot tub).Ê I have brand new hardwood floors and I put it in a different area every day. The whole house gets done a couple of times a week.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Nice device
Review: It works great and it is really helpful. The price is great and the customer service was excellent.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It works fine but I am not very happy on its scheduling ...
Review: It works fineÊ but I am not very happy on its scheduling features. Although it claims that you set the timing and don't have to worry about it, but the reality is that it regularly gets lost in the house and doesn't come back to docking on its own. So, we have to bring it back once a while ourselves for charging.Also, still couldn't figure out how to maneuver it using the remote - it doesn't respond promptly to remote buttons.Overall it's good but for the price I feel it is still less of value for money.Important, it is far from your total vacuum cleaning solution- It is good as a second cleaner, it helps to clean to some extend but it can't replace the traditional cleaner - that means you will still need another, traditional vacuum for your complete cleaning.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This product will keep the dog / cat hair off the floors

Title: Color me surprised.Ê It works.
Review: It works as advertised.Ê I was actually suprised.Ê I thought it was a gimmick, but it gets up all sorts of stuff and is so easy to use my 9 year old set it up.Ê We named it "Mrs. Jones," my 4th grade teacher, because Mrs. Jones sucked.Ê In fact it works so well, we bought two more!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It was very nice until it's broken
Review: It was very nice until it's broken. The side spinner stopped working after 3 months of purchase. I followed the video and cleaned the spinner but it still does not work. And the anti-tangle light is always on. I think it is related to the anti-tangle sensor.Considering this thing is ridiculously expensive. I would expect it should work smoothly without any issue. But just in 3 months this happens. Now I have to call them and figure out what to do and waste my time on this. Definitely not worth the price!Update: I contacted them and they sent me a replacement module for the side spinner. Now everything works as before. Pumped up the rating to 4 stars.

Review: It turned out to be what we hoped it would. It (Robbie) really works out, we find the dust level in the whole house is down. We have been surprised at what he finds and picks up. Three weeks and no complaints.

With only 2 lighthouses it maneuvers into too many other areas in a hit & miss manner. Better to clean 1 room at a time more thoroughly.Ê Also needs a feature to have it move back & forth from the walls rather than in a criss cross, helter skelter manner.Meanwhile, I am very happy with the Roomba's cleaning quality.Ê I have breathing problems which make it difficult to do heavy cleaning so the Roomba keeps my asthma much calmer.

Considering the hair from my long-haired furkids would probably clog it every five minutes, I appreciate the effort it makes to keep the carpet cleaned.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: YOU DON'T GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR
Review: It is absolutely critical to wait for a few weeks before writing a review of a new product.Ê The iRobot Roomba 880 is absolutely fascinating for the first three days - I estimate we saved 15 minutes of vacuuming over that time, but easily spent 3 hours watching the thing cruise around our house.Ê My initial review would have read "This thing is a gift from the Almighty!".Ê However, after 10 days we are sadly returning the little guy whence it came.A quick note on our environment: we bought the 880 as part of a remodel project - new hardwood floors in our living room and kitchen.Ê We have 2 short hair labs, one short hair cat, two kids with hair of various lengths, two short hair parents, a guinnea pig, and a constant flow of messy friends and neighbors enjoying our living space.Ê The day after our new floors were finished it became apparent that we would either need to sweep 2x a day or get a robot to do the job.Ê We weren't expecting it to replace our need to vacuum, but were hoping it would be able to remove the majority of the pet hair, specifically.Before I slam this thing, let me tell you what I did like:Virtual Walls: the 880 comes with a pair of infrared beacons that can be used to create virtual walls, or 'halos' around places you don't want it to bother, like dog bowls.Ê These were very effective / easy to set up.Scheduling: I really liked the ability to set a daily schedule.Ê Great concept.Ê The entire point of a robotic vacuum is to reduce your interaction with the act of vacuuming - setting your schedule and interacting only when it needs you to empty its dustbin is a critical requirement in my book.Design: I'm a sucker for good looking tech, and would describe the Roomba as a good looking piece of hardware.Dust Bin: I had to empty the dustbin after two cleanings or so, and it was always full of pet hair.Ê I would prefer to empty once a week of course, but we have a zoo over here, so I thought it was fair.Ê At least I didn't have to empty it multiple times per cleaning.What I did NOT like:Noise: know that this thing is loud, specifically on hardwood floors (much quieter on carpet).Ê We have a TV in our kitchen, and we could not watch it while the little guy was running.Inefficient Cleaning Path: As I noted, I was fascinated watching this thing clean - I'd seriously crack a beer and just follow it around, trying to figure out its floor mapping algorithm.Ê After literally hours of watching it go, I believe it is totally random.Ê It would find and hug a wall, but then decide to veer off in a random direction.Ê The random approach to cleaning meant it would re-clean the same spots often, and leave others untouched.Ê I was hoping to see it learn over time, but it didn't - not over 10 days at least.Ê The end result is that it would run around MUCH longer than it needed. Combine gripes one and two, and you had a noisy device running around your house for hours - and this meant scheduling became a challenge.Ê I couldn't find 2 hours on any day that I could guarantee it wouldn't bother someone.Table and Chairs: The 880 was especially awful at figuring out our dining area - normal 4 legged table, 4 chairs and a bench. The robots sensor sees walls just fine, and slows down before impact - but not the case with skinny chair legs. The thing would head into our dining room with a head full of steam and smash full-on into our chairs, then proceed to bounce drunkenly around like a bull in a china shop - smashing into legs right and left. Yes, sometimes it pivots nicely around the leg - after its smashed into it full-speed in the first place.Random Stops: If we let the 880 run while we were gone, it seemed to invariably get stuck, stop, and ask for someone to move it - generally around our stairs.Ê I suspect that it had vertigo and would freak out on occasion when it felt it was going to fall down the stairs.Overall, I didn't have pie-in-the-sky hopes for this thing - honestly, I was just excited to have a freaking robot vacuuming my freaking floors.Ê That said, when I drop $700 large on a piece of tech, I expect the programming to have been a priority - and this is an area that needs improvement in my opinion.Ê I believe, quite strongly, that you are paying a brand premium for this thing that isn't deserved - compare the feature set to the like-priced Deebot D77 and you realize that iRobot is playing the brand game without pushing the envelope on functionality.Ê I'm waiting on my Deebot D77 (which is currently $70 off at Best Buy) to arrive and will update this post based on that experience.*****EDIT*****Well, our Deebot D77 showed up and we've used it religiously for about 2 weeks or so.Ê All I can say is that Robots seem a lot smarter in the movies - I was expecting Wall E, and instead I got a couple Battle Droids from Star Wars Episode 1.Ê Before I lament about my D77 experience, I'll just say that I do not believe either of these devices are worth their current price tags (~$700 USD as of this post).Ê I think it's a toss-up between the two honestly - I'm planning to keep the D77 primarily because A) our dark wood floors require daily vacuuming/sweeping, and B) I don't have the stomach to try another brand right now.Ê That said, what I like and what I don't:Likes:Base Canister: The D77's base vacuum canister is, hands down, the best feature this thing has - it's also the only feature I think it beats the Roomba 880.Ê We'll need to empty it 1-2 times a week as a standard.Ê This is much better than the every-couple-days-or-more bin emptying I was doing with the Roomba.Ê I've also used the vacuum canister for our stairs a few times - while it's functional, it's not super convenient (why o why didn't they add a small battery so you don't need to plug in for short use????).Noise: I do believe the D77 is quieter on our hardwood floors.Ê It's not super quiet, so don't think this is a dirt-whisperer.. just quieter than the Roomba.Cleaning Algorithm Options: the D77 has a number of additional cleaning options - you can tell it to hug the walls, go super-clean, or go normal - each altering the robot's cleaning path.Ê Note that I was not impressed with ANY of these - but options are nice, I suppose.Double spinners: while the Roomba only has one dirt spinner, the Deebot has two - this makes 2x the sense of having 1.Ê It did not result in a 2x better cleaning process, mind you.Dislikes:Inefficient Cleaning Path: I was seriously hoping this thing was smarter than it turned out to be.Ê But, alas, it's as dumb, maybe dumber, than the Roomba.Ê To be fair, the dirt sensor is a smart addition, and you can see it alter the D77's course when it encounters obvious dirt.Ê But my gripes about the Roomba's inefficient, seemingly random cleaning pattern are the same with the Deebot.Ê At $700, I expect these devices to have enough memory and processing power to A) do a great job at mapping their cleaning space, B) keeping track of where they are in that space, and C) figuring out what they have cleaned and what they haven't.Ê Instead, both bounce around randomly until they don't have any more juice.Ê This is about 2 hours for the D77.Ê I'll add, while both robots run full-speed into chair legs, the Roomba does a better job at sensing when it's about to run into a wall and slows down accordingly.Ê The Deebot, on the other hand, runs into walls full-speed consistently.Lack of scheduling options: the Deebot allows you to set a schedule, but only for the same time, every. stinking.Ê day.Ê That's not a typo.Ê While the Roomba 880 lets you pick both day of the week AND specific time per day, the Deebot only allows you to select 1 time, and then runs every day.Ê This sucks.Ê Understand that setting your schedule means you will have a loud vacuum running for 16 hours of your week.Easily stuck: the Deebot needs to be freed regularly.Ê It gets stuck on very low profile, low pile carpets, generally on the corner.Ê The Roomba did not get stuck once in the same places.Design: my wife likes the way the Deebot's shell looks while I prefer the look of the Roomba.Ê However, the digital interface is awful.Ê Simply awful.Ê So awful I needed to type this fact 3 times and am not doneÊ

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It is a great machine. I have been using it for the ...
Review: It is a great machine. I have been using it for the last month. I have a dog that sheds too much and I was going crazy . Now , I only vacuum myself about twice a week. The rest of the time I let IRobot do the job.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Greatest thing since sliced bread!
Review: It gets everywhere we can't, especially under heavy furniture.Ê It picks up all the dog hair, all the dirt from living by the water, and most importantly doesn't get tangled on any of our oriental rugs.Ê Recommended for anyone who can press a button and doesn't like to vacuum.Ê Love it, love it, love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: a bit stupid, but does the job
Review: It frequently gets stuck and runs out of power between the spokes of my office chair, and it spends a stupid amount of time trying to get over a half-inch high threshold between two rooms (outcome depends on angle of approach)--and then turning right around and trying to cross it again, and again, and again. "Turn in a random direction" is clearly a huge part of its programming, which appears stupid but is actually wise, since with purely deterministic programming, a programming error would result in certain areas of the floor consistently being passed over. With randomness, it cannot guarantee that it will cover the entire floor surface in one run, but it doesn't need to, since it can easily run daily and keep the floor clean through small consistent efforts. It does result in cleaner floors, but expect to have to rescue it frequently.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: One Star
Review: it doesn't workcan't even start

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Other than that it works great.
Review: It doesn't pick up bigger crumbs, but instead hits them across the floor.Ê Other than that it works great.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It does great! I like how I can just watch it ...
Review: It does great! I like how I can just watch it work, and have barely any cleaning to do. But its memory isn't so good with remembering the landscape of the rooms.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: It does an excellent job. We have three dogs and the floors are cleaned everyday.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: It does all I expected.Ê It's ability to get in places an ordinary vacuum cannot is a bonus.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Better than Rainbow
Review: It does a great job. My iRobot's name is Scooter.Ê We love Scooter.Ê Way better than our Rainbow vacuum!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It does a great job, but I do not give the five ...
Review: It does a great job, but I do not give the five stars because the inconvenience of the small debris bin

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My love affair with iRobot.Ê I named him Max.
Review: It delights and amazes me.Ê It picks up my Golden Retriever's hair and fluffs the carpet as it cleans.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best robot vacuum
Review: It cleans almost as well as an upright. It is a slightly dirty job cleaning it after every use, but I'm happy that everything it picked up is now in the vacuum instead of on my floor.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great Job
Review: It clean extremely well,Ê i can't not compared it with previous models but this model cleans well and is not noisy, battery last quite some time and recycle bin is size is decent you will not have to empty the bin every pass. Of course that depends on the how dirty is the floor.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not the smartest robot, but does a great job cleaning (based on its bin)
Review: It can't find its docking station even when I place it 1-5 feet away from it, straight out, facing the correct direction. Let alone after its done cleaning (it has no memory of where its been and where its docking station is.. it just hopes it can randomly find it again). But, it does a fantastic job picking up dust and short dog hair off of the hardwood, tile, AND carpet floors. There is a little sensor on top that prevents it (by 1/4 inch) from getting under several pieces of furniture. The total height off the ground, including sensor, is exactly 9 cm (or just over 3.54 inches).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Is my little helper

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Should come with every labrador puppy adoption
Review: Is it possible to write a 5-star review after only 1 days of use? Perhaps.I would have never spent this much on a vacuum, but we got a lab pup last year, and between the black hair she sheds and the two old cats we have that make my allergies worse, we really, really needed to vacuum more regularly. I am not a house cleaning kind of person, especially worse once I started working on my business from home - the housecleaning is never done. After our pup's first spring of shedding her entire coat (you labrador owners know what I'm talking about) the idea of a robotic vacuum was suddenly very enticing.Ê An Amazon search for Roomba brought up the latest 880 model, and the glowing reviews that all mentioned "pet hair" sealed the deal.For all new Roomba 880 owners, please be aware you have to contain your excitement at the unboxing ceremony, b/c it needs to be charged overnight before the first use. Really wish someone (ahem, other reviewers) said as much, but there you are, I've said it now.My place is about 900 sqft, split into two wings between the living room, which is raised 2 steps above the rest of the home, and all else. So we started the fully-charged-overnight Roomba in the carpeted living room. Did I mention I, er, don't really vacuum like I should? So we had to watch the little guy on its first run, since the red Full Bin light lit up every 5-10 minutes about the first 5 times. We ended up dumping the bin about a dozen times on that first run before it finally ran out of batteries, or maybe it finished, not sure. But hey, the living room floor is clean! And it looks like it was done with a proper vacuum by the H (not me, he vacuums more thoroughly than me). Our light beige carpet is beige, and light, again.I have no idea what is so enticing about watching this little guy, but it is. We usually watching a movie or catch a show at night, but not that night. All we did was watch the Roomba make random directions changes that apparently covered every square inch of the living room. Hopefully that fascination is going to fade - the whole point of getting a robot vacuum was so I could do something else while the vacuuming was done.Noise - really not bad, especially compared to a traditional vacuum. We easily had a normal-level conversation while the Roomba was doing its thing in the same room. The best comparison I could find is that the Roomba sounds like an electric pencil sharpener - that hum and whine and some small machinery spinning fast, but not much louder than that. And as soon as the Roomba went under the couch or bed, we could barely hear it at all, as if the upstairs neighbor was vacuuming.Pet reactions - the dog and two cats - all were curious, none scared. My pup, who's an energetic 13 months, couldn't care less about it after her first investigation, and we had to get her to move when the Roomba was heading for her. She got bumped a couple of times as she laid there on the floor with it. My excitable lab pup was totally unexcited by the Roomba. That tells you how non-threatening it is.Ê The cats actually seemed annoyed that they had to move when it came in their direction. In comparison, the cats are super wary of the upright vac, and the pup gets really excited around it, as well as our handheld vacuum.The next morning, used the Roomba in the master bedroom and that was a little more problematic - Roomba was not picking up very well, and decided it was done cleaning even though its batter was still charged and little clumps of puppy fur were scattered in trails all over the floor. This was my opportunity to figure out the Lighthouses/Virtual Walls, which were pretty simple. At least, simple after I read other reviews, not from reading the manual. Easy to set up, forcing the Roomba to clean the center of the room it kept missing. It preferred under the bed for some reason. I set up a "wall" by the bed so it wouldn't go under there (until the puppy knocked over the Lighthouse thingy when I was out of the room, so note that Lighthouses don't work when on its side). As the previous evening, I was emptying the bin frequently, maybe every 15-20 minutes, but it wasn't until I popped out the rollers and removed the spirals of hair in the ends did it start vacuuming properly again. I also cleaned the HEPA filter with the handheld vacuum, as other suggested.So less than 24 hours since its first use, we have all but the last bedroom vacuumed, and it feels good, like I did a ton of work and deserve a treat. Am certainly glad we got it, as we were contemplating hiring a housekeeper to make up for my anti-housework personality. But the Roomba will do for now. And it's cooler to say "Yeah, we got a robot" than to say "Yeah, we got Roomba".

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's like watching a drunken toddler vacuum your house.
Review: Is it just me or is this thing incapable of learning? If this is the best iRobot has to offer, they've got a long way to go.I'm a computer programmer and can imagine some fairly obvious ways to improve the 880's navigation algorithms. It doesn't seem to "learn" your room(s) at all. That could (and should) be accomplished by maintaining a reference map in memory that gets refined over time.Sure, there are always objects that will come and go, but your walls and most of your furniture stay where they are, right? So just imagine a large sheet of graph paper where the Roomba simply records the obstructions it finds. Once developed, the 880 could (and should) create a much more logical and efficient route based on that map.But no, each run is a random series of pinball-like zig-zags. At the end of the hour, we commonly find large areas that went uncleaned. Today, for example, the Roomba spent all of its time in a single part of our main floor. It failed to re-find the bathroom or our laundry room as it has done in the past.This can only be explained by poor programming.Meanwhile, the 880 keeps dragging shoes around by their shoestrings, getting stuck on top of power cables, certain pieces of decor and the legs of one very expensive piece of furniture that we have to remember to put atop a sofa so it won't get damaged.
