When the Roomba encounters these objects, it tries to free itself but it appears to not remember those problem areas and therefore fails to learn from them.Again, this can only be explained by poor programming.We always keep our shoes next to the front door. And whenever we forgot to tuck their shoelaces inside, the 880 will choke on them. What it should be doing instead is to avoid that area after 2 or 3 times. So on that imaginary map, just imagine marking those problem areas with a red "keep-out" sign. Our solution is to purchase a couple of those iRobot Keep-Off mats, and we'll see how that works.One comical anecdote for you: One morning the 880 went into the bathroom and shut the door. My wife said, "maybe its bin is full and it needs to take a dump." To which I replied, "Yeah, it took the accessories brochure in there so it could be a while."Ê :)All in all we love the idea of the Roomba, and the 880 was probably worth waiting for. But we expected to see more adaptive AI from this productÊ especially from a company that also makes military products.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome!
Review: IRobot, Kudos. I was skeptical earlier, but now, I will look at your other home products with serious interest!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Disappointing High-End Robot
Review: iRobot is probably considered within the home robot industry to be the defacto standard of what is best.Ê My purchase of the Roomba 880 in June 2015 however did not meet my expectations based on praises by many reviewers, both within the home robot industry and on sites like Amazon.Ê I had decided to purchase a Roomba as a replacement for my original Neato XV-11 which has served me very well for over five years.Ê After now having the Roomba for six months, I can definitely say that I wish I had listened to my instincts and gone with another Neato.What Ive observed over the last six months:- quieter operation than my XV-11- dirt detection does cause the robot to focus on cleaning soiled areas more- dust bin is adequately large- rollers do not tangle with hair such that the rollers are impeded, however hair does build up within the rollers themselves and does require regular clearing- AeroForce Extraction with AirFlow Accelerator works okay on carpet but does not work well on hard surfaces with small debris, i.e. artificial christmas tree needles- multi-room cleaning is limited to 20 minutes per room and requires Lighthouses; room-to-room navigation and return to base is not reliable.- Virtual Walls do not reliably contain the robot- due to the random cleaning pattern, even after several cleaning cycles in an area, not all of the area will be cleaned- side brush is mostly useless on carpet; works okay on hard surfaces; when not along a wall and on hard surfaces, debris tends to be thrown out of the path of the robot instead of into the cleaning path leaving the debris to maybe be collected on another path- to effectively clean a room I find myself rearranging much of the room to allow the robot to clean, i.e. putting chairs up on tables, moving ottoman, clearing anything on the floor- impact of robot bumper on furniture and other items is strong enough that it can knock items over and/or off of furniture if not a solid pieceAfter six months of regular use I cannot recommend the Roomba 880.Ê I strongly feel that the $700 spent on this robot could have been saved and a much cheaper Roomba.Ê Another Roomba without the Aeroforce Extraction, AirFlow Acceleration, multi-room features would have provided the same experience.Ê Alternatively, and what I wish I had done, is to get another Neato and have a robotic vacuum which actually does clean the house to the point of nearly replacing an upright.Ê In short, the Roomba 880 has been both frustrating and disappointing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Another great product from iRobot!
Review: iRobot has always out top quality products. The Roomba 880 follows tradition. Love the rollers instead of brushes. Easy to program, easy to empty and overall easy to use.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Dust and Hair magnet!
Review: Initially hesitant at the price of the 880, but so far it's worth it.Ê Have had the 880 for less than a week, but it's cleaned all rooms in the house and has picked up an amazing amount dust and dog hair.Ê Was completely surprised by how much hair and dust this picked up from our family room which was vacuumed the day before we let the Roomba loose.Ê The family room is our high traffic room where we spend most of our time and where our dog lays out.Ê We have to constantly vacuum this room and do a carpet cleaning (Hoover MaxExtract cleaner) once every couple of months due to our little furball and foot traffic.Ê We've let the Roomba loose on this room four times now, and it's filled it's bin every time with hair and dust.Ê The carpet looks clean, but it's still pulling up very fine hair and dust.Ê One of the best things about the Roomba is it'll vacuum under our couches and beds, places that are difficult to clean under.We have carpet, hardwood, black granite and dark gray slate floors in different areas of the house and so far there have not been any issues on any of these surfaces.Ê The Roomba has not had a problem rolling over computer power cords and has not sucked up throw rugs either.Ê It has stopped and had to be resarted a few times on stair edges where it went charging towards the stairs and stopped just short of going over the edge. There has been one instance of it going past one of the lighthouses which was in virtual wall mode.Ê Repositioned the lighthouse and it didn't pass it again.Our house is two story, multi-level so moving the Roomba and base from room to room is our mode of operation.Ê Have not had to program the Roomba yet and actually don't see a need to do so since we move it from room to room.With regards to noise, I expected this to be noisier based on some of the reviews, but it's not an issue so far.Ê Granted we don't run this in the room we're using, but even so it's not noisy to the point that it'll drown out conversation or an audio source.Ê It's definitely quieter than both our Miele and Panasonic canister vacs.Complaints?Ê It doesn't do stairs...Ê The only real complaint is that the dirt bin is small, but given the size of the Roomba, making it bigger would mean making the Roomba bigger.Ê Overall considering we don't have to push our vacuums around it's definitely a win.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: this thing is fantastic. However
Review: In theory, this thing is fantastic.Ê However, for $600 I'm actually pretty disappointed with it for several reasons.First, the dirt bin is ridiculously undersized!Ê I have just one dog, a lab who sheds moderately, and I use Roomba every single day.Ê The dirt bin requires emptying every single day.Ê But that isn't the problem.Ê The problem is that the opening is so narrow that the dirty, dusty clump of dog hairÊ NEVER empties out easily, no matter how much I bang it on the garbage can.Ê I either have to stick a finger in to pull the gross chuck of dirt/hair out, or I started using a toothbrush to do this.Ê Either way, it's a messy and gross job.Ê I much preferred my bagless and easy-to-empty regular vacuum bin.Second, the batteries in the lighthouse/wall towers lasted less than 3 months.Ê There is no way to turn these off when not in use, so this is going to get expensive to keep replacing the batteries.Third, Roomba OFTEN gets stuck at the top of our carpeted stairs.Ê It is supposed to be savvy enough to be able to handle this, but my Roomba is apparently a slow learner.Ê And I wipe of the sensors at least twice a week.Ê So I often come home to find a stuck Roomba that only partially cleaned my floor while I was gone.Fourth, and most irritatingly, after less than 3 months of use, the wheels have started making an extremely annoying high-pitched squeaking sound.Ê I took the whole thing about and can't figure out how to fix this.Ê I believe the squeal is coming the tiny motors that drive the wheels, so it's not even something I can fix with WD-40.Ê I hope this is covered under warranty, because I'm going to have to get this serviced, which is really annoying.I do love coming home from work and NOT seeing dog hair sticking up from my carpets like grass (like I used to see every day), but I'm starting to wonder if this Roomba thing is more hassle than helpful.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Make life easier!
Review: In the beginning, I wasn't sure if I liked it.Ê But after using it every morning for about 20 to 30 minutes, the floors are devoid of dog hair and dust!Ê It is so easy and does such a great job, that I haven't used my big vac in a while.Ê I just steam mop every week or 10 days.Ê Initially, I had to empty the bin a lot during the cycle.Ê Now, usually I just empty it, clean the sensor windows and the rollers AFTER it is through.Ê Then it is ready for the next day.Ê I have mostly tile floors and a few area rugs.Ê Very happy with this purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love
Review: In love

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Forgot docking station location....
Review: In less then one year my 880 forgot where it's docking station is after cleaning the room. I'm ticked because now I have to search two rooms on my hands and knees looking for it now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What a remarkable device
Review: If you've never used a robotic vacuum, you'll love how effective and simple it is, and you'll never want to go back. If you used one before, you'll love how durable and easy-to-maintain the 880 is. It can be programmed to clean while you're away, and it gets into tight spaces. The beacons can limit the Roomba to a specific room or region if you like, and it recharges itself when it's finished. It's quite expensive, and it won't clean as deeply as a top-of-the-line upright vacuum, but it's definitely the best robotic vacuum around.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A few tips for pet owners.
Review: If you have indoor pets, use it every day. If you use it less often, you will have to babysit the dust bin every ten minutes. If there is a lot of hair on the floor, here is what happens: The dust bin fills with hair quickly, also, the outlet from the vac in to the dust bin gets clogged with hair. You need to check it every ten minutes in this scenario, empty the bin and un-clog the outlet.Ê The more often you use it, the less hair on the floor, the less you have to check it. We have six dogs and I only use the Roomba when I am here to monitor it. I never fire it up unattended. If you have less hair on the floor, you may be able to use it unattended, or check the bin less often. Our bathrooms are pretty hair free, so I stick it in there, fire it up, shut the door, and go get it in 15 minutes. It won't get clogged or need monitoring in that scenario. Even checking it often, it is less work than hand vacuuming. Our floors have never been cleaner! We used to wait until the floors were pretty disgusting before vacuuming and dust mopping, so we lived with nasty floors most of the time. Now the floors are almost spotless all the time. Having clean floors is very satisfying and reduces your background level of stress and angst, this is the best feature of the Roomba. Another interesting side effect is that since the floors are so clean, we find ourselves keeping the entire house tidier and more organized to "go with" the clean floors! My sister has one with bristle brushes while the 880 has the non bristled extractors. She tells me she has to clean those brushes a lot, this unit does not have that issue. It's worth every penny.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Poor pet hair performance
Review: If you have dogs that shed - this unit is worthless.Ê I have a 645 and it's fantastic.Ê I got this one and am thoroughly disappointed.Ê It does not pick up german shepherd hair long or short.Ê The full bin indicator is fooled by pet hair.Ê The improvements actually make this unit much worse than the 600 series.Ê You may have to pick hair out of brushes - but at least the 600 series will pick up pet hair very well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: WRETCHED MACHINE!!
Review: If you have a combination of hardwood floors and area rugs, DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME BUYING THIS PRODUCT!Ê I had to rescue this wretched machine 5 times in the same room as it got caught in the transition area between the area rug and the hardwood floor. And don't get me started about the machine finishing a room...It never did!! It would go off and leave one room and start another. Neat idea but frustrating to watch and more frustrating to untangle it from cords and tree skirts.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best gift I have ever bought for myself!!!
Review: If you are on the fence about buying an iRobot vacuum, don't waste another minute and get one asap!! You will be doing yourself the biggest favor!!!Ê Also, if you're contemplating splurging on the newest model, the 880, I would highly recommend it.Ê I got the 770 model right before the 880 one came out...and boy its great!Ê Both clean well, but the 880 cleans quieter.Ê Best of all, it requires less on my part because the bristles of the older model are a pain in the butt to clean and maintain.Ê Now, I keep my 770 upstairs and the 880 downstairs.The only cons about the 880 to me are that...1.Ê The red empty bin light seems to come on faster and more frequently than the 770...and it constantly lights up even when there is barely anything in the bin.Ê Even after I have cleaned the filter and cleared the extractors, the red light sometimes is still on and I will just turn the unit off then turn it back on to get rid of the red annoying light.2.Ê When you empty the bin, most times there will be dust or debris that was halfway from the extractors and halfway into the bin...but the opening of the bin motion causes the dust to break up and fall onto the ground....so half the time before the unit stops cleaning, there is still dirt that didn't make it to the bin yet....so you end up with a little mess every time you try to empty the bin.Ê I do not have that problem with the 770.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: From clean sweep to Star Wars, it's a big hit.
Review: If you are looking for a robot cleaning tool that performs a clean sweep, then this is it.Ê Now, I'm not going to say that it will match one of the highly rated vacuum cleaners that you push, pull, and use with a multitude of different instruments.Ê It doesn't.Ê But it is a good labor saving tool. The Roomba 880 (or other circular type robot) will not get in a corner,...it just can't.Ê It's ROUND.Ê However, we run the 880 every 2 - 3 days in the living room, kitchen, bedrooms, bathrooms, and hallway on the main floor.Ê Sometimes we use the barriers that come with it to limit the space it cleans, and sometimes we just let it roam freely.Ê It cleans acceptably and keeps the use of other vacuum cleaners to a minimum.Ê Just make sure that the Roomba is emptied after every use, that you pick up / move any electrical cords, and that you know how to set the timing device.Ê It can be disconcerting to be wakened at 3:00 AM with the Roomba making its rounds.Ê Also, if you have an alarm system that senses movement, that might be a problem, though our system has not been set off as yet by the Roomba.Ê Just something to think about.Ê When the Roomba begins to run out of electricity it will go immediately to it's docking station,...just like one of the space ships in Star Wars.Ê This model is expensive, but it certainly put a smile on my wife's face.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love our Roomba 880...
Review: If anyone would have told me I could be a hero for buying a vacuum cleaner, I wouldn't have believed it. The Roomba 880 is simply awesome. It works on a programmed schedule. Handles pet hair well and covers our entire floor. Moves amazingly well from hardwood to rugs to carpet. If a room doesn't need cleaning or isn't picked up you just shut the door or use one of the virtual barriers. They work well.You do need to make sure loose items like shoe laces and blind pulls are picked up but it is far more tolerant of obstacles than I thought it would be as it moved from room to room. The bin is small but that reflects its size. This is a great product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I am largely satisfied with its performance
Review: I've used this robot vacuum cleaner regularly for 10 months now.Ê Except for its few shortcomings, I am largely satisfied with its performance.Ê I think that its positives, especially the fact that it needs very little supervision, far outweigh its negatives.Ê First the negatives:1.Ê Sometimes it will return to its docking station for a recharge after completing a run.Ê Other times it simply stops in place and must be placedÊ directly in front of the docking station and ordered to dock.Ê Even then it will sometimes wander off and start cleaning again.Ê I think that Roomba's docking smarts need some refinement.2.Ê It is not designed to properly clean a wood floor in a carpeted corridor with a band of wood on each side narrower than Roomba.Ê In that case it leans at an angle from the elevated carpet to the wood floor and is unable to make full contact with the wood floor.Ê I am then forced to roll up the carpet so that Roomba has the room to vacuum the wood floor thoroughly.3.Ê I have 1" diameter bent steel sled chairs.Ê Instead of bouncing off the the sled base as it does off of larger objects, Roomba will sometimes try to cross the base and will get hung up and cry for help.Ê Its object sensors should be more sensitive to such smaller objects and not try to climb or cross them.Some owners have complained about the noise generated by Roomba as it goes about its business.Ê Since it's much quieter than a conventional vacuum cleaner, I don't mind the noise level at all.Ê Robot vacuum cleaners with a spinning brush are all unable to reach into about the last inch of an interior corner.Ê That's why its best to quickly sweep out interior corners with a small whisk broom before letting Roomba loose.Ê To get the best results out of Roomba, it's important to do a bit of furniture movement so that Roomba has room to squeeze between and behind things.Ê Roomba takes much longer to vacuum a room than it would take to do so manually with a conventional machine.Ê I see that as a positive feature, because, as random as it appears to be, Roomba will repeatedly visit all areas of a room from multiple directions.Ê In the end, it appears to do a more thorough job of vacuuming than would a bored human operator.Ê I don't mind cleaning out the dust compartment after every workout.Ê This chore is a good way to get a sense of how much dust and hairs Roomba has picked up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and I really like it, although it is a bit high maintenance
Review: I've used it for over 6 months, and I really like it, although it is a bit high maintenance.Ê Does a great job picking up cat litter and cleaning carpets, but does need emptying and cleaning after a couple of runs to keep it working at its best.Ê It's really nice to be able to set it up to clean an area while you are busy elsewhere.Works great cleaning under beds and furniture with at least 4" clearance.I've had to change the HEPA filter out about every month (I run mine almost daily in a ~120 sq ft area around a litter box), so it can be pricey if you stick with the OEM filters.Ê I've had no problems using cheaper replacements, but they likely are not true HEPA filters.Ê It's not a big concern for me, since I bought it primarily to pick up cat litter.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A cleaner house for less effort, but not worth the price due to too much inattention to its design.
Review: I've used it for 2 weeks now, and it's strengths and weaknesses have become quite apparent.Like other reviewers have noted, strengths include1) it doesn't procrastinate cleaning, and sticks to its programmed schedule and I do procrastinate, so my house is cleaner with it. It picks up a surprising amount of something (worn out fibers, lint, hair, dust from the carpet, but not that much from solid floors). But, it's getting something from running vs. nothing from when I procrastinate. That's a big plus.2) it gets under baseboards, couches, the bed with a vengeance, and I basically don't do them well if at all, and so dust bunnies have headed for the hills.3) I have it do smaller rooms, like the bathroom or den, by tossing it in, closing the door, and coming back for it 5-10 minutes later, and the throw rugs, and under the couch and behind the door are all clean and neat, and it's overcome my procrastination again, and so the house is cleaner still.4) it's cute and fun to watch if you're bored.5) it's relatively quiet, enough so that I can watch tv without turning up the volume.Ê Ok, my hearing is not great, and I have the volume up aways already, but it's way quieter than my Hoover.The minuses include1) it misses spots, sometimes small, sometimes half of an entire room; the light house seems to make it skip large chunks of rooms and go in to neighboring ones instead.2) it doesn't map out space at all, goes over the same spot repeatedly while missing the small or big chunks3) it uses up a lot of time.Ê With it missing a lot it takes ~1 hour to do maybe 1000 sq. ft of contiguous space (LR, DR, kitchen), and getting almost everything it takes 2.5 hours.Ê I can vacuum and dust mop the same area in about 10-15 minutes.4) it gets lost and can't find it's way back to the base sometimes, without the light house. And with the light house it seems to get confused and has just done 'doughnuts' where it spins around 360's incessantly trying to figure out where the light house is and can't 'get a fix' and so stays lost.5) when the dust bin light is on saying it's full - it keeps running.6) one time the entire dust bin fell out while it was running - I thought I had clicked it back in to place after the prior cleaning, but odds are I hadn't. And the machine kept running with the bin sitting on the floor, and the gadget spewing dust and dirt back in to the room. THAT is the ultimate in stupid design.Bottom line: it's not the Jetson's Rosie, and instead it needs a fair amount of supervision.Overall, if it cost $250. I'd give it 5 stars.Ê For $350. I'd give it 4-4.5 stars. For $700. it gets 3 stars. Cadillacs get judged on a higher standard than Pintos or the like. For big bucks, I expect near perfection attention to detail.The serious details Roomba didn't attend to: having no 'interlock' to prevent it from running without a dust bin, or when it's full, no adequate room mapping system, light houses that don't work well if at all, and it's subsequent inefficient use of time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Outstanding for daily carpet cleaning w/ pets
Review: I've owned 3 Roomba's, and this is by far my favorite.Ê Much better for carpets with animal hair.Ê Keeping the previous ones free of binding hairs on previous models took several minutes of maintenance for each cleaning (2 dogs + 2 cats).Ê Cleaning the rollers on this one is a piece of cake, and it never binds up.Ê My only issue is that the battery has recently stoppedÊ charging, which I'm hoping is just a battery problem and not a robot issue.Ê The troubleshooting steps from the iRobot website haven't helped.Ê I have a trouble ticket into iRobot right now--waiting to hear back from them.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Remarkable difference from the earlier versions
Review: I've only had this robot for 2 weeks.Ê I had an earlier version several years ago and was not impressed.Ê Therefore, I was hesitant to buy this one.Ê Remarkable difference,Ê love the rollers compared to the brushes much easier to maintain.Ê It hasn't got stuck, always find it at its base.Ê I clean 2-3 rooms a day.Ê Works as advertised.Ê I have a small air compressor that blows at 25psi.Ê I use it to clean the filter and dirt bin.Ê When I hold the filter up to a light I can still see thru it and it still looks new.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Can you give 6 Stars?!
Review: I've only had him for a week but it could be the greatest invention EVER!Ê To set the scene:Ê I have 2 very hairy golden retrievers and live in a warm climate - 2 hairy dogs + warm climate = LOTS OF SHEDDING!Ê I mean tumbleweed shedding!Ê To add to the issue, I am both an asthmatic on fairly serious meds and am allergic to pretty much everything including but not limited to oxygen.Ê We have a maid who comes and cleans twice a month.Ê She is here for about 4 hours (1900 sf) and does a thorough job.Ê I always feel better for the first couple of days after she has been here.Roomba arrived and we set him up to charge.Ê We live in a one floor beach house that has a one step drop down in a small area that leads to the back.Ê Roomba has navigated our living room, bar room, hallways, kitchen and one of the bedrooms (we keep him out of the guest room).Ê The very first day, Roomba (still haven't named him yet) did a full cleaning and it took about and hour and a half.Ê His receptacle was full at about the 1/2 way point.Ê Fortunately I was home and I emptied him.Ê I was curious to see if the next day he would fill up given the previous day's cleaning.Ê The next day I came home and Roomba had completed his task and receptacle was only 1/2 full.He gets under our bed and our living room furniture with ease.Ê The most important thing we have found is that he is very gentle with our walls and furniture but he still gets right up to them.Ê We have leather restoration hardware chairs, sofas, and ottomans. . . . . no issues with dings at all.On day three, I noticed a marked difference in my breathing and "stuffiness."Ê Today is day 5 and I am LOVING HIM!!!!I will happily update in the future if it warrants, but as of today, I am screaming at the top of the world, BUY A ROOMBA 880!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... had the 880 for about 2 weeks now and love it! Our home is all hardwood flooring or ...
Review: I've had the 880 for about 2 weeks now and love it!Ê Our home is all hardwood flooring or tile. The roomba has not scratched our flooring or the wood thresholds while transitioning from wood to tile.Ê It does better than I expected on our area rugs, but I still have to vacuum those with my dyson (expected with 2 dogs).Ê Good battery life. It is quieter than anticipated during operation.Ê The only complaint would be that it scratches too easily. A part of the roomba wedged its way under my couch somehow and was scratched heavily on the faceplate as it tried to escape a few days after buying it. The placement pieces of all kinds are available for a good price though.This is not meant to replace your normal vacuuming,especially if you have pets that shed.Ê It does a great job on a daily basis, allowing me to cut down on dry mopping multiple times per day.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The best Roomba yet
Review: I've had several Roombas.Ê They all did a decent job, but were a big pain to clean.Ê I have two dogs, one sheds like crazy and frequently I have two four legged houseguests that are even worse.Ê With all four here I have to vacuum every day, mostly carpet. It takes maybe two minutes to clean the 880.Ê I concentrate on the master bedroom and the living room.Ê Very happy with this product.Ê I did try the Neato, but it had electronics problems, but they did replace them, 6 or 7 times.Ê I finally got sick of going to Fed Ex every few weeks and went back to Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love this thing beyond all reason
Review: I've had my 880 for about 6 weeks now.Ê I use it 2 or 3 times per week as my giant Doberman is a shedding machine, plus I live in FL, so the sand grit he tracks in daily is an added nightmare.Ê I love this thing beyond all reason.Ê I have gained back hours of time by not having to vacuum by hand so often.Ê I use it manually rather than scheduling because it's easier for me to break off the house into sections...I clear the obstacles out of the way and use the lighthouses so it does a room or two at a time.Ê It has only gotten stuck once, tangled in some smaller cords that I now know have to be up off the floor.Ê One other time, I noticed it kept leaving a little pile of dirt when I picked it up and the bin was nearly empty despite knowing the floors had plenty of dog hair on them that was now gone.Ê Very odd.Ê Discovered that long human hair had gotten wrapped around the roller bars so they weren't turning and tossing dirt into the bin.Ê It was all crammed up into the cavity behind the roller bars, thus falling when I picked it up.Ê Once the long hair removal restored free rolling, no more issue.Ê I clean the bin and bang dust out of the filter on every use, so no issues with bin size or reduced air flow due to clogged filter.Ê The lighthouses are a bit of a mystery, sometimes being the virtual wall they're set to be and sometimes not.Ê Not that big a deal since I'm home when it's running.Ê I have tried to make sense of the random pattern, but there doesn't seem to be any...guess I don't really care as long as the whole room gets cleaned and it does. I was going to name it Mrs. Hughes after my favorite character on Downton Abbey, but no woman would ever clean in such a random fashion, so it became Carson instead.Ê :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I've had it for two weeks. I'm not sure ...
Review: I've had it for two weeks.Ê I'm not sure about it.Ê It only runs an hour and then returns for recharging.Ê One hour is not long enough to do the floor especially since it goes over the same spots over and over again and misses others.Ê It does small rooms really well.Ê It picks up really well.Ê Our floors are very clean (no shoes allowed) and it still picks up dust as can be seen in the filter.Ê The haphazard pattern it use is perplexing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Helpful but needlessly cleans low traffic walls repeatedly
Review: I've had it for three weeks and I have tiled floors and two cats. I also use it for only two rooms about 450sq.ft total. It definitely helps pick up a 1/4 bin of cat hair, dander, etc per day. But it still leaves behind some debris at the bottom of my feet.While observing it, it needlessly over-cleans the same perimeter 4+ times, wasting battery and it does not go to the places I want it to go. As I am writing this, I have left it on for about an hour and it has yet to clean the area under my feet. It has already wanted to dock. When you think about it, I would have been done using a regular vacuum and covered hard to reach spots like the corners and walls. It does not seem capable of adequately cleaning more than 2 rooms before it wants to dock.I've seen videos comparing coverage in one room vs other products and while I don't disbelieve it, people will miss the details. It might cover all spots, but on many high traffic spots, it goes over it only once, while it goes over many low traffic spots like the wall needlessly over and over and over and over again. It also may not cover all walls with the brushed side.This leads to the other problem with having only one side brush. I've seen so many instances where multiple brushes would be effective. I've seen it clean perimeters / walls with the brushless side and it never comes back to clean that area with the brushed side.It also scratches itself pretty good on the sides and bottom on the first use. So it would be odd to return it if you're not satisfied.But, when I'm not home, it helps eliminate a lot of cat hair and debris from my feet for the most part. It's also quieter than what I've read and seen from various videos online. I can still let it run when I'm in the room doing work. As much as I complain about it, it's probably the best out there and helps a lot on LIGHT jobs. The price definitely hurts.Note, I've never used any other robot vacuum as a comparison.UPDATE: after six months of using it, I spilled baby bird food (powder) on my tiled floor. The vac does not have enough suction to clean powder in the grout. Even after several passes, it does not clean the mess. I think a brush is needed. Also, the rubber bumpers around the edge of the unit eventually wears off on your furniture. My leather furniture has rubber marks all along the side and my speaker grill is worn.But, customer service is excellent.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Loving it so far.
Review: I've had it for about a month and its really working out for my relatively small New York apartment.I've been trying to gingerly warm my Roomba up to the task of cleaning the apt, not sure of how cautious I need to be.Ê For example, I started by putting my curtains which brush against the floor, up and off the ground, just in case the Roomba were to ingest the bottom and then try to rip them off the wall.Ê After watching it a few times I realized that didn't seem to be a concern, and now I don't bother - curtains are still up on the wall.It does have a way with cords, however, but that only inspires me to have better cable management, so it actually works out well.I have a tripod lamp, however, and it won't seem to play well with those precarious legs - I've put a heavy book near the tripod, which seems to keep the Roomba at bay - clever thinking like this seems to get around most issues.I also have a new jute rug.Ê Haven't owned some crappy rugs in the past that always shed unbelievable amounts, I finally spent a bit more in the hopes that it wouldn't shed as much, if at all.Ê However, every time the Roomba goes over the rug, the bin gets filled with rug-fluff very quickly.Ê I THINK, that its getting better - the Roomba is managing to return to its dock without a full bin more than before - but its something I'll keep an eye on.Ê So to recap with a future buyer, a new rug might limit the Roomba's practicality until it stops shedding.Lastly, only one piece of furniture that I own seems to make the Roomba get stuck - it happens to have a cross-member at PRECISELY the right height for the Roomba to wedge itself in.Ê When it does, I simply have to extricate the Roomba and return it to its dock.Ê Not the end of the world.Ê However, I've taken both of the virtualwalls and placed them between the legs of the piece of furniture the Roomba gets stuck on, underneath it so they aren't as obvious, and the frequency with which it gets stuck there has reduced dramatically.All in all, a great way for a clean-but-lazy person to stay both clean and lazy.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Garbage. Can't be relied on to work consistently.
Review: I've had 2 Roomba 880s now and they both do the same damn thing. Every 5th or 6th cleaning cycle in my tiny 450' apartment the 880 gets stuck in the last room and keeps going around in circles until it runs out of power. I know there is a problem as soon as I see that the "dock" light is on an this idiotic piece of garbage repeatedly (10-20 times) goes up to the lighthouse and, instead of crossing over and finding it's way back to the docking station, turns around and goes right back into the room. It does this over and over again until the battery light comes on and it runs out of power (invariably in the most inconvenient spot possible under a drawer or the bed). I've already replaced this piece of crap once and the new one does exactly the same thing. It's no surprise that this company is producing garbage sinceÊ it's a subsidiary of Bose which is a company that spends massive resources on a marketing campaign designed to mislead people into believing that it's substandard speakers are superior.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Can't say enough...
Review: I've got 2 dogs...and this little magic dude has saved my relationship with them.Ê Well, not to that extreme...but it will pick up their hair like crazy.Ê Maintenance couldn't be any easier as well with the rubber rollers.Ê I run it 3 times a week, and I dump the bin every time.Ê Once a week, I dust off the filter...and once a month, I take my air compressor with the blow gun tip and give the whole thing a good dust out.Ê The designers really must have had some trouble with some folks in the past, because they've color coded (if it's yellow - press it, and whatever part will unlatch with no tools required), shaped, and diagrammed everything on the parts that need to come apart.Ê I think they dummy-proofed dummy-proofing.Ê But it's great because I can break it down and clean it in less than a minute.I've had it since March of '15, and the only issue I've ever had with it was the battery not charging.Ê Not sure if it was the battery or the charter or what - but this is how the support/warranty call went.Ê Me "Hi, my Roomba 880 isn't charging."Ê Tech, "We're sorry to hear that.Ê Try...(X)....and if that doesn't work, try...(Y)... Did that fix the problem?"Ê Me, "No, it still won't charge."Ê Tech, "Well we're gonna go ahead and send you a brand new unit.Ê It should arrive in a couple of days.Ê I'm emailing you a shipping label to print, so when the new one comes in, just box up the old one and send it back to us.Ê Will that work for you?"Ê Me, "ummm, of course that works for me!".Ê Amazing.Ê Other companies can learn from this.Ê For that alone makes it worth 5 stars.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... site) for a couple of years and I was amazed how good a job it did
Review: I've been using the Roomba 660 (bought it used off an auction site) for a couple of years and I was amazed how good a job it did, but "Vic the Vac" lost his sense of direction and was crashing into everything, so time to up-grade. this new Roomba is worlds above the older model, "Jedger Hoover" has picked up way more than the 600 model even with the Aerovac feature on it. It needed the bin cleaned out every day for about a week, now after three weeks it only needs dumped about every three days. Still amazed how clean the floors are and how this is also keeping the dust down in the whole house. I can't recommend this enough, save yourself time and energy and have this robotÊ clean up after your.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I would love to have a robot vacuum if the energy consumption ...
Review: I've been evaluating this model because of all the positive reviews on Amazon. A friend owns this model and kindly loaned it to me for evaluation. I can see where the enthusiasm comes from but I'm not convinced. The robot is limited by its battery power supply. The overwhelming power design is consumed by its mobility. In other words, the robot spends most of its energy walking rather than vacuuming. The vacuum is so weak that it will repeatedly go over dust or dirt that the weakest vacuum picks up at first try. In my opinion, the robot is not balanced in energy consumption for vacuuming and mobility.The majority of positive reviewers are probably sold by a full dust bin. Yes, if you let the robot runs continually, it will get the bin full. Therefore, it gives the user a satisfying moment after a duty cycle. However, the bin is small or tiny. I even suspect that it's intentionally made tiny to elicit such reactions: to see the robot is constantly harvesting dirt. A psychological benefit mostly drives the positive review. In reality, the users have to keep the robot running probably daily to keep a house clean. The labor for other vacuum goes to clean this machine and maintenance with so much frequency of running the robot.I would love to have a robot vacuum if the energy consumption for actually vacuuming and walking is balanced. The suction should pick up dirt apparent and please give me a bigger bin.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I've always been skeptical of this concept, but now ...
Review: I've always been skeptical of this concept, but now am sold.Ê I should have gotten one of these years ago.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Like the new design
Review: I'm using this everyday and very surprised to see how much pet hair it picks up everyday! Like the new design, new brush design and easy cleaning.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's worth it!!!
Review: I'm so glad I opted for this model! After having the lower Pet Series model with the brushes for several years it was worth the upgrade! Unbelievable how well it works!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent for hairy dog owners!
Review: I'm really impressed with this little guy so far. We bought the "bells and whistles" model as we have a super hairy Golden Retriever. We just moved into a new house with all wood floors so after we unpacked I set the Roomba going to test it out. I wasn't expecting too much as we had only just moved in and the house was spotless. I'm consistently surprised at just how much hair and dust this picks up! It really is amazing. I just set it going in the morning or when I am heading out somewhere and I come back to see that it is full. Even when the floor looks super clean it manages to find dust and hair. If you have a hairy dog I really recommend getting one of these.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does a great job
Review: I'm quite impressed with this little guy.Ê The first few times I ran it, I was shocked at how much dust and dirt was on a carpet I had recently cleaned with a normal upright vacuum cleaner.Ê Now it runs a daily cycle while I am at work through the rooms I use the most.Ê For the rest of the house I simply move it and run cleaning cycles more occasionally.My upright vacuum is now mainly used for spots the Roomba can't reach, and for cleaning the Roomba himself.Ê I'd definitely recommend using a vacuum to clean the filter (drawing air across the surface, not through it, or you could damage the filter from the pressure difference).Ê Tapping the filter clean is a sure-fire way to kick a lot of dust into the air.One other point of note - Roomba really helps you keep your living space clean in two ways.Ê The first is obvious, by cleaning the floors.Ê The second, though, is almost more powerful - it helps instill good cleaning practices in its humans.Ê What do I mean by that?Ê Well, if you have a cluttered room, you're going to clean it before Roomba can do its job.Ê Once you see just how useful Roomba is and just how much dust it's gathering, you're going to want to run Roomba regularly - preferably daily through the rooms you use the most.Ê You will quickly get in the habit of checking daily for clutter and dealing with it.Ê That's a good habit, and it tends to spread out from there - now that you've got the floor under control and spend only a brief time keeping it that way, clutter or dust above the floor seems more noticeable and you now have the time to actually tackle it.Ê If you feel like you're always falling behind at keeping the house clean, this can really help you get caught up and instill the habits you need to stay caught up.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRobot, iHappy!
Review: I'm not sure there is much to say here.Ê You plug in the dock, you put the Roomba on it and charge it up.Ê You push the Clean button and just get out of its way.Ê I'm not sure how much area this will cover on a charge, but I believe it would be pretty large.When I first got the vacuum, it appeared that it just cleans in some random pattern, but then it also occurred to me that I really didn't care how it cleaned as long as it did the cleaning and I didn't have to.Ê We live in a 3 story house and obviously it won't go up and down stairs (Thank goodness!). But I can grab it by it's convenient handle, take it down to the family room, turn it on and close the door.Ê I come back later to a clean room.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's ok
Review: I'm not really impressed.Ê It's ok says it all.Ê It tends to miss spots and not pick up all that well.Ê It will skip a bunch of stuff and leave the room so I find myself putting it back where I want it to clean.Ê A lot like my kids.Ê For the cost I would prefer that it did a better job but since we have it, we use it.Ê The concept is great and it does pick up a lot of stuff, just not as much as I would like it to.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I'M IN LOVE WITH IROBOT. IT IS REALLY MARVELOUS!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works great
Review: I'm happy with it! You can schedule it for the day of the week and times, which is neat.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I'm amazed at this technology
Review: I'm amazed at this technology. I have 2 Pugs that shed like no other dog I've ever seen. The Roomba does a great job of picking up pet hair. The side brush is brilliant for cleaning along walls. The bin fills up quickly and typically needs to be emptied before cleaning is done. But this was expected. Gets around chairs, furniture, under cabinets, over area rugs etc with no issue. Should have bought one of these years ago.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's True!
Review: I'd read about how much pet hair this picks up, but you really have to see it to believe it. I only received my Roomba last week, and I'm in the process of "conditioning" my carpeted rooms. It's going to take several times before I'll see a cleaner bin. This is going to save me a lot of time I think the cat will be able to tell the difference, as well. Hopefully, this will help her hyperesthesia condition. If only it did stairs...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Three Stars
Review: I wrote a review note in the return package.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Hire a house keeper instead.
Review: I would not recommend this to wool carpet owners.Ê The robot 880 has shredded 2 different hand woven wool rugs.Ê The 'dust sensor' registers the carpet as dirty and it keeps going over the same spot again and again.Ê Furthermore the 'brushless' nature of the rollers are rubber and it just yanks up the fibers.Ê The reason I'm giving it a three and not a one is that hand woven wool rugs aon top of hardwoods is probably not the norm for people.Ê I does a fair job on the hardwoods picking up the majority of the dust and does a good job on standard residential synthetic carpet.Ê this is not a replacement for regularly cleaning but keeps the dust bunnies down.Ê The external room sensors to exclude or include rooms are challenging to set up as well is the vacuum.Ê Doesn't seem to me like it would be a big stretch to include wi fi and a more friend app.Ê I would not recommended this purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: cleans the floor better than my previous vacuum
Review: I would give it 5 stars if the remote worked. I know it is a robot and it does do a great job if left to clean by itself. but at times I need to just clean specific areas were SPOT clean does not help. I have to keep the remote perfectly pointed in a straight line directly at the roomba or else it stops.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Surprisingly pleased with this purchase!
Review: I work full time and have hardwood and carpeted floors.Ê Although I have not taken time yet to actually program the Roomba 880 for regular cleaning, I find I have been using it almost every day when I am getting ready for work.Ê I have a clean house and no kids, but I do have a non-shedding dog. The best thing about it is that it goes under my tables, chairs, beds and couches and picks up the dust bunnies. It does go over my fringed area rugs easily, and if it gets "stuck" after a minute or so, it gets "unstuck" and continues on its' way.Ê When I have company, after they leave, I close the door to the bedroom (carpeted) and let it work.Ê It covers EVERY inch, except maybe the deep corners --Ê I can see the "tracks".Ê The other really great feature is that I have baseboard heating and the Roomba is able to run along the heaters and sweep out the dust underneath them for vacuuming.Ê I like it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Comparison between Roomba 880 and Neato BotVac from a long time robot vacuum user
Review: I won't cover the basics of what a robot will / won't do in general, but I've been a long time user of an older model Roomba 500 series, looking for a new toy. I bought the BotVac first and then decided to try the Roomba 880 later after being dissatisfied with some aspects of the BotVac.-- The short version --Best robot vacuum I've EVER tested, and I've tested a lot. The only concern I would have is picking up flat and heavy objects from hardwood -- the new rollers don't seem to work as well as brushes for hardwood surfaces, though they more than make up for this in convenience. This is the first robot where I truly consider it "virtually maintenance free".4/5 stars only for price. Although it's superior, I don't think it's so superior that it commands nearly double the average price for a robot vacuum. I have found the Neato BotVac's deliver close to the Roomba's performance for far less cost.-----When I went from the Roomba 595 to the Botvac 65, I thought that Botvac beat the crap out of the Roomba. The Roomba would often get stuck under chairs and spend 20 minutes spinning around freeing itself. With no lighthouses, it was very hard to convince the Roomba to thoroughly clean a 2 bed 2 bath apartment. It would either prematurely return to the base without touching half the place, or try to clean too much and die before getting back to the base, etc. And the brush/roller got so dirty and worn with just a few weeks of usage that I was spending more time cleaning gross dusty brushes that I almost wished to just manually vacuum my place with the Dyson, where I wouldn't be so hands-on with dirt.Anyway, now that I have a Roomba 880, I'm realizing that there is a HUGE difference between the low and high end Roombas. The virtual lighthouses make a huge difference in the Roomba's ability to cover separate areas of your place reliably with every run. The unit is quieter and moves faster than the older Roombas. The rear cliff sensors give it a new "trick" -- reversing out of an obstacle. That seems to free itself from a chair much faster than randomly spinning-and-bumping. Of course, the improvement with the AeroForce rollers are well documented and I mostly agree -- with one exception. They seem worse on hardwood floors and other non-carpeted surfaces. The Roomba 880 had a very hard time picking up oatmeal flakes off a hardwood surface while the 595 and Botvac had no issue. Since the thread is about Botvac vs Roomba 880, I'll just talk about the advantages of each:NOISE:Roomba is quieter, by far. I can't tell if the Neato has better suction or just a louder motor.CLEANING PERFORMANCE:Roomba wins on carpet, by far. It seems to get far more dust out of the carpet than Neato does. I remember the first day I got the 880, it picked up 3 bins full of stuff, and the BotVac had been running every day.The jury is still out on hardwood, but I think the Botvac wins here. Neither is fantastic though -- both have a tendency of flinging/scattering dirt around on hardwood, and lacking the suction to pick up heavier things like oatmeal or pebbles.CLEANING SPEED:It's actually more or less a draw, which surprised me. I tested by sprinkling oatmeal (ok, I bought too much oatmeal) over the living room carpet and measuring how long it took until it was basically all picked up. It was actually around the same time.The Neato's weakness is that it first spends a lengthy amount of time circling a perimeter before zipping back and forth in quick strokes. The latter is fast, but the former acts like a drunken Roomba stumbling around with no grace (more on that later)OBSTACLE AVOIDANCE:HUGE advantage to Roomba, but specifically the 880. The Roomba 595 was not any better than the Neato BotVac, but the 880 is a TON better. My reason for buying the 880 was mainly because I usually found the Neato stuck on something. Its "D" shape causes it to get stuck or flung off a ground when it pinches itself under a chair leg and attempts to spin. The laser turret also leads to it getting pinched under low clearance furniture. It also catapults itself off Poang chairs, and basically gets stuck on any loose article of clothing.The Roomba is not invincible, but it gets around the house almost perfectly for a month. I've only gotten it stuck once.My torture test for this is a bathroom with 2 loose towels on the ground and a Poang chair. The Neato lasts maybe 2 minutes here before dying. The Roomba runs on average for 15 to 20 minutes, and it's almost always getting stuck on the towel that kills it. But it conquers the towel trap 19 times out of 20.Note that this is ESPECIALLY bad for Neato because it spends the first part of its cleaning cycle circling the perimeter of the room where it tends to find the most obstacles. Nothing is more disheartening than to come home to a robot that seems to have only gotten 5 minutes into its cleaning cycle.NAVIGATION:Draw. If it weren't for lighthouses, Neato would win. But "BotVision" has its downsides:- Once in a while it "forgets" to do a large chunk of your room or forgets to do a room altogether. It's rare but it happens.- Inefficient planning, ironically. It partitions rooms into 10-by-10ft squares, and cleans those squares in seemingly random order, including bouncing back and forth down a hallway between two rooms to do different parts. I call it "showing off". It's fun to watch but it is wasting maybe 25% of its charge in transit.- Prematurely declares areas off limits due to vision. It cannot cope with things like bed skirts and prematurely rules them out as off-limits areas. Once in a while it accidentally manages to back itself under the bedskirt and then gets "trapped" in there forever.- No dirt sensor makes it one-shot for bigger messes. My biggest messes tend to be popcorn crumbs near the sofa, which the Roomba(s) do an excellent job of recognizing via Dirt Detect and really getting that area clean. The Neato only knows how to make one pass across it.- Somewhat sensitive to movement / room changes. You gotta get out of the house. If you walk near it, it will avoid you like an obstacle and possibly cause it to not clean that area. If you open or close doors, or even slightly move furniture around, it can get very upset/lost.Roomba without lighthouses is pretty horrible for a large floorplan or multiple rooms. Even though you think with random walking it would eventually achieve full coverage, IT DOES NOT. There's various features (mainly obstacles and curved walls) that seem to be Roomba Black Holes and lure it into a trap. The most common one in my place is trash can -> wall hug -> dining table, spend 20 minutes bumping around the chairs.At least with a lighthouse, it knows to get out of there after covering that area once. Without lighthouses, it repeatedly gets lured into doing that instead of cleaning the rest of the place.MAINTENANCE:The Roomba wins hands down. A month into daily or twice daily usage, there's almost no wear visible on either the rollers or the spinning brush. The Neato's combo brush is pretty beat up and still has some hair clinging to it that I can't get out. The Neato's spinner is really worn and looks like a toothbrush needing to be replaced. It seems to dig that spinner deep into the carpet which frays and twists the spinner bristles itself.Even emptying the bin is way easier on the roomba. Tap the bottom against the trash can to free lint from the filter, then open the door and just dump it. The Neato requires removal of the filter which almost always results in a plume of dust being released, and the dirt clings to the filter which is really hard to remove without a vacuum. I always make a mess emptying the BotVac and getting the filter clean.AESTHETICS / OTHER:Random thoughts here:- The Roomba is infuriating to watch. Accept that it's random movement and statistically will get that crumb it missed by an inch. It's like saying you're so close to winning the lottery because your number was 1 off. It doesn't matter if it's 1 or 10 off, it's all random.- The Neato leaves a much more satisfying pattern on your carpet that says "freshly vacuumed". The Roomba leaves random criss cross marks and the odd circle here andÊ

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I wish I would have bought this years ago! ...
Review: I wish I would have bought this years ago!Ê My floors are always clean and that is saying a lot with three kids and two dogs!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love this!
Review: I wish I found this sooner.Ê Great for houses that have pets that shed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Close, but not quite, the little robot that could have, but didn't have all it needed
Review: I wish I could give it 5 stars, but there are a few shortcomings. It does a good job of sucking up dirt, but if you have pets, expect to empty it often. I recommend every time you stop it. It is nice to have the Roomba doing the work, but it is not as slick as the movies make it seem.First, for the price, this is the most expensive of the models, and yet it only comes with two light houses. That third light house really makes a difference when trying to keep Roomba in one place.Second, Roomba can't seem to make a distinction between a light house and it's home base. Telling it to dock is difficult unless the light houses are picked up, and Roomba is close (but not too close) to the base.Third, there are no clear instructions on how to use Roomba with respect to cleaning the house. The thing seems to have the capacity to clean an entire house, but doesn't seem to have the smarts for doing it. The unit has no concept of a room, and does not seem to have much learning ability. If you want to clean one room, and you leave the doors closed, all is well. If you want to clean the whole house, no way will that happen on any kind of automated schedule.fourth, for all the tech in Roomba, no wifi, no z-wave, no zigbee, just one finicky infra red remote.iRobot, if you are here reading, pay attention. This unit has too few smarts, too little memory, and to little integration.Fifth, Roomba mostly just wanders around, even after repeated cleanings. It learns a little about a room it is based in, but that seems to be it.Sixth, wires and cables are not handled well. If you leave your iPhone charger cable dangling, Roomba is doomed. Larger cables, like power cords, don't get tangled, but Roomba has difficulty negotiating the cords.Lastly, rugs are not Roomba-friendly unless they are very thin. Nothing with shag. Nothing too soft. Ikea bath mats are not good with Roomba.I could go on, but just know this: your house needs to be very tidy, very open, with legged furniture, and noting larger than an M&M on the floor for Roomb to be effective. Put your chairs up on the table, and don't try for too much area at any one time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 880 vs. Golden Retriever
Review: I will start off by saying I have a 85 lbs. Golden Retriever and a medium hair cat.Ê Anyone that has a Golden Retriever knows the level of fur that drops is amazing.Ê I have a Dyson Animal that handles it all, and requires the brushes to have the fur removed from the brush about once per year.Ê Overall, it chews through it and does an amazing job with almost no maintenance.The Roomba 880 does an excellent job cleaning our hard travertine floor.Ê It's made a significant impact in the fur and dirt in our hard floored rooms. However, on heavier nap carpet, it gets stuck, beeps, and shuts off.Ê So much for being multi-surface.Ê I'm sure it would be fine on short carpet.Another major downfall of the Roomba is that the waste bin fills up after every cycle.Ê It fills up after vacuuming a 500 SF room on a daily basis.Ê This is disappointing.Ê This means that there is really no point in me setting it up to run automatically, as I have to empty the bin daily for it to run well. (I am mindful that it's mostly dog hair, but it's still a chore).Ê Once or twice per week, I have to pull the brushes out of the unit to remove tangled up fur.Ê The good news is that iRobot made this maintenance very easy.Ê They engineered the brushes themselves, and the mechanism that holds them very well.Ê I can remove them in seconds.About once per month, I have to remove the rotating side brush with a screwdriver and take fur out of that.Bottom line: The Roomba 880 does a good job keeping my hard floor fur-free.Ê However, it requires a LOT of tending to if you have a heavy shedding pet.I look forward to seeing if Dyson manages to make a solid Robot this year.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Better than Expected
Review: I wasn't sure what to expect from this vacuum, but after a months of nearly daily use I can say I am impressed.My first thought was it wouldn't clean near edges, or get confused by table legs and such, but after watching it for several hours (I am an easily entertained engineer) I am impressed.Cleaning:I vacuumed my floor immediately before I set the Roomba free, and was disgusted at how much hair and grit it dug out of the carpet.Ê It doesn't have much suction power, but the little rollers do their job at picking stuff up.Ê There was a lot of cat hair that had probably been there for 2 or 3 years.Ê First room filled the trash bit, but each consecutive use reduces the amount somewhat so after a while it will do more than one room without emptying the bin.Ê The small brush pulls debris from near edges in front of the rollers so it can clean by walls.Ê Hard floors it works okay, it picks up most of the loose debris, but obviously need to wet mop or something (Scooba) to get anything stuck to the floor.Algorithms:It does a good job cleaning the entire floor.Ê Sometimes it will miss small areas, but if you are smart with the virtual walls (2 included) it will help the vacuum out a lot.Ê If the vacuum becomes hung up on say a carpet square running over some speaker wires in a wire protector, it does a good job of lifting itself up and working itself free.Ê It has no problems transitioning from hard to carpet in my house and even does fine with the standing mats/welcome mats in the kitchen and by the doors.Ê I haven't seen them look that clean.Ê Ever.The Roomba is slow, much slower than vacuuming by hand, but at the same time you can prep a room and set it free while you go do something else.Ê You can also schedule the Roomba to run when you want, although with kids in the house I prefer to clean up all their toys and hit start.It seems it won't fall off steps, stops well before it gets off balance and goes over the edge.Battery:It will run for quite a while, maybe enough to do 2 or 3 small rooms.Maintenance:Make sure you dump the catch container every run, and also regularly pull out the rubber rollers and make sure there is no hair tangled up in them.Ê If you see the flashing magnifying glass icon, it means you need to take the rollers out I believe, the book really isn't very clear on that.Ê If it is illuminated steady it is doing a spot cleaning of a certain area which is a bit different.Ê Or maybe dirty rollers confuse it into doing a spot cleaning, not entirely certain, but taking the rollers out and a quick clean of the compartment made the notification go away.Virtual Walls and Light Houses:Set the virtual wall(s) to prevent the Roomba from wandering into other rooms, certain areas might prevent it from cleaning well.Ê Use the light house mode to prevent it from crossing that area until it has finished the area it is in.Ê This is useful for a large room you want to divide into smaller regions.Ê Maybe if it has a complex arrangement or something that would confuse the Roomba.Ê These beacons turn on automatically when the Roomba is running and go to sleep when it is not.Bottom Line:I really like the Roomba, and haven't used the traditional vacuum since we got it.Ê My wife has grown to like it too, and even my daughter loves following it around.Ê She usually interferes with its cleaning pattern though by sitting in front of it and laughing as it tries to clean around her.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I was amazed and very impressed
Review: I was very skeptical at with the first trial run. I was amazed and very impressed. It did a better job than I ever could. Recommend it over humans. I have named it Robby.Buy it especially if u have pets , kids or a lazy spouse.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Beyond my Expectations
Review: I was very skeptical about a robot that could clean my condo. I bought it as a toy, but I praise it as a useful tool. I set it to clean my 1100 square foot apartment at 10am every day. When I come home it is nestled back in it's dock and it is filled with dust bunnies and dirt. After 10 days my allergies have subsided, and my apartment is much cleaner. I hate cleaning. This device is a godsend. It is not perfect. It occasionally gets stuck under my sofa. But, I would never ever clean under my sofa, so the 2 times a week it gets stuck is worth the aggravation. Great product. Well done!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I'm in love!
Review: I was very sceptical with this but decided to give it a try. And I love it! Not sure how much time I'm saving since I keep watching it go around and around... It's like staring into the fire... Such a fun little bugger! It is easy to use, it does a great job and while it's vacuuming, I can do the dusting or whatever. Now I need to get the one to do the lawn!!!Update: About a month later and our love has just grown stronger! I've been using it almost daily at different parts of the house and it is amazing! I don't have to vacuum anymore! My house is cleaner because Roomba is cleaning it more often than I ever did. And more thoroughly than I ever did. It definitely goes with me to the desert island!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It is fantastic.. We love it
Review: I was truly skeptical.Ê It is fantastic.. We love it.Ê Amazing how much dirt it picks up in places you did not reach.. (under beds)... we have a large home and it does take a day or two to figure out how to break up the house to do it all.. but - it is work it.. Amazing - love it..

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Skeptic to Believer to Depender
Review: I was skeptical...really, really skeptical about these robot vacuums.Ê After seeing them at Costco I still waited years to even consider one.Ê Well recent back problems suddenly made a robot vacuum something that now makes sense, IF it worked.Ê After researching manufacture's sites and reading pages and pages of reviews I settled on buying the Roomba 880 (aka 'Hal').Ê Yes it's expensive, but the new improvements in the 800 series really work well for me.I live in a 3 bedroom 2 bath house (1400 SF) that has hard floors, area and throw rugs, rubber/foam kitchen mats, low pile and deep pile carpets.Ê After I experimented with how the Roomba works, how much it can clean in a given "session", how it uses Virtual Lighthouse (room nodes) and Virtual Fences (and a Virtual Wall Halo for pet food bowls) and docking stations, I now have a setup that works extremely well for me that I will describe below.Ê NOTE:Ê The entire setup is not cheap when you add all the parts up, BUT it does exactly what I want which is to vacuum my entire house for me, something that has become very challenging to do due to chronic back problems:Setup Items:I purchased the higher capacity Lithium battery for the Roomba to both extend battery life and overall run time.Ê This is the one I bought:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00FML2LYK/ref=wms_ohs_product?ie=UTF8&psc=1The Roomba 880 comes with 2 Lighthouse Virtual Wall units and one Docking Station/Charger.Ê I added 3 more Lighthouse units, a Virtual Wall Halo (for pet food bowls) and a second Docking Station/Charger.I also purchased enough rechargeable "C" cell batteries to keep the above units happy.Scenario and Results:With the above accessories my Roomba 880 vacuums 1/2 of my house every other day and it does a better job than I ever did using my Dyson, partially due to the frequency that I would vacuum, but I think this is mainly due to how thorough the Roomba is AND how well it vacuums up pet hair and dust/dirt.Ê The overall dust level is significantly lower (much less dust on furniture) now that I am using the Roomba 880.Ê Everyday it picks up an amazing amount of pet hair, cat litter, dust and dirt.Ê I honestly think it is a "cleaner" vacuum than my Dyson Animal by both removing dust (as my Dyson also did) but also containing dust in it's filtering system as it vacuums.Ê My Dyson Animal DC07 is a great vacuum but it has always stirred up a lot of dust as it cleans since the exhaust port blows down onto the floor/carpet as it vacuums, the Roomba does not and the HEPA filter is easily cleaned after each vacuuming when you empty the bin .One BIG feature of the new 800 series is the ribbed extractors instead of conventional brush rollers that are supposed to greatly reduce how often you clean hair from them.Ê After a couple months of daily use with bins full of super fine, long pet hair, I have never had to remove any hair (or anything) from the new rubber ribbed extractor rollers.Ê The ONLY maintenance has been to empty the dirt bin each day and tap out the bin filter, very easy to do and eye opening each time to see how much Roomba picks up each day.At first the "random" nature of it's navigation routine was captivating to watch as I wondered how in the world it could clean well using that "logic", but it does clean really, really well.Ê It's also hard not to "watch" the darn thing when you first start using it as you try to figure out the advertised 60 robotic logic routines it uses in the iAdapt system.Ê All I know is my house has never been cleaner and both myself and my pets are a lot happier with clean, super clean floors.NOTE on making a house Roomba friendly:These newer 800 series seem to do really well at not getting hung up on cords and things.Ê I have LOTS of network, power, audio, computer, cords and I haven't had to remove an eaten cord yet. Likewise with throw rugs and rubber mat corners, if Roomba hits some rugs/mats diagonally it can begin to fold them back, but even if they get turned up and/or sucked into the ribbed extractors, the Roomba is great at spitting them back out, spinning around and continuing on it's task.Ê This 880 is tenacious about getting un-stuck BUT it will get stuck given the right conditions.Ê For my situation, I simply watched the Roomba over several sessions around my house and fixed a few issues I had to where the 880 no longer needs watching, it just works.Using two docking stations:I am using automatic scheduled cleanings that happen each day, where the 880 wakes up based on the time of day I set to begin vacumming.Ê After each vacuuming I simply empty the dirt/dust bin and clean the HEPA filter and put the 880 into alternate docking stations, every other day, located at opposite ends of the house.Ê I am using one of the Lighthouse units as a "Fence", that divides my house into two halves, with one docking station located in each half.Ê I did not need to purchase the second docking station to clean my house effectively, but it is much more convenient since Roomba automatically docks itself after each cleaning session for charging and having a station in each end of the house allows the Roomba to dock and charge no matter which half it has just cleaned.Ê Now my ONLY task is to empty the bin and put Roomba in the docking station that is located in the half of the house I want vacuumed the next day.Room Nodes: Virtual Lighthouse Room ModeI highly recommend using the Virtual Lighthouse Room Nodes that tell the Roomba where individual rooms are.Ê The idea is that containing the Roobma to smaller areas allows more efficient cleaning and that is definitely the case.Ê When using the Lighthouse units in room mode, the 880 finishes each room before continuing into the next.Ê They work great and I think they are critical to getting the best experience from your Roomba.Ê You don't necessarily need a Lighthouse at every single room with a door, but locating them at doorways into main rooms allows the Roomba to work as intended.Ê I have a large master bedroom, with small hallway walkthrough closet that leads to the master bathroom (creates an 'L' shape room) that the Roomba does well, but I also have a living room and kitchen floor plan that also makes a much larger 'L' shape that I ended up needing a Lighthouse in room mode to separate the kitchen into it's own room to allow the 880 to clean efficiently.I started off a huge skeptic and I now truly appreciate and depend on "Hal" to do my vacuuming everyday, rain or shine.Ê OH, on a skittish pet note...I have a cat who is normally timid and scared of new things and she could care less about "Hal" and I absolutely know she's a lot happier to not be living in all that dirt, dust and hair "Hal" kindly removes everyday :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works great!
Review: I was skeptical, now I just empty the bin everyday.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and this thing is excellent!
Review: I was skeptical, but my wife wanted it, so I bought it for her.Ê We have two cats, and hardwood floors with rugs, and this thing is excellent!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Frees up your time, cleans well, but requires a lot of hand-holding.
Review: I was skeptical when I bought the Roomba.Ê Our vacuum needed to be replaced and I figured I could try this out and return it if I didn't like it.Ê First run performance was astounding.Ê It really cleaned the floor VERY well.Ê Even in the corners.Ê Wasn't too loud either (as other reviews had mentioned).Ê Sure it makes noise, but it's about half as loud as any vacuum I've ever heard.All-in-all, I'm not completely amazed by this device; although it shines in many ways, its shortcomings are starting to get on my nerves.Ê Below is a break-down of the pros and cons I've experienced.Ê Hopefully this will help you make an informed decision:PROS:o - Cleans well.There's no denying it.Ê This vacuum does a great job, especially in corners.Ê If I leave it in a room and press start, when I come back, the floor is super clean and I was able to focus my time and energy on something more important.o - Anti-tangle feature rocks.Got power cords, chargers, or other wires/cables on the floor?Ê Don't worry.Ê The Roomba senses these items and never gets tangled in them.Ê I was worried about this, but the roomba can go pretty much anywhere without causing a problem.o - Scheduler - ISet this thing to start up around 10:45am daily when no one's home.Ê You can schedule one time for each day of the week.Ê I come home and the place is spotless.Ê AWESOME!!!o - Move it where you need it and leave it alone.I originally thought you had to use the roomba in just one place thinking it would have to "learn" the configuration of the room.Ê That's not the case.Ê Just pick the Roomba up and move it to where you need it and hit 'Clean' and walk away.Ê It does all the work.Ê When you come back into that room, it's totally clean.Ê I LOVE this.o - Spot Clean is really niceYou can put the roomba in the middle of a very messy area and hit "spot" and it will do this spiral clean job covering about a 3 foot diameter circle area and cleans it up.o - Remote controlOnce you figure it out (see complaints below), the remote is very very handy.Ê You can get it to clean small jobs right where you want it to.o - Emptying is quick and easyI used to have a dyson and emptying it usually got lots of dust everywhere.Ê The Roomba is much easier to handle and empty.Ê Also, the filters (comes with two) are easy to clean.Ê I usually rinse it off with warm water and let it dry while the other one is in the roomba.Ê I always have a clean filter around.Ê The manufacturer may want me to buy replacements, but this method works very very well for me.Ê I never put a wet or damp filter into the vacuum.o - Doesn't fall down stairs.Ê Totally stops at the edge of the stairs.o - gentle on furnitureThe roomba senses walls and other furniture that comes all the way to the floor (like chest of drawers).Ê It will slow down to a very slow speed when it approaches these items and doesn't nick or damage the furniture.Ê for chair legs, it does bump though.Ê The edge of the device is cushioned though so it's very gentle.o - When it works, it really works well.Ê But it's not perfect.Ê Read cons below.CONS:o - Doesn't always pick up fine fibersWe got one of those over-sized fake spiders for halloween.Ê The darned thing shed these clumps of black microfibers from its hairy legs.Ê The roomba 880 went over these many times and never picked them up.Ê This is when the bristle brush model would have probably done a superior job compared to the silicon rollers.Ê Finally, I used a Shark vacuum (like a dustbuster with a beater bar in it).Ê That got the hairs up.o - Chairs and obstacles extend the cleaning timeNavigating the dining room table and chair legs is an arduous task for the roomba.Ê It WILL clean well in all of these areas, but it can take a VERY long time bumping, turning moving, bumping, turning, moving over and over again often getting "trapped" between the legs of the same chair more than once.o - Owners manual is a jokeI work in the technology field and get paid to figure out how complex systems function.Ê This owners manual gave practically ZERO helpful information.Ê I had to scour the internet to figure out how the virtual wall and virtual lighthouse (failed to) work.Ê Doesn't tell you the best place to position your roomba dock.Ê Doesn't tell you how the lighthouse works.Ê Doesn't tell you how the wall works.Ê Doesn't tell you how the remote control (REALLY) works.o - Remote control is ridiculously confusingYou can use the remote to "wake up the roomba" by pressing the 'clean' button.Ê Then you are supposed to be able to move it to a spot you want it to start cleaning in by using the direction buttons on the remote.Ê However, as soon as your finger leaves one of these buttons, the roomba goes into "dock" mode and starts looking for its home.Ê It took me a while to figure out that you had to press the 'clean' button again to get it to stop looking for the dock, the press it once more to have it start to clean.Ê Really confusing and this is NOT what the manual says it should do.o -
