Frequently cannot find its dockThis happens probably 50% of the time.Ê I come home and the roomba isn't in its dock.Ê I hunt around and eventually find it sitting in some lonely corner just as dead as a doornail.Ê This is not supposed to happen, especially when the roomba has woken up on its own and starting a cleaning cycle.Ê One would imagine the "intelligent" device would remember where its dock was positioned, but this is not the case.Ê Lovely bonus... we left for Thanksgiving vacation and I set the scheduler and left.Ê Came home and the roomba was in the living room dead.Ê The memory had been lost for the time of day and day of the week, which I had to reset.Ê The schedule stayed in memory, but the clock... nope.Ê The kitchen wasn't ever cleaned so I came home to a dirty house.Ê Something that a $700 vacuum should do, no??o - Needs to be emptied frequently.At least daily.Ê If not, more.Ê We moved into a place with some new carpet.Ê If you've ever gotten new carpet, you'll know that it sheds a lot of fiber in the first few months of ownership.Ê Due to this factor, the Roomba would fill up its dirt bay within about 5 minutes of running.Ê Now, it's a little better.Ê This is purely a function of the carpet and with older carpets, it doesn't have this problem.o - "Algorithm" ain't all that smartI thought this robot would "learn" the lay of the land and get the floor cleaned in the most efficient manner possible.Ê This couldn't be further from the truth.Ê As we all know, every room has... you know... furniture.Ê If you had a completely empty rectangular room, the Roomba would clean it pretty systematically, I'm sure.Ê But once it bumps into a table leg or lamp base or whatever, it just goes off in a new direction.Ê I've personally witnessed the Roomba spend over an hour and a half (not exaggerating) in a 16x16 square foot room seemingly going over the same areas several times.o - Virtual Lighthouse is uselessThe virtual lighthouse is a black device that's about the size of your fist that is supposed to cast an infra-red beam across a doorway separating two rooms and act as a temporary barrier between these rooms. The idea is that only when the roomba is done cleaning the first room, it will cross the barrier and start to clean the other room.Ê This model comes with 2 of these devices, but I've never seen the roomba successfully clean three rooms.Ê Partly because it gets full too fast, and partly because once it crosses that first barrier, it doesn't really know the difference between the first and the second.Ê Eventually, it just thinks it's completely done and goes into 'dock' mode.Ê But in these cases, it won't cross back over the invisible barrier to get to the room where its dock is.Ê One usually ends up turning the roomba off manually, or it just shuts itself off.o - Virtual wall is okay, but if the Roomba was a little smarter, you wouldn't even need it.Ê The virtual wall is the same device as the lighthouse.Ê You just flip a switch on it to become a wall.Ê This is just like the lighthouse only the barrier becomes "permanent".Ê If you didn't have this, the roomba would take hours to clean one floor as it randomly bounced around tryin

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Yes, it's *that* good...
Review: I was skeptical of the merits of spending so much on what I fear would prove to be a novelty or toy, but after letting Roomba do its thing for the past few days, I'm thrilled.It's not quite a "set and forget" device (it's stalled out once on a cord and wedged itself under a cabinet once). The battery life is limited (enough for two big carpeted rooms but not a lot more). The bin fills up quickly (partly because it gets more dirt than my fancy upright vac, but also because the bin is just physically small).But mostly, it's a huge time-saver, does a better job than I would do, and it's amusing to have around. Five stars. Great purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... skeptical at first about purchasing a Roomba but so glad I did
Review: I was skeptical at first about purchasing a Roomba but so glad I did! This machine is Awesome! I followed the quick start menu and was off and cleaning. I couldn't believe the amount of dirt it picked up on the first cleaning. Before I purchased the Roomba I was using my $1500.00 Kirby.The best thing about this device, it does all the work for you!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is amazing..
Review: I was skeptic about these types of vacuums, but decided to finally pull the trigger.Ê I've only had this Roomba for a few weeks, but I have quickly become obsessed with it.Ê This thing is amazing...and so far, worth every penny.Ê I have mostly hardwoods in my house and tile in the kitchen, as well as an 85lb dog who sheds like there is no tomorrow.Ê He may not love the Roomba, but I sure do.Ê I run it nearly every day and am amazed at how well it does with picking up fur balls, dust, dirt, etc.Ê Yes, it gets hung up on shag area rugs sometimes and once in a while needs to be moved, but all in all, this thing is brilliant.Ê Best part, it goes underneath chairs, couches, tables, armories, etc., where most people don't clean regularly.Ê If you hate vacuuming (like I do), buy this iRobot and let it do the work for you.Ê This thing is SMART and I'm regretting not having bought one years ago.Ê BUY this vacuum!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pricey but well worth it
Review: I was quite hesitant to buy this item but read every review I could find to be informed.Ê I used another Roomba for the first time recently and I was impressed.Ê We have two cats, one of which has long hair, so I decided after all my reading to get this model. I bought it at a place where I had a 20% off coupon.Ê I charged the battery overnight, used it for the first time today and I am thrilled with this product!Ê It has picked up two bins full of cat hair from a carpet that looked clean.Ê It gets right up to the baseboards in the kitchen and goes under some of the furniture.Ê I have not yet taken it upstairs to clean under the beds, but, I think those areas, and the rest of our home are going to be a lot cleaner than they have been before.Ê It really was a major purchase, but I am very glad I made that choice.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love this Vacuum
Review: I was not sure if it would actually be able to handle my home, but it has done a great job.Ê I have 8 cats and one dog so I was vacuuming every day and still missed spots, or the hair would move around while I vacuumed and wouldn't see it until I had put the vacuum away.Ê GGRRRRRÊ This little thing comes on at 3 pm everyday and does a better job at it, then I did.Ê It has only got stuck once because it got under a piece of furniture that is higher in the front then in the back or sides.Ê I still vacuum with the regular vacuum once a week to get in the areas that are to small for him to be able to get in, but my life is so much easier with this little thing/him.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love!
Review: I was hesitant to buy a Roomba even though I've wanted one for years. I love this little guy. I bought this one at Target and it was about $150 more than the other model. The battery lasts longer and it said it can do multiple rooms.It's a great little machine. We had to empty it twice on day one. I had no idea that my oreck was that bad. We charged it up and brought it upstairs today. It's busy cleaning all the floors up here now.I didn't think it could go from my hardwoods to the stone floor in my bath but it navigated the half round transition with no problem.Ê The bog watch out upstairs are cords. Get those collected and off the ground and you're golden.Thanks Bob (my daughter named him that). I'm reading a book while he's off and working.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Really works!
Review: I was hesitant at first when trying to decide if I should buy this expensive little gadget.Ê After all how could this little unit really do the job. I'm happy to say it really works. Everytime I let it loose it comes up with a full dirt cup and it leaves me wondering where all the dirt comes from when I can't see any. It has made a monotonous chore fun.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Nice and usefull product
Review: I was expecting a more efficient cleaning route algorithm.Nice and usefull product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love it!
Review: I was a skeptic at using something like this to sweep my floors, but I am pleasantly surprised.Ê This little thing works great!Ê I love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love iRobot!
Review: I was a sceptic. I was wrong. I love iRobot!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but I'm glad I did this vacuum is awesome turn it on ...
Review: I was a little Leary about spending that kind if money on this little fella, but I'm glad I did this vacuum is awesome turn it on and let it do it's thing what a time saver! I have a lot of wood and tile floors and I was surprised on well it did on my carpet too! I would definetly recommend to any one who has pets and not a lot of time to bring out the push vacuum. I love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and I'm in love! To be able to sit here and surf ...
Review: I was a little hesitant to order a robot vacuum; I've always thought they were a gimmick that would fade into the sunset once they had their day. But then my sister-in-law talked me into getting one, and I'm in love! To be able to sit here and surf the net while Minnie cleans my floors - what's not to love?!? And clean, she does! I do have to get another lighthouse or two - but I have about 2,000 sq ft of "odd" living space - angled rooms, etc. For someone with squared-off spaces, I don't see where there would be necessary. She's expensive, yes, but my time is more important to me than doing housework, so this is worth every penny!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wow - This Really Works!
Review: I was a little hesitant to order a robot vacuum; I've always thought they were a gimmick that would fade into the sunset once they had their day. But then my sister-in-law talked me into getting one, and I'm in love! To be able to sit here and surf the net or do something else while Minnie cleans my wood floors (I hate cleaning floors!) - what's not to love?!? And clean it, she does!I do have to purchase another lighthouse or two - but I have about 2,000 sq ft of "odd" living space - angled rooms, etc. For someone with squared-off spaces, I don't see where this would be necessary.She's expensive, yes, but my time is more important to me than doing housework, so this is worth every penny!General "good to know" info:- I clean out the dirt bin after every cleaning. We have three pets (short hair), so I just do it whether it needs it or not.- I have very long hair, and so even though Minnie does a good job of vacuuming things up and not getting wrapped around the rubber rollers, the hair will get caught up in 1) the wheel compartment that holds the rubber rollers in place, and 2) the little "sweeper side brush" will also get long hair caught around the spinning wheel up inside of it - so you will need to clean that out maybe once a week or so depending on how often you vacuum. For the little side brush, you just take a small screwdriver, unscrew it, clean the hair out of the wheel, and screw it back in.Honestly it sounds like more work and effort than it is. I was annoyed when my SIL told me and showed me how to do it, but after she showed me, I was like "okay, that's really no big deal at all, and still totally worth every penny!"Cheers!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Review: I was a hesitant. Could this really do the job or was it an overhyped, overpriced, underperforming tech gadget? My home has 2600 sq ft of bamboo and tile floor with only small area rugs in two of the rooms. Dust and dirt can be quite visible on hard surface floors, but at least you know that it's there. And for this purpose Roomba seems most ideal. It is easy to setup and use. I thought my floors were fairly clean the first time I used it and was astounded at the amount of dirt that filled the collection bin. A few observations: It cleans extremely well, but not perfectly. There will be a few areas it just can't reach and you will need to do some touchup cleaning on occasion. The collection bin and filter need to emptied / cleaned far more frequently that a full-sized vacuum, but it's an easy task. It's not significantly louder than my other vacuums (a Miela canister and Sebo upright, both of which I consider fairly quiet). I have not had any problems with wire or furniture entanglement. In fact, it slides right under most of my furniture, where dust bunnies hide. It seems to be well designed and built. Is it worth the price? For me, yes. For others, I can't say. But if you have hard flooring, are a bit OCD about keeping it clean and like the idea of letting a robot do the work, Roomba may be for you.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A Great Helper --Remember the Consumables
Review: I was a fairly early adopter of robot vacuum cleaners, having had a Neato XV-11 in the house for nearly 3 years. And it's been useful, if temperamental, and requiring a lot of care and frequent untangling from bits of string. And now, in comes this refined next generation robot cleaner and I am just blown away with how advanced it is.First of all, it gets jammed less. Not that it can't get jammed or caught. This allows a lot more autonomous use, and makes possible the promise of scheduled cleaning. With my old vacuum, I'd have never dared use its timer function (even if its clock could be made to keep the time after a full battery discharge) as I'd most surely have come home to a beeping, helpless robot with a shoelace wrapped around its brush. With this Roomba, there is a good probability it will be able to clean up my front room and get back to its dock without intervention. As I have children likely to leave large scale debris everywhere, I've gotten into the habit of picking up the Roomba's room every morning while getting them off to school and allowing the Roomba to complete its schedule later in the day when nobody is there. Then later on, if I have the time, I'll make sure the kitchen area is clear and move it there for a second chore of the day.It will occasionally collect long bits of hair which end up coiled around the tips of the 'extractors' but these are easily removed; I'm sure you could remove any coiled hair in 10 seconds if you were in a hurry. Hair can also manage to coil itself around and under the auxiliary side brush fouling it and causing it to stop, if it stops in the right place it can even block the ledge sensor on that corner of the robot and allow it to drive over the lip of a step or other drop off. Luckily, the brush is easily removed with a screwdriver and disentangle it in a few seconds. iRobot technical support was able to suggest this fix via online chat after a 12 minute wait for a human.Originally, I had a small shag area rugÊ in the Roomba's room, but I've since moved it because not only did the robot struggle getting around on even that small area, but it was picking up long nylon fibers that were actively cutting into the rubber extractors on the bottom and wearing them out faster than it would otherwise. That cheap pink rug, was this guy's arch enemy. On hard wood and flat carpets it breezes along. And it does a lot of cleaning on a charge. It easily cleans my entire top floor on a charge (perhaps 900 square feet). Listen for any change in its noise, if it's picked up something large (like for instance a small zip-lock bag) that needs to be manually removed you can definitely hear a change in pitch.The tower, virtual wall system works OK, although it's a bit hard to find a place for the virtual wall near my doorway.I have a hard time believing they expect people will follow the proscribed maintenance of wiping it down every week. We'll see. My extractors are already getting a bit worn on the ends after a month of erratic use, I can see why they'll have to be replaced a couple times a year; yet I don't see them sold here on Amazon, only on the iRobot website for now.It certainly picks up more and a larger variety of debris than my old Neato, all the while being noticeably less noisy. Also, it's a bit shorter so it can go under a bench in my TV room that the Neato couldn't.The glossy upper shell tends to pick up scratches if you flip it over to access the bottom; what a shame. So take care, or don't let it bother you.Controls are large, the display is bright and clear. The instruction manual is a well laid out and clear, although the lawyers did make them add a lot of ridiculous safety warnings. I'm not sure about the utility of the remote control. It's cool, but in real life, I think only the handicapped will find it useful.The device has 3 parts that are consumed in normal operation, the filter which is about $8 a piece, the roller set which is about $30 and the spinning brush which is about $5, My rollers are getting quite beat up, but I'm not sure when they'll cross the line and need replacing. I can't find anyplace but iRobot's own website to get the roller set, so add in shipping costs too.In general, I've been extremely pleased with the robot and it has motivated me to keep my front room tidy every day. Which is miraculous.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: absolutely the best
Review: I was a bit skeptical about how effective this would be with a large shedding dog and a small shedding long haired cat....a friend raved about hers so Santa brought me one. One word: Wow.Ê Not only does this machine do a great job on multiple rooms, and multiple floor types--wood, tile, carpet--it does it quickly. After the initial vacuuming, it became faster and more efficient. I still have to dump the bin about every 20 minutes, but the time and effort that it saves me on daily vacuuming is wonderful!Ê I have a few furniture items that it can't get under or gets stuck, but I think I can use the little blocker beacon to stop that. I thought it was sooo expensive, but now, if anything ever happens to this one--we've even named her--I'm definitely getting another one. Isn't technology wonderful!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It not worth to pay for this amount of money to buy this dumb machine, and destory your cable or wire
Review: I used iRobot for a few moths, but it brings more problem when it struck with my headphone or any wire on the ground. It not worth to pay for this amount of money to buy this dumb machine, and destory your cable or wire.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fire the maid, get a ROOMBA!
Review: I tried two Neato models...they could never find their way back to base.Ê They cleaned well but I spent my time restarting when they would get stuck!Ê Then a month ago I got "angel".Ê I have Saltillo tile throughout my home with area rugs.Ê The 880 is programmed for everyday and it's amazing how dirty two people can be especially without any pets in the house.Ê Angel does not appear to have any logical way of cleaning but I have learned to just let her go for the most part and she does a great job!Ê Can't figure where she finds all the dirt!Ê She runs almost 2 hours before returning to base.Ê Cleaning people don't always show up but roomba is always there!Ê I no longer need paid help to clean!Ê I just got the IScooba.Ê Not as happy with that machine...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worst. Robot. Ever.
Review: I thought that decades of R&D by Roomba would have produced something that worked.Ê So many problems.Ê It would go to the next room without ever finishing the first room.Ê It's path is essentially random so many spots are missed.Ê The battery would die when it was away from the dock so I constantly had to carry it back.Ê I set it to vacuum at 2am and it was so loud, it woke both of us up - even though we were upstairs with the door closed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love this thing.
Review: I think the closest thing I would compare this too is a dishwasher, especially considering some people's objections to it (and the price!). My dishwasher takes over two hours. If I do the dishes by hand I can probably have them done in less than a quarter of that time. Plus, it doesn't eliminate all my dish-washing work: I still have to rinse, load, and unload. If dishwashers were new and you just bought your first, you may complain about those issues. I, however, love my dishwasher and would loose my mind if I had to go back to hand-washing dishes.I also love my Roomba. It takes forever and I have to do a bit of prep work first (pick up clutter and maybe put some dinning room chairs up), but that takes about 1 minute and then you can just press the button and move on to other things. And it really does a very good job. Better than any upright I've ever owned. Mostly, I think, because it ends up going over most spots many, many times by the time it's done. When I vacuum myself, I go over each strip of floor once (maybe) at about 100 miles an hour in an effort to get it over with. I kept my Dyson upright for a couple weeks, but I really have no use for it now. I'm still keeping a small stick vacuum around for the stairs and quick cleanups, but that's it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Vacuums like a seven year old with mild OCD and ADHD.
Review: I think it's nice to have a robot vacuum my carpet and bare floors every day. It picks up pet hair too! I need to get a second for the lower level of the house though.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Everyone needs one
Review: I think I have a new love- this robot is amazing!Ê I could go on and on about this thing!Ê Thoroughly impressed with the amount of lint, dust, dog hair, scraps of whatever and even kidney bean sized pebbles that she picks up.Ê We've enjoyed watching her first few trips round our house and watch with excitement as she navigates around wall edges, around and under couches (which rarely if ever get vacuumed).Ê I was worried that the noise would bother me but roomba can be doing her thing in the same room where we're having out with NO problem; she is amazingly quiet.Ê Dust bin filled up quickly at first but I believe that after we catch up on the amount of whatever is in our carpet, the reservoir will hold a full 2 hour cleaning session's worth no problem.Ê We will be buying both sets of parents a roomba for Christmas.Ê Way to go iRoomba!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth every dollar
Review: I suppose you could say I was slightly more than hesitant to buy a robotic vacuum - especially when it costs more than my old Dyson D14 Animal did years ago.However, in our 1800 square foot house with 2 shorthair dogs, hardwood floors, tile, and a couple of area rugs, we have a massive hair problem; and that's with cleaning the floors once per week and bathing and grooming the dogs on a regular basis. So you could say the wife and I took a leap of faith and bought this 880 model. With being able to set it to clean once per day, we figured that even if it didn't do as good of a job as my Dyson, that at least it would help with our weekly cleaning.Our first use of the 880 came just 3 days after we cleaned the floors. As anyone with hardwood floors can testify, you can certainly pick-up a lot of dirt and hair without the floors ever really looking dirty, and that was most definitely the case here. Before the unit was done with the house, we had to empty the dust bin twice. Watching the unit work is interesting as well. You almost want to guide it around (and you can with the included remote control) because it almost looks as if it's not going to clean the whole area, but it eventually does. It effortlessly hopped over some speaker wire channel that I have laid-down on the floor that's about half an inch tall to clean behind the couch, and I wasn't expecting it to do that at all. We have since set it to clean daily to prevent it from filling up the bin completely, and have been able to skip using the Dyson at all while mopping/waxing the floors now.The only time I've seen it get stuck was when it went into the master bathroom and tried to go between the toilet and the wall. When it started to back-up after realizing it couldn't make it, it started to suck-up the thick mat surrounding the toilet - but it handled the mats in the guest bathroom like a champ, so perhaps it was just a fluke. Regardless, it can happen.As far as it bumping into objects, it's quite gentle. We have a glass display table by our front door with objects that would break if they were bumped too hard. As you watch the unit run towards an object, its proximity detection slows down the forward motion, causing a rather gentle nudge instead of a full-force bump, and it handled the table with ease.The bottom line, at least as far as I'm concerned, is buy this model - especially if you have any circumstances similar to mine. While sure, it might not clean as well as the latest and greatest Dyson made for hardwood floors (which I certainly wouldn't buy now because of this), but it still cleans well, plus you're paying for the convenience of having it do the work for you - and it'll go places your regular vacuum won't.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I should have it long time ago

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but it cleans as good as anything else I've used
Review: I run my 88 several times a week in different areas of the house.Ê For the life of me I can't understand how is tracks to cover the entire room/area, but it cleans as good as anything else I've used.Ê I'm very satisfied with its performance.Ê There is a technique of sorts that you pick up on as you become more familiar with operation ofÊ the Roomba.Ê The jury is still out durability, but that not withstanding, I'm very pleased with the Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Robot for My House
Review: I researched the Roomba 870-880, the Neato 85 and the Iclebo Arte. The Roomba (880) is clearly the best for my situation. I have oak wood floors with a darkish stain, and 3 Persian carpets with 1-3" fringe, one of which is also a very thin flat weave that can not be cleaned with a stand up vacuum without taking PIA precautions to prevent it from being sucked up. It represents the worst case scenario for an oriental throw rug. My Roomba "Max" handles all this beautifully and I believe is the only Robot that can do so and still give a deep vacuum clean. If you have a similar situation the Roomba aeroforce series is a no brainer. Below I will list the key positives first, and then will discuss the single annoying flaw of this Roomba series.Pros:1) The crazy "random" vacuum pattern is NOT crazy. So called consumer testers love to throw down dirt and measure how much gets cleaned by each robot in one pass. Most comment that the Roomba 880 takes the longest to clean, misses some spots, and bounces around randomly. The whole assessment based on a single cleaning is irrelevant. These robots clean painlessly multiple times each week. The important point is how well does it clean over an extended period. Good luck finding such a review!Ê I do not believe the so called random pattern has no intelligence to it, I think it records its bouncing about and makes adjustments to move to missed spots. Not one of these testers has any access to the Roomba algorithm and none should be concluding its pattern is random. Secondly, while the crisscrossing patterns the Roomba uses does take longer to clean a room it does a better job. That is because each crisscross represents a double cleaning of that area and those crisscrosses seem more concentrated in the open areas where people walk. So this "randomness" is more intelligent than it has been given credit by the professional critics.2) The Roomba does focused cleaning on problem areas. Just like a human, Roomba has a dirt detection system and will concentrate on areas where it senses dirt. Also, it is great alongside walls where dust collects, and the Roomba makes short stuttering twisting back and forth movements as it chugs along the wall. This is not "random", but rather unrecognized genius.3) Intelligent obstacle management. My house is tough with chairs, floor cords, and fringed carpets everywhere. The Roomba handles most all of it. It has been brilliant on carpet fringe up to 3" long. It detects it and spits it out. After a week it has not got hung up once on the fringe. Likewise it generally does not get stuck on my cables. However, these do slow it down and I have taken to cleaning them up to minimizes that bitt. The circular shape of the Roomba should outperform its D-shaped competitor by not getting stuck in tight areas, like under chair legs, because it simply rotates and redirects itself to escape. At the end of the day the Roomba requires less adjustments to my room than other robots (the Iclebo may be an exception but does not have a powerful vacuum and is an therefore non-starter for me).4) The Roomba reduces allergen exposure. Some say this is not true but they are coming from thinking about air purifiers. Clearly the Roomba and Neato in particular are going to be very helpful, because the HEPA filters are going to allow the high concentration of dirt on the floor to be picked up without spewing it into the air. It is about removing the reservoir of allergens in your house, rather than removing allergens already in your air. This is a great device for allergy sufferers such as myself.5) Do not get distracted by dust bin size. The strength of the vacuum and the size of the HEPA filter are more important. Once you do the initial cleanings the Roomba dust bin is plenty big enough for its intended maintenance function. It keeps your house clean by frequently vacuuming effortlessly. It is not intended to clean massive messes. If the local football team visits after the game and does not wipe their feet, get out your upright. Use the right tool for the job. For the Roomba I would highly encourage getting a routine together to clean the HEPA filter. I use a compressor to blow it out from inside to the outside. Most won't have that option but perhaps can use a strong hand vac. One must keep these small filters clean regardless of the robot. That is the main chore you assume relative to a traditional vacuum.6) The double rubber roller cleaners are brilliant and do not collect hair and threads that need to be constantly cleaned out. Say goodbye to that disgusting chore.Cons:1) Their is little doubt that future models will incorporate some sort of GPS based easy to program room navigation. In the meantime we have the "Lighthouse" for the Roomba. Its function is poorly described in the manual. Dawn, who writes the top Amazon review on this model, gives a great description worth the read. Here is my description of the way to understand and use it productively:Lighthouse mode DOES NOT function as the name implies. It DOES NOT attractÊ the Roomba into a designated room, like a ship to a harbor. Instead it acts the same as a Virtual Wall, but once the Roomba finishes cleaning that walled in area, it is allowed out to begin cleaning the adjacent room. Perhaps "Lighthouse Mode" should have been called Virtual Gate. This "Virtual Gate" function can be very useful for larger houses (> 2000 sq ft?). One can then divide the house into 2-4 areas, manually place the Roomba at one end of your house, and have it clean area by area inward from that point. By alternating which end of the house where you start the Roomba you can potentially get more systematic cleaning, and you can further place it in any area that needs immediate attention. BUT NOTE!, all this requires manually moving the Roomba about, and conflicts with its advertised scheduling function. I'm guessing the instructions are poor due to this conflict with the marketing department! To do scheduled cleanings as well, it only makes sense to place the Home Station in an area that gets the dirtiest, and then supplement that cleaning with the manual method just described. My smaller 1500 sq ft home gets great results just letting the Roomba loose twice per week to clean with its algorithm. No manual fussing about is required for my smaller house.2) A much smaller point is that the Roomba still uses NiMH batteries. Expect Lithium batteries in the future which will take up less space and probably allow for a redesign and upgrade of the entire Roomba. The only unit I know of that utilizes Lithium batteries is the Iclebo which gives a 1 year warranty on them versus the 6 month warranties for the NiMH types.Update (June 30, 2015):I have modified my commentary and description of the LightHouses. Seen Con #1 above for that new commentary. Once this function is understood it is more a Pro than a Con for big house owners.Update (June 13, 2015):After a month I am even more blown away with the awesomeness of this product. My house has never been so clean with next to no work! Currently I have programmed Max to clean my 1500 sq ft house twice a week starting at 5:00 am. I only keep my bedroom door closed so he does not wake me. He typically does his job in a bit less than one hour and has always returned to the base station by the time I have woken. Later I just put him in my bedroom, close the door, and manually return him to the base when he is finished there. I am only using one of "light houses" in virtual wall mode to keep him out of a stairwell. On its own Roomba will not fall down the stairs but generally goes far enough to drop its front wheel (which causes it to issue a warning and then turn itself off). I highly recommend getting an air compressor to blow out the filter from the inside after each use. I have also taken to weighing my dust bin with a kitchen scale so as to better judge how often to schedule the vacuuming. Right now I am getting about 4 grams of debris each session. I also want to mention one potentially significant negative. It is possible that this Roomba with its "aeroforce" rubber cylinders imparts more wear on a carpet than does an ordinary vac

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Stop reading reviews and buy this!
Review: I researched for months before buying this.Ê It's been running everyday since it first arrived.Ê I can't tell you how much I love this.Ê Buy some risers to lift your dresser, couch etc.Ê The roomba fits nicely under most my furniture and I can't tell you how much cleaner my home is now!Ê I sweep, mop and dust and THEN let the Roomba go.Ê It's quite disgusting how much he picks up even after I've cleaned.Ê Start saving your money...and get this.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: IRobot 880 is no joke
Review: I recently visited a good friend of mine, and his family purchased the IRobot (i think it was the 500 series).Ê They loved it.Ê His wife is a neat freak for sure, and she loves it.Ê She especially likes how it leaves nice straight lines in her carpet, and her cleaning service told her the house is much cleaner when they visit.Ê Before that visit, I never would have considered the Irobot...i just thought it was a novelty that probably didn't work..(kind of like the Sharpe Image Air Purifiers I got burnt on).I have a 5 room ranch house, with a large hallway (all hardwood with a few rugs).Ê It takes me forever to sweep and vacuum, and it's nearly impossible to get all the dirt/dust picked up.Ê So I decided to look at the Irobot, and I purchased the 770 through amazon. Before I used it for the first time, I did a DEEP cleaning of my house, to give it a good baseline to start with.Ê I THOUGHT it was a deep cleaning...I could not believe the amount of dirt and dust that was inside the receptical.Ê It was really unbelievable.Ê The only problem was, the 770 doesn't work with lighthouses (i thought they all did), and it only effectively cleaned 3 of my rooms.Ê Amazon was awesome, took the unit back, and I bought the 880.Ê At this point, I was okay with spending more money, because I knew it worked, and from all the reviews, the 880 was even better.It came with 2 lighthouses, I bought 2 more and this thing runs for 2 hours straight, cleaning all 5 rooms.Ê I keep a 6th room closed off (storage room for now), but it would do that one too without a problem.Ê The vacuum is definitely more powerful, the receptical is much larger and it looks very cool.Ê I noticed the 770 would drive over dirt/dust and once in awhile would not pick it up. The 880 sucks up everything.Ê The dirt detection is also amazing to watch.Ê It somehow senses a dirty area and focuses on that area for awhile.Ê It's amazing.I highly recommend it.Ê I have it scheduled every day at 5:30am (also my alarm). My place is always clean.Ê Surprise visitors?Ê Bring it on!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Oh Roomba, where have you been all of my life??!!
Review: I recently bought this Roomba, my first one, and I absolutely love it! I have 2 cats, hardwood floors, and a few area rugs so I spend a great deal of time vacuuming several times a week. Roomba has taken over and does a fabulous job!I run it every day and it does an excellent job of picking up all the cat hair even when it doesn't look like there is any on the floor or rug. It's a no brainer to start using, easy instructions (well except for the fact that there are no instructions for kitty cat roomba riding lessons- hint, hint iRobot), and it's pretty quiet.Ê I can't image not having one now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Roomba 880 robot vacuum sucks...in a good way.
Review: I recently bought the new Roomba 880. It is pretty amazing in many ways. It will find it's way into most all hard to get into places. I LOVE how it easily navigates under beds, couches, etc. Even narrow nightstands. I have mostly hardwood floors and it cleans them with no problem. It easily changes from a hard floor to a carpet. It gathers dust, pet hair and particles that you can't see. It is ultra easy to empty its dirt container, and yes it will find its way back to its base and re dock when it is low on a charge. It struggles a bit with deeply embedded pet pair in a rug. That is really my only disappointment other than the fact that my cats haven't taken a ride on it yet.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: NO LONGER KNEED DEEP IN PET HAIR!
Review: I received this for Mother's day so I have had it only a short time, but I am flabbergasted at how well it works and kicking myself for not getting one years earlier.Ê We have a 130 lb., Great-Dane sized Great Pyrenees/Anatolian Shepherd mix who sheds year round and who we let run both in and outside.Ê We have a 5000 sq foot one-story home, and 4 active boys and once you get an initial cleaning done in each room, this Roomba does an amazing job of keeping up the dog hair and dirt that are tracked in.Ê --I am not one of those who requires everyone to remove their shoes so we track in lots of dirt and so does our dog.Ê It's been a real battle to control the hair and sand but for the first time in years, my floors are not covered in sand and pet hair!Ê We have Saltillo tile and wood through out, with 5 or 6 area rugs and this keeps it all up.Ê I rotate it through the house now, having it do two or three rooms per day so every room gets a thorough vacuuming about every 3rd day.Ê My only dig is that the battery does not last long enough --about 1.5 hours, and then it needs to charge for 4 or so to get back to that same run time.Ê Requires some thought to run it in the morning and then get it back to the dock to charge so that you can run it again later.Ê I don't use the scheduler as much.Ê It doesn't always find the dock on it's own but I can live with that.Ê Amazed with it and it's very strong vacuuming power -better than my dirt level and in such a small package.Ê Some complain about the noise, but for a vacuum, it is very quiet.Ê You can have a conversation over it for sure, though why not run it in the next room while you talk?Ê Haven't tried anything but the 880.Ê For my next trick, I will be ordering the 4400 mAH lithium battery so I can get a longer run time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Rita(my roomba)
Review: I received this amazing product as a present from my in laws and have fallen in love with it in just 3 days. The amount of dirt and dog hair it cleaned up in two days of my house that I thought was clean blew me away and was kind of disgusting to be honest. We have 3 dogs and carpet in the bedrooms and wood/tile throughout the rest of the house. It did really well on the wood/tile floors but where I was really amazed was in the rooms with carpet. The rubber parts on the bottom really pull the pet hair out of your carpet that you have no idea your regular vacuum is missing. It has only been a few days but I can honestly say this roomba exceeded my expectations. The best part is knowing I have one less thing on my ever growing list of things to do.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... a Christmas gift from my mom and I'm so happy she didn't waste her money
Review: I received the Roomba 880 as a Christmas gift from my mom and I'm so happy she didn't waste her money. This vacuum is amazing. It cleans in a way I can't explain. I have two kids and two Persian cats and my floors and carpets are spotless. I have the newest Shark model and still leaves a lot of hair and dirt behind, but when Roomba vacuums I cannot fine single piece of hair and I love that nothing gest stuck in the rollers type of brushes this new Roomba model has.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: best gift ever!
Review: I received as a Mother's Day present and is the best gift - EVER! I love love love my Roomba. It cleans better than I thought possible and does it everyday on schedule.It's been about two months since I've had it and love it more each day. It's getting used to the house and does a great job.... With 2 kids, 2 dogs, a husband, 8 chickens on an acre property - it keeps me sane.Husbands ... Considering for your wife? You will be at the top of the " best hubby ever list!" Mine is!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba 980 is amazing
Review: I receive a discount coupon for a roomba 980 from bzzagent and got a great deal.This little vacuum willÊ exceed your expectation.First I thought will it really work must be big noisy.Not at all is small to medium size,yet quiet but powerful ,leaves your floor clean,pick up all dirt,crum.It does a great job,and I love it,saves so much time,especially if you have a busy schedule becauseÊ it cleans for you.words can not explained how pleased happy I am with this . roomba 980 is a timesaver and a lifesaver.You can use you on rugs,hardfloors,so that's a plus cause I can use it in my room,living room that has rugs,and also on the kitchen which has hardwood floors.I love everything about roombaÊ 980 and it does what manufacturer promise,highly recomend for others to get it,you are going to be happy with the results,as I am.I'll have to say roomba 980 is the best vacumm,I'ver ever use,great investment.I love the fact ,I do not need to pass the vacumm myself

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I really love this vacuum
Review: I really love this vacuum. I hate cleaning house, but this thing does the vacummimg for me.Ê It does a good job at keeping the floors clean since it runs everyday. I alternate it every other week on the different floors of my house. My only complaint with the vacuum is that it doesn't always find its way back to the charging station, so you have to go searching for it so you put it back on the charger

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I really love it for my carpeted areas but doesn't seem to ...
Review: I really love it for my carpeted areas but doesn't seem to do as well on my wood floors. That's why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Beware that only SOME replacement parts are available.
Review: I really like this vacuum in many ways and wanted to give it five stars.Ê But six months after the warranty expired, the handle broke where it attaches to the body.Ê I called customer service to get a replacement, only to be told that none is available and I should just pick the unit up with two hands.Ê I was astounded that all replacement parts are not available from this company for a $600 machine.Ê It's a good thing this happened before I purchased additional products from them, because they have just lost two future sales.Ê So consider this before you buy.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Two Thumbs Up!
Review: I really like it, so far it is meeting my expectations and picking up the very fine pet hairs we can't keep up with. Its truly amazing what it picks up. We program it to run daily for one hour, it is keeping the pet hair off the floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Perfect little vacuum
Review: I read many reviews for each type of irobot vacuums available and decided this was the right one for us. I have really long hair so having the ease of cleaning out my hair was a must! I am so happy with it! We just got hardwood floors throughout our whole house and realized that there is a lot of crumbs and hair that accumulate everyday. (I have 2 small dogs that shed lightly and a 2 year old so the mess is frequent). We named ours Felicia and our daughter likes to remind us everyday to "turn on Felicia"Pros:- my hair doesn't tangle in the brush and is really easy to remove (just remove the brushes and its gathered at the end)- the house is significantly cleaner by turning it on everyday (when we skip a day or two I start to notice the accumulated dirt/hair/crumbs)- we have a big house and battery lasts long enough to vacuum everywhere upstairs and downstairs- the lighthouses work well and keep the roomba out of certain rooms if need be (I have noticed that if you put it down after the vacuum has already started that it sometimes doesn't work and I will find her in the room even though I put the lighthouse at the doorway)- she gets even the smallest dog hair but also gets the big crumbs- transitioning from the rug back to hardwood floor is breeze for it even if it has frills at the edges of the rug- you can schedule it to clean everyday at a certain time which is convenient- its super gentle when it bumps the walls and furnitureCons:- it is noisy but I don't mind it (the house is always loud with a kid around)- it doesn't maneuver around as well as I thought but again we have a big house so it has many hallways and rooms to cover. Sometimes I have to go look for her and move her to another room if she has been there too long.- docking station is light so sometimes she will have a hard time getting back on it if it moved a little but its been rare moments when that really happens- if the bin is full it only has a little red light that turns on but it doesn't beep or let you know so you have to check on her often if you know your house is messy but this gets less a problem after a month of vacuuming. Also if you have a new rug be prepared to empty the bin a lot because it gets all the fuzz (see below for more info).Keep in mind:- you will have to roomba proof your house and by that I mean: first few times follow it around and see where it might get stuck or move cords etc.- if you bought a new rug be prepared for it to get a lot of the fuzz that new rugs tend to have which makes the bin full and you have to empty it frequently.Overall completely satisfied and super happy that we decided to purchase this!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for picking up hair
Review: I purchased this vacuum about a month ago and I love it. I run it in a different room each night and the floors always look clean now. With the regular vacuum, I had to clean out the rollers every couple of rooms because of hair getting wrapped around the brushes. I still pull the hair off the rollers but it comes off really easy instead of being all tangled in the brushes. I like that I can do other things while it's running. It does a good job too. It goes under furniture and around chairs, etc. It cost more than I planned to spend on a vacuum but it was worth it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Neither Amazon nor Roomba will stand behind an expensive product that must be replaced twice within 90 days. Don't Buy!
Review: I purchased this from Amazon. Within 30 days, it had a fatal error and the manufacturer replaced it with another "new" roomba. I was advised 2 days ago that it must also be replaced. I asked for a refund instead from the manufacturer, and because i bought it from Amazon, they won't. And Amazon won't because it's past 30 days. I have now had 2 roombas, 3 weeks for the first one, 6 weeks for this second one. They leave rat tails all over the floor, dust pan is small and does not fill up, yet my older Neato that is upstairs, twice the dust bin size, is completely full when I put it on the floors the roomba just finished.Ê This poor poor cleaning may be due to the fact this second roomba is also defective, or it may be all.Ê I will not recommend this at all. Not sure how I'm going to get money back for this bait and switch of replacing and then oops, your replacement is beyond your 30 days so sucks to be you.Ê First ever transaction with Amazon that I am completely disappointed beyond belief and not sure what I'm going to do about this. First interaction with Roomba and I know it will be the last.Ê Today I received an email from Roomba say, just kidding, we won't replace it now that you want a refund. Just hold down the clean button and it should reset it self.Ê I did several times prior to contacting them. So now, not only will it clean poorly, it only clean poorly when I am home to start it.Ê Either iRobots Roomba or Amazon need to find a way to fix this. You don't get to sell poorly performing expensive merchandise, and pass off accountability.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Jetsons!
Review: I purchased the Roomba after long consideration. A coworker had one and highly recommended it. When I first purchased the vacuum, I was skeptical - I have two cats, two large dos, and four children - lots of mess! The Roomba has surpassed all expectations and has surprised me with its power and thoroughness. It is quite nice to start the Roomba, leave to go shopping, and then return to freshly vacuumed floors!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Like a Dishwasher, you will wonder how you ever lived without it.
Review: I purchased my first Roomba over a year ago (the 650 for pets).Ê I thought about that purchase for 2 years before I decided to do it.Ê The price was a big factor in what took me too long.Ê As soon as I used it, I instantly regretted not purchasing one years ago.Ê I use it just about everyday and it's still going as well as day 1 with regular cleaning and filter changes.Ê When Amazon offered me the 880 Roomba, I was floored (ha).Ê This is an amazing (and yes expensive) piece of equipment.Ê The 880 immediately looks a bit slicker out of the package than the 650 and the brush design and filter is completely changed. I love that it already came with everything needed for the virtual walls and a remote!Ê I have been running it all around the house for a few weeks.Ê I have two incredibly messy toddlers, lots of thick area carpets on wooden floors.Ê The new 880 is quieter than the 650, my husband loves that because although we often run it during the day or times when less people are around the house, he is typically at his home office.Ê The 880 lives up to the Roomba name and does a fantastic job cleaning, it seems "smarter" than the 650 and gets the job done faster.Ê The rubber brushes are so ridiculously easy to clean compared to the 650.Ê I felt the 880 did a better job with dust and allergens but the old brush design did about 10% better on my carpets at getting all the loose carpet fibers.Ê I can live with that, it's still great.Ê I also feel the compartment holds a little less dirt and my shaggy carpets can fill up the Roomba quickly.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Suzanne is Close to Perfection:Ê Wonderful Everything
Review: I purchased my 870 (same as 880, but missing a cool remote control) directly from iRobot, as it was not available from my favorite retailer, Amazon.Ê I am so favorably impressed with Suzanne (my lovely Roomba 870) that I wanted to share the love with you.Ê This is my 4th Roomba, so I have a bit of experience with the device.Ê If you're not much of a reader, here is the BOTTOM LINE:Ê If you like the wholeÊ Roomba idea, just BUY THIS MACHINE.Ê It is the apotheosis of Roomba.Ê You will love it.(1) Cleaning.Ê I have three dogs (2 terriers and one Rottweiler, thanks for asking) and they generate lots of hair which has caused my previous Roombas to have major problems with hair on the brushes - I had to remove and clean the brushed after nearly every run.Ê Even the upgrade did not help much.Ê This new (no kidding, really NEW) design sends the hair straight to the bin.Ê There is NEVER hair on the brushes!Ê I have NEVER had to clean the "extractors".Ê Never.Ê The rugs look as if they have been steam cleaned.Ê Wow!(2) Bin Capacity.Ê Others have complained about the small capacity of the dust bin.Ê I, too, was really annoyed when the bin filled up in less than an hour while cleaning a carpet that had already been cleaned by a huge noisy vacuum operated by Christine, (the machine simply, the world's best house cleaner and garden organizer).Ê THERE IS NO PROBLEM, because Roomba had just removed a pile of dust and dog hair from a carpet that looked clean!Ê I ran Suzanne (the Roomba) every 12 hours for a 3 days, and the bin filled up every day.Ê On the 4th day, the bin was only partially full, and the carpet was starting to look new.Ê On the 6th day, the bin was just a little full.Ê In other words, her bin fills up because Suzanne finds dirt that others miss.(3) Christine Changes.Ê Because Suzanne is so good, Christine only needs to vacuum those little corners that Suzanne can not get into.Ê This leaves more time for other cleaning, like blinds and doing magic in the garden.Ê The big vacuum simply is not used for floors anymore.(4)Ê Terriers Attack!Ê When Suzanne is cleaning a room, the dogs just leave the room.Ê For my first Roomba, I started it cleaning and then went into town for breakfast.Ê I came home to find the Roomba on its back and my male Terrier, Captain, looking really guilty.Ê They now get along OK, although I do not believe that they will ever be friends.(5) Algorithm Upgrade?Ê Sorry, iRobot, I can not see signs that the new algorithms are much more intelligent than before, except that Suzanne is less hungry for cords than her predecessors.Ê From time to time, Suzanne will get stuck under a small chair - something about the close spacing of the 4 legs that confuses her.Ê Like most Roomba owners, I have made a few changes to my house to make it Roomba compatible, e.g., getting cords off of the floor.Ê So far, so good.Ê My measure of success is the percent of the time that Suzanne makes it back to her charging station.Ê We're running about 50% for a very large and complex first floor of my house.Ê (My own charging station is my recliner.Ê Christine might like a 6-pack.)(6)Ê Cost.Ê Yes, it is expensive, but so is my Lexus.Ê Both cases I can afford and I enjoy both.Ê Still, I AM a bit irritated by how CHEAP iRobot was for an item that costs so much!Ê Example:Ê Only ONE extra filter is included.Ê Two of the cheaper Virtual-Wall units were included, rather than the way-cooler Virtual Wall Lighthouses.Ê Furthermore, it would have been nice if the Virtual-Wall devices used a standard size, rechargeable battery, rather than a standard size battery that gets thrown away after use.Ê I do not mind paying for quality, but naked greed is such a turn-off.Ê So, I gritted my teeth and bought a charger and a few rechargeable batteries.Ê While on the subject of batteries, Suzanne does seem to clean significantly longer than previous Roombas.Ê Still a mystery why the lithium battery in my tablets last forever, but the lithium battery in my Roombas seem to require replacement every couple of years.(7)Ê Dock.Ê Nice job here, as the power supply is incorporated into the dock, so there is less junk (and wires) on the floor - less for Christine (of, more likely, me) to trip over.If you made it this far reading this too-long review, thanks for your patience.Ê I really wanted to get the word out.Ê BTW:Ê Christine does not know of my fondness for Suzanne, but there are signs that she is a little suspicious.Ê My wife likes the Roomba, but less than me.Ê Sorry about having to discuss the lovers quadrangle, but it really is critical to understanding the review.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... on previous (extremely detailed) reviews and I was not disappointed.
Review: I purchased it based on previous (extremely detailed) reviews and I was not disappointed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing little guy!
Review: I purchased irobot room a 880Ê about a month ago from Bed Bath and beyond using a 20% off coupon (saving $140!).Ê We named it Puck :)Ê What an incredible little guy!!!Ê I have it clean on the first floor which consists of three bedrooms, one bathroom, entryway, long hallway, kitchen, dining room, and living room. It does a wonderful job cleaning on one battery charge (about 2 hours).Ê We have a shepherd mix and four cats that roam around on this level of the house and are in FULL shedding mode.Ê A nice feature is that you can set the I robot to clean seven days a week however I do not use this feature because before I run Puck I want to make sure that there is nothing in its way let alone a nasty regurgitated cat fur ball from one of the cats for it to run over.Ê I also like to be around to help Puck maneuver around the house.Ê I think because the layout of my house is so long it has a hard time to find its way back to Dock even with the virtual light houses. In a more square or rectangular home I think it would find its way easier.Ê The compartment for dirt and debris and fur isn't huge but for me it's not a big deal because I'm usually somewhere around the house cleaning whenever I have Puck vacuuming.Ê Puck will also periodically shut itself in the bathroom (because it can push the door shut) to do its businessÊ and unfortunately it does not have opposable thumbs and cannot reach the doorhandleÊ to let itself outÊ haha. I usually have to empty it at least once during its cleaning cycle but it is A LOT of fur.Ê An added bonus is that it will pick up tidy breeze cat pellets that my cats kick out of their litter box. It hasn't fallen down the steps yet so it's Cliff detector works. I love this little thing!Ê Wish I didn't wait to get it as long as I did.Ê All good vacuums are relatively expensive but at least this one does most of the work for you :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I press the button, I sit at my computer ...
Review: I press the button, I sit at my computer. Two hours later the whole apartment is vacuumed. I empty the bin.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not As Good As I Had Hoped (And Thought I'd Paid For)
Review: I owned one of these quite a few years ago, not long after they were first introduced to the market.Ê That one was very expensive, and had been a Christmas gift to me.Ê I also owned a competitor's model 3 or 4 years ago, a little less expensive (inflation factored in too) that gave out after about a year.Ê This one is my third adventure in robot vacuums.Ê To be fair to all three, I have always had, and have now, several dogs, and they do tend to up the ante significantly with respect to household dirt and debris.Ê Of course, I also own a traditional vacuum, but with my work schedule it's rare that I have time to use it more than once a week, when I clean the entire house to within an inch of its life.Ê My decision to try another Roomba had to do with that lack of time, and my interest in not living in a kennel between manual cleanings.Ê All this stated...I still think the Roomba is very steeply priced for what it is.Ê I work in a high-tech company, and as much as I appreciate the many significant design and logic improvements in the 880 over the one I had years ago, I don't genuinely think, now that I've had this one for several months, that it's quite worth the asking price, and the price here was the best one I could find on it.On the plus side, I like the programming it offers, and that it now comes with two door / entry sensors - neither of which I've used, because my home is entirely one level.Ê I like that it now allows cleaning of either carpeted or hard flooring of its own adjustment, rather than me having to manually adjust / set up sensors / reprogram, as in the old days.Ê I like that I can set up a schedule for it over a week's cadence, and given my particular circumstances, I have mine programmed to run every day.Ê It does clean better than its much earlier predecessor, and as well as the competitor's model that I had a couple of years back.Ê It also doesn't get "stuck" (under couches, going over rugs and door mats, over power cords, amongst the legs of the 6-place dining set it negotiates here at my home) as much as either of the other two robot vacuums I've owned.Ê It has reasonably good dustbin capacity, and I don't find myself having to empty it DURING a cleaning, but always on a daily basis, which isn't too bad.On the minus side, I have already noticed a reduction in power, so it won't "climb" a very slight level change between my (hardwood-floored) great room and my (tiled) kitchen, sunroom and office area, without a struggle, whereas it used to make that transition without hesitation.Ê That tells me that even though I've only had it for a few months (granted, with daily use), I'll be replacing the power pack soon.Ê There are definitely IMPROVEMENTS in the spin-roll design over the brushes of the earlier version (as well as the competitor's design).Ê But they're still not very robust, and I find that I very frequently need to flip the unit over, remove and clean those up and cut hairs, etc., loose, to keep them operating smoothly, and clear the uptake vent behind them.Ê If I don't do this every/other use, that uptake vent WILL get clogged with dog hair and debris, and because I can't really "trust" that this won't happen, I have to sort of listen to the sound of the little motor to stop the unit and clean out that vent when it "sounds" muffled, or it will just keep running, but will pick up nothing -- in fact, ironically, this just happened again, as I was writing this.Ê And lastly, I am VERY irritated to find, despite routine maintenance to keep hairs or anything else from causing it to bind, that the edger spin brush has stopped rotating, making the unit essentially useless along walls and furniture legs.Ê I *THINK* I've bought the extended protection plan, but I'm going to try unscrewing that brush and see if a cleaning and some lubricant will get it running again, without having to send it back and doing without for however long it takes to get it repaired and returned to me.Bottom line -- I do appreciate the daily cursory clean up it affords me, but that doesn't make it necessarily AFFORDABLE for me, and I kind of wish I had waited a year or two longer before trying a Roomba again - especially at the top of the line, and at this price point.Ê As stated earlier, I work for a high-tech company, and I have a pretty good idea what it likely costs to manufacture this thing.Ê There must be some highly-paid developers and SW designers to justify this price point, and a healthy margin, because the cost is not in the unit itself.Ê I would call this a very light-duty novelty for those who can afford it, and if they can spend the money on something like this, they can probably pay someone to come in and clean once or twice a week, and get dusting and clean bathrooms too.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: That one did a great job on the pet hair
Review: I owned another Roomba but I got tired of having to clean out the brushes all the time because of our golden retriever's hair.Ê That one did a great job on the pet hair.Ê I think it's the 365 model that I have.Ê I bought this new one so I could give my old one away.Ê Since it was so much more expensive than the 365 I thought it would do a better job.Ê I read the reviews saying that it was good but I'm just not all that excited about this model.Ê It has a different way of handling pet hair it appears.Ê Instead of just sucking it up, it sort of chops it up when going over rugs.Ê Then it seems to leave little clumps of hair and doesn't manage to pick them up.Ê I thought I could just program this to run nightly and I would be able to maintain clean floors.Ê I always have to get out the regular vacuum to get the rest of the pet hair up.Ê Even some smaller stuff it leaves on the floor.Ê I'm wondering if I have a defective model because this just doesn't seem to pick up as good as the previous model I owned.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works great for dog hair!
Review: I owned a Roomba a few years ago and I was very disappointed by it. But I took the chance again and it is well worth it. I own a black lab and a pit/boxer mix and this little robot cleans up all of the dog hair I can through at it without a fuss. If you are looking at getting a Roomba to help conrol pet hair this will work. Just remember to keep the bin empty.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Corrects the Biggest Problem IÕve Had with My Older Roomba
Review: I own a Roomba 660 Pet Vacuum that has performed perfectly for 1+ years.Ê I have been delighted with its performance, cleaning under as well as around furniture and picking up hair from a long-haired cat who sheds copiously throughout the spring. My only complaint about this vacuum is that it picks up cat fur and winds it around the rubber brush. Although not impossible, it is very difficult to remove the wound-up fur. Otherwise, however, the 660 is a great vacumm, cleaning the house for 1Ê hours each day, returning without fail to its docking station for recharging.When offered the opportunity to use the newest pet and allergy Roomba (880), I did not anticipate enjoying it any more than my older, but still not so old, Roomba (660).Ê As often happens, I was wrong.Ê This new Roomba comes with a significant improvement over my old, much-appreciatedÊ 660. There are no brushes! This Roomba cleans with rubber(?) rods that operate in opposition to each other, sweeping up pet hair and dust without wrapping hair around brushes.Ê Debris is then deposited in the vacuums bin for easy disposal.Ê That gets rid of my least favorite choreÊ removing pet hair from the brushes of the 660.I have a long-haired cat, a short-haired cat and a Yorkie.Ê Not only do they leave hair behind, especially during spring shedding, they also bring in a ton of dust and debris from the yard.Ê Every day!Ê I can program this vacuum, like the 660, to start up on its own, every day, which means that Im getting a consistently cleaner home with an important reduction in allergens.Ê My coughing and sneezing is reduced, although opening doors for pets and people still allows a certain amount of allergens to come inside.Ê I have set the vacuum to run daily automatically, so you might think it finds little to suck upÊ by the end of the week.Ê Not so!Ê Even running every day, this vacuum still finds dust to suck up.Does it do a better job of cleaning than my old 660?Ê Its hard to make a call on this point because the carpet was already fairly clean, having been cleaned daily by the 660.Ê The 880 appears to pick up more dust but less debris than the 660.Overall, Im pleased with this new Roomba.Ê I am happy to recommend it to all pet owners, but, in case youre dismayed by the price of this newest Roomba, consider the 660 as an alternative.Ê Although it lacks the newest features of the 880, its a great value at just over half the price.By the way, when you register your Roomba 880, the irobot company will send you a little gift.Ê In my case, it was two new filters, a nice touch I was not expecting.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great little robot, worried about the robot uprising
Review: I originally gave this a bad review for its performance on hard surfaces.Ê I have had to edit the review and change it from a bad review to a good review.Ê Why?Ê The problem on hard surfaces was because I wasn't properly clearing it out after use and there was something jammed in there, blocking it.The problem was human error, not robot error.Now that it is properly cleared, it picks up everything that it needs to pick up.Ê It's a great little robot which keeps my space dust-free with almost no effort on my part.Why four stars instead of five?Ê Because this is a very dumb robot, for all its AI.Ê It has no navigation abilities.Ê It doesn't make a map of the room.Ê It goes in pre-set patterns, like spirals and edge-following.Ê That is effective.Ê It gets the job done.Ê But to really earn five stars, this little robot needs to go to the next level, which means it needs to make a map of the space it is cleaning and clean in a more organized way.Ê Like the other reviewers, at this price point I would expect it to have wifi connectivity and some type of web-based control or monitoring.I'm sure this is coming.Ê Google is prototyping self-driving cars, and some of the competitors for this robot already do map a room.Ê Certainly iRobot is working on more advanced features.Ê Until then, this robot gets 4 stars, and I'm happy with it.Stay alert for the robot uprising!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The Bachelor Pad No Longer
Review: I ordered this not really expecting a whole lot.Ê I have 3 large dogs (GSD) and just replaced my living room carpet with laminate.Ê I never knew how much fur the carpet hid until it was no longer there.Ê There were fur balls everywhere, all the time.Ê No matter how much I brushed them.Ê I would vacuum and within 5 minutes find another big ball of hair.The Roomba has almost eliminated hairballs.Ê I am thoroughly impressed.Ê It has a few different cleaning modes, and depending on the degree of cleaning you expect will help you decide which one is appropriate.Ê The first mode is just cleaning to a room as limited by physical walls and the virtual walls which come with the vacuum.Ê In this mode it will clean the room until it thinks it is done.Ê This mode done a very thorough job and is more than clean enough for me.Ê The other mode is room to room cleaning, where you block off entrances to the other room(s) with the virtual walls.Ê It will then finish cleaning each room before moving on to the next.Ê This is what I have it set for when I have it run on a schedule.Ê The caveat is in the room to room mode it will only stay in each room for 25 minutes so that it can make it through them on a single charge (I assume).Ê This is usually enough for maintenance, but about a once a week I still do the single room clean to tidy up some more.If I run it regularly I can get through most of the house on a single bin.Ê However, with 3 large dogs it does sometimes need to be emptied due to fur consumption.Ê For most people I wouldn't expect it to be an issue.Ê It's not a big deal.Ê The red light comes on, you empty the bin, put it back, hit the button and it keeps going.Ê Still far better than having to vacuum myself!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good, but doesn't meet advertised expectations.
Review: I ordered this model with high expectations based on customer reviews and friend's recommendations.Ê This vacuum does not quite meet the advertised expectations.Ê A few points to consider before spending the money on this model:It is advertised as "virtually maintenance free", but maintenance is required at least once week if you have pets.Ê We have two cats, and their hair frequently gets caught and wrapped around in the front wheel.Ê You can detach the entire wheel base and remove the wheel, so it isn't too difficult to clean.Ê Hair will also clog the spinning brush, but this can be removed and cleaned with a screwdriver.Ê I wouldn't consider this "maintenance free", considering parts have to be removed with tools and cleaned at least once a week.The device is also advertised to handle "any shaped and sized room".Ê We have a relatively small 1200 ft. condo with a large irregular shaped living/kitchen/dining area, plus two square bedrooms.Ê The device often does not make it in to the bedrooms after cleaning the living room, even though we do have "lighthouses" setup at the entrance of each room that are supposed to make sure the Roomba adequately cleans the living room before going in to the bedrooms.We also have a higher rug in the dining room, and the device is unable to detect the rug so it does not clean it.A couple design changes for easier cleaning would make this a 4-star device for the money.Ê If you could program it to understand where high rugs are located so the device doesn't just bump the rug in turn, I would give it a 4-star review.Ê If the navigation could also be improved to better understand your home's layout to make sure it hits all rooms before docking, that would make it a 5-star device for the price.Ê (By the way, it only makes its way back to the docking station ab out 50% of the time when done)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I ordered one and I love it!
Review: I ordered one and I love it!! We have 5 dogs and it works like a charm!! Best Purchase we have made!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not worth $700 , $140 restocking fee??
Review: I never write reviews and hardly ever return anything , but felt compelled to do so this time , I bought the 880 after reading the great reviews , I had a Neato and it was time to upgrade . Once I got it it was just ok , certainly not worth the $700 price tag , my $300 neato did a much better job ... , it would indicate that the bin was full but when I opened it there was hardly anything in the dustbin only to see that it was completely clogged up. This happened on many occasions. I called Amazon to return it , they were very helpful and I received instructions to do so. Once they received the rumba I got an email that they refunded my money minus a $140 restocking fee !!!! Really ??? The lady on the phone never mentioned that , I only had the thing for a couple of weeks .I realize that it was a secondary company , Mr. Vac & Mrs. Sew that they dealt with it but still ....feel that it was outrageous. I thought I received a lemon and wanted to order the 880 again but I don't want to get hit with another $140 "restocking fee".

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I never thought I would be so satisfied with this product as I am
Review: I never thought I would be so satisfied with this product as I am. We have a Labrador Retriever and a Sheltie and they shed like crazy. Everyday there is a pile of short eyelash-like hairs on our tile floor and in our carpet.Ê Hair is everywhere.Ê The Roomba 880 picks up all of the hair.Ê I do the main living areas in the early AM and in an hour or 2 it is done.Ê A recharge and I unleash it on the other rooms.This saves me from vacuuming at least 2x's a week with my regular vacuum.Ê I had a few times that the Roomba got caught up in an area, but considering that minor glitch, my purchase is well worth it. I highly recommend it to anyone who have pets that shed. It saves me a ton of work!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My new best friend
Review: I named mine "Roger".Ê Yes, he was expensive, but oh....SO worth it!Ê Even my husband likes to vacuum now.Ê We don't run it on an automatic schedule because with our pets we usually have to clean out the dust bin once or twice during a cycle. Also, I like to keep an eye on him just in case he runs into any little hangups anywhere.Ê I've wanted one of these for years and finally just bit the bullet and ordered it.Ê The house even smells better after Roger parks himself in his little recharger.Ê I love how he can get under chairs and coffee tables.Ê I am always amazed with how much stuff he picks up!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: it's a totally a useless product, when there are so many good vacuum ...
Review: I marked it one star, because it have to have at least one star! Otherwise, it should be no star at all. It broke only 2 days of using, it's a totally a useless product, when there are so many good vacuum out there with lower price and much better service. Don't buy this product espicially when you are out US. You can buy a very good cleaning robot with only 1/5 price, with much better after-sales service.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great product
Review: I love this vacuum. Run it when you leave the house and voila - clean floors. I'm very impressed with how much dust this collects vs. our ten-year old Miele. Not that the Miele is bad, but the Roomba finds dust even after using the other vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love this vacuum. I run it frequently. I like to go barefoot in the house, this vacuum keep my floor grit free.Does a good job vacuuming. I replaced my older model with this one. I programed it so it would vacuum on schedule, no more pushing the button to vacuum. Best purchase my husband made this year.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love this vacuum cleaner
Review: I love this vacuum cleaner. Does a thorough job of vacuuming. I have ceramic tile and wood floors so while "Ruby" is working, I can do anything else except vacuum.Ê Easily travels from one room to the next cleaning all the way! Fascinating and fantastic!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My second Roomba, and I love it.
Review: I love this thing. I have a dog, and I was amazed to see how much hair is on my carpet that I didn't realize was there. This is my second Roomba, and I have been a big fan for a long time. I am upgrading to the 880, and the new features work very well. I program mine to clean once a day.Ê I use the lighthouses and my only minor complaint might be that it is a little random about when it decides to go into another cleaning area. It does an excellent job, but it might choose not to go into a particular cleaning area for several days in a row.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth every penny, love it
