Review: I LOVE this thing.Ê We have a home with all hard floors and three dogs, one of whom is a 'German Shedder'.Ê We had hair balls floating all over.Ê I needed to vacuum daily, I wasn't going to do that... we also have aged barnwood floors, complete with original nail holes, gouges etc. which are super cool but holy gosh hard to keep clean.Ê The dirt goes down in those crevices.When I got the Roomba, I vacuumed the entire main floor and then set it going.Ê It finally stopped early when it was over full.Ê It got that much up after I worked on the floors.Ê Now I run it daily, clean the dirt trap as part of my morning routine and do my heavier floor cleaning once a week.Ê Voila! problems solved.Ê I am no longer embarassed to have folks show up unannounced (which I was).Ê Total dog person, but really like the house to be tidy.PS months later - this product is still working for pet hair, hardly a blip... runs over cords, under furniture, around dog toys.Ê It's occasionally gotten trapped under a cabinet kick that was slightly different height than others... it's sometimes gotten jammed with a chewed dog toy or too much dog hair BUT it stops and tells you what's wrong, pick it up and clean it (easy) and off it goes again.Ê I'm getting excessively attached to this thing, sooo incredible to have clean floors with three dogs all shedding.Ê I couldn't keep up with it otherwise.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Highly recommend!
Review: I love this thing.Ê it does a great job of picking up dirt and has no problem navigating around the rooms - although it locked itself inside of one of my bathrooms because the door wasn't fully against the wall.Ê it ended up working its way behind the door and shutting it.Ê That was pretty funny.Ê I came home, the bathroom door was shut, and it had "died" (battery ran out).Ê But it recharged quickly and was all set to go in a few hours.It's amazing how otherwise it doesn't every get stuck anywhere.Ê The first time I used it on my upstairs it picked up a huge amount of dirt that was a real eye opener - I think primarily because it went under the beds and other furniture that normally doesn't get cleaned.Ê I also love the ability to program by day and just let it do its thing.Ê I've had it about two months now so don't know how long it will run but so far it's been great - and I highly recommend it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacuum, no issues yet
Review: I love this thing.Ê I have two cats and have allergies.Ê This thing keeps the place clean and me breathing well.Ê I had my doubts, thought this was a 'maintenance' vacuum, to run between weekly deep cleaning with my Dyson.Ê When I first got it, I did a thorough vacuum with the dyson first, and didn't stop until it didn't pick up anything new.Ê Charged up the Roomba and let it run.Ê It stopped; complaining of a full bin.Ê a little miffed (if the big vacuum stopped picking things up how could the Roomba fill up already?).Ê To my surprise the bin was well and truly packed with pet fur.Ê It took three consecutive days of running (once per day) till it stopped filling the bin.This thing gets to places I can not get to otherwise. I have a workbench which is too heavy and cluttered to move on a regular basis - this scoots in under it with not problem.Ê It also seems strangely smart about what it can and can't push around.Ê If it encounters small light paper bags or tissue boxes, for instance, it will push them around to get at the rug underneath, but when it bumps into your leg, a chair, or cabinet, it stops, turns, and moves on.It does get trapped fairly easily if you have cluttered floors.Ê It will usually escape but can take time (and battery life) to do so. So I have taken to putting chairs upside down on my dining room table, making sure tray tables are away, etc... to give it more room to work.The thing is quiet as well.Ê I will let it run as I work on my computer or watch TV in the same room.Ê My older cat, spooked by just about anything, doesn't mind the thing and will hang out in the same room as it.Ê My younger cat used to play with it, but it tends to eat her toys so she has gotten aggressive with it recently, I don't think she likes it anymore.I haven't had an issue with maintenance yet - the filter is easy to replace.Ê The rollers got jammed once, but they were easy to remove and unblock.Ê And occasionally I have to untangle cat toys from the little spinning brush on its side.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great machine
Review: I love this thing! Got it almost a year ago and it is great. I had it scheduled to clean at night so I could wake up to clean floors but my daughter thinks it is too loud so now I run it when I'm not home- it does get stuck sometimes but I just either block off those very few areas or pick it up and return it to its dock when I get home. Love it so much my siblings got robotic vacuums too. I find it works well on all flooring- rugs, tile, and wood

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: CAN'T BELIEVE HOW GREAT THIS WORKS!
Review: I love this thing so much that I bought 2 of them -- 1 for each level of my house.Ê Not only that, but I devoted a Facebook post to how great it works.Ê I resisted buying one of these for years because I thought it was a toy.Ê I had NO IDEA HOW GREAT THESE THINGS WORK!!!Ê It takes a lot to impress me, and I held on to the box and receipt, assuming I'd play with it for a couple of days and then return it to the store.Ê Instead, each and every time it ran, it brought me an overflowing box of dirt, dust and pet hair -- and this was AFTER THE CLEANING LADY CAME.Ê Astonishing how much dirt and dust and crap follow the dogs into the house every day.Ê Makes a huge difference in the cleanliness of the house.Ê Easy to operate, easy to progam, easy to clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Makes life easy
Review: I love this Roomba. I set the lighthouses for my 3 first floor rooms and schedule Roomba to vacuum at 3am and we wake up to clean floors. It is the most maintenance free one I've had. I did buy extra filters and I switch them out every other day because we have a lot of dust. I hope this one lasts a long time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: our dogs don't like it...
Review: I LOVE this Romba! It has helped SO much with keeping the hair from our 3 dogs & 1 cat down to a minimum!On a funny note...Is it normal for it to chase my dogs? LOL one time it literally bumped my dog backed up and did it again 3 times!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome
Review: I love this robot.Ê it does a way better job at cleaning carpets than my kids.Ê Maintenance is dirt simple.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: So convenient!
Review: I love this machine!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: What is not to love?
Review: I love this machine and what it does for me...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: melting charging contacts!!!!
Review: i love this irobot, it saved me hours and hours of cleaning, but my 880 is defective and has melted charging contacts and melted base contacts. I think it is very dangerous to have this kind of problems, huge liability for irobot, i hope they will fix this problem because i really love the product. i contacted customer service, they were great and wanted to replace it for a new one, but i just cant trust this band anymore.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love this little piece of gear.
Review: I love this great little device.Ê She has some little issues, but does a pretty good job of cleaning up our floors.Ê I have to watch where it goes to make sure all of the floor is covered, but otherwise it's good to go.Ê Without proper supervision it may repeat cleaning in one area of the floor on a big room, so you have to make sure it gets corrected to the rest of the room.Ê I am amazed how much dirt and dog hair it picks up.Ê We have a housekeeper come in every other week, but it still picks up a significant amount of dog hair when I run it twice a week.Ê It's definitely easier than running a vacuum cleaner around manually, and fun to watch if you're a techie type.Ê I highly recommend it, especially if you have tile or hardwood floors.Ê Thank you Roomba for helping me battle the never ending fight against dog hair.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome
Review: I LOVE this crazy thing... I spent 7 months researching these robot cleaners, and finally landed on this one.OMGÊ WOWI have some pretty expensive (and good) vacuum cleaners. So I cleaned the house and then let this thing loose. It got so much stuff off the floors that I had to continually stop and empty its bin. I could not believe what this thing was picking up.When I bought it, I thought: How much can a motorized pie plate pick up... Boy, was I wrong.And I love the fact that when it gets low on charge, or it's finished cleaning, it returns to its charging station.I am now a convert to the robotÊ ;-)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love the way it cleans up all the pet hair.Ê Keeps the dust and dander down too.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love the Roomba 880
Review: I love the Roomba 880.Ê It is so wonderful to stand back and let this vacuum do it's job.Ê It gets lots of hair, dust and dirt up.Ê I have two very furry cats and a not as furry dog.Ê I could spend my life vacuuming and instead I just let this little thing loose.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Gotta love the robots!
Review: I love the Roomba 880 and have owned it for about 4 months now and am so glad I bought it. I just leave it to do its magic when I go out and return to a clean home! If I am going to be home, it allows me to do other things while taking care of the cleaning needs.. It is a MUST have! In fact, I was so enamored by the convenience, that I went ahead and got the Scooba and Braava... my floors are always clean now, despite pets and kids!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love the irobot 880!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love the idea of this and have actually bought a ...
Review: I love the idea of this and have actually bought a few of their products.Ê I have had two issues with the Roomba's charging connectors.Ê They did send me a replacement unit which was great but I wish the quality was a little better for the price.Ê That being said after a year I couldn't live without it and would still buy it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love the bristle-less rollers on this model.Ê It is an essential part of our home.Ê We love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love my vacuum
Review: I love my vacuum, I call it Robotin. I have a 1Bed1Bath apartment with carpet in the bedroom and hardwood floors in the rest of the house. It works marvelously for both type of floors. It doesn't get stuck on my furniture. I am aware of not leaving things in the floor, such as shoes and socks. Sometimes I do and the robot gets stuck, some other times it doesn't. If it happens, it's no problem, I just take it out and hit the clean button again. I scheduled it to run every morning, so it wakes me up (I am a heavy sleeper, so it helps me not being late for work). It's not as loud as a traditional vacuum but it's not quite either. It cleans for an hour everyday. I let it rest on the weekends (during this time my HEPA filter is getting dry). I mop my floors once a week. I can be bare foot all the time, its great. I clean my robot once a week as well. I wash the HEPA filter. Take the hair out from the brush, the little wheel, and the 2 tangle-free debris extractors. And of course, I take out the dirt from the dirt container as well. It takes me around 6 minutes to do it and I need a screwdriver. It is very easy and I never have to worry about vacuuming. I have owned it for 5 months now. My house smells clean all the time and I love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth the investment
Review: I love my Roomba. It works well and makes vacuuming easier for me since it's a chore I struggle with post an injury. Here are my pros and cons:Pros:* Very intuitive.* Easy to program a cleaning once a day for any and all days of the week.* Stores in a small area of the room* The battery lasts a long time for a good cleaning.* It goes from carpet to hardwood floor very easily.Cons:* The "walls/barriers" that accompany the Roomba don't work too well. Sometimes they strictly work as a wall and never prevent the vacuum from entering the next room, sometimes it doesn't work at all, and other times it works great-- this is all regardless of settings.* It doesn't get the edge where the rug meets the hardwood floors very well.Overall, the product was well worth the money.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very happy I purchased
Review: I love my Roomba. It works very well on hardwood and does a pretty good job getting the pet hair off of the carpet. For what it doesn't get up, at least it leaves huge chunks that I can easily pick up (like it weaves all the pet hair together). I can deal with that, as once the chunks are picked up (probably leaves 3-4 per room), there is no pet hair on the rug at all. It's a smart machine, and I haven't used a regular vacuum since getting this!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I LOVE my roomba
Review: I LOVE my roomba. He has a name and is the first person I greet everyday when I come home. I have 2 dogs and a cat and this little guys is a life saver. Well worth every penny and I'm not sure why I waited so long to buy him.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I LOVE MY ROOMBA
Review: I LOVE MY ROOMBA, IT DOES A GREAT JOB. WISHED I HAD BOUGHT ONE YEARS AGO. IÊ WILL AND HAVE RECOMENDED IT TO FAMILY AND FREINDS.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great vacuum! Worth the price!
Review: I love my Roomba! What a time saver! It vacuums while I do other things! I highly recommend this model over the older ones. It has a much larger dust bin, better battery, and needs much less maintenance. It does great with solid surface floors and area rugs. The bin needs changing quite often with wall to wall carpet because of the carpet fuzz. It performs best when given one room to do at a time.Ê Be sure to do a little prep: get lamp cords off the floor (a small Command strip hook along the baseboard does the trick), pick up clutter, move chairs, footstools, and other items out of the way. It's fantastic at getting under furniture. I use it at my office and my home. It's quiet enough for me to have a phone conversation with it running in the same room.Ê It may be very expensive for a vacuum, but I have found it to be worth every penny!Ê I have saved thousands by getting this and getting rid of my cleaning crew.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love my roomba! Really does well with pet hair.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for pet hair!
Review: I love my Roomba! Excellent for picking up pet hair!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love my Roomba
Review: I love my Roomba!Ê It amazes me how well this little guy cleans.Ê One of the best purchases I have ever made.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Well worth the price!
Review: I LOVE my Roomba!Ê I've had it about a month and could not be more pleased.Ê I chose this model because we have Oriental wool rugs with fringes and the brushless system cleans them without damaging them.Ê We have a big, fluffy Maine Coon cat that sheds everywhere, and the Roomba does a fantastic job of cleaning up the cat hair. It also does an amazing job of vacuuming wood floors and and all our various rugs.Ê It manages to clean around chair legs and gets under things I could not reach with a regular vacuum, and it goes over computer wires and other cords without hassle. It's much quieter than a regular vacuum cleaner.Ê One day I came in and found that it had turned itself off without finishing its job.Ê When I turned it back on it sounded sick.Ê It was very easy to remove the rollers, and I discovered that it had sucked up one of the cat's toy mice.Ê Once the mouse was removed the Roomba worked just fine again.Ê You have to empty the dirt bin after every clean, but it's a snap to do and much easier than doing the vacuuming.Ê When you register it, iRobot will send you 2 more filters.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I Love my ROOMBA 880!
Review: I love my ROOMBA 880! I don't know how I did it before her.Ê I have two cats and had to do my laminate floors EVERYDAY!Ê (90% laminate & Vinyl, 15% Carpet) Now I have time to do other chores!Ê Just love my girl!Ê Thank You IROBOT!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Once I figured out the logistics of how its programming works, this was an absolute Godsend!
Review: I love my Rooma 880! I admit there are some things that could be improved upon, but since I don't think technology is really there, yet, I'm going to go ahead and give this 5 stars.We have a Siberian Husky, an Australian Shepherd, and a Maine Coon cat. All of these animals have one thing in common: fur, fur, so much fur, and death by fur! If we go without vacuuming for about one week, we will literally (not exaggerating - we measured out of morbid curiosity) vacuum about 3 to 5 gallons of fur depending on how compressed it is. With the Roomba running daily, the fur is finally under control.As for the things that I wish technology would catch up with, the Roomba was a bit tricky to figure out in our ranch style home. Also, I imagine if you had a split level home, you would need 2 Roombas to be able to run them daily over the whole house. I'm not sure, but it seems like that would be the case. I'd check out other reviews for that one to be sure.Our house is about a 1500 square foot ranch home with hardwood floors. I was initially having trouble with the Roomba either not cleaning all of the rooms or dying before it could make it back to its dock. I troubleshot getting the Roomba to clean all of the rooms I wanted it to. After some research, I discovered that when I put a Lighthouse in a doorway, that tells the Roomba not to move forward into the next room "forward" of the lighthouse until it's done cleaning the room "behind" the Lighthouse. Given that some of our rooms are quite large, such as the living/dining room, the Roomba was dying before it finished cleaning or couldn't find its base again. For those of you in similar situations, I suggest removing the Lighthouses altogether. Also, place the Roomba towards the center of the home versus all the way on one side or the other. We now use our Lighthouse/Virtual Walls as virtual walls to keep the Roomba out of the bathrooms as it likes to get stuck behind doors in tight spaces. Without using Lighthouses, the Roomba cleans the entire house as it should. Also, It does at times get stuck in tight spaces around the house where there might be clutter and likes to eat shoe laces or things like iPhone power cords. The solution for this is to remove clutter, open spaces, and (you guessed it) tuck in those shoe laces and power cords!Other than that, the Roomba is great. I let it run once a day, empty it when I get home, and rejoice that I no longer have tumble weeds of fur all over the home!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love my IRobot Roomba 880
Review: I love my IRobot Roomba. I use it every day and often twice a day.We have 2 dogs and three toddlers living with us and our floors remain very clean. I'm also encouraged to pick up every night, so the floor is clear for the roomba. It is amazing how much it picks up on just once cycle!! I will always have a roomba because now we'll never have to vacuum ever!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A good investment in a cleaner home
Review: I love mine. We have named him Lurch, and usually enjoy watching him wake up automatically every day and scoot around the house doing his chores. Every now and then we have to have him skip a session because he's loud though. And we have to keep our bathroom doors closed because he has a tendency to get stuck on the plush bathroom rugs. And he ate a sock once. He's kind of like a puppy that way, but without the peeing in the floor. And the logic of his cleaning pattern is, shall we say, less than clear. But if we keep obstructions to a minimum (yes, we pick up for the robot more than for ourselves), he does a great job of keeping my hardwood floors clean of dust, debris, and pet hair. He picks up so much I do have to empty his bin every day, and sometimes he will pick up so much in the first 45 minutes he will go back home and dock, waiting to be emptied, before completing his appointed rounds.In summary, he was a pricey investment, but we had just had new hardwood installed and wanted to keep it clean and knew that with our schedule we would not realistically vacuum every day and would otherwise be consigning ourselves to a life of watching husky hair blow across the living room in great tumbleweeds. This is better, and definitely worth it.I haven't seen the cat ride it down the hallway yet though. When that happens, I'll know that we're all pleased with the investment.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it
Review: I love love love it.Ê With the brush, it does get in the corner pretty well.Ê It is great to wake up every morning to a clean carpet.Ê We have a Golden Retriver with a lot of hair.Ê If we use it nightly, we only have to empty it in the morning.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love it. Unbelievable the cat and dog hair, dander it picks up I can breathe

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love it. My family even gave it a name, "Judy"

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: i call him k-9.
Review: i love it. i set him loose in a room and he just goes and goes. excellent cleaning job. well worth the price.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love it. I love it
Review: I love it. I love it. I love it. Did I say, "I love it"? I've had it a little over a month. It was easy to set up and get started with. Instructions are straightforward and well written. It's amazing to watch, and has quickly become a member of the family as it bustles here and there. It's especially entertaining when it heads directly down the long hall. It's easy to clean. I thought emptying the bin would be annoying, but it's actually gratifying to see all the gunk it picks up. I thought I was a clean freak, but this run circles around me (quite literally!). The sound is rather distracting, so talking on the phone or concentrating on something in Mr. Roomba's proximity isn't easy, but the result is worth going into another room for a while. Already I've noticed a reduction in my morning allergies.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love it. Big improvement from the original I bought.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I love it. A few glitches that weren't helped by ...
Review: I love it.Ê A few glitches that weren't helped by the poorly written manual, both hard copy and on line.Ê It doesn't go back to the dock most of the time.Ê But I do love it.Ê It has changed my life.Ê This model doesn't have bristles that collect fur and I love that.Ê No bristles to clean out all the time.Ê Great product.Ê Amazing engineering.Ê Fascinating to watch.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRobot Roomba 880 Vacuum Cleaning Robot
Review: I love it!!!Ê I love it!!!Ê I love it!!Ê Did I mention I love the iRobot Roomba 880 Vacuum cleaning devise!!Ê I have three inside cats...that means cat hair daily.Ê I have hardwood floors, tile floors, oriental rugs with fringe on some, downstairs is fully carpeted.Ê The Roomba 880 cleans all the surfaces and they look like new when the Roomba returns to the home station.Ê I simply empty the tray of all that has been picked up from the floors and let it self charge for the next cleaning.Ê This is the most fantabulous product I have ever had for my home.Ê I really doÊ love it!!Ê It cleans everything except steps and furniture...it goes under the beds and furniture;Ê it cleans around chair legs; it is not loud and I can program it to clean when I am not home on certain days of the week.Ê My husband is an engineer and he too is impressed with the Roomba.Ê Everyone should have a iRobot Roomba 880!!Ê This is like a new maid....mine came from Amazon and you can get yours there also.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!
Review: I love it! It beats the heck out of sweeping or even using the vac.Ê the floor and the area rugs which it has no problem with going on and off of. I definitely recommend it, I think it's great!Now a few things I have learned about the most efficient way to use it.Ê I do not program it to work by itself, it gets tangled in wires and I have one piece of furniture it will get really stuck under. In my opinion, if left alone, it spends too much time going over and over the same areas. So I set the virtual wall and place it in the room/area I want it to do. Then I do the same with the other rooms. I might even sweep stuff out of the edges of a room and use the "spot" setting to get that stuff. I don't work soÊ have time to do this. I may only have it do one room some days. When I am done, I pick it up and place itÊ in front of the docking station and in it goes. Someone said at first it "learns" about areas as it runsÊ and becomes more efficient, but customer service told me this is not true, it runsÊ random patterns. Oh, and don't bother with the remote, it did not work well. Much easier to pick it up and put it where you want it,

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I love it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I named her Karen bc she is like my maid
Review: I looooove my 880. I named her Karen bc she is like my maid. I am a clean freak as it is and was starting to have a panic attacks when I moved into a large 3 story town house that was 4 times the size of any apartment I've ever lived in and got a kitten and a puppy. I could not keep up with the daily cleaning needs of a large house and new pets and spent my weekends cleaning three levels of floors. Before I jumped put the third story window, my boyfriend bought be the sweeper/mop first. It worked okay, but I told him I sweep/vacuum daily and mop weekly, so a vacuum would be the better option. We returned the sweeper/mop and got the 880 and it has been life changing. I got my weekends and sanity back! I have been using it for a month and still shocked to see what it picks up. I use mine on tile, carpet and area rugs and it cruises over them just fine. I have to do very little prep to make sure it doesn't get stuck on anything. Because it creeps against the wall, sometimes it will close a door and get stuck in that room until it dies as mine cannot find it's dock to go back to if I am using it on another level. I just put something against the door so it wont push it close as some of my doors don't open all the way against the wall and stay there. Other than that I run it daily. I make her work for me and she's amazing! My animals hated it at first but now don't seem to care. I run it downstairs during the day, upstairs after work and I have it set to clean my main floor every night at 3AM. Every morning I wake up expecting not to see anything in it as it runs daily but am always shocked how much dust and small items it picks up. More than my Shark does for sure. When I run it on the carpet, which I have been running it for a month now and it is always full of human, pet hair and dust. I get so grossed out bc I am a clean freak and to know it's still getting massive amounts daily is shocking. I am sure most of it comes from places I don't do often with my Shark, like under the bed. The 880 zooms right under my bed skirt and cleans away. It is strange what it likes and doesn't. I have a very, very thin front door mat that it refuses to go over. I think it knows it will get sucked up bc it's so strong and at first I was picking up my think heavy bathroom rugs bc I was sure it would not go over them and one day by accident I left them down and it was on it cursing slowly over them just cleaning away. I was SHOCKED. Anyways, if you have a busy life and house, this is must have. I don't know how I lived without one for so long. I love the virtual walls it come with. I have a tall bird cage so I put one in front of it so it doesn't bang into my cockatiels cage at 3am scaring her. I also put one by the stairs even though you don't have to with this model bc it can sense the stairs, but I still don't like to risk it. I love it too much to have it broken!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I liked it. The 880 performed as advertised
Review: I liked it. The 880 performed as advertised; I can't say it any simpler than that. As a result, I purchased a Roomba 880 for my daughter; with a nine-year old in the house and she and her husband working, who could use such a unit more !?!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: i like it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Truly improved my life!
Review: I just replaced an old Roomba from about 5 years ago with this new one. I am so thrilled with it! I know it's not perfect - and as a prior Roomba user I expected that. But this thing picks up so much out of my area rug that I have now run it about 12 times over the same area rug and it is still filling up the bin. I didn't know it was possible to have that much to vacuum out of a single rug! At this point most of it is loose rug fibers but those were getting tracked around the room so I'm glad they're getting vacuumed up. Kind of makes me glad we have hard wood floors and not carpeting. And this is after using a dyson vac and prior roomba to regularly clean the rug. This 880 is very powerful - when you first start using it stay on top of the bin because once it is full it does keep running and may kick out balls of fiber/dust if it has no where to go. I am a little surprised it doesn't stop and tell you to empty the bin (my previous Roomba did) - but once you're using it regularly and it has already deep cleaned everything I don't think this will matter for regular use.I currently have it set to run at 5am every day in the same 2 main rooms. I wake up, empty the bin, and then set it to work somewhere else. I love this - it can go under things and it keeps our house so much cleaner because I use it daily. We have a yellow lab, a school aged daughter, and we live in a beach town. To keep up with the floors I would need to drag out the dyson every single day. Now I only have to use it for little things here and there.My only wish is that it could handle the transition from the hard wood to the carpet better. But honestly I'm not sure how it could. It has no trouble getting up on the area rug but there is always a little dust or fibers that remain along the edges of the rugs because the Roomba can't suck those up while climbing up on the area rug. So that's where I might use the Dyson to run it along the edges.This truly makes my life easier and I love having it. It's also much, much quieter than previous models. I'm happy.UPDATE:It's been about a month since I bought the first one and I just bought a second one. Now I have one in each of our two main rooms and they both run at 5am. I love waking up to super clean floors!! I love these things!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: FILTHY, USED UNIT! DO NOT BUY!
Review: I just received this unit and opened it to find, to my horror, that the unit was FILTHY, clogged with long, black hair and the collection bin was filled with cat dander and dust, which immediately activated my allergies, causing my face to swell and my vision to blur. There is nothing on this product listing that suggested this would be a rejected item, and -- let me be clear -- this is NOT a "refurbished" item. There were fingerprints all over the cover as well as the filth on the outside and the hair/dander inside.I'll be returning this item, filing a complaint against the merchant and buying a unit directly from iRobot to try out what looks like a neat technology. Shame on Amazon for letting this happen!!!

Review: I just purchased the 880 and was loving it, despite some issues that I was attributing to possible "user" incompetence.Ê But now I think it may be scratching my hardwood floors, but the wheels don't seem to be jammed or stuck or dirty, so I'm baffled and afraid to use it.Ê Does anybody have some solutions on this?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent IRobot Roomba 880
Review: I just love this product it arrived on time packaged to where nothing was broken and does an excellent job cleaning my floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I just love my roomba. It keeps my ceramic tiled floors realy dust free.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Is it wrong to be in love with a vacuum?
Review: I just love it but within 3 months I have had to replace HEPA filter 3 times, the sidebrush once, and the debris extractors once. Noticed it wasn't cleaning as well as it had so replaced HEPA filter and sidebrush but still no improvement. New debris extractors was exactly what was needed to get it working as well as it had in the 1st 2 months.User's manual states that debris extractors should be replaced every 12 months so having to replace them more on the order of every 3 months is a bit costly. Still extremely happy with the product and have not for a moment regretted this purchase. A two dog home really benefits from daily use of this terrific product. And the design of the debris extractors make short work of cleaning them as they are not brushes that would quickly get tangled with dog fur, but rubber rollers that absolutely do not get tangled up with fur. It effortlessly moves from carpeting to hardwood to tile without any problems and the cliff-sensor keeps it from falling down stairs 100% of the time.The 880 even tells you when to clean the extractors and when to empty the bin. Parts that need to be monitored for cleaning are all colored yellow to be recognized easily and are designed for easy access for cleaning. A truly wonderfully thought out, designed, and effective product. Highly recommend this vacuum and have told everyone in my orbit about it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It is a good product just not for my house
Review: I just hate that the dirt container is so tiny you have to constantly empty it and the battery doesn't last that long. Maybe it would work better in a small house. I do not want to have one in every room. Make it too expansive :) Returned

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing Little Critter!
Review: I initially decided to buy this little guy for myself - as a kind of extravagant Mothers Day gift, and an indulgence.Ê But now my viewpoint has evolved.Ê This little critter began as an entertainment...then became impressively functional.Ê I spent time on the first use, setting up the areas that Little Robot should be kept away from.Ê Once the trouble spots were identified, the little worker-bee went to town cleaning thoroughly.Ê I have two floors to my home, and he can clean one entire floor totally without having to re-dock for an energy recharge.Ê He seems to like being under beds and other items of furniture, so I've put up some obstacles so that he focuses more on the center parts of each room.Ê Even though I've used this dirt chomper several times now, I'm still so amused with watching him do his thing.Ê Always wanted my own private robot!!Ê This is a 2-in-1 prize...entertaining AND functional!Ê Makes vacuuming a non-work activity, and I can sit at my desk and take care of other duties while my house gets cleaned without my participation.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I heard such great reviews about this
Review: I heard such great reviews about this... Its cleans like a human in your house.. it doesn't clean the same spot twice. it doesn't fall off the stairs.. it has supper sensors bla bla bla but its not all true. But the reason I decided to give it 4 stars and keep the Roomba is because Yes it true it goes around the whole house the house still looks dusty and dirty but when its time to empty out the Roomba its full of dust and dirt which shows me that I could have been breathing more dirt if I didnt have the Roomba going around everyday and doing what it does. So dont expect to see your house clean when you return but when ur emptying out the little bin you will notice that it actually does pick up dirt... The noise is kinda loud I wish they can work on that. Sometimes it goes into my bathroom or pantry and looks the door on itself and stays there till the battery is dead or the time is up.. Lol thats funny and sad.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

I want sent a replacement battery after numerous conversations with their tech support, however that did not correct the problem. The virtual lighthouses do not work very efficiently either. Bottom line do spend your hard earned cash on this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I haven't vacuumed as much in my lifetime as my ...
Review: I haven't vacuumed as much in my lifetime as my Roomba has done for me in the past couple of weeks.Ê Cat hair be gone!Ê It does require a bit of fuss to keep the bin empty, filter clean, and sensors dusted, but those are minor necessities.Ê The charging stand is a bit light for the Roomba to consistently dock itself as it keeps pushing it rather than loading onto it - but no problem with me putting it on the dock manually.Ê I can not speak to the durability as this is a new purchase, but I hope the Roomba keeps rolling for a long time.Ê Can vacuuming really be a pleasure?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... programmed it yet but even without that it cleans amazing! I highly recommend it especially for hard wood ...
Review: I haven't had it long and haven't programmed it yet but even without that it cleans amazing! I highly recommend it especially for hard wood floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent performance
Review: I have used three of the Neato vacuums for several years, and found them decent, but not a replacement for regular vacuuming with a good upright on carpet. The Neato's "intelligent" mapping of the room was somehow appealing. The Roomba is *much* better at cleaning carpets, and I think it could replace a good upright. I am using two of the Roombas and they are all-around excellent. The seemingly stupid random wandering of the Roomba seems to actually contribute to the cleaning power because it is constantly going over the same spots, and from different angles. The downside is that it takes much longer than the Neato to complete a room, but since you don't have to be there, I don't see that it matters. Also, the battery life of the Roomba seems to be three or four times greater than the Neatos, which often had to recharge during the job. The Roomba can do a 1,000 square foot carpeted area without recharge and do it really well. It also gets hung up on objects only very rarely, much less often than the Neato. I did have to buy two "Halo" units to prohibit its entering some very tricky places.The one modification to the Roomba that I would suggest is to add material to the front bumper, which is the entire front half of the machine. I used one inch-wide, self-adhesive Velcro, only the soft (loop, felt-like) strip. I have one strip all the way around the top of the bumper, another along the bottom (over the original rubber bumper). This modification not only saves furniture, baseboards and door jambs from scuffing or impact damage, it almost completely silences the operation of the machine. Amazon sells the Velcro as "VELCRO Brand - Industrial Strength - Extreme - 1" Wide Tape, 10' - Black."

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The honeymoon is over, but it's still a great helper!
Review: I have two very hairy dogs that shed in large fluffs, plus I have long hair. My husband, fortunately, is bald, but it still doesn't make up for us three other hairy critters in the house! I run the Roomba daily, and it has really helped. I have now, however, gotten past the starry-eyed-in-love-with-my-new-robot-slave stage and can share some issues. Pros of the Roomba are easy - it is a robot that does your vacuuming for you! Amazing. Worth it. The house is waaaay cleaner than it would be if we didn't have one. Plus, we keep things picked up to be out of its way, so it has made us neater, too. Okay, onto some nit-picking now!I started with the 770. It cleaned really well, on both carpet and our wood (bamboo) floors, however, cleaning all of the hair out of the brushes, which I needed to do every single day, using the cutting tool and comb that came with it, was way too messy and too much of a hassle. The brushes work better than the brushless rollers of the 880, though, I have to say.I clean the brushless rollers of the 880 daily, too, but they are very easy to clean. I pull the yellow bearings off the ends to clean out the dog hair that is wrapped around the axle, too. I take the wheel out and get the dog hair off the ends of the metal axle, and about once a week push the metal wheel axle out and get the dog hair that is stuck in the middle. I unscrew the side brush and get the hair off of it/out from under it when needed. So it's not really "low maintenance" - I still empty the bin daily and clean the rollers and wheel daily, but it is less of a hassle with the brushless rollers.The 770 worked better on carpets and rugs.The 880 has damaged a few of our throw rugs (pulling out threads), and doesn't seem like it gets the larger rugs and carpets as clean as the 770. It also seems to get stuck on the rugs more, and wrinkle them up or flip up the corners.The 770 picked up dog hair better - the problem was that it all ended up wound around the brushes and cleaning those was time-consuming and messy.The 880 picks up the dog hair, but then in rolls it into little doggy dreadlocks and spits it back out. It leaves hair on the edges of the throw rugs, too. The "doggy dreadlocks" or as I sometimes call them, "Roomba poops" are easier to pick up than loose dog hair, but I have to go around and pick them up, and they do look like poop when you first see them, because of the elongated shape the Roomba weaves them into. Still, even that is better than cleaning the dog hair from the brushes in the 770 - and cleaner, since I would be filthy after doing it.I don't really get the advantage of a HEPA filter when you have to knock it on the side of the garbage bin and the dust you filtered flies up in the air. I started just changing them when they got dirty because I have allergies, which is why I wanted a HEPA filter. That applies to both 770 and 880.Why aren't these made the right size to go under kitchen toe kicks? Both the 770 and 880 occasionally get stuck under the toe kick because of the way the sensor sticks up higher.I've had the 880 for about 8 months, and it is a little worse for the wear. I have replaced the rollers, and the replacements don't seem to fit as well, though they are iRobot brand. The one with the "square peg" base (the darker one) seems to get a LOT of dog hair stuck around that end of the axle. Also, the yellow bearings do not come off easily to clean like the originals, but hair still gets under them that I need to clean out. They also got torn up almost immediately because they don't seem to sit as evenly/well in their positions, and the rubber "skirts" get torn up. It still works, though.The worst replacement was the side spin brush, though - the screw seemed not to fit as well and it seems like it stripped the threads. Now the side brush comes off sometimes. I went back to the original and it is staying in, but it has fallen out at least once, too. For such an expensive tool, it feels pretty cheap at times.THE BASE (same for both 770 abd 880) is really annoying. about 1/3 of the time, the Roomba pushes it around rather than just docking. It is too light and even though there is a rubber area on the bottom, it just slides around on our wood floors. There is no place to put it in the rooms with carpet, but it might work better there. I don't like that it would prefer to be out in the open somewhere, because I don't really think of the Roomba as part of my home decor! I have it under a chair against a wall in the entry. It's okay, but the plug is on the left and the cord comes out the right side of the base, making it awkward. I would have the dock under the couch if it would dock more reliably and not need me to manually set it in position.Oh, and every once in a while it will get stuck somewhere away from the dock for a long period if we are out of town, and the battery will be completely dead. It will not charge properly in this situation unless I prop up the back end of the Roomba to make it contact the charger better! It also loses its clock when this happens, but not its schedule - so the first time this happened, it came on at 1 in the morning and woke us up. I figured out that the clock was off, and it thought it was 9am on a weekday. So if you ever run the battery all the way down, be sure to check both the schedule and the date and time on the clock!So those are my gripes about my Robot Slave. But the pros are: ROBOT SLAVE!!! So it is still awesome, even if a little annoying.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: iRobot Roomba 1.0
Review: I have tried two other version of the Roomba -- the 770 and 780.Both worked in general for what it was supposed to -- clean automatically and find its way around your rooms. The issue with 700 series was that it would routinely get 'misplaced' around certain items around the house, sometimes die when cleaning and never making it back to the charging station. Moreover, the little 'brushes' that spun while the Roomba was vacuuming would pick up items on the floor that would clog it and they got dirty very fast.This being said, the Roomba 880 is version 1.0--no longer in the 'beta' stages. If you want to begin on the road to robotic vacuuming, this is the one to buy. If you have an older version, the 880 is a great update choice.[---Use---]This vacuum is a necessity to have if your floor is hard i.e. wood, tiles etc.On carpet it will still vacuum however do not expect it to compete with high-end traditional vacuums.The ratings I give it are:Hard Floors - 9/10Carpet - 7/10The Roomba does an excellent job, overall, at vacuuming your floors to pick up dust, hair, and other items it might find. The savings of your time by using the Roomba, it makes up for any minor 'debris' it may miss. I can tell you, though, it does not miss much.Firstly, you program the Roomba to vacuum at certain times during any day--it can be at any hour. Secondly, you let it roam around the house to let it get 'acquainted' with the layout.Ê The latter helps so that it reduces the chances it will get stuck under a low bed or not vacuum thoroughly. After setting the times, the Roomba will automatically start cleaning at the times you selected.[---Sound---]Like the other Roombas except a little quieter. It is about 75% of the volume of your traditional vacuum.----------------------------------------------------As robotic vacuums have been introduced in the market, there have been a variety of models. The consensus on them was usually: lower price=lower quality, Roomba vacuums=the best. As other Roombas had a few issues, this 880 model is the one that other companies will be measuring their product by.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... have to admit buying a $600 vacuum wasn't a easy decision for me
Review: I have to admit buying a $600 vacuum wasn't a easy decision for me. Never regretted it. Indeed maintenance free. Totally worth it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great Vacuum, Terrific Customer Service.
Review: I have this programmed to run daily. It's amazing how much dirt builds up if we miss a day or two. You do have to do some "robot-proofing", just as if you had a toddler. It routinely locks itself in the bathroom if someone leaves the door ajar, and has to be rescued. Vacuuming is difficult for me, so this is a lifesaver. I owned one of the early models, and can say with confidence that they have vastly improved since the 400 line.We did have it break down two weeks before the warranty expired. The contact on the bottom where it docks on the charger was overheating and melted the plastic. Contacted iRobot and they sent out a replacement, no questions asked. In a day and age where good customer service is mostly a thing of the past, I was tickled pink that they would send out a $700 piece of electronics without even asking for a credit card to secure it. I don't know what their recourse would have been if I'd not returned the broken one.I do use two virtual walls to keep the robot from crawling under low furniture and getting stuck. They take two C cell batteries each, that have to be replaced every 4-6 months. There's no warning system when they die; the robot just starts ignoring them.There are a few things it can't pick up, like popcorn. And as someone mentioned it can leave a line of crumbs and dust at the transition between carpet and tile. These are small downsides, though. I suspect that if I were inclined to, I could use the remote to run it parallel to this seam and it'd get it all, but it doesn't bother me that much. A neurotic personÊ might be troubled by the wonky wheel patterns it leaves in the shag, but I find it amusing. Robot footprints! It passes over standard electrical cords with no trouble, but will gobble up smaller cords like phone chargers or earbud cords. They tangle and stop the robot. Sometimes you can salvage them, but occasionally they get damaged, so be sure to put them out of reach.In the course of the year I've owned it, I've had to replace the brushes once. The rollers get cuts in them from picking up threads and hair, and the side twirly brush gets bent and ineffective eventually.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very satisfied.
Review: I have the 880. The set-up and programming was easy. Every morning the waste container is full of pet hair and dander so the house is much cleaner!One night it tumbled down the stairs and broke the bumper. I called IRobot to get it repaired and they sent me another brand new unit for exchange. They advised that my stairs might have too much of a beveled edge or that the edge sensor might have been too dirty to see the edge. I put a virtual wall in front of the stairs just in case and that solved the problem.Highly recommend this product and IRobot!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOVE. LOVE. LOVE this Roomba!
Review: I have owned the IRobot Roomba 880 for approximately 4 months.Ê I purchased it to replace the lower end model I had purchased at Costco about three years ago.Ê I decided to invest in the 880 because while I loved my original Roomba, any problems we had with it stemmed from the brush system.Ê The brush-free system is fantastic on our wood floors.Ê I love that it can be programmed, and I don't have to think about it.Ê We have a few throw rugs around and it has no problem navigating those.Ê Maintenance on the vacuum is very user-friendly and only takes a few minutes.Ê It is especially good at picking up our dog's hair.Ê I wish I could get it to do the stairs!Caveat: We are very allergy conscious in my house.Ê Therefore, we do not have carpeting other than the occasional throw rug.Ê So, I cannot vouch for how well it works on carpets.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I am in LOVE - with a robot!
Review: I have no prior experience with cleaning robots, so this review is based solely on my experience with the Roomba 880 and is probably more geared towards people that actually have pets and are trying to keep the hairy mess down.This robot deserves a thorough review, but heres the quick synopsis if you don't want to read it all: I love it, would buy it again. There's a learning curve to use it efficiently, but I would not want to live without it anymore, it has made my life so much easier and cleaner! Maintaining the robot is easy and fast and it does fine on all surfaces it encounters in my house, including under couches and beds. It cleans for up to 2 hours daily. It is not set it and forget itÊ get a cleaning lady if that is what you want.Here is my experience with this little helpful machine for those interested:Out of the box, I thought that while the instructions weren't the best, they were certainly sufficient to get me started. However, when it comes to how to actually place the virtual walls and lighthouses, the instructions are not terribly helpful and it helped me to watch the robot a few times to get used to best placement.I have about 2000 square foot to clean on my main floor, and it is a mix of linoleum, hardwood floors, large and small area rugs and tiles. The hardwood is about 3/4 inch raised above the linoleum and some area rugs are thick (so the robot has to "climb"). I have a constantly shedding yellow lab, as well as a dark haired cat. So, basically, I had to either vacuum every day or accept that there are some dust bunnies during the days I don't get to it. Now I use my upright vacuum only on the rugs, maybe every other week! Because of the rather large area, I have also purchased some extra virtual walls/lighthouses, so I can better tell the robot where I want it to clean. But my main floor has lots of openings and angles, and I think additional lighthouse/wall units may not be necessary for those with a very open floor plan (two units are included with the robot). My robot is programmed to clean daily while I'm at work during the week and during the afternoon on the weekend. Programming was really easy. To deal with the large area with different amounts of traffic, I switch my lighthouses from the "lighthouse" to the "wall" function a couple of times a week to have certain zones cleaned more often than others. Sometimes I also take the robot to clean an area after I get home from work, if the robot happened to not go in that area that day and I want it to clean there.How does it clean? Well, I think it does a very nice job of keeping the floors at an exceptional level of cleanliness for a pet household. If you have pets that shed, you will appreciate not having to vacuum every day. There will be *some* pet hair left behind in areas that didn't happen to be vacuumed much that day, but quite honestly, it is so minimal that I would argue that maybe you should have a goldfish instead of a dog or cat if that amount of pet hair bothers you. It is basically never more a few stray hairs here and there if you look really close.The unit is not whisper-quiet. Although not terribly loud, it makes enough noise to bug me if it is cleaning in the same room while Im watching TV or trying to sleep. However, mostly it is running while Im away anyway, so it doesnt really matter. My cat and dog dont mind the robot at all after the initial WTF? reaction. My dog got very excited and kept watching and following the robot around initially. Now he doesnt even move out of the way for it and is recognized as an object if he decides to stand his ground. The cat just kind of doesnt care to be very close to the robot while it is cleaning, but isnt really scared of it, either. He just walks around the robot at a bit of a distance. But I have a brave cat that chases and plays with my 82 pound lab while hes spinning in circles of his happy play dance, so who knows, your cat may go hide or hiss at the robot.Contrary to my initial belief, the robot DOES not "map" or "learn" the specific room. Instead, it uses routines (aka programmed behaviors), making decisions based on how it bumps into something (e.g. angle) and how often. For example, there are routines for wall following, circling around chair legs, going diagonally across the room, turning around in different angles when it gets in a tight place, and cleaning a spot it deems very dirty in sort of like a star shaped pattern.Ê Due to these various routines, the robot will not go in straight lines back and forth across the area as one would manually with a vacuum cleaner. Expect it to appear random. It is, but because of this it ends up covering the whole area eventually. I have, however, noticed that certain areas do indeed end up getting more cleaning if they happen to induce a certain routine repeatedly due to the location of obstacles.The robot detects walls and slows down before bumping into them, but cant do that for narrow objects like chair legs or corners. It bumps into those at full speed. It is strong enough to push a small wooden plant stand that has an artificial plant on it out of its place a little bit at a time, so dont leave something tippy on a tall, light stand if you can avoid it.Dog toys are not a problem (unless you have a tiny lapdog and equally tiny toys). The robot pushes past soft objects carefully at low speed (including bed skirts and such). It did try to eat a thin arm on a dog toy once, stopped, and needed rescuing.The dirt detection I believe is based mostly on color difference (optical), and I have read that some dark area rugs may cause issues and get the robot to keep doing its spot cleaning routine. I have not encountered this problem, though. Im not sure about acoustical dirt sensing mentioned here on Amazon. Maybe when the dirt is crunchy??? (There is a round metallic window in the middle of the vacuum channel, so that possibly hears when dirt hits it, but who knows?) On hard floors larger debris might get kicked around a bit if it happens to be at the very edge of the robots spinning side brush. It usually is picked up eventually, though.I dont know if the cliff (stairs) detection works, I have not needed that in my house. I also have never used the remote control. I dont find it useful for anything, really. Maybe I should try it out in a rescue operation if the robot ever decides to stop cleaning while it is under a bed. I dont know if it will turn on remotely, though. Ill give that a try some day.Here are some of the lessons learned in terms of setup and upkeep during the past three months with the robot:Placement of charging station and virtual walls/lighthouses:1) Put the charging station for the robot in the middle of the house with additional zones off of that. Do not daisy-chain. Reason: The robot will not return to the charging station in the starting zone (1) if it has to go from zone 3 THROUGH zone 2 to get back to zone 1 to charge (i.e. lighthouses in connecting between connecting rooms). Customer service has confirmed this. I struggled with this before I figured out what is going on. I initially had the robot on one end of the house (kitchen) and wanted it to clean the living room and the master bedroom connected to the living room in stages by using the included two lighthouses. I kept finding the robot out of battery or simply switched off in the bedroom. Now, sith the charger location in the middle of the house, the robot cleans the living room first, and then goes either into the kitchen, the bedroom area, or the library, depending on where it happened to be when the lighthouses switch to pass. After cleaning that secondary room, it goes back to zone 1, and, if the docking routine has not yet come on, it goes to the next zone and back to zone 1 after it is done. This way it now cleans up to three zones off of the living room without issues.2) Do not put the charging station (zone 1) behind a thin wall that separates it from another zone the robot might want to return from to charge after a cleaning cycle. The robot will keep going to that area behind the wall to try to return to the charge station, but, of course, it can't!Ê It will probablyÊ

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... nervous about spending this much money on an item like this but I am oh so glad that I ...
Review: I have never owned such a device and was nervous about spending this much money on an item like this but I am oh so glad that I did.Ê I have set Roomba on a timer and every morning Roomba vacuums my living room.Ê It is a large room where my dogs spend most of their time.Ê My carpet looks brand new every morning.Ê Well worth the money.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba
Review: I have mixed feelings about this Roomba. It does the job, but it takes forever! For one small bathroom, it could run for hours. It gets most of the dirt... good enough for a daily sweep, at least. But if I need the house vacuumed quickly, it doesn't cut it. Out comes ol' Hoover, he does the job in an hour. Roomba takes all day. If you have the guts to let it run all day without supervision, it'll do the job okay, but if you have anything on the floor... a loose rug, pet food/water dishes, shoes with laces, waste-baskets, cords, pet toys, etc., it may get hung up on them (which takes all its juice), or worse yet, spill them over. I've even seen it get hung up on the little "home base" it's supposed to go to when it's finished... then it goes all over the room again, trying to find "home"... I try using the remote to "guide" it back home, but sometimes that doesn't work, as the thing just wants to go in circles (not a straight line). I end up picking it up and placing it in the base most times. Anyway, it's a good little thing for a light sweep when you just can't bring yourself to get out the ol' Hoover.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The robots are here, and they want to vacuum your floors
Review: I have held off buying a Roomba for years based on reviews that suggested that iRobot was headed in the right direction, but hadn't quite gotten it right.Ê Well now, having emptied dozens of Roomba dust bins crammed full of dust and dog hair, I'm hooked.This machine cleans far more deeply than you'd expect based on the tiny flying saucer profile.My main problem with the Roomba thus far is that it doesn't always recognize the "light houses" that are supposed to confine the unit to a specific area.But what I love is the ability to schedule multiple cleanings per week.Ê Beats waiting two weeks for the maids to arrive.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Impressed.
Review: I have had this now for 3 weeks and I must say I'm impressed. Jarvis, (yes, you must name it) is scheduled to run everyday when we are at work and so far has been finding his dock almost every day.Ê Jarvis picks up quite a bit of dirt - at first, I was emptying him daily - now its about every 3 days. The house is mostly hardwood and I have him cleaning the downstairs (approx 1800 sq ft.). When I want him to clean the master bedroom I pick him up and let him do his thing for about an hour while I get ready in the morning - and then manually put him back on his base. I have the house sectioned off into three zones and so far all is working well. I found him yesterday, out of battery, in front of our Amazon Echo- Alexa - perhaps Jarvis and Alexa have a thing going! Yes, the price is steep, but it really does workÊ -- and works well. If you can justify it, you won't regret it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A super 'helper' to keep floors clean.
Review: I have had the Roomba for several months now and can honestly say that I love the convenience of it. Initially I was concerned about issues with darkly patterned area carpets but the Roomba has surprised me with its abilities. I have since purchased another model for a small vacation apartment we own and my daughter has purchased her own Roomba after seeing the 880 in action at my house. We especially love the ability to clean regularly under furniture like beds.Ê The first few times I too thought that the dust bin was rather small, however, with regular use it is no problem at all because the floors just don't seem to be as dusty any longer. Since I don't usually clean the whole house at the same time, I have not had any issues with battery life either.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... the Roomba 880 for just 6 days and I love it! It came with 2 Virtual Wall/Lighthouses but ...
Review: I have had the Roomba 880 for just 6 days and I love it!Ê It came with 2 Virtual Wall/Lighthouses but I decided I needed a 3rd one.Ê My house is very large. 1760 square feet so I clean each room individually.Ê I found that I do not care for the lighthouse feature because I find it cleans better if you move some furniture and clutter so I have to move small furniture, shoes, etc to other rooms in order to allow the Roomba to thoroughly clean each room.Ê This is where the virtual walls really come in handy.Ê I have done each room 3 times already and I am still picking up quite a bit of dust.Ê I never realized how much my Dyson was actually missing. I believe it was because I would get tired and rush the job and Roomba goes at the same steady pace.Ê I will probably not use the programmable scheduling because I am very particular about leaving ANYTHING running when I am sleeping or away from home.Ê Because of this, the only time it docks itself is when it is cleaning the room/area that has the docking station in it.Ê I read another review where the person uses an air compressor to blow out the filter and clean the machine.Ê That gave me the idea to use the air canister for cleaning my computer keyboard to clean the Roomba filter.Ê Works amazing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: which on mine it is not doing a great job at cleaning
Review: I have had the iRobot Roomba 880 for 7 days now and have used it more then 7 times, with complete battery charges every time. This is what is on my mind about the 880, Things you may not read before purchasing that may be helpful if you do. The 880 only runs on a full charge for 1 hour before it returns itself to its home base. In that hour it cleans 4 average to maybe small rooms in a haphazard method, it does miss places, I have swept those places out to center of floor to get it to pick it up which it will do, but that is babysitting the cleaning process while at home. There is a spot cleaning function on the 880 that I have also used every day, this feature defiantly requires babysitting because once you have pushed the spot button it only runs for 2 minutes in a circle pattern, if it didn't clean well say on 2 area rugs, which on mine it is not doing a great job at cleaning, so mine must be a type of pile area rug butÊ you can push the spot button every 2 minutes for over 2 hours, this makes my area rugs look better because it sort of fluffs the nap up but when you get down close you see all the pet hair that is just can not pull out of the rug. If these area rugs were new I would be upset with all the 880 doesn't pick off of them. On my hard floors I love it, it seems to take a couple cleanings before it learns the rooms, then it doesn't leave kitty litter behind, lovin that. I can walk around bare foot now!! To clean more rooms after the 880 has cleaned the first 4 at my home and docked itself to recharge I have to wait approx., an hour for it to recharge fully, then I carry it to those rooms and since there is know carpet or area rugs in those rooms it does a really good job and I usually turn it off an take back to its home base and it will still have a battery left to run. There is still 2 rooms in my home that I have not used it on and that's because I get tired of babysitting and organizing the rooms, but I would say to clean all of the house it would take the first original full charge, then the second recharge and may be not complete the entire house on that second recharge. The lighthouses that come with the 880 are a big help if you want it to focus on just one or two rooms and not enter the other rooms or you can close the doors to those rooms if they have doors. I need to say if you are using the spot cleaning function on the 880 and you don't want to bend over every 2 min's., then you will love having the included remote. When I have pushed the Dock button on the 880 itself it takes a bit for it to look like it is heading home, when it docks itself for recharging it seems to not be confused in heading in the right direction. In the books that come with it and the videos that you will receive via emails it tells you to clean all these parts every 3 months if you have pets, we had to do so either the second or third day of use. It is an easy cleaning process though. I have to dump the bin VERY frequently do to being an animal lover so I have a feeling these parts will have to be cleaned a lot more often then every 3 months. As long as this machine keeps working I plan to keep using, and for me that will be almost every day. I sent a message to iRobot to ask about an extended warranty they do not offer one. I can not scroll back up here to reread my review so hope my spelling is ok. I hope to post again about the 880 when I have had it longer also.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Loved it so much I got one for my parents too!
Review: I have had the 880 for a couple of weeks and feel compelled to give a review. I had toyed with the idea of a robot vacuum for a long time but could not stomach the idea of paying so much for a "robot vacuum."Ê With not enough hours in the day, three kids, two dogs, a cat and husband, the ever-growing tumbleweed of fur, dust and crumbs taunted me. When I saw that the 880 was discounted for Mother's Day, I decided to give it a try. It so easy to use and does such an incredible job, I have now also gotten my elderly parents one as well.The key to appreciating this vacuum, like most things, is to manage your expectations. This will not replace your regular vacuum. If you have stairs, it cannot climb them, it does not dust raised wood trim or woodwork, it will not clean the deeper parts of rugs that are textured to the point of having very high and low portions (think "dirt trapper" rugs typically used in mudroom entries). It cannot clean an entire, large house on one charge and it sometimes will get its edge wedged under a dresser or chest that is juuuussst the wrong height, and not be able to extricate itself. What it will do is very effectively clean a variety of surfaces on an impressive battery charge, with little user intervention required.I have hardwoods, thin area carpets, thick/wool area rugs (with texture/varying heights), thick and thin Persian and Turkish rugs (with fringe) atop hardwoods and carpet, travertine and tile floors. (The rugs vary in color and I have had no issue with the 880's sensor not allowing it to clean even very dark blue orientals.) The 880 has impressively moved from one surface to the other and cleaned them all (with the exception of the low parts of a mudroom "dirt trapper" rug).Ê I have removed small bathroom throw-rugs with no rubberized backing, figuring they would be scooted out of the way. I have also swept mess off my stairs onto the floor below, allowing Roomba to indirectly clean my stairs. I have a dresser that is just the height that allows the edge of Roomba to scoot beneath, and get stuck. It chimes an error and will shut itself down if not rescued. I could use the virtual lighthouses to block this off, but I haven't bothered -- I just don't run the machine in that room unless I am nearby and able to rescue Roomba when needed.As for the virtual lighthouses (2 included)Ê -- I was not sure how they were different from the virtual walls I saw on other models.Ê There are two settings on the virtual lighthouse. When set to lighthouse, the box signals Roomba to keep coming toward it, and beyond, when the current area is clean. When set to wall, the box signals Roomba to not go past that point. You can team the two lighthouses included to create a "halo" to protect area in a more circular way, if needed. I have a large house with a lot of doors and am able to keep Roomba in one area for a thorough clean (it shuts itself down when it determines an area is fully cleaned) without using these devices. Without them, and an open doorway, I am not sure how far Roomba would travel, but it likely would not be able to find its way back to the dock to recharge.It will automatically return to the dock to recharge itself -- just place the dock against a wall with fairly good clearance on the remaining 3 sides. (Dock must be kept plugged in, so near an outlet as well).Ê The dock itself is about 5 1/4"x 5 3/4" and with the Roomba docked it's 15 1/4" x 13 1/4". The lighthouse boxes are battery powered and turn on and off automatically as the Roomba is powered up or off. I have not timed it, but I estimate that the Roomba takes about 2 hours to fully charge, and runs about the same before needing a charge. The dust bin is small-ish, but it holds an astonishing amount. There is a red trash bin signal displayed on top of Roomba when the bin needs emptying. Emptying the bin only requires you to push a release button on top of the Roomba and slide the bin out, fold down theÊ bon "door" and shake debris into your trash container. There is a little hepa filter atop the dust bin (Roomba comes with 2) with its own door. With a pull on the yellow tab, remove the filter, tap it against the inside of your trash can to clean, reseat the filter and slide the dust bin back into Roomba -- one press of th big round "Clean" button atop the Roomba and its back on its way. Once your floors are being regularly cleaned, you will not have to empty the bin as often, but at the beginning, you will have to empty more often -- because the Roomba is hard at work cleaning up the long-neglected mess!!I have lots of cords and wires, carpet fringe and toys, stuffed animals, etc... around the house. Roomba has had no trouble. A few times, I have seen the "working to not tangle" warning light on top of the Roomba when running atop cords. Also, when Roomba senses a very dirty area, a blue magnifying glass warning lights and the Roomba will go back and forth over the area until it determines it is clean. There are manual buttons atop the machine -- dock (sends Roomba home to the dock), spot (Roomba will quickly spot clean a small circular area - perfect for spills), and time setting buttons for programming. It is all very user friendly and straightforward. This machine is clearly made to be user-friendly, all parts "below" that need tending or are removable are yellow or indicated by yellow parts. Aside from dumping the bin and tapping the hepa filter (btw, right now. when you register the machine online, irobot will send you two free hepa filters), you need to clean the ends of the extricator bars now and then -- there will be a collection of hair on each end, typically. But even those have two different patterns and if you are not sure how to correctly replace them, just look at the pattern pictures on the vac itself -- the pictures show you exactly which goes where and even which direction they must face. (To testify to ease of use, I did just buy one for my elderly parents -- knowing full well that *I* would be getting tech support calls over the slightest area of concern or confusion. As anticiapted, I have gotten no help calls, and they have been using it a lot.)Note that there is also a remote control provided with this unit.Ê I have had no use for mine, though the kids have enjoyed bossing Roomba around a bit with with. It allows you to power Roomba on and off, manually direct Roomba, select spot clean, or tell it to go to its home dock.Apologies for the long review, but this is a splurge for most people and as someone who offen has "analysis paralysis" before making a large purchase, I value details. Is it perfect, flawless and will clean the entire house top to bottom, and all on one charge? No. But is does a remarkable job. Because my house is multi-levels and large, I have run it every day for weeks now in different places and it is remarkable. There are no more tumbleweed balls, no more wispy patches of pet hair, and even under the beds are now clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I have had several Roomba units during the years. ...
Review: I have had several Roomba units during the years.This one seems to have worked out such bugs as getting stuck, falling down stairs despite sensors, battery longivity, and ability to function without compartment cleaning after few uses. The electronic voice mechanism is an added convenienceÊ for trouble-shooting that eliminates confusion.Worth the price for an older gal who is still working.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Mom's "best ever" little helper!
Review: I have had my Roomba 880 for several months now.Ê The first weekend I was home alone with it and ran it several times each day - marveling at the little thing - now it is scheduled to run 4 days a week.Ê I am ASTOUNDED at the amount of dust, dirt and hair this vacuum picks up!Ê It has, as promised, pretty much learned the room and has yet to fail at cleaning every bit of area it can get to.Ê I empty the container (and clean the filter) after each cleaning but it will clean the ~600 sq foot, carpeted area I have it set up to do twice before that container -has- to be emptied. I have it scheduled to clean at 10pm and, though it isn't cleaning a room someone is sleeping in, it wakes no one while doing it's job.Ê It is quiet enough, on carpet, that you can carry on a normal conversation while it is running in the same room.Ê As others have said, hair does not deter it from its job and is very easily cleaned from the rubber rollers when necessary (we have 3 dogs, two cats and two "long-haired women" living in the house).Ê I am hugely impressed - this was worth every nickel I spent on it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: DOESN"T WANT TO DOCK AFTER AWHILE.Ê CHEAPLY MADE AS IT LOOKS LIKE ALL THE METAL IS STARTING TO RUB OFF OR SOMEHTING>>>>
