Review: I have had it for awhile and it was great to begin with.Ê But now I seem to spend half an hour a day trying to get it to go in it's dock.Ê I line it up and press "Dock" and it doesn't work.Ê Going to look into seeing if it is too late to return it.Ê It was really cool at first and i had been planning on buying one for upstairs.Ê I really like the concept so am going to look at some of the alternatives out there since the iRobot can't do the one thing I think should be simple whihc is dock and recharge when I line it up directly with the docking station.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's super easy to clean
Review: I have five dogs and this vacuum is a life saver. I run it every day and can't imagine how I ever lived without it. It's super easy to clean, has never gotten stuck anywhere, and doesn't bump into things. It doesn't even spill one drop from the dogs' water bowl.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This little vacuum does a great job against these odds
Review: I have dogs and cats and live in a dusty old wooden house. This little vacuum does a great job against these odds. I set it up to clean one room a day, go to work and come home to a clean room and the Roomba docked and recharged. When I am home it can work off and on all day (needs time to recharge). I have been wanting one of these forever and I love it.Haven't taught the cat to ride on it yet.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Irritating issue!
Review: I have been wanting a robot vacuum for many years. This year I finally got one for Christmas! Yay! Then I find out it won't vacuum my rugs. It goes onto my rugs fine, gets confused and gives me an error message. I have read in other reviews that it won't vacuum black rugs and that's what I have. Ugg, what a ridiculous issue to have. I will be putting tape over the sensors on the bottom to see if that helps. The machine thinks the black rugs are the edge of stairs or something.Also, don't even try to figure out what it's doing.....it just makes no sense. The robot vacuum is just for cleaning in between your normal vacuuming schedule. It leaves entire sections un vacuumed! It is too expensive to be so random and won't clean my rugs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I have been very happy with this purchase, great product!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best Roomba yet
Review: I have been using the Roomba 500 pet vacuum for two years and was completely satisfied until I used this model.Ê It is definitely more powerful and efficient.Ê The new system replaces the brushes and its a considerable improvement.Ê My carpets are much brighter and cleaner than with the 500 unit.Ê In fact I had just ran the 500 and then followed with the 880 and I was amazed that the dust bin was almost full...as the rug looked clean before.Ê I also noticed it is considerably more quiet than the older model.Ê Additionally, it does not slam into walls and furniture as hard as the older model.Ê It is pricey but if your looking for high quality and super clean floors this is the model to choose.Ê Overall impressive

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: No more sweeping floors!!! iRobot is great!
Review: I have been looking at iRobot for the past 5 years, trying to figure out if it was worth the price to have a robot vacuum my floors - now that I have one, I don't regret it at all!Ê We live in the Caribbean in a large home with all ceramic floors and a new black lab - the amount of dust and dirt that was tracked in everyday increased 100% when we brought in our new puppy - which is what pushed me to finally purchase.I really appreciate how easily the iRobot is to work - the controls are easy to follow and the dirt is easy to empty.Ê I have had to find a few online tutorials, but all in all, the iRobot is very intuitive.Ê At first I didn't realize that the bin that collects the dirt actually lifted down to release the dirt easier, and I was trying to shake it out through the slot that captures the dirt.Ê Once I figured this out, it's been very easy to keep maintenance on.Ê A tip that I didn't read anywhere else, is that anything that is manufactured in YELLOW on the iRobot is a piece that moves or can be removed to facilitate maintenance.I use the iRobot everyday and am continually amazed at how much dirt is picks up - the 2 virtual walls/lighthouses are very easy to use and helpful for the large space downstairs - keeping it contained in the kitchen or dining area, before it moves on to the living area.Ê These devices use 2 "C" batteries, and I've had to change them once in 3 months, so they seem to get a decent life span, with everyday use.The iRobot picks up dog hair, my daughter's waist-long hair and dirt easily.Ê It smooths over computer cords, and if by chance gets caught up, tries to release itself.Ê If release is not possible, it turns itself off.Ê My refrigerator is almost the exact height as the iRobot, so I have had to place a small, rolled up throw carpet under it, so that the iRobot doesn't get stuck - everything else it is the perfect height to glide underneath or just get to the edges (under cabinets, mainly).Ê I love that there are no more hiding dust bunnies under the beds upstairs.So many good things to say about this product.Ê I am glad that I waited a while to purchase, because I feel like the technology has had time to be refined from when it first came out - if you are tired of sweeping your floors, BUY THIS PRODUCT.Ê You won't regret it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing. Way better than previous models for dog hair.
Review: I have an especially fuzzy Golden Retriever and my old Roomba's bristle brush would constantly get clogged with hair. Hair would also wrap around the brush and wheel bearings making it a pain to clean. I gave up on the Roomba when it started taking more time to clean it than it did to vacuum the house myself. I was initially skeptical about the new 880 model but decided to give it a try. I was absolutely amazed how much better it is compared to the old version.Ê I have it run every day in my living room, bedroom and kitchen and it does a great job of keeping up with all of the dog hair. There is so much hair in the bin that sometimes I wonder if the Roomba is running right over the back of my sleeping dog. (It's not. My dog doesn't let it come close to her.) I highly recommend this new model.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Virtual wall sensors failed after only two months of service!
Review: I have an earlier version and it's still going.Ê The 880 works wonderfully, however the virtual wall sensor device (came with two) has stopped working.Ê At first I thought it was the batteries, but that was not the case.Ê I dislike the fact that I had to replace these two sensors after only two months of service!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I have a large space and it doesn't make it ...
Review: I have a large space and it doesn't make it back to the charge and I have to go looking for it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best six hundred dollars I ever spent.
Review: I have a half great pyrenees, half husky dog that sheds like the world is ending.Ê I got a roomba hoping it'd help reduce the amount I needed to sweep, but expecting it to be more or less a novelty item.I haven't had to sweep or vacuum since I bought it, which admittedly hasn't been that long ago, but since my floors (and rugs!) are getting cleaner, rather than less clean, over time, I don't expect this to change.Much to my surprise (having had a roomba many years ago that was essentially a stupid bumper car), the 880 navigates complex rooms with ease.Ê It even avoids squeezing under things that look "a bit too tight."Ê Error lights are easy to interpret and problems are ridiculously easy to sort out on the rare occasion that they do occur (generally they're my fault when they do at all).Ê The wall/object sensor is brilliant, it's so gentle when it bumps off objects that even unstable ceiling fans barely wiggle when it taps them.Ê The vacuum somehow manages to suck up ingrained dirt and pet fur, but if there's an odd wire lying on the floor it won't suck it up and choke on it.Ê The pathing is extremely intelligent and the brush thingy does a surprisingly good job of clearing out corners.Ê It also pulverizes dust bunnies, making them easier to collect, the collection of which was an unanticipated side benefit, as apparently the roomba can gleefully navigate the complex spaces under my desk without any help whatsoever, even while I'm sitting at it in my chair.The only thing that doesn't quite work is the docking, the code underlying how it 'adjusts' if it misses the dock a little is really silly, I suspect the code was tested on a dock somewhat more securely fastened than the lightweight portable dock it comes with... but this "problem" is easily resolved with duct tape (to fasten the dock to something) or, as it turns out, a little code tweaking of my own, as the roomba (somewhat to my surprise) came sealed with a little sticker that says "if you're a software developer of some sort, feel free to add functionalities to the code."So yeah.Ê My floors are spotless in spite of my heavy-shedding pet, which I accomplish by sitting with a good book and a beer.Ê Once every couple of days, I take out the back of the roomba and shake it lightly into a bin to empty it, and then I go back to my beer.Would buy again.Ê Might actually buy an extra and program it to follow me around carrying a six pack, just for fun.Ê The battery lasts for freakin' ever, too.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I have a german Shorthair Pointer. I set to ...
Review: I have a german Shorthair Pointer. I set to clean twice a day. Now I have time to do other mundane stuff!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOVE IT!
Review: I HAVE A BORDER COLLIE WHO IS AN INSIDE DOG WHO SHEDS LOTS OF HAIR.Ê I LOVE THE ROBOT-ROMBA.Ê IT DOES A GREAT JOB OF CLEANING UP THE HAIR AND DIRT.,

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent product. Very pleased.
Review: I have 4 shedding animals in my household, 2 of which I am allergic to.Ê I vacillated for many months before taking the plunge and buying the Roomba.Ê This was a terrific purchase.Ê It vacuums the floors every morning before I get up and my allergies have all but disappeared.Ê PLUS, I have clean floors all the time.Ê My advice to anyone with pet shedding issues:Ê buy one.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best thing I ever purchased!
Review: I have 4 kids and a 7000 square foot house. Cleaning is a full time job! I love everything about the ROOMBA 880! It's not too loud and I can set it to clean while I'm out. What more could I ask for??? My floors look great and it even cleans under my beds and couches! Amazing!!!! Everyone should own one. Worth every penny!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: great for 2 shedding pugs!
Review: I have 2 pugs. This baby does the job...I run it at 11:30pm on Mon, Wed, Fri. Really an amazing product!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great compared to older models
Review: I had the 564 pet series which was a great addition to the family. But after having to replace the brushes multiple times and cleaning it was a nightmare we decided to go with the newer model.(We have two dogs)Ê This is a breath of fresh air.Ê It isn't as loud as the 564 and the brushes are super easy to clean, if you need to. A nice added feature is the red bin light when it needs to be emptied.Ê Everything else is pretty much the same as the 564 except this one also comes with a remote.Ê The remote is a little different to use but is nice when you want to clean a certain spot.Ê I would recommend this product.Ê You can tell a huge difference on carpet and does great on wood floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Gets stuck under something almost every day.
Review: I had such high hopes for this after all the positive reviews.Ê Unfortunately the roomba gets stuck under the lower edges of cabinets under my sink and under my island in the kitchen.Ê Then it gets stuck under the edges of my couch.Ê In the last six months it has completed a fully cleaning 3 times without me having to dislodge it from something.Ê I can't leave it running unattended, as it has destroyed its rubber tracks trying to free itself over and over.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A huge improvement over the early models.
Review: I had one of the original Roombas and it worked fairly well for a while before it finally quit.Ê This one seems a lot better, partly because it can be scheduled to clean automatically, and also because it is much more reliable.Ê It doesn't get tangled up in loose cords, and it handles changing surfaces much better than the old one did.Ê It still occasionally gets stuck, though not nearly as often.The first few times it got huge amounts of dust and fluff out of the carpets: now it seem to get only a moderate amount.Ê After a couple of weeks, the carpets look almost new again!iRobot appears to have fixed the problems the earlier models had, and it 's difficult to see how they could do much better than this.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pretty Amazing
Review: I had no idea how good this thing worked.Ê It cleans the entire ground floor of our house relentlessly (kitchen, dining room, breakfast area, family room, office, bedroom, master bath with two closets, guest bath) , and collects under furniture where we had great difficulty reaching.Ê I was a bit confused on how to use the two lighthouses but finally got them configured in the correct places.Ê iRobot has a video on how to place them if you use them in that mode versus an "invisible wall."Ê Here is the link:Ê https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r_qayCFzg-I

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Essential for anyone with shedding dogs
Review: I had never really thought of getting one of these until 2 colleagues who own dogs swore by it, so I bit the bullet and I have becoem an instant advocate for Roomba. This little machine is awesome. Sure it doesnt have a large dirt container like a fullsize vacuum but it operates flawlessly and I am amazed at how much 'hidden' dog hair and dirt it picks up. I set it up to alternate different parts of the house every other night and I'm learning how to use the 'virtual wall'devices to prevent it getting stuck in some tight places. This is a fantastic product!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pricy with subpar service and warranty, think twice before you buy it!
Review: I had bought this in April, 2014, I have been using it in my 2nd floor master bedroom since, I had it set up on schedule every weekday while nobody was at home, it worked ok, once in a while I would find it somewhere on the floor nowhere near the base, so I had to pick it up and put it back, the next time it would work fine again.However the problem became more persistent starting from two weeks ago, it happened everyday for 10 days in a row, so I decided to call this company and tried to get this issue resolved, the 1st time I called, I was asked a whole bunch of questions that gave me the impression that they were trying to deny there was such a problem, there was question about the location of the home base, the distance between the home base and the virtual wall, blah, blah, blah, and this lady told me that I had to watch Roomba while it's working and see if there's any error message that might indicate what the problem is, so that's what I did on Sat. an Sun., the same thing happened, no error message given. So I called them again on Monday, after 20-min's hold time, I was only to be told to run more tests, that's when I said enough is enough and asked to be transferred to a supervisor. Well, she came on and offered more trouble shooting tips and kept me on the floor trying different things to no avail for half an hour, finally she gave up and said they would send me a replacement without a battery or any other accessories. After the hour-long phone call, I received an email from them stating that there's no warranty for the replacement after the original warranty runs out, which from my understanding is you get this piece of junk for $700, after that, you will be out of luck. I will never buy anything from this company again.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent Product
Review: I had been waiting for years to purchase this product.Ê I struggled over the cost and how well it would perform in my home.Ê Now I cannot imagine life without it.I watched many videos on this product and one reviewer recommended moving things, example: putting your chairs up so it can easily get under the kitchen or dining room tables.Ê I took all the advice from reviewers and each Saturday morning, I put everything up, chairs, dog crates, recycle bin etc. and let it do it's thing.Ê I live in the south west and have saltillo tile in my living room, galley kitchen and kitchen table area.Ê It is about 780 square feet.Ê The Roomba 880 takes about 1 hour to complete the entire area.Ê We used the vitual walls to block off the entrance ways going into the family room and another hallway on the other side of the house.Ê We close any doors and lift the window curtains and shears so they are not touching the floor.Ê One time it pulled down a window shear but stopped immediately.Ê Now we just put the them up using the side curtain holders on the wall.Ê I have to say, we have curtains that do rest on the floor, like they fan out at the bottom.Ê It sounds like a lot of work, but now I have such a system that it is easy.Ê I run it early morning.Ê Let it recharge and run it again late morning.Ê I mop and then put things back in place for the rest of the weekend and week.I have two small dogs and honestly the majority of the items collected in the bin is dog fur.Ê My floors look amazing and it is one of the things guests comment on when visiting our home on how beautiful the floors are.I had initially thought I would run it every day, but I found that to run it on Saturday (twice) is perfect for our life style.Ê I always want to be home when it is running.Ê It one time got caught under the dishwasher edge and one time under by husband's recliner.Ê Now I just open the recliner, so the foot rest is extended and it solved that problem.Ê It has never again got caught under the dishwasher.My husband and I are very frugal so it was hard to spend the money, but I have to say I am very happy with the roomba and my only regret is not buying it sooner.Ê Highly recommend.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This model is amazing. It cleans really well and hasn't gotten stuck ...
Review: I had an old Roomba (500 series) and it was a piece of junk.Ê I rarely used it since it got stuck every 2 minutes and didn't clean much. I was a little apprehensive about spending so much money on the new model, but with a new house, 2 cats, and hardwood floors that are always covered with cat litter, I decided I needed a little help keeping my house clean.Ê This model is amazing.Ê It cleans really well and hasn't gotten stuck on rugs or anything. I'm really glad I bought it and am going to buy a second one for the upstairs floor.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I had already owned a Roomba 760 which we liked very much
Review: I had already owned a Roomba 760 which we liked very much. But then it started cleaning only a few feet before stopping. Eventually I was able to fixed this by cleaning the window under the rollers.Meanwhile, I ordered a Roomba 880 which has 50% more cleaning power. Unfortunately, I own a double-coated dog who sheds 3X per year. This new Roomba requires frequent maintenance because it plugs frequently. It looks to me that iRobot got the better cleaning efficiently simply by making the openings smaller & thus increasing the face velocity. This is a classic approach.Yesterday I had to raise the level of our couch with 3 felt pads & a felt coaster because both our Roombas seem programmed to head directly for the coach in order to get stuck underneath.Ê Still we are satisfied with both. Both are running now nicely cleaning our long ranch styled house.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I am in love!
Review: I had a Roomba many years ago when they first came out.Ê I was rather underwhelmed.Ê It was loud, held very little dirt, got stuck often, and seemed to barely clean.Ê I handed it 'down' to my mother who also rejected it.Ê It sat unused on a lonely shelf until it made it's way to a yard sale.Ê That Roomba was a novelty.This Roomba is a masterpiece.Ê Or at least the sonnet that I'm going to compose to it will be.Ê I have carpet in two bedrooms and the rest of the house is hardwood or linoleum.Ê First the carpets - holy cow, I had no idea they were that dirty!Ê The Roomba gets out dirt my full-size vacuum cleaner misses.Ê I set it out to clean my bedroom and it filled up with dirt before it finished.Ê The amount of dirt and dust was astonishing.Ê I started it again, this time it filled up with dirt but it did finish.Ê The third time it cleaned the entire bedroom, bathroom, and walk-in closet and was only half full.Ê I started running it every other day and it never fills up that way.Ê My Roomba cleans my carpets while I'm at work, or walking the dog, or even lying on the couch stuffing my face with potato chips.My Roomba has vacuumed my floor while my kids sleep in the room next door.Ê The loudest noise is when it bumps into a door during it's navigation.Ê It has only ever gotten stuck once which is under a particular dresser with a high side but a low front.Ê I use the virtual walls to keep the Roomba out from under that dresser.Ê If the Roomba finds a lot of dirt, it goes over the spot a few times to make sure it's clean.Ê My carpeted rooms have never looked so nice or been so clean.Ê My kids' babysitter told me the carpeting looks brand new - which is saying something in a kids room!While the vacuum is insanely great on carpets, I'm a little less pleased on the hardwoods.Ê Not that I'm unhappy, I'm just not jumping over the moon there.Ê While it does vacuum a lot of dirt on the hardwood, it also seems to miss some spots.Ê It may be that there is too much stuff on the floor - we are packing up the apartment to list it for sale. That makes it hard for the Roomba to navigate.Ê I've only tried that room once but will update my review after trying it a few more times.Ê It is a little louder when vacuuming hardwood as the carpet isn't muffling its sound.It does a good job on the linoleum.Ê However, I have a few deep pile rugs on the bathroom floor.Ê One is long and narrow and the Roomba has a little trouble climbing up on it.Ê After a few runs, I just started picking that rug up.Ê The smaller rug though is fine.Ê It does a great job on the kitchen floor.My floors have never been so clean and with so little effort.Ê I come home to clean floors and the Roomba parked back on it's charger.Ê Sigh...Edit (4/11/14):Yesterday I got two additional lighthouse/virtual walls and now the Roomba cleans my room, my kids room, and both bathrooms before it quietly returns to it's dock and waits for my next command.Ê I wish my dog and kids behaved like that.Warning!!Ê Once you buy a Roomba, you'll start thinking, 'Maybe I need more robots.Ê Maybe I should have one mop my floor...'Ê My Braava arrived yesterday and is mopping my kitchen floor now.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Way ahead of 770 so far time will tell if it should get 5 stars
Review: I had a 770 for about a month, (bought from Best Buy). It kept getting stuck on my patterened rug - tan with some black swirly stripes. It thought it was going off a cliff. I read some reviews on the 880 and decided to return the 770 and try the 880. It has only been a few hours and I am already impressed. The 880 moves faster, is a little quieter (not much, but a little), seems smarter about navigating around furniture, and moves over our area rug much better. It did get stuck once so far, but the 770 got stuck everytime it was on this rug. The bin full light also seems to work on the 880, its come on three times already, whereas the 770 it never came on, even though it was definately full. I have all hardwood, with three area rugs. Two very low tight profile rugs, and one medium pile rug with the dark stripes. So far I am very impressed with the 880 over the 770. And I have two dogs that shed like mad. A corgi and a shephard/hound mix. I dont review often, so I am really impressed. If it holds up well over time, it will deserve 5 stars.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Benefits outweigh the cost. Better than the 770 model
Review: I had 770 for a year and upgraded to 880 a month ago in May 2014. Let me do a comparison review, about performance and cost.1. Cost: The 880 model costs $200 more that 770. It is no small money. But if you are ready to invest $400 or more on a vacuum cleaner, then like me you are probably ready to spare the extra 200 provided there are significant incremental benefits. But $700 was still high. So I went to Bed Bath and Beyond with their 20% off coupon for new email customers and got this baby for $560. Now that cost is a little bit reasonable, lets talk performance.2. Battery: On the initial days the 880 battery sucked. It barely lasted an hour. But by 2nd week, the battery started lasting much longer. I have seen it doing 2-3 hour long cleaning sessions. The 770 by comparison lasted about a couple of hours on the best days.3. Cleaning power/ suction: I am reasonably impressed with the 880. This one has a wider mouth to suck objects big enough as caps of water bottles, facial tissue, whole candies, and alphabets that kids play with. Its limit was tested when it sucked in an A4 size paper folded in 4. It didn't stop or issue warning, but continued with a weird sound. The 770 model is significantly behind in this respect. I have seen 770 suck in paper clips , but bigger or longer things like facial tissue stops it. However the bigger mouth and bigger ego of 880 cause it to suck the area rugs in and get in trouble. 770 seemed to ignore a lot of things mightier than paper clips, including area rugs, which was good and bad.4. Navigation: After running clueless in the initial days, 880 seem to have figured things out. A handful of times, it got stuck behind doors, pushed the door to close and got stuck in the room. Other times it came out of rooms just fine.It seem to work around other objects just fine. The 770 used to always lock itself in the restrooms. The 770 also used to climb on to other objects like bags, or some thing else and stop. The 880 seem to tackle the same hurdles better. However the 880 seem to have some issue finding its base at the end of the cleaning. No big deal since the cleaning is already done.5. Routine Maintenance: I find it easy to clean 880. The trash bin is big enough. The whole suction canal is also big enough to clean.The HEPA filter is bigger than 770. The cleaning brushes are not made of rubbery material and does not get hairs entangled in them.Some hairs get circled at the either ends of the brushes but they come out with a pull. All in all it takes a minute or two to clean the 880 trash can, brushes, HEPA filter and canal. The 770 is also easy but takes a little longer because the brushes spins hair in its bristles and one needs to cut the hair out. The trash can also seemed small and dirtier compared to 880.6. Overall cleaning effectiveness: For electronics, some times the whole is lesser than the sum of the parts. But 880 seem to add up well. It seem to clean all the places, hardwood and carpet, well enough. Unlike 770 which some times push or blow away some trash and dust, 880 seems to pull them all and suck em in.7. Other usable features: Both 880 and 770 has hifi features like automatic timed cleaning etc. I don't use those features. I find it fairly easy to just press its button. But if some one is interested to know more, let me know and I will test it and tell you.8. Sound: 880 is pretty quiet. A hum. 770 was a little louder but not like handheld vacuums. I may not sleep with a 770 running, but with a 880, I probably may, as long as it does not hit a lot of objects.9. Overall build quality: Both seem well built and sturdy. I have used 880 only for a month, so I cannot speak for the long term durability. I will update after a year. But it looks as sturdy as 770. 770 was sturdy enough to survive the million times it hit the walls and other objects. it also survived the torture of my 2 year old who used to step on it, throw his shoes on it, push his big toy truck against it. At the end of the year the small round sensor came off the head of the 770. It still hanged there and helped roomba get around. But it looked like the eyes of aliens, hanging out.Over all, the extra benefits are of value worth $50 - $100 extra. But I spent more than that because I have allergies and 770 was not cleaning that well enough. The BedBath deal made it work for me. I have not had buyers remorse with either model, because when i get home and see the beautiful vacuum tracks left by roomba, every day, i feel good. Besides I don't have to fight with my wife on who does the vacuum that weekend, or whether i did it properly. An investment that provides daily returns, I would buy a roomba and gladly skip a vacation to compensate.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I gottet to runet between the regular vacuum cleaning and ...
Review: I gottet to runetÊ between the regular vacuum cleaningÊ and it works well keep the pet hair away, and my house clean .

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The vacuum is great. iRobot is too caught up in itw own image to make it work great
Review: I got this before I was to have surgery because I knew that I couldn't do much for a few weeks post surgery. I have a dog. It's dusty around here.I have this set to go vacuum up the lower part of my house every other day.Ê That's well more than 3K sq ft. It does a magnificent job. iRobot has little electronic pods that work with the unit. you can set them to either attract or repel the Roomba... I bought extras. there are a few placecs that I don't want this thing to go... like under the range in the kitchen. The Roomba needs to have some user adjustable "finders" to prohibit it from going under such things. I did this think stuck under the couch or such pretty much every day. The pods need to be much smaller.. So while all of these is inconvenient on a daily basis... the vacuum does a great job. and because it goes out every other day, the table top dust is way down too. But you have to be home when it's vacuuming because it can't complete on it's own.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I'm very glad I bought this.
Review: I got this at the beginning of May and I use it on my ~2000 sq ft home once/week.I really like this device.Ê I have saltillo tile floors with a fairly wide grouting in most of the house. I have smaller tiles in both bathrooms and carpeting in the master bd and a loft space.I was concerned that the unevenness of the height of the saltillo tiles and grouting, along with the fact that this model doesn't have any brushes (except for the side brush), would prevent this unit from being effective.Ê While it's certainly not perfect, it does a really good job and I am very happy with it.The rollers of course get dirty, but they are very easy to remove and clean.Ê A little hot soapy water and a sponge to wipe them down do the job nicely.Ê Same with the side brush.Ê Unscrew it and a little hot soapy water and it's clean again too.Ê Of course the rollers should be completely dry before putting them back in.It also does a good job on my carpeting.Ê Occasionally threads get wrapped up on the rollers, but they're easy to pull off while washing them.When using in the carpeted rooms, I usually have to empty the canister once in the middle of the job, or cordon off the room into 2 segments using the lighthouse (which work very well).It navigates around obstacles well, but I still remove a few things to facilitate cleaning.Ê It doesn't handle small, low, lightweight rugs well.Ê It pushes them rather than gets on top of, so those are one of the few things I remove.The hepa filter is very nice and works very well.Ê It works so well I had to clean it multiple times during the initial runs.Ê Buy yourself several cans of compressed air and after each run, remove the filter and blow it out clean (outside).Ê I bought replacement filters too, and after a number of runs with the first filter I replaced it with a fresh one and washed and dried the first.Ê I'll now reuse the first one when it's time to wash the current one.Issues:It has some issues reconnecting itself.Ê My home is on several levels, so I never program this to run on it's own.Ê I carry it to a part of the house to clean and when it's finished, I carry it back to the charging station.Ê I've tried putting it on the floor in front of the charger and press the Dock button.Ê Sometimes it makes it, but it usually takes 4 or 5 attempts. I don't usually bother any more and I just place it on the charger myself.Unless the top of your stairs are well illuminated, it may get stuck there.Ê It will go a little too far over the edge, get stuck and call out for help.Ê I've found turning on a light prevents this from happening.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Gets the job done.
Review: I got the Roomba on the premise that it would not be a substitute for a thorough Swifter job done by me, but figured it would keep down the amount of daily dog and cat hair and small "pillows" of hair that would find their way to the baseboards around the house. I used to run around with my handheld vac once or twice a day (I work from home) in between days that I actually broke out the Swifter, but I have a 4,500 sq foot house, so it's a back breaker.Needless to say, I've been eyeing these robots for over a year and have compared them with all of the geek magazine reviews and so on (as I don't trust the Amazon reviews because I think most are hired writers), and I have to see that I have been pleasantly surprised. I actually love this thing. I have had it for about three weeks and I think I've used the Swifter twice. Now, if it strays too far, it won't make it back to the base, but that's only because I don't set up the virtual wall because it almost always makes it back. It goes for hours and does most of the bottom floor (approx. 3,000 sq ft.). I have to let it re-charge to take it upstairs, which I may do a few times a week. I must mention that we have all tile and wood floors with very low lying area rugs. I have one high shag upstairs that it doesn't go on, but I don't care, it goes under the beds, which is more than I do!After spending almost $100K on Amazon and constantly thinking that I need to go on an review this or that product, this is actually my first review. I am also going to review the IScooba which I bought at the same time and I am returning. I read the reviews and was ready to accept that it was less than perfect as long as it took daily scuff marks and dog prints away until I could get to do a thorough mopping job on the weekend, but it's performance didn't justify it's price by any means.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Beware of tile floors
Review: I got the 880 for Christmas and was overjoyed at the prospect of using it on my kitchen tile floor.Ê Bummer, it doesn't pick up any dirt or particles in the grout lines.Ê Now I don't know if it's worth the price at all.Ê The tile floor needs done much more often than the carpeted areas.Ê Very disappointed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 100% maintenance-free after 500 uses
Review: I got my first Roomba in 2004 and was mostly unimpressed.Ê I have no idea what I ever did with it, but didn't use it much.It took me until mid-2014 - a full 10 years - to give Roomba another chance.Ê Well, I've had the 880 for over 16 months and it is still going strong after ~ 500 nightly runs.Ê I have never had to do any maintenance.Ê Never had to change anything or fix anything.Ê No brushes or filters to clean, which I know you have to do for the less expensive models.Ê The 880 has exceeded any hope I ever had for it.Ê If you are thinking about the 880 vs 780 or any other model below it, I can't praise the maintenance-free nature of the 880 enough.Of course I have to empty the dustbin (when the light tells me to - definitely not every day), and occasionally I find Roomba, like a lost child, under my couch caught on my daughter's dress-up Elsa wig, but this is nothing.Ê I'm really thrilled with my Roomba.Ê I'm actually here writing a review because I'm considering buying a second one for the top floor.Ê Given that this has run for 500 nights without showing ANY signs of age or wear-and-tear - I imagine it's easily got another 500 runs in it. That comes to perhaps 50-cents per run.Ê Certainly far more than worth it, and for me, worth getting one for each floor of the house.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A suicidal robot!
Review: I got a suicidal one!Ê It keeps on jamming itself under the cabinet that's just high enough for this Roomba to not trigger its sensors, but clearly not high enough for it stop itself from getting jammed or to figure out it should stop trying to go there if at first it doesn't succeed. Poor thing kills itself nightly... ;)P.S. Careful when buying from Amazon directly, as they will charge you the tax - although they're advertising themselves as the least expensive seller. Other sellers might not charge the tax, so they'll be less expensive!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I give this product a perfect rating because I think this product is perfect for ...
Review: I give this product a perfect rating because I think this product is perfect for the technology that is available in 2014.Ê Does a great job and leaves floors CLEAN! Very little effort on behalf of the operator.Ê I love it!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Spectacular!
Review: I get my house cleaned weekly, and I can't believe the amount of dust and debris Reggie the Roomba sucks out of the carpets. Also does great job on hardwoods, tile and navigates under my furniture like a champ! I'm in love.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very effective
Review: I gave this to my wife for mothers day.Ê We have 3 dogs and 3 cats and hair is a major issue.Ê Also, the dogs bring in debris from the yard.Ê This little guy did a great!! job.Ê Ran the first time for 2 hour and 20 minutes.Ê My wife commented that it looked as good as when she did it.Don't get me wrong we will still need to vacuum once and a while but this does the day to day maintenance so the house always looks clean.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: If you would like the cleaning of the 980 without the crazy price ...
Review: I find that this Roomba cleans just as well as the newest Roomba the 980. Of course the 980 is too of the line tech with all its camera and mapping abilities that work wonders. If you would like the cleaning of the 980 without the crazy price tag. This would be the way to do it. While not as advanced it does clean well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: If you would like the cleaning of the 980 without the crazy price ...
Review: I find that this Roomba 880,Ê cleans just as well as the newest Roomba the 980. Of course the 980 is top of the line tech with all its camera and mapping abilities that work wonders. If you would like the cleaning of the 980 without the crazy price tag this would be the way to do it. While not as advanced it does clean well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I expected more from this robot.
Review: I expected more out of this product.Ê I guess robotics aren't yet where I expected them to be.Ê I purchased this for a multi-room house with very large rooms.Ê Most is carpet.Ê Apparently, the rooms are too large.Ê The unit frequently stops in the middle of the room and can't make it back to the charger unit.Ê I use the light houses to help modulate the size of the cleaning area, but it still fails to coax the unit back for self charging.Ê The dust bin is small and needs to be cleaned too often.Ê I must stick something into the dust bin in order to get the bin to properly empty.Ê This is dusty and dirty work.Ê They should find a better way to manage this.Ê Also, after only two months of partial use, the unit broke down and I had to request various parts to be sent out so that I can replace them.Ê Have received the parts, but not yet had the time to break out the instructions and make the needed repairs.Ê Hopefully, after the warranty expires this will not continue to break down on me.Ê Conclusion:Ê for what this unit cost, I expected more out of it and I expected better reliability.Ê I do like the product or at least the idea behind it, but I am disappointed.Ê I want to give this 2.5 stars, but since I cannot, I will give it only 2 stars.Ê If given the opportunity, I would return it and consider buying one of their less expensive units.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not quite the future
Review: I expected complete cleaning automation for the price point. Instead I find it much easier to clean manually.The good: - Picks up dirt, dust, and hair well (rather impressed with how well it works considering it's size) - Fire and forget cleaning (as advertised, sorta) - Remote control (can turn cleaning into a game, great for annoying the cats) - Scheduled cleaning sessions (neat feature) - Virtual walls (nice to have to prevent it from going to certain areas)The bad: - Easily gets stuck (under fridge, on lamp base, on cat furniture) - High maintenance (hair wraps around spinning brush, Roomba errors off, I have to use screwdriver to remove brush to remove hair..... almost every cleaning session) - Chair legs are Roomba's nemesis (dinning room chairs and bar stools are a big obstacle. Once inside the chair legs, it has a difficult time getting out. I usually have to move the chairs out of the way so Roomba can properly clean those areas)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: works great.
Review: I even named her, works great.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I don't understand the good reviews on this product
Review: I don't understand the good reviews on this product.Ê I based my decision to purchase the Roomba 880 based on the reviews on Amazon.Ê Needless to say we were extremely disappointed in its performance.Ê It didn't pickup minor items on the floor, nor did it completely cover the entire room.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: LOVE our Jarvis!
Review: I don't normally leave reviews but my Jarvis is just too amazing. I don't know what I did before he came into my life. Our house was a zoo before Jarvis, but now things are much more manageable. You'll be surprised how much dirt, fur, and hair roombas pick up. We found out that he'll even suck up crayons. He is the first roomba we bought so I don't have anything else to compare it to besides our Dyson. There is a curious side effect that you want to clean more. Similar to having to pick up for a cleaning service before they come to your house. We do make sure to put up the dining room chairs so he doesn't get stuck. We haven't had any problems with him since we received him for Christmas and plan to keep Jarvis and other roombas a necessity in our household from now on.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: so far love itÊ one year in if it lasts a few more i will not regret the purchase
Review: i don't know how long this will last but for now I love it.Ê may not be a perfect vacuum but it does a decent job on hardwoods, tile and carpet and it puts itself on the charger when it gets tired.Ê easy to clean relatively quiet for a vacuum and you can turn it on in one room with its base plugged in and it will take care of it all by itself.Ê can't say that about most vacuums, or people either.Ê time will tell if it continues to work.Ê have had it a year this month.Ê one question i have is if the battery dies can it be replaced?Ê i know you can replace the brushes and rollers but at some point the battery life will fail and it would be great if you could change that out.Ê would not buy again if that proves to be not an option because these batteries are the key to everything

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I do love the fact that I can program this to run ...
Review: I do love the fact that I can program this to run while I'm gone at work. It is kind of "dumb" sometimes and just bumps around, but it goes over rugs and under furniture which is awesome. I like that you can set up virtual wall so it doesn't go into rooms you don't want it to. If you run it regularly, you don't have to worry about emptying the bin as often, but otherwise it can get filled up quick. I have a rug that sheds and when it goes in that room I have to empty it every time.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba's Fantastic!
Review: I didn't want to like Roomba because it was so expensive.Ê I was hoping she wouldn't work so I could return her.Ê Well - Roomba definitely earned her keep.Ê I vacuumed with my ball vacuum before giving her a try - she picked up a lot of stuff my upright vacuum didn't!Ê I thought for sure she would constantly get stuck on things because I live in a small house with tons of obstacles - she navigated through them with ease and I didn't have to free her once. She went from room to room seeking out dirt and she certainly found it.Ê Emptying her bin is a breeze which is good because I had to do it 3 times on her first cleaning job.Ê I can never give her up - now if I can get my old dog to stop barking at her!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Save your money!
Review: I decided it was finally time to upgrade my very old roomba to a newer version.Ê This roomba worked....for 2 months and then the side brush stopped working:/Ê Such a waste of $629.99.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing little appliance...
Review: I could not be more pleased with the Roomba 880.Ê I have a Cairn terrier who sheds beyond belief.Ê I have been using a German made conventional vacuum (brand name withheld) that cost nearly as much as the Roomba 880 and I was shocked, to say the least, at how much hair, dander, and dirt the Roomba picked up after what I thought was thorough vacuuming with the conventional style vacuum.Ê Needless to say, the first two or three times I used the Roomba emptied the bin more times than you can imagine.Ê With regular use, I may have to empty the bin two or three times for a 1600 square foot home.Ê My house consists of stained concrete floors, Persian area rugs, ceramic tiles, and short shag carpet.Ê It handles all of these surfaces perfectly.There are some reviewers who state that the Roomba misses places.Ê I do not have that problem.Ê I suspect that they are not letting the robot run long enough to do its job.Ê Others complain that it gets trapped too easily.Ê I have a sofa that the Roomba gets trapped under.Ê To prevent this from happening I simply use a couple of light houses.Ê Every third or fourth time vacuuming, I will tip the sofa onto its back and let the Roomba do its job "under the sofa".Ê Overall, it does a good job spitting out electrical cords, speaker wires, etc., but it is not infallible.Ê If you find a wire or cord that is problematic, then just temporarily move the offender.Suggestions for those considering purchasing or who have already purchased but critical:1.Ê Read the instructions.2.Ê Follow the instructions.3.Ê Make the areas that the Roomba is vacuuming, Roomba friendly if necessary.Ê Use your virtual walls, light houses, books, or whateverÊ to prevent entrapment in known problem spots.4.Ê Allow your Roomba time to do its job.Ê It is only vacuuming a 6.5" swath at a time.5.Ê Enjoy your clean floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love Love Love it
Review: I cant believe I waited so long to get one!. Love Love Love it! I was skeptical at first. The control freak in me wasn't too impressed in the beginning. I figured it would outline the room and then go back and forth vacuuming... no it tends to wander around in a criss-cross pattern. I made myself leave the area it was cleaning for about 15 minutes. Came back and everything was picked up. Yes it was worth the money. I have it clean everyday. We have three dogs and a cat. I can see a huge improvement in the amount of dog hair that collects in the corners and all over the floors. Like I said in the beginning... I cant believe I waited this long to buy one. I love mine.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I cannot believe how great this iRobot works
Review: I cannot believe how great this iRobot works! It is unbelievable at the amount of dust it collects every day...I wish I would have bought years ago...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ALL THE YES
Review: I can't live without this, now.... how did I ever? I got it to suck up cat and dog hair, since my numerous vacuums simply won't pick up the pet hair from my hard wood floors- and the roomba does exactly that. For the first time my floors are actually entirely clean, and all I have to do is empty the thing! This is infinitely better than sweeping, vacuuming, and sweeping over and over again on a daily basis.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great addition to my house - with proper preparation.
Review: I can't believe what this little fellow picks up.Ê I really like it a lot.Ê One word of warning to pet owners.Ê Twice now, my cats have barfed prior to Brutus (yes, I gave it a name) doing his programmed morning routine.Ê Let me say that was a real mess and totally ruined what might have been an otherwise wonderful morning.Ê I eliminated the programming and completely survey the floor before manually starting him now.Ê That is my only reason for the 4 stars.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Canceled the maid
Review: I can't believe this Roomba is keeping up two dogs and a toddler across somewhere around 2,000 square feet.Ê We do have to empty the vacuum every day and I've had to replace the rollers a few times, but the 880 has served us well for the last 6 months.This has been a very expensive vacuum investment, not just on the upfront price.Ê Due to varying combinations of dog hair, long human hairs, and the occasional wire or string I've had to replace the extractors twice.Ê When replacing extractors why not replace the side brushes too.Ê I don't like to think about it (am now though), but I'd guess we're approaching the $1,000 investment in the 880.Ê However, I find some comfort in knowing maid service quotes have been in the $400 per cleaning territory (4,000+ square foot house) and I haven't felt the need to hire a maid since getting the Roomba.The 880 runs every weekday, while we're at work, and about every other week I'll let the Roomba mop hit the wood and tile floors.Ê We still clean one of the floors of the house in the traditional way (with one of those old school vacuums you have to move around with your hand), but overall I'm ecstatic I've been able to cancel the maid service.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: How did I live without a Roomba?
Review: I can't believe I didn't buy this sooner. I have 6 dogs.Ê I vacuum every Monday, but by Wednesday there is a lot of dirt and debris on my rugs and concrete floor.I scheduled the Roomba for everyday but weekends. The first day it ran and the bin filled up in an hour. I emptied and let it continue. The next day it ran while I was away and it filled up again, but finished.I love coming home to clean floors!Ê It cleans pet hair, dirt, dust, grass and whatever ends up on the floor.I have dark colored carpets and it works fine. I bought the 880 because the other models said this was a problem.I would highly recommend this robot!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It's great -- just buy it
Review: I can unequivocally say this is the best thing we've bought for our home in a decade.Ê It's not cheap, but it's worth every penny.Ê Just buy it.Ê Really.Pro:-- Some say they empty the bin every week.Ê We have 2 cats and 2 dogs.Ê We need to empty it EVERY DAY because it's full that often.Ê I had no idea there was so much dander, dust, lint and hair to be found on ourÊ floors. It was shocking.Ê It's great to have this little guy vacuuming all that up every day, and I'm happy to empty it every day.-- On carpet it's super quiet and you won't notice it.Ê Most of our floor is wood/slate, and we definitely notice it (but not more than any other vacuum)-- Really simple to "program".Ê All done on with the buttons on the unit-- Some believe this is a "bump and turn" kind of random pattern machine. I don't think so -- it seems to remember the shape of our house, and whiel there is some randomness in the paths it chooses (or seems to be), there's also intelligence and accuracy.Cons:-- Plan on some routine cleaning to keep sensors and moving parts clean and clear of hair that gets wound around them.Ê Not a big deal, but you'll do more routine cleaning than you would with a vacuum cleaner (have you ever needed to clean your vacuum cleaner? neither have I :-))-- The cover that holds the HEPA filter in has a simple catch mechanism that wore out quickly due to normal removal of the filter for cleaning.Ê For the price of this appliance, iRobot should design a better way to keep that filter in there.Ê The catch that broke isn't *really* essential to the operation of the unit, so we didn't need to replace it, but it just seems like putting a cheap component into an expensive machine is kind of silly.-- Gets stuck under some of our counters...repeatedly!Ê The included "fence" devices solves the problem (we just fence those areas off so it doesn't go there).Ê But wouldn't it be possible for the unit to "remember" where it gets stuck and "don't go that close next time"?Ê I would think it should! It's just math...Even with "con" items, this is such a great product and has revolutionized things around here.Ê I can't imagine not having a robot vacuum cleaner (especially with so many pets contributing to the level of need).

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A great success in my homeÉ plus fun!
Review: I bought this vacuum with a bit of uncertainty that it could be my only vacuum for a 3 bedroom house with a basement. It does the job beautifully. I cannot remember a small appliance that has ever made such a difference in my home. I have never been happier with a vacuum in my life. I have to admit, it has only been a few weeks. And I have never tried a robotic vacuum before. I do not know much about the durability of Roomba. However, I find it extremely easy to clean and somehow very fun! I use a forced air spray can to clean the filter and this makes it almost like new.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Damages furniture, gets stuck all of the time
Review: I bought this vacuum recently and am extremely disappointed.Ê It's a really cool idea, but the product feels half-finished and the technology is really unimpressive.The biggest issue I've had is that the robot tends to get confused and rub on furniture or the floor until it causes damage.Ê This has happened several times, despite me buying tons of extra virtual walls and putting them everywhere.It also often gets stuck, despite our apartment having very few furnishings and nothing tricky.Ê Then the battery dies if you don't find the robot and put it back right away, which means the clock gets reset and the robot may start cleaning at 5am when it does get recharged! (This has happened a couple of times now)The virtual walls and lighthouses are also a disaster.Ê In my experience they work about 90% of the time, meaning once every week or two, I find the robot in a room that was supposed to be blocked by a virtual wall.Ê When this happens, the robot often knocks things over, scuffs furniture, etc.I really like the idea of this product, it's just very poorly implemented.Ê I feel like I spend more time managing the roomba and repairing it's damage than I would have spent vacuuming!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: and the Roomba is great for cleaning under beds
Review: I bought this vacuum because I was tired of daily vacuuming my big living room because of my 2 big hairy dogs. Every day my Shark vacuum bin was filled with dust and dog hair.Ê The Roomba 880 must not have a very powerful suction because it picks up almost no dust.Ê The dog hair is picked up but rapidly clogs the entrance to the bin and the bin full light goes on whenÊ there's not much picked up.Ê Right after running the Roomba until the dock light goes on,Ê I run the Shark vacuum in the living room.Ê The bin of the Shark is about as full as when I don't run the Roomba.Ê Also, because the living room is large, the Roomba gets lost half the time and doesn't find the docking station.The pros are that the little twirling side brushes can clean around furniture edges and wall, and the Roomba is great for cleaning under beds.Ê It's also entertaining to watch for both humans and pets.Ê I like the unit well enough to keep it, but if I had it to do over, I probably wouldn't buy it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Effectiveness depends on the type of pet hair
Review: I bought this unit several weeks ago. We have a cat who sheds profuse amounts of fur and a dog who does not sheds little to no fur. This unit is absolutely wonderful for picking up cat hair and dust particles. If you have a short haired cat, it works very well. However, during the Thanksgiving holiday our daughter brought her golden retriever who spent 3 days. The dog sheds a lot of hair and the Roomba was very ineffective picking it up. So, I would recommend this unit depending on the type of pets you have. One more comment.........my husband who notices very little about the house mentioned to me that since we have this unit, the hardwood floors positively shine. We use it 3-4 times a week. Basically, I think it was a great investment.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Mom's best friend
Review: I bought this Roomba to help me maintain a clean living space for my adventurous daughter and minimize dust for my husband and I.Ê My home is a mix of thick carpet, hardwood floor, and tile and offers a variety of fun and interesting obstacles for the Roomba to navigate around (kid toys, chair legs, a telescope, etc).Ê I was so excited when the box arrived, that I opened it up immediately and started to play with my new best friend.Ê Maid Marian (my Roomba) was very easy to set up, does an impressive job cleaning and navigating, and (so far) is easy to maintain.Ê I think she's going to inspire me to get some more robotic friends for my home.SetupThere is a set of word-free instructions with a series of simple pictures, and a more in-depth manual with reasonably thorough descriptions of each of the components. The Roomba itself is pretty straightforward and easy to figure out, and you can always augment your knowledge with Google or YouTube if you need to.Ê The only thing that I was confused by was the Virtual Wall Lighthouse beacon.Ê Apparently there are three kinds of beacons, all included in the instructions, and I didn't realize this until my second time reading through information for the wrong one.Ê Once I turned the page and figured out there was more than one, it was pretty easy to figure out that the Virtual Wall Lighthouses (it comes with 2)Ê were the ones I was looking for.The Virtual Wall Lighthouse beacons are meant as a guide to teach your Roomba where the barriers between rooms are.Ê Lighthouse mode tells it where an edge between two spaces are, and it will finish cleaning the room it's in before moving to the next room.Ê Wall mode tells your Roomba not to go past the beacon. The best placement for these is on the far side of a threshold, behind, but level with the wall/door frame so that they do not interfere with each other and so that your Roomba can find it and clean as much as possible around it.Note that the charger for the Roomba needs to be against a wall since the Roomba drives up on it to charge its battery.Ê It's not in the picture I included, but I ended up taking a twist tie and cinching up the cable to keep it in one place better and minimize the chance for entanglement.CleaningI was very impressed to see what my Roomba picked up when it was done.Ê I have long blonde hair and my husband has a pretty thick beard, and between the two of us we get lots of hair everywhere.Ê The Roomba had no problems with any of it.Ê It even ate all the Cheerios my daughter had sprinkled around the dining room.Ê It had an unbelievable amount of dust in the bin considering it hadn't really been that long since I had swiffered and swept my home.Ê I included a picture of the first pile of dust that I emptied out of it, and that was just for the hardwood and tile rooms! The carpet cleaning was amazing, and she even cleaned up all the horrible things that have been lurking under my bed for years!Ê I must advise cleaning out the bin multiple times during her first clean of your rugs since there will be a LOT.Ê This little girl can clean!PathingThe instructions indicate that it does a combination of 3 things - dirt pile seeking, spiraling, and wall-following.Ê I'll freely admit that I followed my Roomba about my house for her first adventure, and I could distinctly see these traits plus a few others.Ê She deftly navigated around table legs and chairs, under my couch, around my treadmill and its pad, and even found a path around and behind my couch to clean up around my telescope!Ê The only thing the had a little trouble with was my daughter's Splat Mat under her high chair, but I taped down the corners to keep it from rolling up as easily and she had no problems with it for the second cleaning.Update: Roomba is very good at slowing down when she approaches the walls so she won't bump and scratch them, but she can sometimes have trouble with things like table chairs.Ê She's never scratched my furniture but it would be a simple thing to add a padded strip of foam or something around the rim if needed.Roomba room prep:I highly recommend picking up small things for your Roomba's first day and following it around to understand more about how it works so that you know what state you can leave your home in if you plan to let it clean while you're away.Ê Otherwise you may find a few mat corners folded over and some toys pushed into strange places. I picked up things I wanted her to clean under and set them on top of furniture she could get under, but I didn't bother with things like chairs.Ê I taped down the corners of the Splat Mat that sits underneath my daughter's high chair to minimize the risk of entanglement (she struggled a little the first time but never actually got stuck, I just wouldn't have left her alone with it like that).Ê I also recommend picking up electrical cables that your Roomba may run over.Ê Heavy duty ones aren't an issue but I can see the thinner ones (like USB) being a tasty snack.MaintenanceIt's very easy to empty the bin.Ê You just pop it off, open up where the little yellow arrows tell you to, and dump it.Ê You can even take out the HEPA filter if you want to and give it a good shake or dust bust it to prolong its use.Ê There is a blue starfish light that will appear on top of your Roomba when the side brush is slowing down. It may be friction from your rug, or it may be that your little side brush is tangled and you need to clean it off.NoiseThe Roomba is impressively quiet for a vacuum cleaner.Ê I followed her around with a decibel meter (yes I'm a nerd) and found her to tick between about 70-72 onÊ hardwood floors.Ê For reference, my home is between 40 and 50 decibels normally.Ê A typical vacuum is about 80, and conversation is about 60-65.Ê I was able to listen to my audio book on my phone's speakers and do dishes while the Roomba was cleaning right behind me.Misc:Batteries can last for 2-3 hours no problem - I haven't hit the limit yet.Ê It takes a lot longer for the first cleaning, but I separated out places so I could watch her do each new area.The Virtual Wall Lighthouse can survive a brutal beating from an 8-month-old baby.You need to sign for delivery.I'm still learning about my Roomba and I will update this as I learn more.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: THE ROOMBA - MY BEST PURCHASE EVER!
Review: I bought this on August 12, 2014.Ê I had a couple of friends who had a Roomba who "loved" theirs.Ê I was skeptical.Ê When I saw them advertised for the first time years ago, my initial response was "how stupid, there's no way that can work."Ê So I was surprised when several friends really liked theirs - especially for pet hair.Ê I have 6 dogs.Ê I have to vacuum continuously just to keep the pet hair at bay.Ê So my husband and I discussed it, researched, and read reviews and decided to take a chance.Ê Our thought was "If it didn't work, it didn't work."Ê The Roomba arrived, and we set it up.Ê It has a quick start manual, and we gave it a try.Ê It was fun to watch, to see what it would pick up, what it might miss.Ê Whatever it missed, it ALWAYS came back through and picked up.Ê It has now been three weeks and I LOVE THIS VACUUM!!!!!!!Ê I mean I REALLY, REALLY LOVE IT!Ê I run it daily, and I don't have to do anything.Ê This precious vacuum is a diligent hard working machine (I like it so much, I'm ready to name it - yes I know I'm "anthropomorphizing) and it WORKS!Ê I mean really works.Ê I'm astonished to see all the hair it picks up!Ê I'll stop it in the middle of a cleaning cycle to empty the dust bin (even though it lets you know - by beeping and talking - when it needs to be emptied), and I'mÊ always astonished to see how much pet hair, dirt, sand, etc. it has picked up!Ê I ordered extra filters as several reviewers suggested, and I change them more frequently than they need changing just to keep my Roomba in excellent condition.Ê Anything that works that hard deserves to be taken care of.Ê My floors are staying clean - I haven't had to vacuum with my Miele once, although you will have to have a regular vacuum, because there are areas the Roomba will not fit under.Ê I usually just take a broom, and sweep the areas it can't reach, and leave the dirt and stuff for the Roomba to pick up.Ê My furniture is much cleaner because there's no pet hair to be blown around by ceiling fans and re-distributed to furniture!Ê I haven't read the entire manual yet, it's summer and we've been busy, but I know you can program when you want it to clean.Ê The COOLEST and cutest part is that it puts itself back on its charger when it has completed cleaning!Ê Because I like it so much, I'm ordering a second one this month to keep upstairs.Ê I'll probably learn how to program that one and then just let it do it's thing.Ê I have never had a machine that I've loved.Ê I like my Bernina sewing machine, our Bose iPhone player/dock, they're great, but this Roomba is the best invention ever!!!!!Ê DON'T THINK ABOUT IT, JUST BUY IT!Ê YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: missing accessories
Review: i bought this matter.but there are not some of accessories.What's In The Box according to irobot:1 iRobot Roomba 8801 iRobot XLife Battery2 Virtual Wall Lighthouses (batteries included)1 Integrated Home Base1 Remote Control (batteries included)1 Extra HEPA Filter1-Year Manufacturer's Limited Warranty On Robot, 6-Month Manufacturer's Limited Warranty On Batteryi did not get remote control and HEPA filter.please remark this issues.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Rosie the Roomba is my parent's favorite gift
Review: I bought this happy little robot for my 60ish year old parents for Christmas. I didn't expect such incredible results. My parents have a 1 floor 1600 sqft mixed surface house in the AZ desert. They have 2 little animals that shed and create the havoc that gives homes harmony. The results are very good.My parents love "Rosie" the robot as my mom calls her. Here are some notes from the first 6 months:Day 1) One of the dogs follows Rosie around. Job (min-pin) is quickly understanding that even if she runs into him there is nothing to harm him. Lots of hair from the rugs. Emptied the dirt trap a couple times.Day 6) The tile floors constantly look great. No dust. Very little rug hair anymore. Easy to empty the dirt. The virtual walls don't always work but I think we put them in odd places that don't give Rosie the Roomba enough room to turn. The Roomba doesn't replace your need to vacuum when you make a mess but this little maintenance droid removes the dusty dirt, dog hair and tiny rocks you can't always see but feel without shoes when on tile floors.Week 2) Nothing to fix. No problems. Mom loves Rosie. They empty the dirt trap every day even though it isn't necessary anymore.Month 3) Still chugging along. Rosie is programmed for 6:30 to 7:30 am and the dogs don't even look at her anymore.My parents told me this is the best gift I've given them. I'd like to think the work I put on the fridge was awesome but so far Rosie is incredibly successful at making my parents life a easier every day. My parents show Rosie to all their friends.Rosie can get stuck under padded edges of couches but that rarely happens. She is also heavy for her size but you don't have to pick her up often.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Does A Good Job On Kitty Litter
Review: I bought this for my daughter as a wedding present.Ê They have cats and often have kitty litter tracked throughout the house.Ê The newlyweds absolutely love the Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Overpriced for the lack of any intelligence
Review: I bought this expecting it to clean my small 600 sqft studio easily. The first day after observing it's behavior, I decided to return it. I bought this after not doing much research and trusting the Roomba brand. I know these have been out for a while, but expected a lot more from this product after being on the market (the Roomba brand) for so long and the $700 price tag. This thing is not at all intelligent. I assumed it would at least do some basic room mapping initially and increasingly get more efficient, but it doesn't. That is why you are given the virtual lighthouses/virtual wall accessories, because this thing is very dumb. It simply starts in a circle, and then runs across the room until it bumps into something, often bouncing off at either a 90 degree or 180 degree angle. This results in it often getting lost in the same areas of the room and missing other areas. If I was to buy another automatic vaccuum I would consider the Neato D80 which apparently does some basic room mapping and is shaped square like a traditional vacuum to get better coverage in corners and along walls.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Works extreemly well - supports international voltages out of the box
Review: I bought this direct from iRobot and shipped to New Zealand via a forwarding company; the charger is multi-voltage and supports anything you're likely to want out of the box.We have a three storey house and run a 780 on one level, this 880 on another, and a second 880 will arrive soon for the third floor. Compared to the 780 the 880 cleans better (and the 780 already did a good job). We have a husky and so pet hair is dropped throughout the house everyday. The 880 is superior to the 780 by not needing to have the the rollers cleaned after every use. The dust-bin is larger too.The 880 is quieter than the 780 although it's still noisy; we run the 880 at 3am each morning and occasionally it will wake me from the next floor but generally I sleep through the clean cycle - when we get up in the morning the floor is clean.The filter on the 880 is much improved over the 780 by being bigger and fitted with a fine-mesh screen that keeps the bigger dirt from getting sucked into the filter. This filter needs cleaning after every use for us and I generally tap the filter with a heavy metal object to shake the dust lose.The 880 has push buttons rather than capacitive-touch buttons and this means that false triggering of the buttons as happens on the 780 isn't an issue.The charging station and remote for the 780 and 880 are compatible. An improvement for the 880 is that the power plugs straight into the charging-station rather than going to an external transformer as it did for the 780.This Roomba navigates the floor successfully; we have a dodecagon shaped house and with the two lighthouses that ship with it thoughtfully placed this unit almost always finds its way back to the charger. Floor coverage is close to 100% and more than good enough to keep the floor clean enough for our standards.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Temper your expectations (and grit your teeth at the $700 price tag) and you'll be rewarded
Review: I bought this at Bed, Bath, and Beyond because they accept the 20% off coupons for it, otherwise I probably would have gone Amazon. A few things to keep in mind when considering a Roomba:1) It does not replace your upright. The tech for never vacuuming again hasn't arrived yet.2) it does not pick up everything during every cleaning cycle. Be patient - it'll grab more every time.3) the ghost in the machine will inevitably pop up to haunt you. Don't set it loose in a room with valuables sitting atop frail tables, or cords for it to play with.If you're one of those people who enjoys vacuuming several times a week and can't stand the sight of an unclean carpet or floor - forget this product; It's not for you. It will cause you more frustration than it's worth.But if you're a slacker like me who doesn't vacuum nearly enough this little robot is a Godsend. You'll be amazed at how much gunk it picks up, My floors are SO much cleaner than they used to be. It seems to be doing a pretty good job of clearing the air in my house as well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Definitely Consider the Roomba if You have Allergies
Review: I bought this as a gift for my mother.Ê Two of her cousins have Roombas and she thought it would be very beneficial to her.Ê She uses it almost every day and is amazed at how much it collects.Ê My mother can't use a regular vacuum due to severe allergies, so the Roomba offers a huge benefit in both having no emissions and doing such a good job picking up whatever lands on the carpet during the day.Ê She did learn that you can't just put it in another room because it expects the docking station to be in a certain location and will be confused if not where expected.Ê The only problem she had was when the Roomba managed to get under a cedar chest and couldn't find its way out before the battery died - it took a while to figure out where it disappeared.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba is wonderful.
Review: I bought the Roomba 880 over two months ago and we love it so far.Ê Some of the negative comments I read in reviews here just weren't true.Ê Someone complained that the Roomba is loud.Ê Hey, it's a vacuum cleaner and it does make some noise but most of the time it runs when we aren't home.Ê It produces perhaps half the noise that our conventional vacuums produce so "for a vacuum cleaner" it's quiet.Ê The capacity to hold dirt is limited and I empty it daily, if that one minute task is a problem for you, this isn't the item for you.Ê We vacuumed conventionally before we cut the Roomba loose on the house and we were amazed at how much additional dirt it found.Ê We live in the country and have animals so there's always dirt and hair to clean up.Ê You do need to keep the house picked up, any socks or towels and occassionally an extension cord will cause the Roomba to malfunction.Ê We just learn how to help Roomba help us and keep items out of its way.Ê It's expensive and it isn't a miracle worker but it's great to have.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it, but Cost/Value ____
Review: I bought the 650 and had it for a week before getting the 880 as a gift. So of course, I returned the 650 and kept the 880. However; if you are looking to buy either machine save your money and get the 650. The 880 is a slightly better machine but it does not justify the much higher price in my opinion. Both cleaned great, and I could not imagine not having one around now. I have a 3400 sq ft home and I just let it run ever chance I have.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Parts can be easily removed for cleaning and removal of pet hair and ...
Review: I bought one to try it out before I gave it as a gift.Ê I am very impressed so far.Ê It has it drawbacks, but in my opinion the pluses outweigh the negatives. As other reviewers have noted, the robot uses a seemingly random effort to vacuum a space. It won't vacuum the way a person would use a vacuum cleaner.Ê It takes about 20 minutes to do a large room. When working with multiple rooms, the use of the lighthouses can be very helpful. It will take at least one recharge to completely clean more than 2000 sq ft.Ê For apartments and small homes this is very ideal.Ê Larger spaces require more interaction with the robot.Ê It will get lost and have a hard time locating the docking station.Ê buying additional docking stations and lighthouses will reduce the interaction with the robot. After I get the hang of it, I will purchase additional lighthouses and docking stationsCleaning and maintenance are very simple. It is far easier than cleaning a traditional vacuum cleaner. Parts can be easily removed for cleaningÊ and removal of pet hair and lint. It is also much quieter than a traditional vacuum cleaner.Although it is not identified on the Amazon listing Square trade will warranty the product as Other electronic.Ê The amazon product code for the warranty is B003BLS926.Ê Enter the product code into the Amazon search bar and it will take you to page.Well I have had the unit over 1 month and I am still very satisfied.Ê The unit is amazing. It is easier to clean out than a traditional vacuum and it gets in places that may be hard or inconvenient to reach.Ê It sails under my sofa, a place that may only get hit during spring cleaning otherwise. I am thinking of buying another one for the second floor.I just bought my second Roomba for the upstairs and I gave one as gift.Ê I can't imagine how I did without it so long. Right now it is busy vacuuming my office as I type this update.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
