Title: Good thing for marriege
Review: I bought it for my dear friend who is going to get married. It's really a good one for new couple and they like it very well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Why didn't I purchase this years ago?
Review: I bought directly from company, just in case I didn't like - that I would have an easy time returningOk, Ive had my Roomba for a week.Ê It has ran every day, except when we were out of town.Ê I havent programmed it to run itself, I just tap it on in the mornings.Ê It runs a couple hours or more.I dont think it has a rhyme or reason the direction it goes and I dont think it goes the same way every day.It will shut itself in a room if the door is not propped open.Ê (I havent used the light house and dont plan to.Ê They basically set an invisible wall that it doesnt go past.)It did get stuck/wedged under the edge of the dishwasher onceI think it just shut itself off.It did suck up a band-aid and chimed that I needed to remove debris.It doesnt go under my couches because they sit too low, but Im gonna have Mr. Fix-it take care of that.It does bounce in between the legs of the bar stools and dining room chairs.As it is running, I do occasionally clean the debris binI think sometimes it has told me that it is full.I havent dusted since I got it, but who am I kidding, I wouldnt have dusted by now anyway.Ê Unless I can clearly write my name in dust, it doesnt need dusting.I love that it goes under the beds.It has gone back to the charger on its own.Ê Sometimes when it does go back it moves the charger around.Ê I might Velcro it to the floor to keep it stationery. And I think one time it stopped and said it need to be charged.It isnt as loud as a traditional vacuum, I wouldnt suggest watching tv while its running, but you probably could if you turned the tv up a bit.Ê Im usually working in the office when it is going and its not annoying when it comes in.Amazingly it doesnt make the dogs go nuts.Ê It has bumped into Remington and then turned around.I can tell that my floors are cleaner.Ê I dont dread the daily sweeping up dog hair.Ê I am amazed at how much lint and dust it sucks up.even though it runs every day, the bin is still full.Ê I was skeptical on the area rug, but I did vacuum those yesterday and to my surprise there wasnt much in my vacuum.Why didnt I purchase this years ago?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I absolutely hate the Roomba 880
Review: I bought a Neato Botvac 85, used it for one week (loved it) and it stopped working die to an error. Returned it to BB&B and upgraded to the Roomba 880. Big mistake. I loathe this vacuum. It hasn't vacuumed an entire room yet. Light houses don't seem to help. It will stay in the same corner for 30 minutes. I have used it now for about four days. It just finished the room I am in and never hit the middle. It will soon be going back and they can order me another Neato.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: I amazed at the amount of dirtÊ Rosie picks up

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I am very impressed!!! I have dust ...
Review: I am very impressed!!! I have dust allergies.Ê My house is cleaner than when I used an expensive vacuum with a hepa filter.Ê I plan to buy another one. I call her Lucille because, as my husband pointed out, she returns home where she belongs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY ROBOT
Review: I AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY ROBOT, I BOUGHT THIS ROOMBA 880 BECAUSE MY GOLDEN RETRIEVER SHEDS A LOT, DOES A EXCELLENT JOB, MY HOUSE NOW IS VERY CLEAN.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Expensive piece of crap
Review: I am very disappointed.Ê After purchasing my Room a 880 this summer it stopped charging.Ê So what does one do with a $700.00 plus machine that won't charge.Ê Amazon won't take it back.Ê If I do not give it one star I cannot write a review.Ê I buy tons of things from Amazon....so very disappointed

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 3 Shedding Pets? No Problem.
Review: I am so happy with Roomba 880. I get time back to enjoy my family, and I can walk barefoot in my house without having to vaccum daily. Our best investment in YEARS!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wow!!Ê Big improvement over 400 pet series
Review: I am so happy that I took the plunge!!!Ê I debated for months about whether to upgrade from a 400 series Roomba.Ê I LOVE this new robot!Ê I live with two 15 year old boys, a husband with many projects, a dog with wiry hair that sticks to everything, and two cats, and all of this in a climate with lots of silt and salt coming in during the winter.Ê The 880 has exceeded all expectations for picking up tiny particles of dirt and pet hair.Ê The programming works well and it is considerably quieter on wood floors than my old Roomba.Ê The 880 has no problem climbing on and off rugs.Ê However, like previous models, it would not touch my rug with black border and black sections. I tried all the hacks suggested on line to trick the cliff sensors and they didn't work. I decided to return the rug and keep the new robot!Ê For context:Ê I refurbished my 400 series with new brushes and filters and I reconditioned and replaced the battery.Ê I'll still use it in lower traffic areas of the house.Ê The 880 runs circles around it.Pros:Ê The new 880 has never called me to "stop and clean roombas brushes!"--- this was a daily event with the 400 series.Ê The new brushless systems seems to work very well.Ê (Note:Ê all human and nonhuman animals living in my home have short hair.Ê I can't address questions about longer hair causing problems).Ê The dirt extraction is a huge improvement over earlier models.Ê The battery lasts about twice as long as the replacement battery which I bought for the old one.Ê The 880 bangs across metal floor grates and brick hearth without getting stuck.Ê It is respectful of cords and cables.Caveats: Previous models had washable filters.Ê The HEPA filters for this model are much more effective HOWEVER they must be replaced and do not appear to be washable.Ê I also own the Mint floor cleaning robot (now called Brava and sold by iRobot).Ê Mint maps the room and quietly and systematically crisscrosses the room, making clean lines.Ê Roomba is chaotic and apparently this annoys people.Ê If this bothers you, program the 880 to run while you are sleeping, or sit in your recliner and use the remote to drive it around to your liking.Ê The use of lighthouses (allowing Roomba to finish one room before moving to another and then finding its way back to the charger) is not intuitive at first---I am still working on that.Hope this helps!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: If you are thinking about it, pull the trigger. You WON'T be disappointed
Review: I am so glad I made this purchase! Have a 1 story house with hardwoods through out. A few medium sized area rugs (low). Roomba works wonders! Like others have said the 1st few times you run it, it is impressive the amount of debris/dust it picks up! After a few cleanings it is much more minimal. I run mine once or twice a week. I have no pets (yet) but this picks up my long hair very well without it getting tangled around the rollers/ brush. Makes my busy life a bit easier and that was worth every penny. Does a good job not getting tangled up in cords(phone chargers, surge protectors, etc). Very smart and effective cleaning, does miss some corners occasionally. I wanted this to take over sweeping for me, which it does, and allows me to quickly swiffer my floors which takes care of the rest of the cleaning. I am by no means a neat freak or an OCD cleaner, but I do get particular about grime on the floor when walking around barefoot indoors. Roomba does an excellent job with this and meets/ exceeded all my expectations. Still trying to figure out my specific house and room configuration to set up scheduled cleanings, but the lighthouses seem to work well. LOVE IT!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome!
Review: I am really surprised about the amount of dust and hair this thing picks up. It's easy to dump out all the debris and pop back in. I have it set to go off everyday around 10:30am, when no one is home. It can be annoying when trying to watch tv or concentrate on anything really because it can be loud. Our home is about 1500sqFt and it goes and cleans everything without needing to recharge. Sometimes it has a really hard time docking even though the station is literally two feet away. Its kind of entertaining actually, but does get annoying. Overall I completely recommend. This little guy can really do its job.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Rotator brush split in half after two months!
Review: I am quite upset as my Roomba, which I've had for about two months, already has a piece broken. The dark rotator piece has split in half! I have no idea what caused this rubber piece to break, however I would really appreciate a replacement considering the age of the unit. Other than that I really enjoy this Roomba, It does a fantastic job picking up pet hair and more. I do wish it didn't go in such random patterns, but overall it does a great job. If the seller would please contact me about a replacement piece that would be fantastic. Thanks : )

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I have it scheduled to clean M-W-F and it seems like once a week it goes all over the house ...
Review: I am only giving this 4 out of 5 stars because the directions are not clearly written at all.Ê I end up looking at articles online trying to figure things out.Ê The Roomba does do a very thorough job of cleaning the rooms it goes into.Ê I am still trying to figure out how to make sure it goes into all the rooms in my house every time it is scheduled to clean.Ê I have it scheduled to clean M-W-F and it seems like once a week it goes all over the house but the other two times not so much.Ê But overall it was worth the investment.Ê I have a small dog who sheds a lot and hardwood floors.Ê I could never walk around barefoot unless I had just cleaned the floors, thanks to Roomba I can be barefoot in my house a lot more.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Handles big messes well
Review: I am not a fan of vacuuming.Ê So I was a little worried when I bought this, thinking the Roomba may not be able to handle the level of accumulated grossness on my floors without a pre-vacuum from something more conventional.Ê I have two cats, one of which has fairly long hair and I'm very long haired myself.Ê They track litter everywhere. But I'm not about to buy a $700 robot vacuum if I have to pre-vacuum for it, so I decided to just let the Roomba loose.I confined it to one room at a time, and sure enough the Roomba was more than capable of handling even the grossest of floors. Yes, I did have to empty the bin 4+ times the first time it cleaned a room in my apartment, but eventually the thing finished and returned to base.Ê Now I have this thing set to run daily and my floors have never been cleaner.Ê It often finishes the whole apartment without the full bin light coming on.You will likely want to monitor it the first few times you run it in a room to see if there will be any challenges or ways to optimize its route.Ê It's a little entertaining, too.Ê The Lighthouses are a little confusing at first.Ê I think the manual depicts the usage of an older Lighthouse model--- the one in the manual has an arrow on top and the infrared beam leaves out the thin face of the Lighthouse rather than the wide one.Ê After about a a week I had it all figured out, and I don't think I can live without this thing.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best investment ever - shedding dog isn't a match for this beauty
Review: I am IN LOVE with this beautiful machine. I have twins learning to crawl and a dog that sheds like crazy. I can't keep up. BUT I bought this and am in awe how much it gathers. I run it downstairs on the timer every morning before we get up. It's wonderful to not chase fur around the house. I run it upstairs during lunch to clean up before floor play begins with the babies. I couldn't be happier unless I had another just for the upstairs. :-)It's smart enough to untangle itself if it gets caught on a rug. It did lock itself in the bathroom when it went behind the door. It seemed destraught when it kept banging the door. I think it deserves its own name because it is now a beloved family member.P.S. It also gets under the entertainment center better than my housekeepers.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I may leave my husband for 'Robert'!Ê He is AMAZING!
Review: I am in complete love with my Roomba.Ê We named him Robert and he is simply awesome!We bought a new house that is quite large and mostly hardwood except the bedrooms and playroom and with 3 kids and a dog we seem to accumulate a ton of dirt, dust, fur etc all day long.Ê I read a TON of reviews and ended up taking the plunge. TOTALLY WORTH IT SO FAR!I did not buy from Amazon but only because I had a significant coupon to a local store so saved a large amount.I read the manual and many of the Q&A on here so I had a pretty good idea how it worked when I got it.Ê So many of these reviews are helpful so I figured I would address some points I did not see in other reviews.1.Ê Roomba says it only cleans for 1 hour on a manual cycle but I find it runs for much longer.2.Ê I have not done the schedule yet because I feel like I need to see how big of an area it can do on 1 charge.Ê So for now I use the VLH and VW to keep it in an area so I can monitor it.3.Ê If I have it running in a room and the base/charger is not there, it will simply stop and turn off when it is done with the room(s).Ê This was something I couldn't find an answer too but figured it out from watching it.4.Ê Our second floor has the 3 kids bedrooms. I started it in one room, used a VLH outside so it did that one, then had a VLH at the next room so it went and did that and then finished and went to the last room.Ê It shut off if the 3rd room when done and I found it under my sons bed!Ê I then just brought it down to the charger and let it charge again.5.Ê Depending on the rug, the bin can fill up VERY fast.Ê The first time I did the master I had to empty the bin 3 times and then again at the end.Ê The second time I did it I had to empty it once mid cycle.Ê I could tell it needed to be emptied because dust balls were coming out!7.Ê The virtual walls and lighthouses are great and make Roomba very effective since it has such a random pattern and this allows you to know when a room is finished.Ê If it runs out of battery while running, IT DOES NOT REMEMBER WHERE IT LEFT OFF so has to clean the whole area again.Ê By using the LH you know that certain rooms are done since it only leaves the room when it is complete.8.Ê The virtual walls are good but anything can be used as one - door, baby gate, laundry basket etc.. I think the LH feature is much more useful.9.Ê I think 2 LH/Walls are enough but think it would not be as effective without them (think the lower models don't have)Thats all for now.Ê I am going to come back and update after a month or so to update if Robert and I are still in love or having trouble!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Requires close supervision - recommended only for people with no furniture in their house
Review: I am disappointed with this device. If I use it in my bedroom, it gets stuck under the bed. If I use it in the dining room, it gets stuck under a chair. If I use it in the living room, it gets stuck between a chair and a wall. I even bought an extra "virtual wall" unit (total of 3) to try to control the behavior, but the device still gets stuck in every room. With the time I have to spend placing virtual walls and laying down obstacles to keep the Roomba from getting stuck, it would be faster for me to just vacuum the room myself. The top of the unit is already scratched from it trying unsuccessfully to extricate itself from the frequent jams it gets itself into. And all that trouble is to do only one room at a time. There is absolutely no way this device would handle multiple rooms in my house. And my house should be simple -- no clutter, no wires -- just basic furniture.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: My dogs, me, and my roomba
Review: I am completely in love with my Roomba 880: it is a life changer for me.Ê I am a dog rescuer, there are always multiple of dogs running around here.Ê I work full time and seeing a sheen of hair on the floor when I got home from work was just something I had gotten used to.Ê Other than when we had company, and we performed herculean cleaning efforts for days I figured it was just something I had to live with.Enter the roomba.Ê I have had it for about 3 weeks now and I love, love, love it.Ê We have a fairly large space, with all hard surfaces.Ê The upstairs has tile and high ceilings [something that concerned me after reading reviews but which has been a non-issue].Ê It is divided into two rooms, bedroom and living room and the roomba glides effortlessly from room to room.Ê I don't really understand the complaints about "inefficient cleaning patterns", for me the fact that it cleans, and cleans well, is all I care about.Ê And the noise?Ê I can watch T.V. while it is in the same room, for us it is not an issue.Ê I have a very heavy cast iron bed which cannot be moved and it has always been very, very difficult to clean under---the roomba cleans wonderfully under it.Ê It is probably the first time in 10 years that i have really felt dust and hair free under there.Ê Downstairs I was a little more concerned as the floor is very rough stone, normally used outdoors.Ê The roomba had no problems, and it cleaned under the kitchen island, another small miracle and game changer for us.Ê This little guy is just amazing and I catch myself just staring at it clean [the dogs got used to it by the first day].Ê I like to be in control of it if it grabs an errant sock or becomes full so I do not set it to go on automatically, I like to be here.I will add here however that as much as I appreciate the roomba 880 vacuum, I did not have a similarly positive experience with the roomba brava floor mopping robot---I returned that after it worked feebly for a few minutes then stopped.Ê But the Roomba 880 Vacuum is a wonderful help in my household that makes us very very happy and our environment so much cleaner with so much ease.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: are definetely an excellent choice.
Review: I also have a Roomba 650 and could not perceive any difference in the vacuum system to justify such a big price difference between the two models.Ê However, the Roomba products, no matter the model, are definetely an excellent choice.

Title: Five Stars
Review: I adore the simplicity of use,. the convenience of scheduling and the surety of cleanliness.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Can't live without it!
Review: I absolutely love this robot! I have it programmed to clean every day at noon when I'm not at home, and 80% of the time I come home and it's cleaned both rooms and is sitting on the charger. I have two cats and empty the bin whenever the light comes on (which is usually 2-3 days). It picks up A LOT of cat fur. I vacuumed with a regular vacuum before letting the Roomba loose for the first time. Still had to empty the bin 4-5 times. It's a lot better than my conventional vacuum. I could go on and on, but I will forever not be able to live without it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Vauuming happens that YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO!
Review: I absolutely love this product.... the only people who would give this product a negative review are a) people who didn't read the instructions or b) people who don't vacuum.... It's like having a good-natured, happy, drunk, robot in your house... and are you ready for this... Vacuuming happens that YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO.... If she misses a spot, no problem, set her on it and hit the spot cleaning button and she gladly fixes it.... You will find yourself making all of your furniture Roomba safe for her to effortlessly slide under and you will tend to keep the clutter picked up... both bonuses! It's a fantastic product... if they made one to mow the lawn......

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Finally!!
Review: I absolutely LOVE this machine!Ê I had a friend with the older version, but I wasn't thrilled since she constantly had to watch it (caught on drapes, cords, stairs, etc.).Ê This updated version is exactly what it claims to be,Ê I set it for three times a week, and the overall cleanliness of my house has greatly increased as I need to dust less often and the floors stay clean--that's saying something with two dogs!Ê It is pricey, but worth every penny!

Title: I absolutely love my Roomba
Review: I absolutely love my Roomba. It covers the entire space quickly and efficiently and returns to recharge. It saves me so much work. I wish it had been at a lower price but I love it.

Title: I didn't know it was her (Lucy, my Roomba) who I needed in my life.Ê Thank you!!
Review: Her name is Lucy.When I describe Lucy this is what I say:I've always wanted to hire someone to come inÊ 2-3 hours a day to help around the house.Ê Budget wise we could never justify it.Ê Lucy is all that I hoped that person would be and more.Ê My home is less dusty, my house seems to feel like the maid was just here, she is always on time and does not take sick days.Ê And well she's an investment but the return is priceless.Ê I'm not one to wish 'oh I wished I would have met you sooner', cause I'm a 'may life come as it may' person...however, in this case YES where have you been all my life.In love.My enthusiasm has spread like wildfire.Ê Before I went to purchase mine I told my brother about it and all the reviews I'd read online...he then purchased the 980, loves it.I have 4 sisters, 3 of them have purchased one... a 650 & 2 880's.

An improvement, in my opinion, would be to have it dock, when bin is full?Ê It keeps going even if the bin is full...minor issue.Now if he could just retrieve milk from fridge for 3 yr old child...just sayin...Update after 6 months.Still works. Worried though that the random pattern of movement will adversely shorten lifespan.Has difficulty cleaning area where carpet meets hardwood.An improvement would be to soften the edges of it so furniture isn't banged up so much.I disagree though with reviewers statingIt's loud. I would say its 1/3 the volume of a regular vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Did not last long enough for an $800 product
Review: Have owned this unit for 1 year and 8 months.Ê Worked great for the first 9 months.Ê Would have been a 5 star review at that point.Ê Then, it stopped communicating with the virtual walls units.Ê After talking with customer support several times (Roomba's customer support is very good by the way), they decided that the entire unit (not just the virtual walls) needed to be replaced.Ê It was still under warranty, so the replacement was free.Ê Then a few months later, we changed area rugs in the living room to a rug that has some black in it.Ê Since that time, the unit will not go onto the rug.Ê Customer support says this is because the unit reads black surfaces as a hole or stairwell and will not go on those surfaces.Ê There is no way to address this, so at that point, the unit became useless for about one third of the area we use it to clean.Ê Finally, last week, the unit started dragging the dock station around whenever it tried to leave the dock.Ê In looking at it, the plastic housing around one of the metal charging contacts on the bottom of the unit has basically melted and deformed the contact surface so that it now gets hung up on the dock.Ê It's now out of warranty, so the unit is essentially dead.Ê It was great for awhile, but for $800 (that's what I paid at the time), I expect better durability.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but not it's such a great pleasure to come back home and it's clean there
Review: Have been using iRobot Roomba 880 for the last 6 month. We never cared about cleanliness of our floors, but not it's such a great pleasure to come back home and it's clean there! Just empty the dust container and that's it. Have it running 3 times per week on a schedule.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: NDR-113
Review: Great little vacuum. Was tired of having to use a conventional vacuum to keep up with all the hair my german shepherd sheds. Programmed it to run once every morning - no more dog hair in my living room. As long as you do the proper upkeep and maintenence (emptying the bin, swapping and washing the filters once a week, pulling out the rollers and removing the hair that can accumulate, etc) this thing will clean just as well if not better than your quality upright vacuums.My two year old named ours 'Andrew' :)EDIT - forgot to mention from the initial review, having a Roomba forces you to pick things up off the floor, which is a good thing. The anti-tangle feature is nice and works in certain situations, but not always. My living room floor is not only cleaner, but the entire room is now more tidy. Our two year old makes it a point to play the clean-up game so 'Andrew wont eat my toys'.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love it!
Review: Got this for my wife for her birthday, along with a new house with hardwood floors.Ê We love this thing; use at least twice a day.Ê We have a big fluffy dog and a smallish fluffy cat, along with two parakeets.Ê Our rugs are new and wool.Ê It vacuums up everything we'd expect it to.Ê Our roomba is less noisy than a regular vacuum.Ê My wife comes home from work, gets a glass of wine and sits and watches it do the work.Ê We've had it since July and are still very pleased with the work it does for us.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Their house is usually pretty messy and big
Review: Got this for my place, as well as for my parents as a gift.Ê Their house is usually pretty messy and big.It does an excellent job going around and cleaning the place, but its more for maintenance than heavy duty cleaning.Ê This is not meant to replace your vacuum cleaner, you'll still need to keep that for emergencies.NOTE:Ê This is a little bit of a hack: but I found if you take your old vacuum and aim a suction tube inside of the Roomba's dust bin, its a pretty effective dust bin and filter cleaner.Ê Then, its when your manual vacuum is too full, you empty that out, instead of the Roomba.Ê I found it saves on time and helps prolong the life of the filter; other people might have a different experience.The robot is at its best when it runs on either a daily schedule, or every other day.Ê It remembers to tidy up the place, so you don't have to.Make sure liquid or paste-like substances are off the floor before the robot reaches it, or else the substance will get sprayed everywhere.For my apartment, this does a fantastic job making sure I never have to vacuum.Ê I don't have any pets and am fairly neat, so the robot goes about its business and finds its way back to the charging station 90% of the time.For my parent's house, they have a ton of cats, a dog and birds.Ê Their Roomba had to be emptied 3-4 times within its first pass through their house.Ê Since then, it has to be emptied after every pass (once per weekday).A couple of notes: the Roomba can detect if its approaching a ledge (such as a staircase) and it will back away from it.Ê If you have an uneven surface such as carpets on hardwood floors and doorways where the floor raises a little, I found its hard to predict what will stop it and with the robot will climb over.Ê I expected the Roomba to be stopped by the floor humps in the doorways, but the Roomba went up and over, no problems.Ê There is a carpet however, that will stop the Roomba, and it looks like its less of an elevation change than the humps in the doorways.Ê You just have to watch it the first few times and plan ahead.Lastly, I have found there's sort of a rule of "three corners and four walls."Ê If you put the Roomba in a large area which has roughly four wall-like barriers, and the exit is through one of the four corners, its chances of ever leaving that area during its run, get really low.Ê Generally the larger the exit you can provide for the robot, the better; so plan ahead.

My hands sometimes bother me, with an auto-immune arthritis, so it was getting harder to vacuum and keep floors clean. This one without the brushes is a God send! Also, allergies/ sinus much improved!! Highly recommended. Trying to upload video.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: With the dual bumpers, it's a necessity, not a luxury
Review: Given my lucrative profession, trading $600 for years worth of daily vacuuming was a no-brainer.Ê It was my first robot vacuum, so after a lot of research, I decided on the 870 for its new AeroForce vacuum design (the 880's remote and virtual lighthouses did not seem worth an extra $100).Ê I had to order it from the iRobot webpage as Amazon does not carry it yet.When I got it, I was amazed (and disgusted) with the sheer amount of dirt it pulled out of my floors (about twelve cartridges worth -- gross!).Ê However, the show was almost stopped immediately.Ê I have a lot of nice, dark-wooded furniture.Ê Although the Roomba is good about not slamming into my white walls or lighter furniture, I watched in horror as it plowed at full speed into the legs of my recliner, hassock, dresser, bookshelves, nightstand, and bed.Ê Small patches of the wood stain started to come off after just two days of use.Ê I fretted that I might have to return the Roomba, despite enjoying it so much.Ê I researched the issue and found theÊRobot Add-Ons Dual Ultra-Soft Bumper for Roomba.Ê I stopped using the Roomba until it arrived.Ê Installation was very simple, and my furniture has suffered no damage ever since.Ê I almost docked the Roomba by one star in this review, because iRobot really ought to install these things by default.Ê (Seriously, iRobot -- I paid $600 for a vacuum and you can't even install a few cents worth of protective cushioning to spare my furniture from a very well-known defect of your product?)Pros:* I suffer from allergies and have to take over-the-counter Zyrtec.Ê It turns out that not vacuuming regularly was a major contributor to my allergies.Ê Now that my apartment is vacuumed every day, my nasal congestion is gone (my voice is actually different), I no longer have hard nasal secretions, I don't itch or sneeze in my apartment, etc.Ê It is truly remarkable how much better my respiratory health is after just a couple of weeks.Ê In fact, my respiratory health is so vastly improved that I experience drastically fewer allergy symptoms even while I am outside of the house.Ê That's why I said in the title of my review that this device is not a luxury, it's a necessity.* It does a really good job vacuuming.Ê With its side brush, it's brilliant at cleaning edges.Ê It design is very powerful in general.Ê It hasn't yet left behind any visible debris; my apartment is pristine every day.Ê It fits under my couch, kitchen storage rack, bed, nightstand, dresser, and bookshelf, areas that I would rarely vacuum myself.Ê I'm still amazed at the amount of dust finds every day, given my apartment's spotless appearance.Ê I'm almost incredulous.Ê Where is all of this dust coming from?Ê How is it possible that a third to a half of a cartridge of dust accumulates in my 650 sq. ft. apartment every single day?* It's virtually maintenance-free.Ê Every day I take the cartridge outside to the trash can and dump it out, blow in it to get the rest of the dust out, then take the filter out and tap it against the edge of the garbage can.Ê I clean the sensors once a week and make sure there's no hair wrapped around the side brush and plastic roller things.Ê How great is that?* It's rather quiet.Ê I hoped it would be louder so that I could use it as an alarm clock, but it doesn't wake me.Ê It's a little uncomfortable having a phone conversation while it's in the same room as you, but not as bad as a regular vacuum cleaner.* This vacuum turned me from foul bachelor into neat freak.Ê Since I run my vacuum every day, I can't have stuff strewn about on the floor, so I have adjusted my habits to automatically produce less clutter.Ê It did not take long to learn how to robot-proof my apartment:Ê shut my closet, ensure the toilet paper is not unrolled down to the bathroom floor, don't leave stuff on the ground.Ê This tendency towards decluttering has positive benefits on my ability to concentrate and my stress level.Cons:* As mentioned, it will brutalize your dark wood furniture until you get theÊRobot Add-Ons Dual Ultra-Soft Bumper for Roomba.* Sometimes it fails to dock properly.Ê It ends up rotating the dock somewhat such that it no longer can situate itself upon it, leading it to roam around the apartment vacuuming continuously until it runs out of batteries.Ê It's for this reason that I would not be comfortable running the Roomba automatically if I went away on vacation.Ê This could probably be addressed with a sturdier base station.Ê The existing one is very lightweight, which is why it's so easily amenable to becoming rotated.Ê iRobot could address this with an actual Rooba-sized platform at the front of the base station.* It produces dust in the air while it is vacuuming, which bothers my allergies.Ê Of course, a regular vacuum does that too, and regular vacuums are even worse because by nature you are standing right where the dust is being kicked up.Ê I usually run it while I leave home (say, while I am exercising), or if I'm at home, I lock myself in my office and open the windows while it runs.* Although there is some intelligence to the algorithms it uses to determine its path (like cleaning along the edges of walls/furniture, going over an area repeatedly when it detects dirt, or the spiral pattern), its paths are still rather dumb.Ê You'll watch it bounce around like a pinball trying to get out of some tight spot it's wedged itself into.Ê It'll generally get itself out without your intervention.Ê It gets stuck once in a blue moon, say, wedged between my bed's leg and the wall, or it locks itself in the bathroom.Ê I have addressed that by moving the bed slightly and purchasing a door stop for the bathroom door.Ê Nevertheless, I get the impression that if the pathfinding algorithms were smarter, it could clean my apartment in a much shorter timespan.Ê But I don't really mind it the way it is.Ê Apparently iRobot will be addressing this in future models by incorporating vSLAM (technology acquired when they purchased Evolution Robotics).Final verdict:Ê except for the serious, show-stopping, dark wood brutalization issue that I addressed with the bumpers, none of the cons are serious enough to warrant subtracting stars.Ê I'm very happy with my Roomba, and I hope it serves me well for years to come.Postscript:Ê after being amazed with the Roomba 870, I became curious about the Scooba 450.Ê That recommendation is a little dicier -- layout and materials of your home are crucial in deciding whether to recommend the Scooba 450.Ê I give that one four stars because my apartment is conducive to it and it makes my kitchen and bathroom floors actually glisten.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: More than a cat toy
Review: full disclosure -- part of why I got this was to see my cat's reactions.Ê So that being said my expectations were very low.Ê My husband's even lower. this does not clean as well as either my Dyson or my Shark -- nor would I expect it toHowever for in between "deep cleaning" this is a great thing.Ê While I know I can schedule it to go off and do it's thing I tend to use it more manually.Ê In the morning while getting ready for the day I set it off to clean my front living area.Ê It does an amazing job of getting around, under, and into the corners and crevices.It moves along floors, carpets, large area rugs, and heavy throw rugs without hesitation.Ê It also cleans well in the toe kick area in the kitchen.The cat eyes it with skepticism but does not chase it.Ê (I think they have formed a truce)It is a great way to frequently vacuum high traffic areas while doing other things.Ê For what is basically a hand held battery vacuum this does a great job.Ê The only thing that would make me happier is if they made something like this that could vacuum stairs.September 9, 2014I've now owned this for about 6 months and I still love it.Ê My husband will often set it off in the front room during the morning so that it gets a light cleaning while we are getting ready to head out for the day.Ê Thing like this can be a novelty that after a few months are no longer used.Ê This item is more than a novelty.Ê It is a great tool to keep the heavily trafficed front room clean in-between deeper cleanings.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fantastic New Addition to the Roomba Family
Review: First, let me admit that I am a Roomba fanatic. We have four Roombas plus a Scooba. So I absolutely jumped on the opportunity to test out the Roomba 880 and see how it compared with the other previous Roombas.As much as I've always loved Roombas, this Roomba 880 is just amazing. They really do listen to feedback and improve their models. Our older models had ALL sorts of trouble with my long hair wrapping around and around the brushes. I used to sit there during TV shows patiently cleaning the Roomba innards out. With this new Roomba, the new rubber-style brushes are super. It barely has issues at all.The HEPA filter is great. You can definitely feel that far more air is moving through the system. That then means it picks up even more dirt and dust than it used to. It might take you multiple passes on a room before you're done with it the first time now, because you keep filling up the bin. It's just that good.It has all the usual, favorite features of returning to its charger by itself and being able to schedule to run when you're not around. Roombas in general are awesome. They are so helpful in keeping a house clean. This one steps it up a notch.I can't give high enough praise for this thing. Now I just have to find new homes for our other ones. I almost feel guilty about foisting our old ones on people and having them deal with the niggling issues of brushes and such. But still, an old Roomba is better than no Roomba. That being said, if you can afford this newest Roomba, I highly recommend it. And so does our cat, Juliet.We were sent a Vine review copy of this.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love it.Ê Its become a member of the family. The wife named it Albert.
Review: First time we used it we had to empty it every 5 minutes now that its programmed we only empty it after eachÊ cycle.goes out on its own every day while we are at work picking up the dog hair and debris and docking itself for a recharge. Told my wife she never vacuumed under the bed like this thing does. It does a better job than she did.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba Great!Ê Virtual Walls - Not So Much
Review: First off... this thing does a GREAT job on my hardwood floors in keeping my pet hair (2 cats) off it, as well as general "dirty" that happens from day to day stuff.Ê The menu system for setting up schedules is pretty simple and easy to use.Ê For the most part it doesn't get stuck often and does a great job of navigating around.Ê What I don't like about it... the "virtual walls" you receive don't work worth a s***.Ê There's no other way of describing it.Ê Trying to keep the roomba from going through an open bathroom door, I set one of the virtual door stations behind the plane (in the bathroom).Ê Roomba passed right through it.Ê So I follow the directions and set the virtual wall station in front of the door... same thing.Ê Like its not even there.Ê Tried using both stations flanking the door plane... still runs through it.Ê The Virtual wall stations have a blinking light when the roomba is active, so I know they are working, but they don't stop the roomba at all.Ê Plus they are large sit on the floor making a very unpleasing aesthetic to any room decore.Ê Other than that.. the roomba works great!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Is the Model 880 really that much better that the previous model??
Review: First I would like to qualify this review by stating that I've previously owned two model 790's and thought that model worked very well in maintaining our hardwood floors. We have a rather large doberman that sheds a surprising amount of short black hair.The 790's did a respectable job of processing the dog hair along with anything else that found its way onto the floor.I was excited when the 880 was introduced and the manufacturer boasted of the many improvements over the previous models.My wife and I decided to send one 790 up to the second floor to maintain the bedrooms and the other 790 down to the basement, which has a combination of wall to wall carpet and ceramic tiles.The brand new 880 was charged up and set free on the first floor where the majority of dog hair and day to day traffic were the heaviest.Within the first week of operation, i noticed that the 880 was prone to showing off its red blinking trash can which means the dirt canister needs to be emptied. I was surprised on several occasions that when i went to remove the dirt canister, it was no where near full of dirt and hair. Upon closer examination, the 880 has a problem routing debris past the two rollers and through the narrow slot leading into the opening of the dirt canister. There is a sensor located directly under the two rollers that senses this buildup of hair and dust and it triggers the red flashing trash icon to come on.In summation, my wife and I prefer the 790 reliability and consistency in cleaning over the new and improved 880 which we view as requiring a much higher degree of hands-on maintenance.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Expensive, but perfect for the lazy guy
Review: Everything other reviewers have said is true.Ê This thing works well, the movement appears random, it's a little noisy, and easy to program.Ê It's important to pick up beforehand, and that by itself will keep your house tidy.Ê The bin is a little small, but as other reviewers have stated, after the first or second run, it becomes less of an issue (we had just cleaned our carpets and our bin was full in about 20 minutes.Ê The rollers are great for tangle-free, easy clean up of long hair.My experience is the Roomba runs for about 1.25 hours before needing to recharge and it may miss some areas.Ê Lighthouses/virtual walls are provided if you want the Roomba to clean a certain area longer.Ê I haven't used the remote, but you can move it to spot clean areas too.It's not maintenance free, but it sure beats pushing a vacuum around.Ê Every week, it's recommended you wipe the sensor and clear the front wheel.Ê You should empty the dustbin and check the rollers after every run.Overall, we're very happy with the purchase - it's been only 2 weeks though, and we missed a recent price drop!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Every day I love the Roomba
Review: Every day I love the Roomba. Anyone with dogs will love getting up in the morning to clean floors. The instructions are bad. I hope a relative did them for free because if you follow quick start instructions you will never get to use the Roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: The iRobot Roomba 880's ability to clean allergens from my floors and rugs amazes me ...
Review: Even though I was wild over the fact that I was going to have a Roomba 880 cleaning my house, it wasn't love at first sight.Ê In fact, for a while I was quite disgusted with the whole process.Ê What I needed to do was take my time and learn to work with the Roomba and get to know its capabilities.Ê After a few weeks we've both settled in and things are working out quite nicely.Ê Fabulously actually.My mistake was expecting more of the Roomba 880 than perhaps it was capable of.Ê There were things I needed to learn about from working with the Virtual Wall / Lighthouse to maintenance.Ê I didn't think I needed the Virtual Wall, but once I figured out how to use it I was quite pleased with the result.For several days I was not a happy camper.Ê In the back of my mind I was thinking that if the Roomba 880 was a maid, he or she would be taking a hike.Ê I ran up and down the stairs checking on the cleaning progress, which appeared to be between zero and none.Ê the darn thing seemed to be cleaning in a willy nilly fashion and kept getting stuck.Ê My Electrolux Silverado Deluxe canister vacuum seemed quite advanced in comparison.The Roomba got stuck on the corner of a large rug, got hung up on a pine room separator, and fell a few times.Ê It took a short tumble into the bathroom and when it went from the kitchen into another one.Ê My son said that the Roomba 880 had Cliff Sensors and shouldn't do that.Ê If you have a house built in 1840 like mine, some of the construction will defy any AI bot in the world and it did.Ê Later, when I set up a Virtual Wall, these issues were taken care of.Ê FYI, the tumble in the kitchen was due to the dark, slick surface of the floor and the rounded molding.I was not happy, my cat was totally freaked, but slowly things began to turn around.Ê I noticed that Liam Neeson (yeah, I named my Roomba 880 after him) began to do things that I liked.Ê That really fine pet dander, dust and hair began disappearing from my floors and rugs.Ê Things became cleaner and cleaner, and yes, I became much more capable of working with Liam.The Silverado still has its purpose and won't be retired just yet.Ê Those wide pine boards need help and try as he might, Liam can't get under the couch.Ê Instead of disgust, I've slowly grown to love my Roomba 880 and wonder what I ever did without it.Ê I really needed something to help me with dust and pet dander that set my allergies and asthma off big time.I've put together a video that I hope hits some major points, especially the part on maintenance.Ê It's not all encompassing, but will give everyone an idea as to what the Roomba 880 is all about.Ê I'll go over some of the particulars below to give a few extra pointers.I did register and name my Roomba 880.Ê I called customer service, got a number for tech and called them.Ê One ring and someone picked upÊ I had to think of something to ask so I inquired as to how to open my Lighthouse to insert the batteries (the picture in the manual is not for the 880).Ê I'm sure Delroy thought I was daft, but was patient and answered my question.Ê Thank you, Delroy for not laughing (I thought he was going to).Ê I received a couple of emails and now I know that Roomba cares for the customer and will go the extra mile.Ê I will be receiving two extra filters for registering Liam Neeson, have exquisite service, and now have a much cleaner house.The iROBOT ROOMBA:Ê Setting the Language:This is quite an easy process, but if you don't understand what the Roomba 880 is trying to tell you, it can be problematic. I have encountered some error messages and need to have them in a language I can understand.You simply remove the Roomba 880 from the charging dock.Ê Press the Dock button continually for a few seconds.Ê This would be what's called a "long press" if you were working with a Bluetooth device.Lightly tap the center Clean button until you hear the language you prefer.Ê There are sixteen languages:Ê English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Polish, Russian, Portuguese, Japanese, Korean, or Chinese.Ê Once you have made your selection, hold the Clean button for a few seconds and it will set.Ê The Cleaning Pattern / Cleaning Modes:At first I thought Liam was not all there if you know what I mean, but finally figured out how to set the patterns and use a Virtual Wall (there are two in the box).Ê Essentially there are two patterns the Roomba 880 follows, Spiraling and Wall Following.The Spiraling can be set by either tapping Spot on the face of the Roomba 880 or on the remote.Ê When Liam began to spiral, the cleaning seemed much more controlled.Ê It spirals outward in a three foot circle and goes back to where it started.Ê It's a more concentrated way to work on a specific area, especially if you have an unexpected spill you want cleaned up.The Wall Following method is the one that appears to be willy nilly, but it actually isn't. To set this you either tap the Clean button on the Roomba 880 or once again, on the remote.Ê I can easily see that continued cleaning can lead to a specific pattern, but because my household continually changes, I don't have one (yet).Ê If you don't want that pet bowl shoved against the wall or your fine furniture banged around, you will need to set up one or more of your Virtual Walls (more on that later).I most certainly learned that Liam didn't like clutter and wanted it out of the way.Ê In time it was easy to look at a room and know what needed to be removed or moved.Ê If it couldn't be removed or I didn't want Liam to go past a certain area, I used a virtual wall.If you want, you can schedule a cleaning.Ê I wouldn't suggest trying this until you are quite familiar with the way the Roomba 880 works.Ê Once you schedule, the Roomba 880 will leave at your prearranged time and return to Home Base when done.Ê I much prefer moving Liam from room to room because I'm home most of the time and find I can "supervise" more.Ê Cleaning System:There are apparently several changes between the old and new Roombas, but because I never owned one, I can't speak from experience.Ê I do know that people were quite annoyed by the brushes that worked well, but became entangled with hair.Ê That isn't happening when Liam cleans.Ê There is some hair and fiber wound along the edges of the extractors, but they do not interfere with the cleaning provided I do periodical maintenance.The AeroForce Performance Cleaning System.This is where the Roomba 880 breaks away from the old system and most likely has listened to what the customer wants and doesn't want.Ê I've heard a lot of people complaining about the old Roombas and the brushes.Ê They were like a throwback into the last century when there were carpet sweepers.Ê I know because I have one and still use it now and then.Ê The hair tangles in the brushes and needs to be either pulled out and cut and pulled out.Ê Following are the two changes.Tangle-Free Debris Extractors.These extractors are like rubberized tubes.Ê When Liam does his cleaning, no hair accumulated around them save on the edges.Ê There's a bit of tangle, but when I remove the extractors (a simple process) I just pick it off.Ê Each extractor has a different geometric shape on the end so there's no problem putting them back in.Ê I actually had to wash these off when Liam ran over something wet, but air dried them and put them back in.High-Powered Vacuum Channel.This supposedly has "accelerated airflow through a seal channel."Ê I cannot tell you anything technical about this channel, but I must say Liam is picking up an amazing amount of very fine dust and dander, something I really need him to do.Ê When I open up the bin I'm quite pleased with what I'm finding.Ê Not that I enjoy looking at dirt, but better in the bin than in on my floors and carpets than in my lungs.Spinning Side Brush.When Liam is roaming along the side of a wall, I can see the little spinning side brush at work flipping dust bunnies where he can get at them.Ê If he misses on the first pass, he'll manage to get them on the next.Ê This side brush can be removed for cleaning.Ê I have yet to do so, but it can be removed via a coin or screwdriver.Floo

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: It will pretty often miss spots and go over others ten times
Review: Even this roomba is just alright. I don't think roombas will ever even nearly replace actual vacuuming. It just gets stuck, wedged, congested, etc. The lack of actual cleaning logic is frustrating too. It will pretty often miss spots and go over others ten times. I'd try the other brands that actually map out the room, because the whole random walking thing is lame. Go spend the money on a good vacuum instead.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I was skeptical...
Review: Even after reading all of the positive reviews I was skeptical about spending $700 for a vacuum but I really wanted to find out if this gizmo would free us up from having to constantly clean up after our two dogs. We've been using the Roomba for a week now and I really am amazed how well it works. We've scheduled our Roomba to go through the house every morning at 8 am. Only twice has it gotten stuck - once between legs on a chair and once in pile of cords under a bed. Other than those two little issues, this thing works great and the proof is in the dust bin. I'm not sure that every square inch of every room is being vacuumed but it's doing enough that each room appears to be cleaned and there's enough dirt, sand and dog fur in the dust bin to convince me thatÊ this Roomba really does work as described. Yes, $700 is a lot to spend for a vacuum...but when you consider you're also buying the time to actually do the work, I think a Roomba really is a good investment.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Error 2. Open Roomba's brush cage and clean brushes -- It's brand new and clean!
Review: Error 2 in 3~5 minutes after it started working.The debris is clean and it just stopped at the center of the carpet.I'll wait for the customer service for one more day before returning it. :( So disappointed.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: pet hair still on carpet 6 months later
Review: Don't get me wrong, we love rosita the roomba, especially with a toddler in the house. She is great for cleaning up spills and doing the work while I keep my daughter entertained. But, the one big flaw, is that it doesn't always pick up everything, especially pet fur. We have a black lab and a shih tzu that lived in our apartment for four months until we decided they would enjoy my parents house while we waited to move. They have been gone 6 months now and we are still finding black hair on the ground. We run the roomba all the time (we have a toddler remember) and occasionally find loose hair in the living room.Also, something to keep in mind is that some children are terrified of the thing. My daughter doesn't mind and swats the roomba away when it gets close, but my sister's toddler is terrified. She thinks the roomba is going to steal her toys and keeps putting everything on the coffee table, even when the roomba isn't out and about. Of course, this is also nice to help keep the place clean!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great Vacuum but Dumber than a box of rocks
Review: Does a great job for the most part. It does get itself trapped in corners and the dumb thing can't get itself out.Otherwise I am surprised at how much dirt it picks up from what looks like a "clean" room....as dumb as it is, it beats trying to get someone in my family to vacuum!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Super Clean House (eventually)
Review: Does a great job cleaning my house with hardwood floors. (I don't have any carpet.)In particular, it gets those areas I would only ever bother to swift a couple times a year. Under couches, under the beds, tables, etc. This alone makes a huge difference.Not the smartest robot in the world. It essentially just randomly bounces around. Hopefully in the future they will introduce models with better navigation. It's frustrating to watch it repeatedly clean areas while 'missing' others. Only by cleaning for hours does it eventually get everything. My guess is a bot with some navigation would completely clean the space in 1/5 to 1/8 of the time it takes the Roomba to do it.So 4 stars for super clean house, 1 star deduction for taking 2 hours to do a 20 minute job.Keep in mind you will need to de-clutter your space prior to roomba doing it's thing. Doubt this robot would work effectively in a house with young children.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good but wait for cheaper price -699$ to high

It needs to be emptied daily so if going away for few days -it will only run one day and then be to full to work rest of the time. One other note I got it a month ago and it was 100 to 150$ cheaper than listed now. The price 699 seems high but it does keep you from having to vacuum daily and sometimes I don't even have to sweep (if didn't have 3 little kids may even be able to get away with not sweeping for two or so days )
