DO NOT BUY

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba Vs Siberian Husky
Review: Did you know that Siberian Huskies shed a lot? No really.... they shed a TON!Ê Prior to purchasing the iRobot Roomba 880 I would vacuum with my cordless Dyson every single day and every single time I'd have to stop half way so I could flip the vacuum head over and manually remove the hair that had been caught in the bristles.Ê This tedious task went on for approximately six months before I discovered that my wife and I are expecting TWINS! Immediately I realized that I would soon have more important things to do than vacuum daily.Ê However, at the same time it would instantly become more important that my house is clean.I spent the next month reading about Roomba and Neato and other brands who have developed nearly identical products.Ê Eventually I picked the Roomba 880 for one feature in particular--it's advertised as a maintenance free device. Calling a vacuum maintenance free is a bold claim, so I was prepared to send it back.Ê For the first couple weeks I never auto-ran the Roomba because I wanted to see how it operated.Ê Here is what I've learned from operating my Roomba:1) The Roomba 880 doesn't appear to "mindlessly bounce around the room."Ê The pattern is actually quite methodical.2) It's louder than I expected, but it's still relatively quiet.3) If I leave cables on the ground they're usually fine.Ê iPod cables, Android charging cables, power cables, etc. don't seem to get sucked up. The get picked up and dragged around, but I can grab them as the Roomba goes by and they easily pull out.4) The Roomba will hug walls, couch legs, dog crates, table lets, etc to clean around them.5) The bin holds a lot of dog hair, but I still empty it daily.6) Eventually it will find a way to get stuck.Ê It cleans my house every day and maybe once a week I'll see it get stuck on something.7) Everyone things I vacuum right before they come over--I haven't vacuumed since I bought the Roomba.8) Transitioning between hardwood, to tile, to carpet, to area run, to bathroom rug is flawless.Ê I have the edges of my rugs all run-tapped down, but my handheld vacuum would always pull up the edges. The Roomba doesn't seem to do that and the carpet is equally clean.After the Roomba ran I manually vacuumed and managed to collect a little hair and dust.Ê After manually vacuuming the Roomba managed to collect a little hair and dust.Ê All in all I find this point insignificant.Ê It seems no matter how good of a vacuuming job you do a different vacuum that works a different way will find something in your carpet to clean out.If I had to estimate how many Sq Ft of house it can clean on a single charge I would say around 1500.Ê That's with it having to navigate around couches, chairs, tables, etc.The vacuum itself is larger than I expected. It's still pretty small, but I imagined it would be smaller.The exhaust vent for the release air is on the top.Ê This was a relief because my current Dyson has it on the side.Ê This meant Husky hair would catch wind and scoot away from me.Ê Since the vent is on the top the hair stays stationary on the floor and is eventually picked up by the Roomba.All-in-all I'm very happy with the performance of my Roomba 880. Despite having a cat, dog, and wife who all shred hair like crazy my floors are always clean.Ê In addition, I've never had to clean the Roomba because hair is never stuck in it.Ê If you have any questions or want some pictures/videos of the Roomba in action leave a comment!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great product! better than what I thought
Review: did a excellent job on cleaning my 1 floor single house. The house is about 1800 sq.ft, and it has to do it twice. I closed some door to divide the whole room in two part. It did one part for about 2+ hours. I did not try other cheaper model/brand.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Furious about Roomba!
Review: Delivered 11-26-14 As of 1-14-15 it has totally quit working. Won't clean, won't charge, nothing. Wish I' never bought it. Don't waste your $$$. And I do mean WASTE!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, love, love it!
Review: Decided to give this to myself for Christmas because of the following:- we adopted 2 exotic longhair kittens- we have a housekeeper who comes every two weeks and completely cleans the house- in between cleanings, our wood floors and tile would get a LOT of hair- the constant vacuuming was driving me crazy...my husband and I both workI had my doubts about the Roomba....specifically, I have had to use tweezers, scissors, etc. with my "old fashioned" vac to get the pet and my hair (I have long hair) out of the belts, etc. so how could this little robot deal with this?OMG...it is absolutely AMAZING!1. The 880 has no belts like prior models...never gets clogged with hair on various parts of mechanism.2. I can do laundry, take a bubble bath, make dinner, etc. and my Roomba runs all over our 4000 sqft house cleaning the floors beautifully....wood, tile and Persian rugs.3. When he is done, he sends himself home to recharge.4. He cleans BETTER than my housekeeper....Roomba goes under every piece of furniture and cleans...for a test, I ran the Roomba immediately after housekeeper left and Roomba was full when he was done...because he goes under everything.5. He magically adjusts his height depending on the surface or obstruction...don't worry about stairs, he is too smart for that.6. Only one suggestion...they should add audible alarm when he is full...there is a light but audible would be handy.7. One warning - watching the Roomba can be mesmerizing....you will be tempted to follow him around and watch him clean...force yourself to take a bubble bath :-)8. The Best most well thought out product I've ever used!!!!I'm buying another for our weekend home....P.S. The cats love following it around....suggest you don't get "detective mouse" cat toy if you have Roomba. They think the Roomba is a bigger more fun version and now try to play with the "sweeper" part of the Roomba sometimes. Cute but they had better not hurt my Roomba! :-)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not very useful if you have area rugs
Review: Cool product, but this Roomba gets stuck on our (relatively short-pile) area rugs, at which point the thing quits and dies. Not sure it's worth the money.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cool product but stopped charging
Review: Cool product but stopped charging.Ê It didn't clean the carpet very well but did a good job on the tile and hardwood floors.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: very good machine but requires some attention
Review: Considering this is my first roomba my expectations were great, after a couple of weeks of use I really see it very good job. I have a Golden Retriver, two children and it is a challenge to leave the floor without traces of hair especially under furniture.The type of floor where the use is hard smooth bright; is not as noisy as I thought, good performance and the virtual wall / lighthouse.Although the move seems totally random I have to admit that the rooms are clean at the end of the process; My house has three bedrooms, two bathrooms, living room and kitchen, about 300 square feet is cleaned all my roomba 880.The price actually is high but the completion of all parts is excellent.Negatives I found so far; can snag cables, shoelaces, backpacks strips, thin mats or magazines; it is better to remove them, can be mounted on some obstacles and getting stuck, the previous guide wheel can be stopped with hair if it is very fine, but it is easy to remove and clean it can happen.It is recommended to tour the house with the roomba the first time to review the potential problems; more clear floor best. It is best to place the chairs on the table to improve cleaning, also make sure you have no liquids spilled.Anyone know when the battery runs out? It really is incredible, it never ends.You can see the 880 working at my home http://1drv.ms/1vNrfPSIn summary a very good machine but requires some attention, especially considering its high price.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Definitely worth the money
Review: Compared to the 200-model Roomba I had years ago, the Roomba 880 is a huge improvement. It picks up a lot more hair, dust, and fine dust; the main dust bin is easy to clean out; and maintenance of the various parts (rotating brushes, rollers, air filter) is very easy. I'd recommend having a few cans of compressed air handy so you can blow out the dust from the air filter. This Roomba has a good battery life, and he programmable schedule is very handy. I bought another lighthouse so I could section off parts of my apartment more easily.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best xmas present
Review: Cleans the hardwood and rugs perfectly. Best xmas present!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Cleans great. Easy to operate. Smart. Pet friendly.My wife said this was the best present she got.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Not Good on Tile...
Review: Cannot clean lentils off a tile floor. I noticed my new 880 doesn't have the suction power to get stuff out of the grout. I have normal tile; the grout isn't especially deep. To test it, I threw a handful of dried lentil beans on the floor and turned it on. It got about 60% of it up with 2 "spot" cleaning cycles.I have had 3 Roombas. This is the first one with rubber fin things instead of brushes. The ones with brushes worked fine on tile and carpet. I wish I had known that this was only good for pet hair and/or on carpet.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Highly recommend
Review: Can't say enough about my new "Robby"!Ê Got it for Christmas and so far it has done everything I expected it to.Ê We have pets and I needed a quick cleanup in between once a week hard cleaning.Ê I did have to empty it twice on the 2nd day so I will run it while I am at home.Ê We have a retriever and she sheds like crazy but Robby got it and more up.Ê I would recommend this for a home with or without pets. Got it on a great one day deal and saved $99.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Beep, Bop, boop vacuuuuuuuuuuuuumÊ -Robo vacuum.
Review: Can't say enough about it!Ê Wow is it expensive, but shop it for a while.Ê It went up and down $30-50 for the few weeks I was pricing it.Ê Very effective.Ê Does a great job.Ê This model comes with a remote so I can drive it.Ê Lots of fun.Ê Easy to program and man does it clean well.Ê Haven't been able to get the cat to ride it yet though:/Ê I just watched it clean for the first few days.Ê Hasn't tried to kill me yet, but I will update post if it starts to become sentient.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Perfect for Dog Hair
Review: Can't live without this thing now. We have two heavy shedding dogs (short hair) and it cleans up after them pretty well. We have to empty the filter often though, but it beats all the vacuuming I was doing before this thing!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for long hair (and kind of life-changing)
Review: Can a vacuum change your life? This one seems to have changed mine. First of all, I hate vacuuming because of the noise and because my long hair gets in the vacuum brush bristles and I spend as much time with a serrated knife trying to free hair and stuff from the bristles as I do actually vacuuming (or more, maybe.) This Roomba is much quieter than a regular vacuum (although it may have gotten a bit noisier in the two months I've had it) and the rubber rollers that take the place of bristles grab the hair and push it off to the side so later you just need to flip over the Roomba and slip the hair off the sides of the rollers. It's SO easy. It's good with pet hair, too, although it seems to just push it into long, stringy clumps and then leave them on the carpet, where they are easy to pick up.As good or maybe better than the way the Roomba deals with long hair is the way you can set it to run each day at any time you want. I set mine to run every day starting early in the morning and use it as an alarm clock. So, each evening I look all around and make sure there are no shoes on the floor and that bag of trash I was going to take out is actually taken out and everything is neat and tidy. Then, when I wake up (sometimes a little bit before my Roomba "alarm", sometimes woken by the Roomba) I look around again to make sure no cat toys (or cat puke, which seems to happen just before or sometimes during the running of the Roomba) is in the way, and the Roomba cleaning the floor inspires me to start off the day by cleaning something, too.So, the Roomba has changed my life by giving me this regular cleaning routine and it's kind of amazing. I actually used to have the first generation Roomba and I used it maybe twice, forgot about it, and eventually gave it away. The fact that this one is programmed to run every day makes ALL THE DIFFERENCE.When I first started running it, the dust cup was full halfway through a cycle every time. After several weeks of this, I wondered if it was actually sucking dust from my downstair's neighbors place or...I mean...really? That much dust and dirt EVERY DAY? Finally, it stopped filling up each time and I guess my place was just that dirty and gross.It sometimes knocks its own base station out of place a little. Just enough that it can't dock itself again. Also, the virtual walls/lighthouses don't always seem to work. In one case, I think I had two doorways that were just too close to each other and one virtual wall was interfering with the other. I solved this problem by putting aÊCatit Design Senses Play Circuit, set in a gentle wave pattern, in a doorway. I also had trouble the first time I decided to leave and run an errand while the Roomba was running. I found it had escaped into the kitchen (may have had some feline help) and had errored out after going under a kitchen island and finding and picking up a piece of a broken coffee mug. No damage done, though, just a good reminder to clean under the darn kitchen island!Speaking of cats, I don't think mine are going to be riding the Roomba any time, well, ever. They aren't afraid of it, though. They like to lay down in the middle of the floor and then are surprised EVERY TIME the Roomba is SO RUDE as to head straight for them. You'd think after the 10th time that day the Roomba touched their back or tail they'd learn, but they seem convinced each time they've found the ONE SPOT the Roomba won't go.So, this Roomba IS GREAT. Because of it, I actually feel good about having people over to my place, and even after nearly two months my incredibly cheap rental carpet still keeps looking better every day. I would recommend it to anyone trying to develop more regular cleaning habits.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great for busy professionals
Review: By far the best device. We set it and forget it. My wife and I are always very busy, but during the day when we are not home, we just put it in a room and let it do a chore we would like to not to have to do. Cleans and picks up dust like no other. If your a busy professional this is a device for you.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Breaks like all the other Roomba's You will have to maintain ...
Review: Breaks like all the other Roomba'sYou will have to maintain this more than a vacuum.not fun.Pet's will run awayMight as well save your money and buy a dyson.I didDoes the job and I'm not a robot mechanic anymore.waste of money

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Horrible Service!!
Review: Bought this vaccum as I already had a neato and wanted to compare the two brands. This vacuum worked well for the first two weeks I had it, and then it just stopped running on schedule. Anytime I had to clean my room I had to press the clean button. Obviously this was inconvenient as using the room and having a robot clean at the same time was causing issues. I contacted the manufacturer concerning this and simply they did not seem to care. I finally returned this item and wentÊ back to Neato! Waste of my time!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Fantastic cleaning but sucky navigation
Review: Bought this to use back home in India where we have 3 medium size pets with meadium shedding. The rubber rollers are a godsend! i just cannot imagine using bristle rollers - would need intense cleaning every week rather than the easy clean that i do now. All the parts that need to be cleaned come off easily and go backOn the flip side it doesnt navigate very well between rooms and sometimes goes off for no reason. So many times i come back to find that the Roomba has stopped somewhere and has not come back to home base5 stars for cleaning ability3 stars for navigation

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wife loves it
Review: Bought this for my wife on recommendation from my son. It is interesting to watch it work and it picks up dirt you don't see.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wife had recently become disabled and just cannot clean like she used to
Review: Bought this for my wife on mother's day at $100 discount. Money well spent. Wife had recently become disabled and just cannot clean like she used to. This is great for under beds. A few things: 1. You will still have to get corners with a Swiffer or similar cleaning tool. 2. The first time you use it you will stir up a lot of dust. We had 2 room Hepa filters wide open. 3. You have to empty the bin often. But to me that is a small price to pay. 4. A small portable vacuum like this one: http://www.amazon.com/Black-Decker-FHV1200-Cordless-Ultra-Compact/dp/B002FQJW4W/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1431737686&sr=8-4&keywords=black+%26+decker+cordless+vac makes cleaning bin much easier.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Irobot Power
Review: Bought this for my wife for Mother's Day....hey, it's a vacuum she doesn't have to push around.The day before, I let her vacuum just to see how well the Roomba 880 would actually work as read in some posts.When it was done cleaning 3 rooms (tv room, kitchen, and dining) it came back with lots of cat hair, and dirt!My wife couldn't believe how well it worked, and neither could I!PROS:- much quieter than standard vac- no more Human powered vacuuming!- it picks up a lot of dirt and does it wellCONS:- it's expensive..... but think of all the time you gain by not having to vacuum yourself

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, Love, Love it
Review: Bought this directly from iRobot as it wasn't available anywhere else yet...I have a 4400 square foot house consisting of hard wood floors, tile, regular carpeting, and super deep plush carpeting.Ê I have a house keeper that comes weekly, and I clean throughout the week in addition to the housekeeper.Ê That being said, I cannot believe how much debris this thing picks up.Ê I do have 2 teens with lots of friends, and a little furry dog that brings things in on her fur. And it has been a battle to keep my floors clean until I bought the Roomba.Ê I run it daily.Have you ever moved after living in a home for a few years, and seen the "stuff" that is under your bed?Ê The lint, hair, etc?Ê This robot goes under beds, couches, etc...where we typically don't clean, and gets all of the stuff. It did get caught under the bed once (was hung on a sock that was under the bed.)It is gentle when it bumps into things, and redirects itself.Ê I didn't think it would handle the very thick carpet (it is really, really thick) but it goes along pretty well on it.Ê I do have that same carpet as a rug on the hard wood living room, and it can't make the jump up that high...but I can put it on the rug manually and it cleans it fine.Ê I block the edges of the rug with the light houses to keep it on the rug...otherwise it runs off when it gets near the edges.We did a "spot clean" in the middle of the rug, and it does a spiral pattern and made neat "crop circles" in the carpet.Ê That amused the teens.It covers a room so well.Ê You will be amazed.Ê We have lots of allergies and I cannot believe the stuff I am getting out of the filter and bin each day.It is pricey, but it is so worth it...and if it helps with our allergies (think of the cost of allergy meds, etc) it will be really worth it.Ê I don't know how long they last, but I am reading up on the maintenance to make sure I get the most years out of it.Ê My mom wants one now.I opted for this model (880) over the 700 series because my daughter and I have long hair, and I dislike having to cut hair off of brush rollers on traditional vacuum cleaners.Ê This has rubber rollers.Ê I have not had any problem with long hair hanging up on it.Ê My mom has dogs that shed short hair, so we may go for the 770 or 780 for her house.I have not found anything to complain about yet with the Roomba.Ê I love it.Ê Two times out of the last 2 weeks it has not been able to find the docking station on it's own, but I redirected it and it found it finally.Ê My house is one level so is long and drawn out, and if the Roomba is in the back of the house and it decides it is docking time, it cannot "see" the dock.Ê If it is near the dock, it locks onto it and heads that way.Ê It has a flashing light on top that flashes "dock" and I simply aimed it down the hallway and it headed on home.Ê It behaves better than my dog or my teens.Ê Put it on your birthday, Mother's Day or Christmas gift list.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Worth the Investment
Review: Bought my butler in April or May in the face of much family skepticism. Long story short: Roomba is my buddy. The kids tease me. My wife chortles, yet agrees our floors are more consistently clean than B.R. (Before Roomba). I'm thinking of giving my in-laws one for Christmas. Follow the directions for use and maintenance and the little guy will work flawlessly. My wife is amused that I've assigned gender. I did the vacuuming B.R. so why not a guy? I've learned he works best with frequent use, as the directions suggest. I run him every morning after we've all left (highly programable is another plus -- better than any human), except weekends when the kids sleep in. I'm giving him four instead of five stars for three reasons: loud (not as loud as our lonely Dyson, however), inconsistent self docking (you can program him to "return to base when done" and he parks and recharges -- fun to watch.), and ability to handle deep carpet. We have mostly hardwood floors; carpet in kids' rooms; rugs in family room, my office and my wife's Wife Room. He does all the rugs and carpets no sweat except in the Wife Room. That rug is quite thick (about half an inch) and he just bounces off the thing. The Dyson is happy with this situation, however; otherwise he would atrophy. Other than that rug he transitions flawlessly from hardwood to carpet/rug. He's got more energy for hardwood, however; the fibers of carpet tire him out faster for obvious reason involving physics stuff and terms like "friction." I really like this product and am totally comfortable that I'm getting my money's worth. Our dog is not a fan. But she's mainly the reason we got him in the first place. No more dog hair tumbleweeds! When they make one that cleans toilets I'm all in!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Expensive - But Really Happy with it!
Review: Bought much earlier version like 2005. Liked it alot, but required alot of maintenance - cleaned ok to good, not great. Lots of time cleaning it after it vac. Great idea - but this one: pricey, but so far, very pleased. Cleans hardwood, ceramic tile & area rugs very, very well. Adjusts to varied floor types in one area very well - missed nothing! Cleaning it was a breeze. Still need to try it on carpeted room - but very hopeful. This thing functions really well! WORTH IT!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but does a very good job of picking up pet hair and traversing from ...
Review: Bin fills up fast, but does a very good job of picking up pet hair and traversing from hard wood to carpet.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I really like mine, it works better than I had expected.
Review: Better than I expectedOkay I am new to these automated appliances. I had no preference I have only observed these things on Youtube. I thought about getting one of these before before but its random method of cleaning did not make sense to me and did not seem like a real cleaning device but more of a novelty item. I called and spoke with someone who has one of the new 880's and she said it works great, it seems to make no sense to its routine and don't try and figure it out just realize it will clean the heck out of your floors. huh ok?But still I was leaning towards the Neato Botvac so I figured I would try the Roomba first since it was on sale and based on her recommendation and if not satisfied return it and get the Botvac and because of their history of problems get an extended warranty but I really liked the systematic approach it uses for cleaning and many people love them just like some who love the Roombas.Ok so I just got the Roomba 880 yesterday. Like you I had read probably a hundred reviews and watched some youtube videos but most of what Isaw and ready were based on earlier models.What I originally thought about the Roomba based on some reviews were:It would be loudIt would "Slam" into and damage furnitureIt would run only for about an hour then battery would dieIt would not pick up much except light stuff off the carpetIt would frighten my cats or they would ride it around.It would not replace manual vacuumingIt was not worth the moneyIt would not clean all the roomsIt would not find its way back to the baseIt would get stuck a lotBut in reality I discovered:It is not loud at all, in fact much quieter than my upright.It slows down before bump stopping to most furniture and wallsIts bumper is soft so does not damage anythingMy Cats are intrigued. They will watch it and are not intimidated by it.This 880 cleaned my floors better than my upright. I did not think that it would but it pulled alls sorts of stuff up. Clearly this is NOTjust a sweeper. I have not let it complete a full cycle yet so I cannot comment for it returning back to base. But I ran it this morning and it took 2 hours before the battery light came off of green and moved to Amber. It was still cleaning with no signs of slowing down or docking when I stopped it.I noticed that the bin full indicator does NOT stop the unit, it keeps packing it in there. My second run of the house and still get a fully packed bin.My first run I emptied the dust bin twice just from our master bedroom! I really can't believe it, this thing pulls up so much crap from myfloor it is amazing. Not sure how because my manual vacuum is a good but it just doesn't get into small places easily. This thing pulls all that crap from those hard to reach places like under the bed and especially between the wall and the edge of the carpet. My carpet is berber so it sort of scoots along on it with no restriction. By the way, in spite of all the cat fur it picked up there was nothing on the rubber extractors when I checked them.I think I might have a newer version model because my battery will clearly run for 2 hours before even coming off green. My 1400 sq foot single story house using the supplied two lighthouses. I put the base in the living room (center of the house) and the Roomba 880 visited the Kitchen, the dining room, the living room, and three bedrooms. ( I closed the bathroom doors because I have yet to remove the tassel carpets which I cannot vaccum manually and although the Roomba is supposed to be able to deal with them I did not want to run the risk of jamming up the roomba).Keep in mind this was my second run on most of these carpets and I still had a very full very packed dust bin. I notice on mine that thered dustbin full light will come on and the unit will continue to run.Also when it finds dirt it moves in a "W" pattern like you are painting a wall or vaccuming by hand not the "Circle" pattern as shown in videos of previous model units.It may not be a very systematic or organized looking approach to cleaningÊ but it works and it does a great job.Ê No idea about reliabiltiy or longevity at this point. Might not be a bad idea to get extended warranty, but I didn't get one with mine.My suggestion is to verify return policy and try one out, you really got nothing to loose execpt a bunch of dust and dirt. I am still keeping the boxjust in case but so far so good! I really do like mine it works better than I had expected.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best vacuum I have ever owned
Review: Best vacuum I have ever owned.Ê It sucks up more than my old upright and i don't have to do any work.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: All that I had hoped for
Review: Best toy I have bought in a long time. Immediate after charging I put my Roomba to work and it did amazing with the pet hair.Ê Already, after 4 daily uses, the rug in which my cats love to lay on look ten times better.Ê I did finally use a stand up vacuum on it to help establish a baseline that hopefully the Roomba can maintain.Ê As it currently works, I do not seeing that being a problem.Ê I primarily have hard wood floors and it does a pretty decent job on them.Ê I do have one rug that the Roomba refuses to climb over because it assumes it hit a positive block or something.Ê A little disappointed in that but still happy with the results provided throughout the rest of the house.Ê It doesnt completely eliminate the need to vacuum occasionally with a standard vacuum but I can see the difference already when I come home after work.Ê The machine is rather noisy but not too crazy.Ê I still prefer it to run during its schedule time when at work compared to when I am home. (Although it is fun to watch these first few days.)I already bought a second Roomba for my downstairs level and cant wait for the tag team duo.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Buy this, you won't regret it!!!!!
Review: Best thing I've ever bought. I almost feel like I have a housekeeper. I have a husky and a golden retriever and hair was a huge problem in our home. Not anymore. I dust less and sneeze less. I schedule it to go off in the middle of the night and I usually start it when I leave the house to run errands. Works wonderfully on our hardwood, tile, and carpet. Even vacuums our bath mats without a problem. We even keep the house neater by picking up every night to make sure she can get everywhere. Ours is a she, and yes, we named her :)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Putting it together was pretty simple and the only trouble I occurred was charging ...
Review: Before buying this I checked out a lot of the reviews and most all of them were highly impressed. I wasn't sure which on I wanted to get and decided on the 880. I was still somewhat skeptical but since I was getting this for my woman to help her out somewhat, I bought it.After the package came it set around the house a couple of days before I decided to open it with her.Putting it together was pretty simple and the only trouble I occurred was charging it for the first time. The book said let it charge for the first time 17 hour. But on the Roomba the charged light was one. I still hooked it up to charge. After waiting for the time to run out I started to use it and saw the charge light was red and not green. I found out that when I put it in there to charge it I place it in correct (my mistake not the Roombas). then I had to wait for it to recharge again.I decided not to use it in every room the first time and made sure it had a clean floor to start off with. After doing just the living room and the kitchen (vinyl) I had to empty it 3 times, which wonder me because I have a very good vacuum cleaner that cleans fantastic (or so I thought).I wanted to make an comparison on what it would do in a room that I didnt vacuum first. So I had it vacuum my bedroom (which really needed it).After all said and done the rooms were very clean. The next time I used it I only had to empty it after it had cleaned every room.Love it and I am so happy to have bought this.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Been using this 3 times a week since purchased and ...
Review: Been using this 3 times a week since purchased and it's still going strong. Just make sure you clean up after your pets before it starts, if there is a turd on the ground it will run over it and track it all over your house and grind it into your rugs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We named him Elmer because he loves hunting dust bunnies
Review: Been thinking of getting a Roomba for years, but wasn't completely sold on the idea - especially worrying about it eating rug fringe. Then I saw this model. He came to our home yesterday. We have named him Elmer - because he's hunting dust wabbits all over the house. I have severe asthma, and the rollers and HEPA filter really got my attention. WOW! What a difference. He has done wonders on our floors. He has his moments with the fringe, but he manages. We've torn out carpet, replaced windows, replaced A/C and change filters monthly, and there are at least two air-purifiers going in the house at all times. He still picked up a small dog's worth of fluff in this first 24 hours. And we don't have a dog! Yep, I love him. (And I never give 5 star reviews)

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome product.
Review: Beautiful piece of Engineering. Works very well on hard wood floors. Only issue is that my wife and daughter's hair keeps getting stuck in the brush and rollers. Other that that, nothing comes close to the way it cleans. Wish it had a smart phone interface. Especially since it costs more than the iPad I bought my wife, I would expect a 'smarter' feature. Also, it could use a larger trash reservoir. The pets hair really fills up quickly. It's still a little loud, especially if you trying to watch the tv. For all these reasons, I give it a four star. Otherwise, this would be a five star.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: CAUTION, Ruins area rugs!
Review: Be very Careful using this product.Ê We bought this and used it once, it ruined over $8,000 in area rugs.Ê It pulled the wool loose all over and actually pulled so hard that areas of the rug were left with 6 inch strands of wool being pulled loose.Ê The manufacturer said that it is the owners responsibility to check with EVERY manufacturer of flooring products on which this is to be used to see if it is suitable.Ê They denied any responsibility so now we are out $8,000 for the three rugs this vacuum ruined! No where in there manuals does it state this.Ê We are hiring an attorney to file suit.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: DOES GREAT JOB...COULDN'T BE HAPPIER
Review: Based on first 3 days it does exactly what it is suppose to do ...couldn'tÊ be happierONE WEEK LATER....I have used it now for a week and my opinion has not changed. I have a 80# lab that sheds like crazy and use to either vacuum or Swiffer everyday. I can say without any doubt this is a great piece of technology. i cant even find any dog hair anywhere in my house. I run it twice a day once in morning and once in afternoon and set up walls so it concentrates on 1/2 of house at a time . I am glad i waited till the new technology was out and think it works just great

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: We love her and treat her as one of the family
Review: Barbara Silk -Ê We named her Rosie, after the Jetsons robot.Ê We love her and treat her as one of the family.Ê She also doubles as an alarm clock.Ê When she starts into my bedroom, there is no going back to sleep.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent cleaning performance; navigation could use some more improvement
Review: Background:Ê 2200 sq ft, single story, mostly tile, carpet in bedrooms, very open floor plan with some irregularly shaped rooms.Best features: The cleaning performance of the AeroForce extractor is fantastic... and disturbing... I thought my house was clean.Ê The first time Roomba came back with a bin full of lint, dust, debris, etc. I thought, "Where'd you find that?Ê You made that up!"Ê Then I let it get its first full charge and sent it back out... and it did it again.Ê Apparently the house wasn't as clean as I thought it looked.Ê Its dirt sensors (I'm guessing are electrostatic in nature...) really do find very fine grained particulates.Ê Roomba 880 even pulls out the very fine sand/silt/dust that blows relentlessly here in New Mexico.Ê One reviewer said it wasn't a substitute for a broom, but my experience has been that it did a better job than manual sweeping, but couldn't quite match mopping or Swiffer/Shark style cleaners (there are other robots for that, right?).Biggest area for improvement: The navigation is a bit peculiar, and I find myself playing guessing games to figure out how to manipulate the physical environment to make Roomba more likely to succeed.Ê It has a standard repertoire of moves: forward, run into something, try to arc around it about 3-4 times, if that fails, make a 135 degree turn to go diagonally backward from the course that ran into this object, resume cleaning.Ê It's biggest challenge seems to be trying to figure out the actual dimensions/shape of the room versus what's just an obstacle within a room.Ê If you have a very open floor plan, particularly with irregularly shaped rooms, it seems like it gets confused.Ê The lighthouses help, and I actually purchased several more, which further improved performance.Takeaways: If you have a floor plan like the one I've described here, expect to need a lighthouse at the threshold of each room and some to subdivide large open areas (i.e.: kitchen --> living room if it's all one big area).Ê The more you subdivide the area to be cleaned into simpler, more square geometry, the easier time Roomba seems to have getting to 100% coverage.Ê Scheduling more than once a week (even just two days) seems to improve coverage, as Roomba appears to know where it spent most of its time in previous sessions and will focus more on areas that it hasn't visited as recently.
