Review: Awesome vacuum. I have two dogs, one being a husky. I do not ever have to vacuum. Thank you roomba

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Awesome roomba, much better than my previous 650 model.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome machine, even cleans my shag rugs
Review: Awesome machine, even cleans my shag rugs, and German Shepherd's hair that I would have to vacuum every other day!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: Awesome device.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Disappointed after 6 weeks of daily use
Review: At first, the entire family loved the Roomba because we woke up to clean floors. The first day we used this was July 8th and within 6 weeks of daily use, we are disappointed. We've cleaned the brushes, replaced the filter and still I am having to vacuum after the Roomba is finished. For the amount of money I spent, this is extremely frustrating.I'm hoping the seller can offer suggestions??

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very easy to use out of the box
Review: At first I was very skeptical of a robot vacuum. My wife is five months pregnant, we have a dog that massively sheds, especially during the summer, we live in a an apartment and we don't have time to vacuum everyday.Ê I read all of the reviews and did the research.Ê I decided to give it a shot.1. The biggest issue I saw people had in the reviews was the noise level.Ê It is not that loud. It's quieter than a regular vacuum and I'm not usually home when it's going.Ê Trust me, it's not that loud!2. I have to clean the bin and filter every day. My dog sheds a lot so this is ok with me.Ê I can physically see how much it has cleaned up the floors.3. Our floors look and feel clean.4. Very easy to use out of the box.5. Easy to set the date/time and schedule the cleaning for the week.6. If the rollers and other parts get clogged with hair, it is very simple to take apart and clean! Great feature!!The one draw back for me is the filter.Ê Can never get it clean enough.Ê But, I guess it's better that the dust/dirt is on the filter than on my floor.I would definitely recommend this for anyone with a pet or for anyone that does not have a lot of time to vacuum and want their floors to look and feel clean!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cleans great
Review: At first I was skeptical about how well these irobots can clean but I have been very surprised how thoroughly they actually vacuum. I have been surprised at the amount of dust that it picks up. I'm currently searching for other robots to clean around the house. I highly recommend irobots

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Saves you a ton of work, but don't use it on Pottery Barn rugs
Review: As most of the comments show, this is a superb vacuum cleaner that will save people hours of hassles and work around the house.Ê It's rare to find something that can accomplish housework while you're away from home, but the Roomba does the job.Ê I initially bought it when I lived in an apartment with a low pile synthetic carpet that could take the beater brushes without problems.Ê Although the carpets looked fine, the Roomba picked up a surprising amount of dust with every cycle.I recently moved to a house and bought 4 large Pottery Barn wool rugs.Ê The instructions warned against using vacuums with rotating brushes, but the Roomba is small enough that I thought it would be okay.Ê I was wrong; the Roomba's chamber filled with clean wool fibers in less than half the cycle, and from then on, I had to use the virtual wall to keep the room away from the carpets.Ê I still use the Roomba on my hardwood floors, and I'm not sure yet if they are getting scratched from that use.Ê Overall, this is an ideal vacuum cleaner for low pile synthetic rugs that do well with rotating brushes, but you shouldn't use it on Pottery Barn rugs, and as another reviewer has commented, you should monitor your hardwood floors for scratches if you use the Roomba there.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Great product.
Review: As good as our Dyson... without the work!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Gets stuck on black/ darker carpets
Review: Another racist product I've ordered.Ê When it encounters black carpet, it think it doesn't exist and avoids it at all cost.Ê Heaven forbid if it was on black carpet by accident, then it just gets itself stuck.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Pretty cool.
Review: An important thing to keep in mind is that the Roomba is designed as a HELPER, it isn't going to do 100% of the work for you so that you'll never have to clean your floors again. It will not replace your vacuum. It will only make your life a little easier.If you're a moderately clean person anyway or have hardwood/tile flooring, this thing will be the best purchase you've made in recent years.If your the average person with a whole house full of carpet, you'll put a good bit of time into emptying the bin. It picks up quite a lot of debris which is good but you really should vacuum before you run this thing for the first time or you'll be disappointed.If you have 4 rowdy boys and 3 bull mastiffs on a farm, it won't get your floors clean. Nothing will. The money you would spend on this would be better used to hire a cleaning service to do your floors once a month for a year.Remember:Ê Roomba HELPS *YOU* keep your floors clean. It isn't a magical contraption operated by pixies that never requires maintenance or regular inspection. No vacuum is the trouble free device you wish it to be, that's just life, find the option that suits you best and deal with it.For me, this thing is awesome. I love having it and once I learned how to set it up to fit my needs, life has been basically wonderful. I come home and my floors are clean, all I have to do is empty a canister every few days and I'm good to go.I've noticed that it has a little trouble with bath mats, they'll end up bunched or moved entirely but who cares? It's easier to slide a mat back into place than it is to clean the floors myself.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Five Stars
Review: An amazing vacuum.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing..
Review: Amazing... not disappointments!Ê It comes with "light houses" in case it needs help navigating multiple rooms, but they don't seem to be needed.Ê It runs around all over the house and always finds its way back to the dock to recharge.Ê My wife and I are delighted with this product.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Awesome! No more walking home to kitty litter on the floor
Review: Amazing. Hsve wanted one for years and finally got one for Christmas. Asked for this model because of the cats and all the litter they distribute everywhere. Was starting to get annoyed with coming home to such a mess. Roomba 880 works great! I have a 1400sq ft condo. Front door opens to long hallway... Kitchen opens to the side and then down the hallway opens up to the living room. Litter boxes are in the entry way. Using the two virtual walls/light houses it comes with and setting up "homebase" just where the hallway opens up to the living room, the roomba cleans the kitchenÊ and hallway where the litter box is perfectly and returns back to the homebase at the end of the cleaning cycle. It's so great. I purchased another lighthouse/virtual wall to see if it can navigate into the living room as well but worried about the battery running out if I have it do that too... So we'll give it a try... If it runs out I may have to just adjust the lighthouses differently one day to have it just do the living room.Ê Noise is louder than expected but def quieter than my upright vacuumHelpful tip.. If your homebase is on hardwood, I recommend getting those 3M double sided strips to hang pictures or hooks and put them on the bottom.Ê They keep it stable while the roomba goes around or tries to position itself to recharge

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: A+++
Review: Amazing, I can't believe I didn't do this sooner. We have a golden retriever and a lab and they were covering my house in hair.I work full time, go to school full time, have two little boys and a baby on the way. I named her "Hilga" the cleaning lady and she gives me so much time back. Worth every penny, and was at my door in two days. Very satisfied.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Perfect buy
Review: Amazing!!!! I love this little guy and with 2 dogs and a 2 year old I run it every morning.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing what it picks up and nice to have it ...
Review: Amazing what it picks up and nice to have it being able to be programmed to take care of things with no effort from me.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: awesome sauce
Review: Amazing product. Just the price is to much.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazing little helper!
Review: Amazing little helper, we have a large dog and one kiddo, needless to say they bring in quite alot of dirt and sheeded hair from the dog. Romba has to vaccum about 1750sqf and it does it more then well, it goes under soffas,Ê tabels and chairs, over carpet to hard floor etc. Where normally you have to lift or move around to get to. There is a few things that it could do better, do 100% of the area, we can see that it missed a few spots, it could be quieter kind of noisy at night and the dustbin could be little larger.Ê And the last thing is that the lighthouse has a limited reach (2.5m), so if you have larger openings between the rooms it sneeks out before the room is fully complete or does not stay in that room....ohh another thing is that the spare parts are cheep.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Amazed.
Review: Amazed. But, it's so illogical I program it to run when I'm not at home to keep me from getting stressed out. I recommend

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: works great
Review: Amazed how well this works. Wish it could mop the floor too

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I Definitely Recommend This
Review: Amazed at how thoroughly the Roomba 880 cleans. Started in a room that looked clean and could not believe that after 4 cycles in one day, it found enough invisible debris to fill the bin each time. Love that it vacuums under our king-size bed! Spinning side brush cleans in corners and around furniture legs where regular vacuums can't! Low sound and slow enough movement does not scare the cat or dogs.Can do something else while floors are being cleaned. Easy to empty and no brushes to clean. It takes time, though--1-2 hours or more per room and then about an hour to re-charge. Plan on using it someplace almost every day to keep up--can't do a quick cleanup when company's coming. Best to move a few things to give it a clear path.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Just buy one
Review: Almost a year now and it still vacuums every day for me.Ê I love it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Why did I wait so long to pull the trigger?
Review: All kinds of awesome.Ê It has a few quirks, but my floors are now always clean.Ê I have two dogs and one is a husky.Ê She sheds like mad.Ê I run it every day and sometimes twice a day.Ê I would recommend getting a soft bumper for it.Ê I had been waiting for the price to lower on it.Ê It finally dropped to $600 and I bought it.Ê I would have paid 800 if I knew it worked so well.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Wow wow wow
Review: All I can say is WOW! And my OCD wife says the same.I bought her this for her birthday this year and we're amazed at how well it does. Even our housekeeper says the floors are cleaner now than when she was sweeping them. She still mops for us, but has cut about an hour off her time here not having to sweep anymore. In fact, the day we got our Roomba was a Friday, the same day our housekeeper cleans. After she left, we ran this baby and were astounded at how much it picked up.We have 100% concrete floors with area rugs scattered throughout. The Roomba has had no trouble getting over and around and even cleaning areas that didn't get cleaned regularly before, under the dressers, beds, ottomans, etc. The key is just emptying it and cleaning it as per the instructions on a regular basis. We LOVE coming home to clean floors!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Well worth every dime!Ê Great little cleaner!
Review: Ah love!Ê I have finally found a reliable housekeeper!Ê Roberto the Roomba.Ê I have to say I was skeptical, and also $699 hurt- a pricey risk.Ê But wow!Ê Has it ever been worth it!Ê I purchased this after seeing a cat dressed as a shark riding a Roomba video.Ê Frankly, I wasn't really "in the know" on robot vacuum cleaners.Ê I thought my house was pretty clean with a once-a-week housekeeper, but ROOMBA seriously takes it to a whole new level of clean.......I have parrots, and they throw their seed husks everyone, so I thought, maybe this roomba thing will help me keep on top of it.Ê Sure enough, yes!Ê The bird disaster area is spit polish cleaned at 11 am every day.Ê Mission accomplished.The BIG SURPRISE, however, is what the Roomba does for the rest of my first floor living space!Ê I have about 1000 square feet of hard wood floorsÊ with intermittent area rugs.Ê Roomba tackles the WHOLE THING.Ê Like other reviewers, I was kind of shocked by how much "stuff" was being sucked up on each cleaning.Ê However, we are now about 2 weeks in, and the amount is decreasing.Another surpris is how smart this thing is!Ê He will go underneath furniture and clean it better than it has ever been cleaned, and figure out how to get back out.Ê He goes into all the rooms, finding his ways into pantries and closets if the door is open...cleaning everything. Roomba sometimesÊ "finds things" with his sweeper function.Ê TheÊ first week, he "brought out" all sorts of things hidden under various pieces of furniture.Ê A random unattached cord, a camera case, an ant trap from 2010, a little raincoat pouch......Roomba has gotten stuck under furniture twice, locked himself in the bathroom once, and got stuck on an floor intake vent.Ê He just shut off and waited til I got home.Ê Otherwise, everyday at 11, he gets to work and re docks himself.This was a great purchase, and I am saving up to get another Roomba for the upstairs.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Much cleaner than vacuuming
Review: After two weeks, I like my new Roomba 880.1) Situation - I have a 6,000 sq foot house with almost all hard wood floors and a hairy Golden Retriever.2) First week - The first week I tried to intelligently move around the home/charging station and the towers.Ê That was frustrating.3) Preparation - I was also busy getting wires/clutter out of the way.Ê I also put felt pads under some tables so the Roomba could get under them.Ê Roomba would get stuck under some tables and I've put junk under the table to block Roomba before getting stuck.4) The second week I put the home charging station in a reasonable spot where Roomba can occasionally find its way home.Ê Mainly now I put Roomba in a room with doors closed.Ê If the room has openings, I'll put a tower or other obstacle (box/chair) in the way.Ê After 30+ minutes, I'll take Roomba to another room.Ê When battery dies, I'll clean it out and charge it up.5) Clean/Filter - I am pretty quick at cleaning the hair out of my Roomba now.Ê I think the new 880 that I have may be much easier than previous models.Ê I'm always amazed at how much hair it picks up.Ê The filter is very dirty.Ê I don't know how to clean it and I don't know if I care.Ê I don't want to start spending money on filters.6) Schedule - I don't use the automatic schedule.Ê Roomba is too noisy to run at night and I like to supervise it somewhat.Ê I try to use it upstairs when the wife is downstairs and vice versa.Ê Plus, in my larger house, Roomba won't find its way home when done.6) Results - My floors are dramatically cleaner than when we vacuumed once/twice a week and picked up the hair balls daily.Ê Amazing to walk around barefoot on the clean floors.7) Roomba is very expensive8) Dogs are VERY expensive - certainly cheapest/easiest choice is to not have a dog.Ê And brushing the dog will help a ton.9) We love our dog like crazy so we are keeping him and the roomba.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Meet the new maid at my house.
Review: After sitting on the fence about a robotic vacuum (and it's cost)we finally bit the bullet and ordered the 880, we have had it for 5 days and I am over the moon in love with it!Ê I have two dogs and one is a Champion Class Shedder, never had a dog that shed this much in my entire life.Ê We have never been able to keep ahead of her hair.Ê We ran the regular vacuum on the day the new Roomba 880 arrived and we have ran the Roomba (from here on dubbed "The Maid") every day since then.Ê She picks up an amazing amount of hair and dander, besides my floors (carpet and tile) looking 100% better, and looking better by the day, the level of dust is going down as well.Ê As much as I hate to say this about the cost...worth every single penny.Ê If you are sitting on the fence, jump in...you will be glad you did.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: fast and efficient
Review: After remodeling our home with hardwoods and tile throughout, as most, we noticed the pet hair and dust and every speck of dirt.Ê We read reviews of robotic vacuums and spoke to friends who had roombas and most comments from all sources was good, but...tangles of pet hair, small debris bin, etc...We are VERY happy with the 880!Ê 2 story home so use it upstairs for 3 straight cleanings and the bin filled fairly quickly on 1st 2 cleanings, then it was just maintenance cleaning.Ê Moved it downstairs and same process.Amazed at how quick and quiet this machine is considering the reviews I had read.Ê Our 2 inside pets that shed so much we are surprised they are not bald leave quite a bit of hair about and the Roomba has not tangled once with the new brushless technology.We are thinking of buying another to prevent having to move it up/down stairs.Ê I only wish they made one that cleaned stairs!Highly recommended after a week of service.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: House is now cleaner than it's ever been, especially under queen beds. Dust bunnies are now extinct!
Review: After reading the reviews, I had some concerns, but having used the 880 for a month, I am very pleased. Yes, it is loud, but no more so than other powerful vacuums. Yes, it bumps into things, but with no more force than needed. Yes, the dust bin is small, but if you clean every other day and empty between cleanings, accumulated dust will be low enough that the bin size is fine. (I do wish it gave an alarm in addition to a red light.) Another on-line complaint was stopping at dark stripes in carpets due to the "stair detection" system. I have not had that problem. However, like any child or pet, you have to adapt a bit to its behavior. Follow it around a few times during initial use and find places (I had two) where it gets trapped. Move furniture or put a wastebasket or other article there to keep it out. Be careful about "home base" and "lighthouse" placement to avoid interference and obstacles. Following iRobot's examples, I had the best results by putting "home base" along a central corridor wall, which creates a tripping hazard. All things said, however, the house is now cleaner than it's ever been, especially under queen beds. Dust bunnies are now extinct!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Excellent Product But Know It Doesn't Replace Your Vacuum
Review: After reading many reviews, I purchased this hoping that it would work well enough to reduce the number of times I needed to pull out my upright vacuum. It was clear from the reviews that this product would not replace an upright vacuum, partially due to the lack of suction power, and partially due to a lack of attachments necessary to reach tight spaces. I have a 950 sq. foot apartment with mixed carpet and linoleum flooring and one cat.As expected, this doesn't excel at removing the fine debris in the carpet, due to a lack of suction. However, it exceeded my expectations in its ability to remove pet hair and large debris. I used the Roomba exclusively for a month, and my floors have never been cleaner. When I finally pulled my upright out, I was surprised to find it picked up very little pet hair. It did pick up a moderate about of fine debris, but no more than it would when I was vacuuming with it once a week.The Roomba has allowed me to take my vacuuming down from once a week to once a month. Reducing my time spent vacuuming by 75 percent made this purchase worth the expense. As long has you have accurate expectations on what this product will (manage day to day pet hair) and will not do (replace your regular vacuum), I highly recommend it.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: but I am glad I bought it
Review: After reading all the reviews,Ê I was skeptical, but I am glad I bought it. I have a German Shepherd and two cats. Before getting the 880, I would vacuum 2 to 4 times a day, and always felt like I was losing the battle. I now run Rosie, I named my 880 after the Jetsons, twice a day. This thing gets everything, and I am even having to dust a lot less. I take it up stairs once a week to make sure I get all the house. Make sure you don't leave cordÊ on the floor, it gets tangled up really easily.Ê Also, I find that I have to take the brushes off and pull the hair out of them after every use. All in all, I love it, and it saves me so much time and stress.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: the awesome 880 fixed roomba's long existing flaws!
Review: After many years and 3 roombas I almost gave up on them. My main issue was the constant maintenance required. Every 2-3 runs I would have to painfully clean brushes and that's a very messy job, with dust and hair flying to your face. And really I dont have much hair at my house, but the carpet really didnt help the brushes. Then after a while the robot would not run quite as well, battery out pretty fast.Well, irobot found the solution!! With the new rubber technology, the 880 did many runs and still looks brand new underneath! I ran it a couple times just a few days after my cleaners came, and it picked up so much crap it was beautiful. I am a convert of irobot again.Definitely put the extra bucks and get the 880, do not get the brushed roombas!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I like it better than Neato Robotics
Review: After having to return two Neato Botvac vacuums because they arrived damaged and wouldn't work, I finally gave iRobot a try. I am sure glad I did because this vacuum is of much higher quality (it feels that way to me). It cleaned my condo, which has laminate flooring, very well. This vacuum is relatively quiet yet it had no problem picking up cat food and cat litter. I just received this vacuum in the mail and I will update my review if anything changes, as far as durability is concerned.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Roomba is no longer just an expensive toy!
Review: After having the 880 for over a month now I've found that it is easy to use, it cleans under places we normally almost never get and does a rather impressive job.Ê It's not as powerful as a plug in upright or shopvac, but it does a very respectable job of cleaning.Ê I was horrified, then pleasantly surprised when I had to empty the reasonably sized debris bin a couple times when first setting the little creature loose in a room.Ê Apparently it was picking up a LOT of dust and pet hair under furniture we only cleaned under once a year or so.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: I bought this beautiful baby. I got it today and I absolutely ...
Review: After debating for a week about spending $755 (includingÊ taxes), reading all the reviews, asking tons of questions (thanks to those who answered them), I bought this beautiful baby. I got it today andÊ I absolutely love it. I just love it. It works perfect. It is not noisy, not as loud as a normal vacuum winch was very important for me. It was fully charged, easy andÊ ready to use. Did the job on its own, just great. Now, I have only used it twice, I just got it today. I just pray it last for aÊ long time. I can't say enough how happy I am.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Very useful and fun to watch
Review: After being skeptical about Roomba systems for a long time, I decided to take the plunge and go for their top of the line model.Ê I figure if I'm going to jump on the bandwagon I might as well jump all the way.Ê And I am very glad I did.Ê This thing is quite amazing.Ê It wanders seemingly randomly around the house but it eventually gets every where it can and it handles multiple surfaces with ease.Ê Sometimes it gets caught, or it traps itself in a bathroom by closing the door (!) or it continues trying to clean when the bin is full, but overall it makes a significant difference to the cleanliness of the house.Ê Is it the best vacuum in the world?Ê No.Ê Get a Dyson.Ê But my hardwood and carpet mixed floors have never been cleaner now that I run Roomba every couple of days between serious cleanings.Ê The only thing I don't like about it is it should return to its base (or at least stop and scream for help) when the bin is full.Ê And it is a little too loud to run at night while trying to sleep.Ê But I'm glad I bought it and I'd do it again.Ê Also note the light wall devices that come with this package are extremely useful to help keep the little guy where you need it to be.Ê Highly recommended.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love, love, love!!!
Review: After an initial hiccup, I totally love this unit, and the iRobot company.Ê I bought this to clean my brand-new ultra-cuishy carpet in my entire upstairs.Ê Sadly, the first unit I received would clean for a couple of minutes, and then stop, saying it was stuck.Ê I called iRobot customer service, and after walking me through some trouble-shooting steps, they sent me a new unit, along with a return label for the old one.Ê I was concerned about this, since I bought the unit here on Amazon, but iRobot provided support with no problem at all.Ê Their customer support people were also extremely polite and helpful.Ê I set the second unit up, and - WOW!Ê I'm in love.Ê I have 2 cats, both shorthair, and neither sheds more than the ordinary house cat.Ê I run my Roomba every few days, and it always ends up full of cat hair.Ê After a week, I have enough cat hair picked up to make another cat!Ê It works great on it.Ê It also goes room to room with no problem.Ê I have the virtual wall/lighthouse units set up, one as a wall protecting the stairs, and the other in a doorway, so that the Roomba totally cleans one room before going to the next.Ê I bought an additional virtual wall/lighthouse for another doorway, so that I can have it clean the whole upstairs.Ê The biggest challenge is making sure all the cat toys are picked up before running it.Ê When a cat toy does get lodged in the roller, again, no problem.Ê The unit is very easy to open up and untangle.Ê The bin is easy to empty, and I love that it has a fine-particle filter.Ê It's never been easier to keep a clean carpet.Ê The only downside, if you can call it that, is that it's so good at picking up pet hair that I need to run it every couple of days, or just be prepared to empty the bin a couple of times during its cleaning cycle.Ê There is a "bin full" light on top, so it's easy to see when the bin needs to be emptied.Ê I've read other reviews complaining that the bin is too small, but I don't find this to be a problem.Ê It cleans very well on both carpet and tile, picks up cat hair I never knew was even there, and leaves my entire upstairs clean with very little effort on my part.Ê I have nothing but great things to say about this product, and am very happy with my purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: After 1 year_ tree of it all dead_I was fun of every staff might make life easier_after few days ...
Review: After 1 year tree of it all deadI was fun of every staff might make life easierafter few days of trying irobot I actually bought 9 products from there company(gift to my whole family). In no more than one month one of my Scroba dead. I returned it, and want have one more try buy another one to replace it. Within one year, two Scroba and one Roomba dead. Today, I called factory to fix Roomba, they ask me to buy some components to replace it(not the brush I change very offen). I hope it works out. But with so many money I throw to the company ,quite unhappy with the unreliable products!Ê When u make purchase keep in mind, it might only works no more than a year. So my Japanese neighbor told me. She had a dead room a as well!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Love my Roomba
Review: Absolutely the best purchase I have made!!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: No More Vacuuming
Review: Absolutely love this Roomba. We have not vacuumed the floor since we go it 4 months ago. It is THAT good. The trick is to use it frequently and keep the cords and area rugs out of its way. Just push the button, go out to dinner and come back and the floor is clean!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Four Stars
Review: Absolutely great! Highly recomended for a busyÊ family. Only minus- extremly loud on wooden floors...

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: ... on parts of my area rug it does a great job of helping keep up with all of the ...
Review: A side from avoiding the dark embroidering on parts of my area rug it does a great job of helping keep up with all of the pet hair

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Good
Review: A little bit noisy, not All Terrain in the house, after all it makes rooms clean. Good

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Actually exceeded my expectations.
Review: A few months ago my wife and I bought our dream home - hardwood throughout the main floor and a wonderful walkout basement that opens to a beautiful Carolina backyard for our high-energy terrier to run and play in.Ê Unfortunately the combination of dog, plenty of clay in the backyard, and light colored flooring in the basement den led to a crisis of cleaning.Ê Vacuuming and mopping would keep the room clean for either 3-4 days or until the next rain made fresh wet clay to stick to our dogs paws.Ê Within two months we were sick of having to constantly clean that floor.Enter the Roomba.Ê We've got this baby scheduled to run at 8:15 AM every morning (just after leaving for work) and the floor in our den is cleaner than the day we moved in.Ê Immediately after seeing the fantastic job it did cleaning the den we started putting it to work in other rooms.Ê The first time I ran it in my office (the only carpeted room in the house) I was horrified at what and how much I was dumping out of it's bin after every run - and thankful that this thing is in my corner.My wife was originally very skeptical of getting a Roomba.Ê Now we love our little guy so much that we're strongly considering bringing in a Braava as well for it's wet mopping feature.Ê Worth every penny!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Cliff Sensors STILL glitchy at steps
Review: [purchased November 3rd at a local retailer, not on Amazon]I've owned 4 or 5 Roombas.Ê The 880 has some nice improvements.Ê It's much quieter than my old 500 series; the dust bin is larger; the suction seems to be better.But there is STILL a major problem with the cliff sensors.Ê We have several rooms with typical steps down, some about 36" wide, others much wider ("sunken" living room).Ê Roomba will successfully detect these "cliffs" when its approach is angled (not perpendicular to the edge of the step), but if it happens to approach a step straight on (90% to the step), it will tip over and throw Error #6 ("move Roomba and push the clean button again").Ê This is very annoying and inconvenient.It's amazing to me that iRobot has not fixed this long-standing problem (since Roomba Red!).Ê Customer Service says it's an issue with Roomba's line of sight (infrared beam, I think).Ê When it approaches a step straight on, it cannot detect the edge.Ê And guess who has to get up from her desk and walk down 23 steps to give it a helping hand.Ê Grrr!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: High hopes. Big disappointment.
Review: 880 was unable to pick up the dog hair from our area rugs. Worked with iRobot to resolve the situation, but the issue persisted after several different "fixes" - we actually had to start using our old vacuum to pick up the hair. After further research, other owners have reported the same issue - the 880 supposedly struggles to differentiate when going from hardwood to area rugs and the mechanism doesn't do its job properly.Hoped this machine was going to live up to its potential, but due to its inability to clean our apartment and the expensive price tag, it was a no brainer to return the unit. Love iRobot as a company, but truly disappointed in this purchase.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: love
Review: 880 points.love it

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: 800 Series Roomba > 900
Review: 800 Series is great runs well finds its way back to the dock I have 2 that clean a warehouse type area and they normally find their way back without help.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Expensive but still a value
Review: 8/3/14I read several reviews before making the purchase and I'm glad I read them and glad that I made the purchase.Ê This little guy really gets after things.Ê We have two dogs and one cat.Ê I have it set to run everyday at 11:00AM - mostly when we're out of the house.Ê That makes about 10-12 hours of vacuuming each week.Ê How many more times is that than you currently spend per week?Ê He gets places we weren't getting and has done a terrific job of not getting hung up in extension chords, rugs and the like.Ê When you register the 880 they ask you to create a nick name for your unit.Ê We picked FurVee.Ê Kinda like HumVee but for fur.Ê The name is apt.Ê Generally he runs about 1-1/2 hrs to 2 hrs then docks.Ê Every once in a while he won't make it back to the charger, but it's no big deal.Ê You'll need to tend to him for the first several days (or at least we did) until he can clean your house with one load of debris.Ê Once he max's out, he'll stop.Ê So the first several days we'd watch and have to empty the bin one to three times.Ê Now he can get through the whole house (3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, LR, DR, Den) The weekly maintenance is simple and easy, but is important to be done.Ê Seems to be solidly built and has good senses as to getting around and getting out of things too.Ê Am on week 3 of ownership and can see this around for many, many years.My interest then turned to iRobot's Scooba 450 mop.Ê I read the reviews there too.Ê The 880 is at least the third generation vacuum and it's got most of the issues with the earlier units whipped.Ê It didn't seem that way in the reviews I read for the Scooba.Ê So I'llÊ wait a generation or two to see if the company works out the kinks on that unit too, as I'm sure they will.I would buy it again.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Sometimes it fell down the stairs, bam bam bam bam bam, which broke my heart.
Review: 2.5 stars. When it works, it is pretty good. But it fell down the stairs 5 times in one week. Most of the time, it can avoid going down the stairs, stopped right at the edge. But accidents still happened quite often. Is this a known issue? Or I got a bad device? I don't how much damage has caused to this robot already after all these falls. I have 6 places in the house that step down deep (stairs). Anyone has the same issue?

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: This thing is amazing. With a dog that sheds more than any ...
Review: 2 months in and absolutely NO complaints!Ê This thing is amazing.Ê With a dog that sheds more than any dog should, this thing keeps things clean and tidy.Ê Would recommend it to any one, and have!!!

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: Best household purchase. Makes me more tidy! Millennial family with young child & allergy issues.
Review: ÊIm the kind of guy who researches everything and reads the manual before turning it on. I bought this on impulse as a present for my wife, without doing ANY researchÊ and I think it is one of the best purchase Ive made in all of 2015.OPERATION:This thing is extremely easy to use. The quick start guide is all you need. I was able to charge it up and then just press the start button without reading anything. I figured out how to clean it, how to use the accessories and how to unclog it without reading anything. Its extremely user friendly.It moved from hardwood to high pile carpet to low pile carpet to vinyl flooring with absolutely no issues and no loss of suction.It gives you audio cues when anything is wrong and it docks itself when it needs to charge or when it detects that its finished. (if it hasnt ventured too far from its home base)Its not whisper quiet, but I can run it in the morning and it does not wake up my wife & daughter.CLEANING:The video Ive uploaded is my actual first experience with the Roomba 880its my first experience with any robotic vacuum cleaner. I literally put it through its paces on camera. If you want to see how it handles getting tossed into a war zone, watch the video.I put it in the middle of the living room after opening Christmas presents. Pine needles everywhere, wrapping paper bits, etc. It went to places the that hadnt been vacuumed since we built this house 5 years ago.It was able to clean about 800-900 square feet of living room, kitchen & hallway on one charge.On a second charge, it was able to do my daughters room and our master bedroom. Im a little ashamed to say but it filled up FIVE times before it finished the master bedroom and ran out of batteries. I had been putting off cleaning under my bed for 4 years, but this thing did it for me. All I had to do was move some junk out from under there and it did the hard work.On a third charge, it cleaned about 1000 square feet of carpeted living room & home office in the basement.It detects dirtier areas and goes into spot clean mode.Ive since read in reviews that it cant clean black carpet but it was able to clean the black carpet in my office just fine, probably because its not jet black, but has specks of blue and grey in it.CLOGS:Ive been running it now for about a week, and Ive only had it clog up twice. Once was because it was running for about 2 hours, cleaning under beds and other areas that we dont ever get to. It sucked up so much hair and loose string, etc, that it tripped the tangle sensor.The other time was because I wanted to let it run over a batch of cords to see how it would handle loose chargers, etc. It grabbed hold of my lightning cable and stopped immediately, displaying a red warning icon and playing an audible message that theres a clog.Without reading the manual, I just flipped it over, pressed the obvious buttons on the bottom to pop off the cover for the 2 spinners, took them both out and the cord came out without any issues. Absolutely no damage done to the cord.SAFETY:The cliff sensors work perfectly, we were very nervous that it was going to drive right off a cliff to its doom, but it handles the edge of the hardwood like a pro.I let it run over Christmas lights, power cords, loose cloths, etc and have not had any safety issues yet.The only thing I would say to be careful of is heavy objects that are precariously balanced. I had it knock a metal Fireplace Screen on top of itself. No damage was done aside from a few scratches to the top.Its pretty gentle on the furniture, when its going at full speed and it hits a chair, it may move it slightly. It ran into the fireplace screen about 8 times before it knocked it over.ACCESSORIES:It comes with an extra HEPA filter, Im not sure when youre supposed to change it, but it got massively clogged up after the first couple of days. I just took an air compressor to it and blew out most of the dirt. Do this outside though, the HEPA catches microscopic allergens and toxins like dust mite fecal matter, etc you dont want to be blowing this stuff in your house or garage.It also come with 2 Virtual Walls and a remote control. Aside from the time I used it in the video, I havent used the remote control since.The virtual walls I use all the time. I havent tried to use lighthouse mode yet, but that is supposed to allow it to find its way back to the docking station from farther rooms in the house.OVERALLAs a young millennial couple raising a small child, my wife and I did not grow up with the clean genes of our parents. We grew up with the internet and nintendo.When we get some down time from work or taking care of our daughter, the first thing we wanted to do was Netflix or Xbox not pick up a vacuum cleaner.The roomba is not only keeping our house clean, but he's like a family pet. My daughter named him Ro-B (Roe-bee) and I kinda dig it.Ive actually ordered some risers from Amazon because it cant fit under one of my couches. I havent been this excited for an amazon package since I bought my Xbox Elite Bundle. I cant believe how much Im looking forward to 8 plastic 1 risers. The roomba is definitely a life changer, and Ive been recommending it to everyone.I really care about the quality of our indoor air, and this combined with my air purifiers is going to make me feel A LOT better about the air that my family is breathing. It was worth every penny.

Product: iRobot Roomba 880 for Pets and Allergies
Title: One word- AWESOME!!!!
Review: Ruby as we've already come to call our Roomba, is amazing.Ê Best purchase we've made in a long time- keeps the house clean of all the dog hair.Ê The battery lasts a long time- we can actually clean our whole 2500 sq ft house in one charge!Ê Ruby does her thing, then heads back to the dock automatically.Ê All I have to do is empty the dustbin and make sure the rollers are clear, and she's ready to go on her next cleaning adventure.Ê Highly recommended- if you're even thinking about buying one, do it now!
